golds.output: This bacon base is alright, but nothing special. It has a decent smoky flavor, but it's not as robust as I was hoping for. I've used it in a few recipes, and it works, but it's not a standout product.  I'd probably buy it again if I needed a quick bacon flavor boost, but I wouldn't go out of my way to get it.

Product:

Review:
This product is ok, but nothing to brag about. It is made with Blue Plate mayo, which I enjoy, and I enjoy Tabasco pepper sauce. But the pepper flavor in this mayo is not a good, and does not have the typical aroma nor flavor of cayenne. The "heat" is average. There is a strange after-taste that remains from this mayo. I am a regular user of foods with cayenne added, but there is some other, more prominent, flavor in this mayo that is not appealing.

3.0

Cento Petite Diced Tomatoes, 15 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
Very good flavor and aroma! I had never tried this brand before, but now I am very glad I decided to try it. Upon opening a can, the aroma is impressive, and the flavor is too. Very fresh-tasting tomatoes, excellent for addition into sauces, and other dishes. I made a bowl of Salmon salad, and added a few tablespoons of this product into it, and the result was delicious! Everybody who had some, commented on how good the flavor was.

Review:
This is good mayo! Generally I prefer Duke's, but when I can't find it this is my next choice. Good mayo flavor, good quality.

Review:

Product:
Torani Vanilla Syrup 12.7 ounce
Review:
Nice orange flavor! A spoonful mixed into seltzer water, with a tough of vanilla extract added, makes a very tasty beverage.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Chicken of the Sea, Chub Mackerel, 15 Ounce (Pack of 24)
Review:
I am very disappointed in this product. The fish itself is good (in the batch I received), but the label claims "Net weight: 15 ounces". The problem is that each can contains only about 9.33 ounces of fish; the rest is water, oil and fish particles suspended in the fluid. The fluid is approximately
5.67 ounces by weight; 168mL fluid. After 4 hours time allowed for separation, the oil is about 11mL of the total. Hence, each can of "Chicken of The Sea" Chub Mackerel is only about 62 percent fish.
The measurements were based on the average of 10 cans. Deviation from the average was minimal. The ratio of fish-to-water is the worst of all canned fish I have seen. At 9.33 ounces of fish per can, the actual cost of the fish is approximately $0.268/ounce, far higher than it should be, making it more expensive per ounce than canned Salmon.
Also, all 10 cans were excessively dirty, half the cans were badly dented. Rubbing a paper towel around the rim revealed a mix of metal particles and dust/dirt. If you use this product, be sure to clean the can rim before using a can opener, else some of metal and/or dirt can get into the fish.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Muir Glen Organic Tomato Sauce, No Sugar Added, 15 Ounce Can (Pack of 12)
Review:
This is excellent tomato sauce! It is my first experience with it, but I know I will use this product again (and again!) in the future. I like that it has no harmful ingredients, and the flavor is superb -- very fresh aroma and flavor! If you do not have the time to do all the work of making your own sauce from your own tomatoes, this product is an excellent substitute.
Rating:
5.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Newtons Fig Fruit Chewy Cookies - Snack Packs, 12 Count Box, 24 Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
These are Fig Newtons, what can you say?  Everyone likes them (or not).  They are a nice-sized snack in a nearly indestructible foil wrapper.  You get two double-length cookies, approximately equivalent to 4 regular Fig Newtons.  Good for tossing in lunches, purses, the car, etc.  Arrived very fresh and in good shape.  Handy as a somewhat more nutritious snack.  We like them enough to order more, when on sale!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Betty Crocker Hamburger Helper Philly Cheesesteak, 6.5-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)
Review:
It's Hamburger Helper.  What can you say?  You either like it or you don't.  We do.  It's not exactly like homemade, but for a quick meal when you're in a hurry, it's okay.  The Hamburger Helper meal sizes are continuing to shrink.  These are a measly 6.6 ounces; about enough for one hungry person or two mildly hungry ones. I add a few extras--about 4 ounces of dry spaghetti noodles, a cup of additional water, some tomatoes and/or other veggies, to make a bigger meal.  Also, I quite often use ground Italian sausage, instead of hamburger, very tasty!  I look for these meals on sale, because at full price, they are just too expensive for what you get.  Hope this helps!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
SweetLeaf Sweet Drops Liquid Stevia Sweetener, SteviaClear, 4 Ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
I've used this product for quite a few years, after trying MANY other brands and forms, and still find this to be the absolute best stevia product--hands down!  I don't know what we would do without this product.  We use it every day, all day, for coffee, tea, sweetening yogurt fruit, etc.  All our family members like it, too.  One bottle lasts for over two months, usually three.  It has no aftertaste, a few drops is all it takes and finally, we've been able to almost eliminate sugars from our diet without "suffering".  There are 2,880 drops in a 4 oz or 120ml bottle, according to the manufacturer.  We love it!
UPDATE:  Received new shipment and bottle label has changed.  Now states there are approx. 600 servings per bottle at 5-8 drops per serving or to taste.  Last few bottles seemed slightly weaker, but still the best of all the other brands, by far.  We still love it!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
ALTOIDS Classic Wintergreen Breath Mints, 1.76-Ounce Tin (Pack of 12)
Review:
We love these Wintergreen Altoids! While they are a very good breath mint, we use them mainly for flavoring our coffee and sometimes, tea. One, in the bottom of the cup, or a few in the coffee/tea pot makes life more interesting! Also, good with just a touch of hot cocoa, added along with Altoids, in coffee. And yes, they are good in hot cocoa, too. Very inexpensive, easy way to flavor coffee or tea, much cheaper than alternative. Almost no calories, but big on flavor! We've used these for decades!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Roland Coconut Milk, Lite, 14 Ounce (Pack of 24)
Review:
We see why people like this brand of coconut milk.  We like it, too.  It is organic and does have guar gum (which is a food derived, natural ingredient), but it DOES NOT have chemicals/preservatives, which are bad for you.  It is thick and creamy when slightly warmed, has a strong coconut flavor and tastes better than the brands with added preservatives.  (We've tried a lot of them!)  The ingredients are coconut milk, water, guar gum---that's it!  I DO wish it said what percentage of coconut milk was in the can, some brands do, but other than that, we are happy with this brand.  It DOES NOT have an expiration date printed on the can (we wish it did).  The price is more than the brands with preservatives, which I don't understand, I wish it were lower, but if we want food with no preservatives/added chemicals, I guess this is what our option is.  Hopefully, the price will come down.  What we don't like is the shipping--9 out of 24 cans in the case were severely or moderately dented, which means we had to use them soon or immediately (not happy at all about that).  However, we will order this brand again.  UPDATE:  Ordered second case, case was shipped "as is", broke open during shipping, all 24 cans arrived severely or moderately dented.  Can't even open most of them with a can opener.  Completely unusable and not safe to use.  Unless packing for shipping changes, even though we love the product, we will not order again. Not happy about that, as we can't find a source to purchase locally.  UPDATE:  Contacted Amazon, they sent another case, better packing, only 2 cans minor dented.  Thank you, Amazon!  Will try purchasing again, as we love this stuff!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Yankee Traders Brand, Vanilla Beans, Organic (Whole)- 4 Pods
Review:
I ordered these to try them, not wanting a large quantity, if they weren't a good quality.  I have to say, these are just simply excellent!  These are organic from Frontier Co-op, a company I have ordered products from for decades.  Their quality is usually great, like these vanilla beans.  These beans are plump, slightly juicy, filled with paste, VERY fragrant and aromatic.  The fragrance is just intoxicating.  The flavor is very strong/intense.  One half a pod was all I needed to strongly flavor 1.5 quarts of homemade ice cream! The pods are larger and of a better quality than most and much better than those from the local store.  The price is a bit high.  Next time, I will order a larger quantity to save money.  It does NOT say what grade these beans are or the source of origin/variety.  But, just guessing, they seem to be a grade A.  Whatever they are, these are excellent!  I will buy them again!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Lipton Yellow Label Tea (loose tea) - 450g
Review:
This is NOT the regular Lipton's Tea sold in the USA.  This Lipton's Yellow Label Tea is what most of the rest of the world drinks when they drink Lipton's.  It is not acidic as is the regular USA version we all know (IE: no pucker/dry mouth).  It is bold, but mellow--sometimes with a hint of smoky flavor.  We first drank this while living overseas, I love this Yellow Label tea.  It is very good made as hot tea as well as iced.  Very good with milk or cream.  I have purchased this for years and will definitely purchase this again!
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Review:
Salt comes in all different colors and flavors.
Being a foodie and salt connoisseur, I have traveled the globe trying every salt I have encountered.
Do your research and you will see that Real Salt is from a mine in Utah.
This is an ancient salt mine. This salt is is unrefined so it contains all of the minerals embedded with it.
There is some grit to this salt since it isn't a super fine grind. This is normal and acceptable.
This salt has an excellent balance of minerals enhancing all of the foods you eat naturally.
This belongs in every household for your main table salt.

Keep in mind that flavors are different to everyone since every palate is unique and each person has different mineral levels which also changes how it tastes.
Do your research and you will see that Real Salt is from a mine in Utah.
This is an ancient salt mine. Don't worry about the various colors, this salt is is unrefined so it contains minerals embedded with it.

Bell Plantation PB2 Powdered Peanut Butter, 1 lb Jar (2-pack)
Review:
How can you make peanut butter better than it already is? PB2! This is Peanut Butter without all the oil you get in the jar products. The taste is excellent. You can use it just like you do regular peanut butter. It is much lighter than a jar of peanut butter so it transports well. You can add it to grain recipes to give them a nutty flavor. You can use it in chocolates, shakes, etc. We love this and everyone we have told about it loves it too. I love using this on my pad thai dish and other dishes for a peanut flavor without all the added fat. If you LOVE peanut butter, you will LOVE this low fat version.

Product:
Spicy World Ground Turmeric Powder, 5 Pound
Review:
I am very impressed with the quality of this Turmeric powder. The bag I received was still sealed and the product is very fresh. Upon opening the bag, the intense smell of turmeric filled the room as it should. I tasted this straight and the flavor is robust, earthy, smooth and absent the bitterness you get from roots that aren't fresh. The first dish I made was some basmati rice with this turmeric, some onion, cumin, cayenne and salt. The flavor is exceptional!

I repackaged this for longer storage since this is for day to day cooking. The best way to store this for long-term is to divide it into smaller portions and vacuum seal each portion, then freeze it. Make sure you let it thaw completely to room temperature before opening a packet for use later to avoid moisture issues.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

Product:
 Medaglia D'Oro Instant Espresso Coffee, 2-Ounce Jars (Pack of 6) 
Review:
Darn good coffee. I like to make it with really hot water. Only use 6 oz per teaspoon. I use a regular serving teaspoon and take out as much coffee as it will hold. Mix it well. I like to have a bottom of my coffee cup with the espresso and I top it with Milk. Milk that I have set up the day before with sweetener so the sweetener liquidfies into the milk making it uniformingly sweet. I  have a small bottle that I put milk into and I add my truvia and shake it up vigorously to mix the sugar and milk and set it into a very cold fridge for 8 or more hours. When I make my coffee I make it with very hot water and then stir it, and shake the milk and it has a nice foamy milk appearance and I add about 3 oz of sweetened milk to 6 oz of coffee careful not to stir the coffee just drink it with the layer of milk floating on top the thick rich coffee.....so good! Nice to have one cup. I have a Keurig and a regular coffee maker and the stove top espresso maker and its just a hassle to have one cup and I hate the expense of the keurigs. This is a more viable option for a rich cup of coffee.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
NongShim Bowl Noodle Soup, Kimchi, 3.03 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
Okay so I have been totally addicted to watching Korean Dramas on Hulu and Viki and Dramafever and Gooddrama.net etc... and see this brand constantly being eaten during these South Korean TV shows like Secret Garden, Coffee Prince, Smile You, and Kimchi Family to say a few shows if anyone ever feels like venturing in to the best TV ever! So Since I am a big fan of Korean TV I just had to try this ramen! On the show Potato Star one musician character eats it a lot So I ordered it and BAM! No wonder these actors smile and totally whoof it down! It is definently woofable. So much so I couldn't believe how good it is! I did not cut up the green onion as you see on the top of the package, I should have bought some green onions and sliced them thin and added to the top, but its fine without, more than fine without! Love this stuff. Okay so its spicy...not jalapeno spicey staying in your mouth needing a tortilla or milk to get your tongue back hot, its all together hot in a different way the kind of good hot for hot lovers. Makes you really want more. So spicy and hot with the red chili powder and its smooth and the broth you just want to drink it! Noodles have a great texture not all overly soft, they are firm and really taste better than the typical ramen I buy at my grocery store. Plus you put the water in the bowl, close the lid and when you open the bowl you won't believe the soup its like totally full of noodles like way more than the average ramen. At first the ramen looks all whimpy small and man or man it balloons out to fill the bowl.

Product:
Dandy Blend, Instant Herbal Beverage with Dandelion, 2 lb. Bag
Review:
Foolish and dumb as this may sound, I'd forgotten what impact caffeine has on various health issues - primarily raising my ocular pressure - and that can be serious for those with Glaucoma and other medical eye issues.
New job; new pressures; stress; longer hours; inclement weather, and I was brewing more coffee and having more refills; taking bigger travel mugs and not thinking about it. I was using a higher quality of coffee and had read many articles about how organic; higher quality, etc really has more to do with how coffee affects/doesn't affect someone than the actual caffeine component, so I felt I was "okay" with drinking more of it. Wrong (at least for me).
I had forgotten how I used to mix my coffee half and half with Teeccino and that cut down the caffeine. Teeccino's a great product, but it is not very cost effective for me, and I prefer something without the gluten.

In the past, I tried the packets of Dandy Blend and it was ok. They quickly hardened and dried out so I threw away the unused packets.
I had received some very bad news from my Ophthalmologist, so back to the drawing board and saw this 2# bag of Dandy Blend, with outstanding reviews and comments and thought I'd give it a go again. After all, it's a MUST!
Not only is it gluten-free (and they explain on their site 'how' that is); but dandelions are great for the liver which is very closely related to eye issues - they go hand in hand. (I already take Milk Thistle every day for my liver, so this will be an added bonus!)

Then I asked all of you a few questions on the Q/A area (great feature, and big help!). I wanted to be able to brew Dandy Blend along with a scoop of regular coffee grounds (as I did with Teeccino) and you all told me how I could. Score!
So, right now I'm enjoying a delicious cup - or two, or three - of mixed brew and eventually will cut out the coffee altogether.
I was too chicken to put the DB in the brew basket, so I used my normal amount of water for the pot; only put in one scoop of coffee, instead of two, and then when it was finished brewing, I added one rounded tablespoon to the pot and stirred it in.
FABULOUS!
The recipes and ideas on both the bag and the website are great - I would have never thought of doing that. Now I look forward to trying it. I'm getting ready to do some traveling, so will bring some with me.

Folks - we can monitor our BLOOD pressure at home (which I occasionally do); but we cannot monitor our own ocular pressure. Hopefully, one day, it will be possible to do. Fortunately for me, I HAVE to go regularly to keep a close watch on it; but I was without insurance and took my chances and it was almost disastrous. Please be sure to get your eyes checked regularly, especially to check your pressures. It's still the leading cause of blindness.

*****One week later****
I only mixed with coffee for one week. I ended up loving it so much, I prefer it ALONE! It's delicious! And what's really awesome - no headaches; no fatigue; no withdrawals whatsoever being without coffee! AWESOME!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bergin Nut Company Oat Bran Packages, 32-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
I concur. Ditto to everything everyone else has said. Good stuff. Happy happy. I make muffins regularly and this helps keep the quality along with the pricing and convenience all do-able.
Mine was backordered for about three weeks but I didn't mind as I was in no hurry for it.
First time using this and I like it very much and will use again and again and recommend. Tomorrow I will be seeing a friend and will give her a "care package" of a bag of this and a bag of the Bob's Golden flaxseed meal so it makes a nice gift packaging item also.
Thank you Bergin and Amazon!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Glutino Gluten Free Pantry Favorite Sandwich Bread Mix, 22-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
No doubt this is a good bread and I will probably end up making it again. Here are my thoughts both positive and otherwise.

1) Easily accessible product - found my box at Walmart, for $4.50.
2) The ingredients are self contained in the box; other than eggs, choice of fat; and liquid.
3) I like that you have options: water or milk or almond milk, etc; eggs or egg white; various oils or butter
4) This should easily be touted as another great "no knead" bread - just mix and pour.
5) I like that it gives the options of oven baking or bread machine. I don't have a bread machine so I made mine in the oven.
6) It rose very quickly and there are not several stages to wait through - just the one rising time.
7) It was done very quickly.
8) The bread makes a nice size loaf and slices well, without crumbling
9) Each slice of bread holds up well to spreading and doesn't tear even when buttering with cold, hard butter - no tearing
10) The flavor is good enough on its own, but I could also see how adding other ingredients would really be welcome, too. I can see why all the positive remarks that this is probably one of the best GF breads out there.

And now for my other comments:

While it is Gluten-free, it is not starch free (nor does it claim to be, either). I have a hard time, these days digesting ALL grains, and starches sometimes bother me, too. So, while the ingredients were very clearly stated, I chose to buy the product anyway just to see how well I would 'do' with this particular bread and whether or not to stay with it, or move on to Paleo breads, which are gluten free, as well as grain AND starch free. Only time will tell how I feel after eating this bread.
My other comment is that it contains corn starch, and as 80-90% of corn in the US is genetically modified, I'm wondering if that is true with this item as well?

Nonetheless, I was pleased with all of its attributes, and if/when I make it again, I'll be sure and not let it brown as much - keep an eye on it! :)
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Wild Planet Wild Skipjack Tuna (Light Tuna), 5 oz Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:

Bought it first to try and just now subscribed!
It's delicious! I take it to work and easy enough to eat right out of the can, while sitting in my car listening to the radio and catching some beautiful breezes.
The juice is awesome - fresh tasting. No oil, very little salt..not even water. Just the juice itself.
Fresh and delicious - haven't even made the 'regular' tuna salad with it yet. Haven't felt the need to.
Rating:

The Spice Lab Himalayan Kosher Unprocessed Cooking X-Fine, Grain Salt 2 pounds
Review:
I have a number of different salts in the house and so far my favorite has been the pink Himalayan salt.
The flavor is absolutely incredible and it completely makes all the difference in the way foods taste when you cook. They taste so much better.

But, I was reading some reviews and saw some comments that the pink salt had fluoride and had all these warnings on it! Well, that made me nervous because I try and avoid fluoride (don't use fluoride toothpaste, etc.). I was so disappointed.

But, I read further that the fluoride is not 'added', is not the same as the dangerous fluoride found in our water system here, but rather, naturally occurring. I didn't do a whole lot of research about this, but since that made me happy, I ordered it.

I really do love it, and prefer it over all the others, although the grey is nice as well.
Rating:
5.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

<similarpairs>
Product:
FiberPlus Antioxidant Bars, Chocolatey Peanut Butter, 1.2-Ounce Bars, 5-Count (Pack of 6)
Review:
These Kellogg's Fiber Plus antioxidant bars are delicious; I could eat them all day but then I suppose I'd be spending my life in the restroom! Just as other reviewers have noted, these bars are quite tasty and they don't make me feel bloated, cramped, or uncomfortable in any way. Of course they contain some manmade ingredients (i.e., artificial flavoring) but they're still superior to candy bars. The "chocolatey peanut butter" flavor is quite good and these bars stay fresh a while after you pick up a box or two of them. Great!

True, there's some saturated fat in these bars but overall they're still good for me; they help me stay regular and that's a huge plus.

I highly recommend these Fiber Plus antioxidant bars from Kellogg's. The "chocolatey peanut butter" flavor makes them practically habit-forming!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24)
Review:
These power bars in that mixed berry blast flavor are tasty and delicious! True, I have to take a few minutes to chew them--they're not something I can eat very quickly, they're too chewy for that. Most importantly, but they are very  helpful to me when I exercise. For example, they are excellent for a power boost shortly before I exercise; and they help me replenish the salt I lose when I perspire both during and shortly after exercising.

Some will say that these bars really give you protein while others maintain that these bars don't have enough protein. They do have 6 grams of protein per bar so I guess it becomes an individual decision when it comes to just how much protein you want; you could have two bars before a workout or running if extra protein is what you want.

Overall, these bars are great. I love them! They are excellent for athletes and anyone serious about working out, but of course they can be enjoyed as a snack if you wish.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kellogg's Nutri-Grain Cereal Bars (Raspberry, 8-Count Bars, Pack of 6)
Review:
Kellogg's Nutri Grain cereal bars make for a tasty snack and they are good for when you need quick energy and you're "on the go." They are perfect when you don't have time to eat something more substantial to get quick energy. The price at which Amazon offers them is affordable compared to what my local supermarket charges. These strawberry flavored bars are low in fat and cholesterol, too--a great plus! Moreover, they are even "certified kosher" if that matters to you. Moreover, these bars are both chewy and satisfying  SMILE

However, this cereal bar is not perfect. Each bar contains 26 grams of carbohydrates and 13 grams of sugar; sugar can sometimes turn into fat in your body. These amounts of carbohydrates and sugar are a lot for a comparatively small cereal bar! Moreover, this food bar is not for anyone on a salt free diet as it contains some salt; and people with allergies to wheat or milk should consult their doctor before they eat this food.

These bars go down better if you eat them with juice, milk or water. I eat them with water or apple juice myself.

Overall, the strawberry flavored Nutri Grain cereal bars are useful for those of us who are not allergic to any of their ingredients and who want a healthy alternative to a regular breakfast or a candy bar. The Amazon price makes them affordable and I also recommend them as a nutritious snack food that is especially good for people on the run. They are far superior to any candy bar!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Fruit Harvest Cereal, Strawberry Blueberry, 12.2-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 4)
Review:
Kellogg's Fruit Harvest Strawberry Blueberry packs a huge punch with a great taste and it contains no fat, no trans fats and no cholesterol. It is relatively low in sugar and carbohydrates, too.

Despite the fact that this is one of the best tasting breakfast cereals out there I am disappointed in its vitamin content. The artwork on the box leads you to believe that this cereal just has to be very healthy for you. Yes, it has 25 % of your recommended daily intake of iron, niacin, vitamin B12, vitamin B6, riboflavin, thiamin and folic acid; but I expected this product to be healthier still. I will take off one star for that to make this a four star review.

It is low in sugar just as they say it is. However, if you aren't getting the proper amount of exercise you need, then the extra sugar in the strawberries, blueberries and corn syrup could turn into sugar inside your body. As always, when planning a diet, it helps to consult your physician before starting a new diet.

Nevertheless, the strawberries and blueberries taste delicious--even when you eat this dry and drink milk along with it. Kellogg's Fruit Harvest Cereal offers whole grain which is an important part of any healthy diet.

Overall, Kellogg's Fruit Harvest Strawberry Blueberry breakfast cereal is a great choice to start your day. Sure, it may not be the absolute healthiest cereal on your grocer's shelf but this cereal beats junk food by a mile. Buy some and enjoy today!

SMILE
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Product 19 Cereal, 12-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 4)
Review:
Product 19 is an excellent breakfast cereal. It has absolutely no fat, no trans fat, no cholesterol, and it is rather low in sugar content. Excellent! Product 19 even has 100% of vitamins C, E, B12, B16, iron and other nutrients as well. Very impressive! (Amazon states that it has only 10% of these nutrients but that is incorrect.)

On the other hand, the cereal is low in fiber and it contains sodium and carbohydrates. Check the label to see if you're comfortable with the amounts of ALL the ingredients in this cereal before buying it. Product 19 is something that grew on me; I initially didn't like it but I kept eating it in the morning for health reasons. Over time I appreciated the taste more and more. This may be true for you, too. Not everyone will find this cereal to be tasty the very first time they eat it. You could add a few strawberries or blueberries on top of the cereal to make it sweeter; these berries are also very healthy for you, too.

The packaging is attractive. The sealed plastic bag inside the box keeps the cereal fresh even a couple of months beyond the expiration date on the box.

Overall, Product 19 is an excellent cereal for people who care about what they eat. It may take a little getting used to because of the taste and the consistency of the cereal flakes. Despite the "taste factor" and a few drawbacks concerning sodium and carbohydrates, I highly recommend this cereal as part of a healthy diet.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Ritz Crackers, 10 Count, 37.7 Ounce
Review:
Ritz crackers by Nabisco have always been one of my favorites. I remember eating them in kindergarten at snack time--I always wanted a couple extra! These crackers have stood the test of time because they are very tasty and great to eat as a snack.

Ritz crackers are rather low in fat (4.5 grams of fat per serving) and they have almost no carbohydrates. They are cholesterol free as well--hooray! In addition, this product is kosher if that matters to you. The nutrition label indicates that there are no trans-fats but I did notice a bit of partially hydrogenated ingredients on the label--it may be that the amount of trans-fats this generates is negligible.

Ritz crackers can be eaten by themselves but feel free to get creative! They can help out when it's time to make snacks for company. Just put a bit of cheese (or melted cheese and ham) on them and you're serving up great appetizers or snack in no time! They go great with a little bit of butter on them, too.

Overall, Ritz crackers really hit the spot when I crave a snack before bedtime. I simply take a slice of two of regular cheese and place little bits of the cheese on top of the crackers and with a small beverage it's awesome!

I highly recommend Ritz crackers as one of the healthier crackers that will satisfy you, too. Great!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Gatorade Performance Series Carbohydrate Energy Formula, Wild Berry, 12-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 24)
Review:
Gatorade performance series carbohydrate energy formula is not my favorite tasting beverage; but for the athletes amongst us it can sure make excellent sense to drink this stuff! I am no athlete; I only drink this sporadically. This drink is best suited for people who train intensively and people who compete in sporting competitions. It's essentially a "high octane" version of regular Gatorade. It does have a somewhat pleasant berry, fruity taste to it that is enhanced by huge amounts of sugar. If the taste isn't too great, try to refrigerate this before drinking it. Leave any leftover Gatorade refrigerated for best taste and nutritional value.

Gatorade comes in a firm plastic bottle with a cap that screws on and off for easy drinking. It contains 79 grams of carbs that you will probably lose if you're really exercising a lot. In addition, this type of Gatorade has sodium (ouch) BUT it will rehydrate you fast after you work out. It may also be helpful to drink Gatorade if you have diarrhea; ask your doctor about this. It's also worth noting that this type of Gatorade contains 25% of the recommended daily intake of niacin, B6, and pantothenic acid

In addition, Gatorade can give you an energy boost without making you lose sleep; this is because Gatorade has sugar but no caffeine.

Overall, I highly recommend Gatorade as more than just a snack drink. Gatorade helps you to rehydrate after you sweat a lot during a work out or some type of sporting competition; and it gives you an energy boost as well while replenishing any carbohydrates you may have lost doing exercise. It may also be beneficial when you're on chemotherapy (as I am) to balance out your body's system. I believe that this type of Gatorade also contains electrolytes that can be beneficial to your system.

If you have any questions about Gatorade ask your doctor before drinking this beverage.
Rating:
4.0

I've always loved vanilla more than chocolate thus naturally placed an order for vanilla but received a chocolate sample for free which I had today chilled at lunch and wow what a pick me up I really enjoyed it and still full about 6 hours later- the vanilla had a bit of a chalky after taste that protein whey taste to it which the chocolate didn't so I'll probably try the coffee next to see how it fares to the other two...

Product:
CoCo Libre Coconut Water, 11 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
1- it's only 130 calories
2- it's loaded with protein and essential vits/minerals
3- it does leave you feeling full and not wanting more without breaking calorie budget
4- it's better than juicing all day two of these and sensible dinner will indeed take care of those two extra pesky holiday pounds provided dinner is sensible and no snacking except on a fruit
5- doesn't taste cloying like other coconut water I've tried!
Now the bad
1- every sip comes with a disgusting chalky clump
2- It doesn't matter how much you shake it, it will not dissolve the clumps
3- not particularly palatable I did it more to stick to a dietary plan than for enjoyment
4- isn't as natural as it proclaims but I guess that's to be expected
Good outnumbers bad so I am not totally disappointed but after this 6 day regimen to find once again my true north I'd probably not purchase it again
Good news is it saved me from going on another juice diet - I've almost forgotten how cranky and migraine(y) and dented my wallet was on those at lease thank God I still get to have coffee and some solids (aside from the clumps in this drink that is)

I like all of them and usually don't peek when I reach into the bag. That way I get a pleasant surprise. I probably like the dark chocolate the best but I enjoy all of the choices. If you eat two of three pieces of chocolate, you don't feel so piggy which is another good thing. I find that one piece of chocolate usually satisfies me so this bag lasts a while. It is a good choice for my family. Hersheys just make a very good product that continues to maintain a very excellent product. You can't go wrong with Hersheys.

The chocolate flavor was good and we liked the crunch to the cookies. They were very fresh and arrived unbroken which is always  plus. I would recommend them for little or big people as a good treat.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Kellogg's Corn Flakes Breakfast Cereal, Original, 18 Ounce Box (Pack of 3)
Review:
Here is another favorite breakfast food in my family. We enjoy corn flakes quite a lot. The crunch is good. The flavor is good. The price is good, too. Sometimes at night we indulge in a tasty bowl of cornflakes as we sit by the flickering light of the television as a special treat to ourselves. I have caught family members just enjoying corn flakes by the handful just out of the box. Any of those ways is pretty good. There is one more thing that I do with corn flakes. I make delicious corn flake cookies. These have to be made on a day that is not rainy or damp as egg whites have to be whipped with the corn flakes gently folded in and baked in a low oven. They are truly delicious. We never let any corn flakes go to waste at our house!

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Langers 100% Juice, Pineapple, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: First time I have tried Langers pineapple juice, as I was raised on Dole. A friend told me she liked the brand, so when I saw it at the grocery store, I grabbed a bottle. The main difference between Dole and Langers is Langers comes from a concentrate, and Dole may or may not be from a concentrate (plus Dole is now adding Vitamin E & Vitamin A). They are both products of the Philippines. Langer's seems a little sweeter, though the RDA label states they have the same calories and sugars count. Langers is also a touch thicker, like they emulsified it, as there aren't any bits of pulp settling down to the bottom of the bottle, or perhaps that's because it's pasteurized. Unlike Dole, you don't have to shake the bottle to mix up the settled juice. Nor do you need to transfer it to a new container with a snap lid (so you can shake it again before pouring it into a glass), once youve opened it. You also don't have to rummage around in the junk drawer looking for a church key to open the can. This does need to be refrigerated once the bottle has been opened. Expiration date is basically 1 year from when I purchased it. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kraft Free Catalina Fat Free Dressing, 16-Ounce Plastic Bottles (Pack of 6) Review: I prefer this over the regular Catalina, which I've eaten over 45 years. If you've never had Catalina Salad Dressing, it's a sweet, tangy, tomato based vinaigrette-styled salad dressing. Nice combination when mixed with Bernstein's Light Fantastic Cheese Fantastico Italian Dressing for a different variation. Unlike some other dressings, you do not need to over-dress your greens with this, it stands up for itself. Great on baked chicken. Good for mixing in a BBQ sauce. I've even used this instead of tomato sauce when making a pizza, with a little added diced garlic and onion (it's a lot like Round Table's Maui Zaui pizza's sauce). Rating: 5.0 Product: Campbell's Tomato Soup, 14.5 Ounce Cans (Pack of 12) Review: No dented cans so far. I make cream of tomato soup. Since I don't have milk in my home very often I add 2/3 cup of dried non-fat milk to the soup after I've heated it up. Therefore no scorching. Rating: 5.0 Product: Campbell's Bean with Bacon Soup, 28 Ounce Cans (Pack of 12) Review: Love this soup and it was my Dad's favorite. I am bad, if I have it, I will add some crisped bacon bits over the top. I also like to smash some of the beans to make it thicker. Great to eat with Marie Callender's Original Corn Bread. Plus, with both items, you only need to add water. EXPIRES: 10/2015 Rating: 5.0 Product: Green Giant Corn, White, 7-Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: EXPIRES: October 2017 Tender young sweet white corn. Unlike extra-sweet yellow corn varieties, this does not have a tough skin. Good kernel length. Not a starchy variety. Enough for 2 good servings in this smaller 7ozs. size. Compared to years ago, there is very little water added to the can. All cans are undamaged. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kraft Spaghetti Classics, Tangy Italian Spaghetti Spice Mix & Parmesan Cheese, 8-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 24) Review: Mom used to make this 50yrs ago and I haven't seen it on a store shelf in 15yrs probably. I was very happy to see this again. They haven't changed the sauce at all and it makes plenty for the given amount of pasta. The pasta is not gummy/starchy at all like other store purchased brands I've tried. If they actually pkg'd their pasta I would buy it though I normally just make pasta prior to serving it. Don't care about their parm cheese but then I also don't buy their brand, I'd rather buy a wedge and grate it myself b/c the flavor it so much better. UPDATE 5/2015: EXPIRES 1/2016 Rating: 5.0 Product: Hormel Compleats Beef Rib Tips with Mashed Potatoes and Gravy, 9 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: Has about 15 1/2" cubes of tender beef rib steak tips. Potatoes are okay, nothing to really talk about. I probably don't have the 'hard puck' problems that others do b/c my microwave is 30yo and only rated at 700w, so I cook this for 2" on Med.-High instead of the stated 1.5". Too much gravy, though it has a good taste. Would be good to mix the entire thing up and pour over a grain, bread or noodles. Stated low in sodium but it does come across as salty. Gravy has a powdered garlic taste. Found very few mushrooms, but with so much gravy if the pieces are very small I don't think you would notice them. They were sent for my Subscribe & Save order of Hormel Compleats Homestyle Beef with Mashed Potatoes & Gravy, 10-Ounce Microwavable Bowls (Pack of 6), as there was a mix-up by the packaging plant and the boxes were marked incorrectly. UPDATE 5/4/2015: Just noticed Hormel has changed this slightly. Hormel has removed the mushroom pieces from the beef gravy. Hopefully they haven't changed the gravy's flavor. Product:
Cap Mundo Single-Cup Coffee for Nespresso Brewers, Yrgacheffe, 10 Count (Pack of 6)
Review:
While I am a huge fan of light African coffees for drip coffee, they often make a mediocre espresso. These Yrgacheffe nespresso capsules make a decent espresso, with a fair amount of crema, but it's not an especially rich flavored espresso. The light, wine-like flavors of the bean do come through a bit.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Lindt LINDOR Dark Chocolate Truffles, Kosher, 60 Count Box, 25.4 Ounce
Review:
Both the original order and a replacement order arrived badly melted and partly crushed. The innards of the truffles turn easily to a liquid and the package and packaging was well coated in chocolate.

That said, if you order these in the winter, your success is likely to be better. The chocolates themselves are a sort of semi-dark chocolate, significantly different than milk chocolate, but not as dark as can be had. Tasty too.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Espressione 100% Arabica Coffee, 150-Count Pods
Review:
Both the 100% Arabica and the Espressione Espresso are excellent for espresso drinks. Traditionally espresso, unlike good drip coffee, is made with a mix of Arabica and Robusta coffees. The taste differences are noticeable, but I don't have a strong favorite. I use the pods for convenience, although I also roast my own green beans for espresso as well.

If you look at the negative reviews, they're mostly on the "best before" dates being passed. While I would also be upset to spend money and get "expired" pods, I should point out that the pods are good for quite some time after their nominal expiration dates. I just found a handful of these Espressione Classic pods with 2002 (this is late 2009 now) dates and they made acceptable, though not spectacular espresso. Basically they're vacuum packed and not much is happening inside the wrapper.

5.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
CLIF BAR - Energy Bar - Apricot - (2.4 Ounce Protein Bar, 12 Count)
Review:
This is probably the best of all the "nutrition" snacks I've tried, and I've tried a lot lately.  It's NOT stale, unnatural, gummy, flat, tough, phony, bitter, sour, or just plain "off" in taste or texture.  Then again, it's not fresh apple pie either.

However, the predominant notes are cinnamon and raisins with some raw oat-y undertones, and it's comforting to discover that these are among the ingredients--70% of which are organic.  There is a slight apple-like undertone, but that may be by association, the cinnamon scent reminds one of pumpkins, coffee cake, waffles, and more. It's slightly chewy, but easily eaten and not dry.  The oats (especially) and walnuts add to the texture, although I didn't detect much walnut flavor (although there was that "waffle"-like taste). At any rate, the combination of flavors is excellent, making this an actually enjoyable little treat!

Ingredients: Organic Brown Rice Syrup, ClifProTM (Soy Rice Crisps [Soy Protein Isolate, Rice Flour, Malt Extract], Organic Roasted Soybeans, Organic Soy Flour), Organic Rolled Oats, Raisins, Walnuts, Organic Evaporated Cane Juice, ClifCrunchTM (Organic Oat Fiber, Chicory Extract, Organic Flaxseed, Psyllium), Organic Oat Bran, Molasses Powder, Natural Flavors, Ground Cinnamon, Sea Salt

Nutritional Facts: (Amount per serving is followed by % of daily value) Total Fat: 5 g, 8%;Saturated Fat: 1 g; 4% Trans Fat: 0 gr; Cholesterol 0 mg, Sodium 130 mg, 5%; Potassium 310 mg, 9%;Total Carbohydrates: 43 g, 14%; Dietary Fiber: 5 g, 20%; Insoluble Fiber: 3 g; Sugars: 20 g; Other Carbohydrates 18 g; Protein 10 g  20%.

The Clif website also reports that "Walnuts are a source of Omega-3s"  (there are 400mg of EPA and DHA omega-3 fatty acids per serving), but adds (or their lawyers add): "Supportive but not conclusive research shows that consumption of EPA and DHA omega-3 fatty acids may reduce the risk of coronary heart disease. One CLIF BAR provides 400mg of EPA and DHA omega-3 fatty acids. "

Other nutritional information.  Clif adds enough supplemental ingredients it begins to resemble an enormous,  good-tasting, multivitamin. While you don't get 100% of your recommended daily values (based on a 2,000-calorie diet), you get a pretty fair dose: Vitamin A 30%, C 100%, E 100%, K, 25%,  Thiamin 25% Riboflavin 15% Niacin 15% B6  20% , Folate 20%, B12 15%, Biotin 10%, Calcium 25%, Iron 25%, Pantothenic Acid 20%, Phosphorus 20%, Iodine  15%, Magnesium 25%, Zinc 20%,  Selenium 20%, Copper 15%, Manganese 35%, Chromium 10%, Molybdenum 15%.

While I would have preferred that the best, most natural flavor is chocolate, I'll still recommend these, but I'm taking a break from consuming or reviewing them for a while.  Bon appetit!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
CLIF BAR - Energy Bar - Apricot - (2.4 Ounce Protein Bar, 12 Count)
Review:
Main Points:

Much better then their "Nutrition" line peanut butter bar, the "regular" chocolate brownie bar has a rich flavor and a chewy, slightly nutty, substantial texture.  Unfortunately, there is an aftertaste that belies the initial flavor jolt, and-once tasted-it becomes more prominent. There's a raisiny, plum-y sort of taste (which may come from the figs inside) that threatens the chocolate integrity. Overall, however, it's quite tasty, filling, and eminently portable.

Ingredients:

Clif Bars feature organic, healthy ingredients, heavy on soy products. The ingredients include (as listed) organic brown rice syrup, organic rolled oats, "Clifpro" (a blend of soy protein isolate, rice flour, malt extract, organic roasted soybeans, organic soy flour), organic evaporated cane sugar, chocolate chips, fig paste, organic soy butter, cocoa, organic milled flaxseed, chicory, sea salt, Dutch cocoa, other natural flavors, and a pharmacopoeia of vitamins and minerals.

Nutrition:

Analysis of a 68-gram bar reveals the following:

Calories 240; Calories from Fat, 40; Total Fat, 4.5 grams; Saturated Fat, 1.5 g; Protein, 10 g; Dietary Fiber, 5g; Insoluble Fiber, 4g; Sugars, 20g; and Total Carbohydrates, 45g; and Sodium, 150mg. (This is basically comparable to the horrendous tasting Nutrition Crunchy Peanut Butter Bar mentioned above.) There are 100% of Daily Requirements of Vitamins C and E, and about 15-35% of many other vitamins and minerals (most of which are added directly to the product-see list above). Here's a nutritional comparison with the Clif "Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup":

Calories 220, Fat Calories 20, Total Fat (g) 2.5, Sat. Fat (g) 0, Cholesterol (mg) 0, Sodium (mg) 90, Potassium (mg) 280, Total Carbs (g) 43, Dietary Fiber (g) 5, Sugars (g) 21, Proteins (g) 8.

Summary:

This is apparently a very nutritious, soy rich, organic, portable snack that emphasizes protein, carbs, and fiber. Fat content is a little bit higher than their Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup, although this product has a bit more protein. While I can't give nutritional recommendations, I hope the information above is helpful.  The taste and texture are very good for this kind of product.  By the way, this is a socially responsible, consumer-friendly company (see [...]
Rating:
4.0
Product:
CLIF BAR - Energy Bar - Apricot - (2.4 Ounce Protein Bar, 12 Count)
Review:
Along with the chocolate Clif Z-Bar, this is one of the better tasting "nutritional" snacks. It has just enough chocolate (from chocolate chips, see ingredient list) to impart a chocolate flavor. Not a heavy or rich chocolate flavor, but an unmistakable one: You don't have to close your eyes, and convince yourself that it's chocolate.

This has a "Bit-O-Honey" -like chewy texture with honey overtones. Throw in some sticky peanut butter and chocolate, and you've pretty much captured the flavor. To my surprise, however, there is no honey. Clif gets that taste from syrups, malt, cane juice, fig paste, and other sweet ingredients.

It's definitely filling, especially if accompanied by an apple or something, and at least eight ounces of water.  While chewy, it doesn't seem as dry as similar products. Could it be the six grams of fat-two of which are saturated?  Made with 70% organic ingredients, this bar has a whopping 11 grams of protein, only 20 grams of sugar (compare that with other brands and flavors), and includes five grams of fiber. Along with Clif's Z-bar and the excellent Clif apple raisin walnut, this is one of the better tasting of its kind--just don't expect a brownie.

Ingredients at the time of this review. (just in case the recipe changes):

Organic Brown Rice Syrup, ClifPro (Soy Rice Crisps [Soy Protein Isolate, Rice Flour, Malt Extract], Organic Soy Flour, Organic Roasted Soybeans), Organic Rolled Oats, Organic Evaporated Cane Juice, Organic Peanut Butter (Organic Peanuts, Salt), Peanut Flour, Chocolate Chips (Organic Evaporated Cane Juice, Unsweetened Chocolate, Cocoa Butter, Soy Lecithin, Natural Flavors), ClifCrunch (Apple Fiver, Oat Fiver, Organic Milled Flaxseed, Chicory Extract, Psyllium), Fig Paste, Peanuts, Natural Flavors, Sea Salt. Vitamins & Minerals: Dicalcium Phosphate, Magnesium Oxide, Ascorbic Acid (Vit. C), Tocopheryl Acetate (Vit. E), Ferric Orthophosphate (Iron), Beta Carotene (Vit. A), Zinc Citrate, Phytonadione (Vit. K1), Biotin, Niacinamide (Vit. B3), Calcium Pantothenate (Vit. B5), Potassium Iodide, Manganese Gluconate, Copper Gluconate, Sodium Selenite, Thiamin (Vit. B1), Chromium Chloride, Cyanocobalamin (Vit. B12), Sodium Molybdate, Folic Acid (Vit. B2), Pyridoxine Hydrochloride (Vit. B6).

4.0
Product:
KIND Healthy Grains Clusters, Vanilla Blueberry with Flax Seeds Granola, 10g Protein, Gluten Free, Non GMO, 11 Ounce Bags, 3 Count
Review:
I enthusiastically recommend this product, primarily for its vastly superior taste and texture. Although nothhing tastes like a blueberry as much as a blueberry, once you adjust (about 4 initial mouthfuls) the KIND version of blueberry, you'll not only love the taste, but it will seem close enough to the real thing that you'll have a Blueberry Experience!  NOt too crunchy, yet not too soft or crumbly, these have a great blueberry/flax/cinnamon flavor which I loved. (Non-cinnamon fans should stay away).

The product is slightly pricey, but this is offset by how filling it is--especially when consumed with water.  I'd recommend this as a pick-me-up/snack almost anytime,; for example, while at the office, on a hike, taking a break from a bike ride, etc. The ingredients tasted fresh (one unlucky reviewer reported a "rancid" ingredient). Overall a very tasty and satisfying snack food.  Highly recommended!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Worcestershire Sauce, Organic, 6.25 oz.
Review:
Annie's, the friendly company, makes this fine organic and vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce (it appears that other products have anchovies in them, hence their non-vegetarian status). Made in the beautiful state of Vermont (not too far from Ben and Jerry's) this apple cider vinegar, molasses, soy sauce based product adds a lot of dark spicy flavor to stir fries, hamburgers (I'm imagining here that you'll probably get soy burgers, and anything needing a sweet/sour/spicy kick to it. As suggested above, great in sauces and stews too.

In each large (perhaps recipe-based) 2 tablespoon serving (about seven servings per container), you get the following nutritional components:

20 calories, no fat, 460 mg. of sodium, 5 grams of carbohydrate (four of which are sugars), and bit of protein (< than 1 gram). Other information about Annie's company and products are on the web at anniesnaturals.com

Hint: For more fun, teach some youngsters to spell "Worcestershire," show them where it is on the map, and read "The Wind in the Willows" to them!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
York Peppermint Patties Dark Chocolate Covered Mint Candy, 66.7 Ounce
Review:
Yes, this is the candy that inspired the name of Patricia Peppermint Patty of Peanuts, (she's the likable, intelligent, assertive one) who pitched a no-hitter and clobbered 5 home runs in one game (and pitched a no-hit, 50-0 game which Charlie Brown lost for her with just one out), who got a D- on every one of her school assignments, and who has kind of a thing for Chuck.  Just like Patty, this candy is a classic.

If you like chocolate and you like mint, theres no better candy.  The bright, fresh mint taste explodes at first bite, somewhat mellowed and balanced by the smooth chocolate covering: The chocolate really gets second billing here, although it becomes more noticeable in the aftertaste. Its incredibly sweet, but somehow doesnt overpower, and the urge for more can be difficult to quell.  Some nutritional information might help, but even that may not be enough.

In three "Dark Chocolate Covered York Peppermint Patties (41 grams), there are 150 calories,  3g total fat, 2g saturated fat, no trans fat or cholesterol, 33g total carbohydrate , 27g sugar,  15g sodium, < 1g dietary fiber < 1g of protein, 2% of  RDA of protein, and 0% of the RDA of vitamin A, vitamin C, and calcium. Not health food, but better than some other candies on the block. Of course, this assumes you eat ONLY THREE PEPPERMINT PATTIES. The ingredients also compare favorably with other candies: Sugar, corn syrup, semi-sweet chocolate (chocolate, sugar, cocoa, milk fat, cocoa butter, soy lecithin, PGPR, vanillin (artificial flavor), invert sugar, egg whites, oil of peppermint, milk.  PGPR stands for Polyglycerol polyricinoleate, an emulsifier made with glycerol and fatty acids.  At least theres no artificial flavors to go along with all that sugars, carbohydrates, and calories.  BY the way, the people at [...] have far worse (nutritionally) data for a York Peppermint Pattie, but one can't tell if their information (which is for one piece only) is for this exact same candy as listed here, or some other version.  You can call the Hershey Company in (of course) Hershey, Pennsylvania to pursue this further, 1-800-468-1714, or go to [...]

Like Patty, Pattie is irresistible.  (I love that he is her ice-skating coach, and she thinks hes a "funny-looking kid with a big nose.")  Theres no denying that this is one delicious treat.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24)
Review:
Tasting and Texture Notes for Banana Flavor Power Bar.

Flavor: The predominant flavor is apples and cinnamon, with a persistent banana undertone, as well as tastes of raisin.  While not a rich banana flavor, it is recognizable, and none of the flavors seems off-tone-much more than can be said for similar products.  After looking at the ingredients below, I was very surprised that the banana power bar contains no cinnamon, and that the apple taste may be actually come from the grape and pear concentrates.  The ingredient list also reveals several grains (oat bran, rice bran, milled rice, brown rice flour), and the source of the banana flavor-banana powder.

Texture: After the initial touch bite into the dense, somewhat hard surface, the ingredients gradually present themselves as very chewy with a noticeable grainy texture.  Again, while initiates may need time to get used to this, it is not unpleasant, and the chewy quality gives the impression of substance (although there are only 3 grams of dietary fiber, as seen below).  I left one semi-open for a day or so, and found that the bar was easier to bite into, perhaps due to moisture absorption.

Nutritional Information:

(The information below is from the website, [...] and differs slightly from the Amazon.com list.)

230 Calories, 10 Calories from Fat, Total Fat 2.5 mg (Saturated Fat, 0.5 g and Trans Fat, 0 g.), Cholesterol 0 mg; Sodium, 100 mg; Potassium, 190 mg; Total Carbohydrates 45 g (Dietary Fiber 3g, Sugars, 20g; Other Carbohydrates, 22 g); Protein, 9g

*Percent Daily Values (DV) are based on a 2,000 calorie diet.

Vitamin A 0%*  Vitamin C 100% ,Calcium 30% , Iron 35% , Vitamin E 100% , Thiamin 100% , Riboflavin 100% , Niacin 100% , Vitamin B6 100% , Folate 100% ,Vitamin B12 100% , Biotin 100% , Pantothenic Acid 100% , Phosphorus 35% , Magnesium 35% , Zinc 35% ,Copper 35%,Chromium 20%, Chloride <2%

Ingredients:

High Fructose Corn Syrup With Grape And Pear Juice Concentrate, Oat Bran, Maltodextrin, Milk Protein Isolate, Banana Powder, Almond Butter, Rice Crisps (Milled Rice, Rice Bran), Brown Rice Flour, Glycerin, Natural Flavors, Soy Protein Isolate.  Contains milk, nut, and soy ingredients. Made on equipment that also processes peanuts.

Conclusion:

With a relatively low fat content (see above), nine grams of protein, and above average taste and texture, this is one of the better "energy bars" sold. Of course, for specific information about whether this meets your dietary needs, consult a physician, dietician, and/or nutritionist.

5.0

Product:
Raven's Brew Decaf Whole Bean Coffee, House Blend, 12 Ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
These coffees are weak in comparison to the Death Wish brand or even the Kicking Horse brand.  Three Peckered is extremely light, like drinking watery hotel coffee.  So, brew it extra strong.  Then it becomes palatable.  Resurrection is weak but tastes very nice and smooth.  Dead Man's Reach is the a medium strength roast that has a little more flavor.

No acidity.  Good taste.  Mediocre at worst.  If you like a smoother, gentler coffee, these three will do.

Better stronger coffees are the Death Wish, Valhalla Java, and Kicking Horse varieties.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Kicking Horse Whole Bean Coffee, Kick Ass Dark Roast, 12.3-Ounce Tins (Pack of 2)
Review:
Better than Starbucks, Dunkin, Maxwell House, Folgers, Green Mountain, Gevalia, etc.  I have tried a lot of coffee--all types of roasts.  This dark roast is full of flavor, never gets acrid, never tastes burnt--even when left in the pot too long!  It does not irritate your stomach or leave an aftertaste.  It is a very good roast, well worth the money.  In fact, you realize how much you get ripped off by the major, more popular brands out there once you taste this coffee.

Whether you like a lighter cup or a strong cup, the coffee never disappoints.  Although I must say that this is better going strong.  More scoops equal more flavor.

It is so good that I am now going to try every other roast they offer.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Cameron's Coffee Roasted Whole Bean Coffee, Flavored, Chocolate Caramel Brownie, 12 Ounce (Pack of 3) 
Review:
This coffee provides what it promises: a sweet brew that is not acidic or chemically-overpowering.  It is a decent flavored coffee that beats Dunkin Donuts' flavored coffees easily.  While the beans smell overpoweringly flavored at first, once you grind and brew them they release a heavenly cocoa aroma and impart only a slightly sweet taste.

Good coffee that smells sweet and tastes natural.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Raven's Brew Whole Bean Deadman's Reach,Dark Roast 12-Ounce Bags (Pack of 2)
Review:
Deceptively smooth.  You can make a strong pot of Deadman's Reach and not taste anything bitter.  But the caffeine level will surprise you.  It may say it's a dark roast, but it tastes like a rather plain medium roast.  In fact, I have had blonde roasts that are similar in taste to this coffee.  You are not getting a very flavorful cup of Joe here, but a pleasant smoothness that delivers a caffeinated punch.

I view this blend as a utilitarian blend.  You need caffeine?  Buy it.  You need a gentler flavor?  Buy it.  Not fond of aromatic coffee?  Buy it.

Deadman's Reach lacks the impressive flavor and aroma of Kicking Horse Coffee blends and lacks the heavier, bold caffeine grip of Valhalla Java from Deathwish.  It's still much better than Dunkin Donuts or most of Starbuck's coffees.  You can taste the quality.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Death Wish & Valhalla Java Whole Bean Coffee Bundle Deal, USDA Certified Organic & Fair Trade (1 of Each Bag)
Review:
Two great coffees, perfect together.  These coffees are strong and never get acidic if brewed extra dark.  Valhalla Java tastes the best, has more nuance to it.  Death Wish is a sort of straight-forward dark deliciousness.  Nothing soft or sweet about these bad boys.  They make a tough cup of Joe that tastes good.  I will say that, if you make them too light, they lose a lot of their flavor, IMO.  Valhalla also seems to have a better caffeine punch in the face.

Buy it.  Brew it.  Die happy.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kicking Horse Whole Bean, Hoodoo Jo Dark Extreme Bold Roast, 12.3 Ounce Tin
Review:
Another Kicking Horse hit coffee here.  Delicious, aromatic, and unique.  No stomach issues or acid issues.  Even when it's been left in the pot too long, its drinkable!  I don't recommend old coffee, but that has to attest to this coffee's quality.  It never tastes burnt.

Hoodoo Jo is unique in that it has a strong medium flavor to me, yet it definitely has "fruity" undertones.  But nothing weird that gets in the way of that coffee taste we all crave.  It is not sweet, but pleasant.  Different.  Earthy and fruity is the best way I can describe it--even though fruity makes you think of sweetness.  I simply mean it has a natural flavor that attracts you like fruit does.  Very interesting.  Very tasty.

It will not turn off the hardcore dark lovers OR the light drinkers.  I'd say every coffee lover should give this a try.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Vita Coco Coconut Water, Pure - Naturally Hydrating Electrolyte Drink - Smart Alternative to Coffee, Soda, and Sports Drinks - Gluten Free - 11.1 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
This is a wonderful product.  Vita Coco tastes delicious.  Not overpowering or sweet.  It has a perfect, subtle, natural coconut taste.

Vita Coco truly does refresh you and re-hydrate you faster than regular water.  Faster than Gatorade.  You can feel the difference.  Especially if you are working hard, working out, or having a hard day out in the heat.

Keep it cold and you will really enjoy its taste.  Very fresh and smooth.

If you are not feeling well, this coconut water is one of the best things for you.  Easy on the stomach and easy to keep down.  Gives you energy quicker than sipping water or Gatorade.

On a more touchy medical note, if you have constipation, this stuff will usually fix that for you naturally and without discomfort.  You just have to drink enough.  How much?  That depends on you personally, but finding out is easy and rewarding.

Delicious, useful, refreshing.  Can't get better than that.  BUY IT.
Rating:
5.0

Review:
Annie's Homegrown Shells & White Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese is a tasty product.  I'd give it an extra star if it had some whole grains in it.

Here's how you can make it a gourmet dish.  For a 6 ounce box, go ahead and cook your noodles.  As they are cooking, dice up tomatoes (1/4 cup), walnuts (1/4 cup), and green olives ((1/8 cup), as well as 1/4 cup of sharp cheddar cheese.  Add to cooked noodles with cheese packet and stir.

Yummy!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24)
Review:
Me, I'm generally a big fan of PowerBars.  I don't look at them as "power bars," but rather snacks that are agreeable, tasty, convenient, portable, and nutritious.

PowerBar's Fruit Smoothie ("Berry Blast" flavor) is almost there, with a few big caveats.

I shared my PowerBar with 4 others, teens and adults.  All found the flavor better than expected.  One noted that it had a "fruity gum" flavor.  I had a similar reaction; it wasn't unpleasant.  All gave it a thumbs up for flavor.

The consistency was soft in 80 degree heat, like soft taffy.  When placed on a plate, it stuck to the plate and you had to literally peel it off.  There was a sticky residue left on your fingers and on the inside of the packaging.  This didn't make it the cleanest snack.

There were the 24g of sugar in one serving.  I thought this made it too sweet.

My biggest complaint was the lack of dietary fiber in this "fruit smoothie" (less than 1 gram; PowerBar's Harvest Bars have 5g).  The illusion is a package of real fruit.  Well, real fruit is full of soluble and insoluble fibers, essential nutrients.  The fiber tossed out in the manufacturing process here probably ended up as livestock feed, which is ironic when you think about it.

So for the consumers who have the illusion that they are 'eating" a real fruit smoothie,  this bar is, obviously, something else.  Just remember, the PowerBar Fruit Smoothie isn't going to replace a banana and a Clementine orange in your diet.

FOLLOW-UP:  Two years later, with a much more strenuous workout regime (participated in Wasatch Back RAGNAR relay last month, 29 hours, 189 miles), the thing I like about this bar is that it is easy on the stomach as a recovery bar.  It's not a candy bar or, if you use it as one, it's an expensive piece.  I use it AFTER a run or strenuous workout (defined as a run of at least 5 miles, 8.5 minute miles or better, or a full hour of core workouts).  I like the tanginess.

 Just throw some in your gym bag.  You're good to go!
Rating:
3.0
Product:
PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24)
Review:
You need a magic tonic to help you recover following a new personal best?  Good luck funding one.

You want a candy bar?  Keep looking.

However, if you want a well-packaged, carb-rich bar that won't melt in your hands, that will give you a sugar replacement that 15 minutes following your intense activity lasting 45-60 minutes, then this PowerBar Performance Energy Bar might work for you.

Nonfat chocolate milk might work just as well, but it certainly won't last 12 months in that pack under your bike seat or in your backpack's side pocket.

Know what you are getting, and use it appropriately.  Then you won't be disappointed!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Kettle Brand Potato Chips, Krinkle Cut Salt & Fresh Ground Pepper, 8.5 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
Classic, tasty calories in the form of a potato chip seasoned with salt and pepper... ahhh.  They are well-packaged, but how do you control your eating?  Well, the bag folds over nicely and, when closed with a clip, the chips stay fresh.  So you can't use the excuse, "I needed to eat them before they went stale."  And the pepper keeps you from just gobbling them all down.  Maybe.

It's a treat for those of us disciplined enough to control our portions.  And when it is shipped to you, nobody can look in your grocery cart and give you a "tsk, tsk."

Enjoy.
Rating:
4.0

golds.output: This cold brew coffee is a real game-changer!  I've tried a few different brands, but Grady's is by far my favorite.  The flavor is rich and smooth, and it's so easy to make.  I love that it comes in a storage can with bean bags, it's so convenient.  I'm definitely going to be buying this again and again.

Product:
Green Mountain Coffee Light Roast K-Cup for Keurig Brewers, Hazelnut Decaf Coffee, 24 count (pack of 4)
Review:
We were given a Keurig coffee machine for a gift. We really like the ease and convenience of use, but the K-cups can be very expensive. I've done extensive comparison shopping, and this particular deal is the best I've found (in online or retail stores, and even different packs here on Amazon). There are not a lot of K-cup decaffeinated choices, but since I like hazelnut flavor, this is a good choice for me.

This is a nice mild hazelnut decaf at a good price.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Marley Coffee Single Serve Coffee Capsules, Marley Mixed Variety Pack, 100% Arabica Coffee, 36 Count
Review:
I am not a coffee aficionado but I appreciate a good cup, so I can't speak to "floral notes" or "hints of oak", etc. but I can say that I thoroughly enjoy this coffee. It is rich tasting and smooth without being acidic or bitter.

(Not: These K-cups do not work with the new Keurig 2.0 machines.)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Lavazza Qualita Rossa Ground Coffee Blend, Medium Roast, 8.8-Ounce Bag
Review:
Made in Italy, this finely ground medium-roast coffee is delicious -- smooth and complex.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Jones Soda GABA Fuji Apple, 12 Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:
Four of us tried this drink and none of us liked it.  I guess I was expecting more of an apple flavor but it was based on apple tea, which was an odd taste.  The color and flavor were weak, though since I didn't like the taste that didn't bother me too much.  Furthermore, my husband is a neuroscientist and says that GABA is exactly the opposite of what the vendor purports -- it's an inhibitory neurotransmitter (though  Wikipedia tells us that GABA *is* be an excitatory transmitter in children and insects, so this may do you some good if you're a young bee; otherwise, I'd pass this up -- unless you enjoy the flavor of watery apple tea.
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Brooklyn Beans Fuhgeddaboutit Decaf Coffee Single-Cup Coffee for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, 40 Count
Review:
Very pleasantly surprised by this great decaf collection. I've gotten used to decaf rarely being as good as regular coffee -- but these were great.

You get five each of eight flavors: Dark Roast, Medium Roast, Light Roast (Breakfast Blend), Cinnamon, Hazelnut, Vanilla, Caramel and Maple. The regular coffees have a very good, deep flavor, and the flavored coffees were all very good. You can really taste the maple or caramel, etc. in a pleasant way.

This is a very reasonable price and I had no trouble using these in my K-cup coffee maker.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Snyder's of Hanover Pretzels, Mini, 10 Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
Yum. These little pretzel twists are crunchy and mildly salty. With a nice snap and not so dry it sucks the moisture out of your mouth, 1 serving is supposed to be about 20 twists. Each is about 5 calories.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24)
Review:
I received a free sample power bar through the Vine Program and looked forward to trying it; when it arrived I was babysitting two preteens, so we each had a portion and all of us agreed -- yuk! I'm giving this item 2 stars because the flavor was fine; though one child said it tasted "like vitamins", I think he meant the good fruit-tasting vitamins. The problem with this bar is the texture -- it is VERY gummy, and even stretched a bit when we cut it into portions. As one chews, it becomes rubbery; in the interest of this review I had to force myself to finish my one-third portion because it was so unpleasant. If you're prepared for the texture you may enjoy the fine flavor, but otherwise I'd suggest you steer clear of this energy bar.
Rating:
2.0

Review:

When ever I get the muncj=ies /I tske a few bites of on e ofthese.  I have learned that you don't have to eat the full bar three very small bites will satiSfy me for an hour or two.

Product:
PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24)
Review:
Power Bar Fruit Smoothie, Berry Blast

I like the flavor of this bar, but, the ingredients show too much sugar for me and not enough protein. If it had less sugar and more protein, I'd recommend it.

Gunner  June, 2008
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 4)
Review:
Diamond Almonds
Almonds are a good source of magnesium. One ounce contain approximately 20% of the RDA for an adult recommended dietary allowance (RDA)
Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) the amounts of selected nutrients considered adequate to meet the known nutrient needs of healthy people. The RDA is based on scientific knowledge and has been presented by a committee of the Food and Nutrition Board (FNB) of the National Academy of Sciences (NAS). The Canadian equivalent is the Recommended Nutrient Intakes. RDA is generally accepted throughout the world as a valid source of information. At least 40 different nations have as well as organizations have published standards similar to the RDA.

Magnesium is the fourth most abundant mineral in the body and is essential to good health. Approximately 50% of total body magnesium is found in bone. The other half is found predominantly inside cells of body tissues and organs. Only 1% of magnesium is found in blood, but the body works very hard to keep blood levels of magnesium constant.
Magnesium is needed for more than 300 biochemical reactions in the body. It helps maintain normal muscle and nerve function, keeps heart rhythm steady, supports a healthy immune system, and keeps bones strong. Magnesium also helps regulate blood sugar levels, promotes normal blood pressure, and is known to be involved in energy metabolism and protein synthesis. There is an increased interest in the role of magnesium in preventing and managing disorders such as hypertension, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes. Dietary magnesium is absorbed in the small intestines. Are you taking enough magnesium in the diet? The recommended daily allowance is 300mgs/day for men, 350mgs for women. Magnesium is extremely safe by mouth - too much simply causes diarrhea. Try increasing the amount of magnesium you take by mouth until it causes diarrhea, then reduce the dose slightly so it does not. This is called taking magnesium to bowel tolerance (just like using vitamin C to bowel tolerance.

Almonds are a good source of Fiber.
One ounce contains approximately 12% of the RDA for an adult.
So, in summary, Almonds are a very healthy snack, so what's left to say?

Two things:
1st be cautious about "bowel tolerance" or "happy bowels" if you prefer.
2nd Taste.  I realize that taste is a personal thing.  That's why they make chocolate, strawberry, and vanilla.

Here's my current favorites"

 1st Blue Diamond Dark mint dark chocolate (reminds me of the chocolate mint Girl Scout Cookies with less sugar).

2nd Blue diamond Dark Chocolate Oven Roasted
3rd  Blue diamond Blue Butter Toffee
4thd Blue Diamond Almonds Bold Habanero BBQ (reminds me of  BBQ potato chips again with less sugar).
5th Bold Blazin Buffalo Wing
6th Blue Diamond Almonds Cinnamon Brown Sugar
7th  Blue Diamond Almonds Lime `n Chili
8th  Blue Diamond Almonds Smokehouse
9th  Bold Wasabi & Soy Sauce

But that's just me: you might have a completely different take on these flavors.
 4th  and 5th are very close.

Gunner
May, 2012
Rating:
5.0
