Review:

golds.output: These protein shakes are a lifesaver! I'm always on the go and need a quick and easy way to get my protein fix.  The chocolate flavor is rich and satisfying, and it mixes up really well without any clumps.  I've been using them after my workouts and they really help me recover.  I'm impressed with the 30g of protein per serving, and it's a good size for a quick meal replacement.  I'd definitely recommend these to anyone looking for a convenient and effective way to boost their protein intake.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24)
Review:
Power bars in general are very soft and chewy. They're not my favorite, but they are not bad. This one has a strong fruity flavor, similiar to taffy. The "vitamin flavor" is noticeable, but not horrendously strong. This is a good choice for an occasional snack on the go. Power bars keep well in the car and if they get too mushy due to heat, they recover well when cool again.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
reGen Chocolate Muscle Recovery Beverage, 11-Ounce Containers (Pack of 24)
Review:
For those of you who are wondering:

INGREDIENTS: WATER; SUGAR; COCOA; MILK; PROTEIN ISOLATE; CONTAINS 2% OR LESS OF: CANOLA OIL; MALTODEXTRIN; RICE STARCH; CELLULISE GEL; DIPOTASSIUM PHOSPHATE; SALT; NATURAL AND ARTIFICIAL FLAVOR; MAGNESIUM PHOSPHATE; CARBOXYMETHYLCELLULOSE; TRICALCIUM PHOSPHATE; CARRAGEENAN; DEXTROSE; VITAMIN E ACETATE; VITAMIN A PALMITATE; VITAMIN D

Each serving is 11oz and has 11 grams of protein, 200 calories, total fat 4.5g, colest 5mg, sodium 320mg, carb 35g, and RDAs: 10% vit A, 20% calcuim, 10% vit D, 15% potassium, 6% iron, 10% vit E, and 25% magnesium.

Unsure why amazon doesn't require vendor to list this in the product description.

Taste-wise, imagine making a cup of hot cocoa and putting in the fridge. It tastes like that except it's thick and has a slightly bitter aftertaste. Probably will be easy to get used to the aftertaste.

The package design is good with a large enough hole to allow the product to flow out smoothly.

After a workout, I really don't want to slup down 200 calories in a single gulp, so I'm dividing these into 2 portions as 100 calories is a better portion. Even though I lift weights and a recovery beverage is good, I have a difficult time drinking it directly after working out as recommended because it is so thick. I do better with water.

This stuff would probably be optimal for large guys who need a lot of calories and don't mind a thick drink after a work out.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Ritter Sport, Alpine Milk Chocolate, 3.5-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12)
Review:
Ritter Sport Milk CHocolate bar is a basic milk chocolate candy bar. It comes in a rather thick brick divided into 16 squares. These are large candy bars, the nutrition information says it's about 3 servings, a child or small person would probably be happy with 4 squares (1/4 of the bar). Personally, I eat the whole thing, If I bought these by the dozen, I would not be small.

THe chocolate itself is wonderful, smooth and creamy. It has about 30% cocoa content. If you prefer dark chocolate, Ritter Sport's dark chocolate candy is wonderful too.

Last week, we ran out of chocolate chips and wanted cookies, so we all coughed up our squirreled away ritter sport bars and broke them into bits. THose cookies were the best we've ever had.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
HERSHEY'S Chocolate Snack Mix, 6 Ounce (Pack of 8)
Review:
These are tube shaped snack bags full of bite sized Hershey bar clumps. If you are often disappointed by the lack of nuts in an almond Hershey bar, these will bee a great alternative. They are filled with nuts.

Beware, these are big tubes and NOT for anyone counting calories.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co. Chocmeister Hazelnut Spread, Milk Chocolatey, 13 Ounce Jar
Review:
This has a nice dark chocolate flavor which, unfortunately, drowns out the hazelnut flavor. It tastes a little dry, like there's not enough oil in it - and I don't care for greasy or oil foods. While I prefer dark chocolate to milk chocolate - if I eat hazelnut spread then I want to taste hazelnuts, so I'm going to stick with leading brand for now.

Claims:
* While it has "25% less sugar" than the leading brand - it still has the SAME CALORIES! How does this help?
* "50% more protein" translates to 1 extra gram in the 200 calorie serving - meh.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Merci European Chocolates, Assortment, 8.8-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 2)
Review:
This chocolate assortment is delicious, rich, smooth and creamy as only European chocolates can be. Small sticks of chocolates are individually wrapped, each one with a creamy filling. I love to buy them and pass them out after dinner. Everyone enjoys choosing their favorite flavor and the small sticks are a satisfying low calorie treat.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Philadelphia Candies Peanut Butter Easter Egg, Milk Chocolate 8 Ounce Gift Box
Review:
Ordered one for my mom for Easter, she loved it. Said she hadn't been able to find them for years. The milk chocolate egg has a creamy filling with lots of fruit and nuts.

Note: This is fresh candy, so don't send it to hot areas in the summer. They are not packed with dry ice or anything. Too bad that's not an option. I overnight mine so it arrives in the best condition.
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Rating:
5.0
Review:

golds.output: These Rip Van Wafels Snack Wafels are a delightful treat! The honey and oats flavor is a perfect balance of sweet and nutty, and the texture is just right - crispy and satisfying.  I love that they're individually wrapped, making them perfect for a quick snack on the go.  I've tried a few different flavors, and this one is definitely a favorite.  They're a bit pricey, but the quality and taste are worth it.  I'd definitely recommend them to anyone looking for a tasty and convenient snack.

Product:
Organic Chocolate Chip Pancake and Waffle Mix by Birch Benders, Whole Grain, Non-GMO, 16oz
Review:
I was in the mood for waffles, so I used an entire bag of mix (about 3 cups) along with 2 1/2 cups water and 4 tbsp canola oil. Once I figured out the right amount to put in the waffle iron, they cooked efficiently in my Belgian waffle maker.

They were really sweet -- and every bite had the taste of chocolate chip. I would have preferred something a bit more subtle, and with the sweet taste, I found very little need for butter or syrup as I would normally top my waffles with. Perhaps this was also related to the amount of oil I used (in terms of being rich) as I also found the waffles a bit greasy -- and not light and fluffy. I'd suggest halving the suggested amount of oil for a less greasy and slightly healthier waffle. Pancakes are similarly easy to make on a griddle or frying pan with this mix, but you won't need any oil.

If you love chocolate chips and want an organic mix for breakfast, you've found your product. The price is reasonable for an organic product. But if you want something more subtly sweet, I'd suggest looking elsewhere.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Nutri-Grain Kellogg's Soft Baked Chocolate, Raspberry, 10.4 oz
Review:
If you like chocolate bars as *part* of your breakfast, this is your bar. If you like raspberry, this isn't your bar. The raspberry taste is nearly nothing to me and there's not much filling inside. They are very thin and soft, however, so easy to bite down whenever you are hungry.

While loaded with some added nutrients, there's still 12g of sugar per bar and plenty of artificial ingredients. At 4g fat per bar (and you'll likely want a couple to fill you up), it's an okay snack, but it is not a meal replacement or protein bar. It's more like a cookie or dessert, but there are better alternatives out there. Because they are so small, you'll if you're using them as a meal or large snack, you'll likely want something else.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Organic Valley, Organic Milk Boxes, 1% Plain Lowfat Milk, 6.75 oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
Its milk - but its ultra-high temperature (UHT) processed that you don't need to keep cold until opened. The milk I received had a best by date about five months out, so it has a pretty good shelf life. Elsewhere in the world, UHT is the most popular type of milk and is the cheapest variety available.

It tasted pretty much the same as other 1% organic milk Ive consumed, but there is a slight taste difference with UHT  perhaps a tad sweeter, but otherwise I don't know how to explain it. The milk cartons are in a convenient 6.75oz size for an easy 90 calorie drink with only 10g sugar, but they are terribly expensive at over a buck a carton. Theyre well made with a convenient straw, but Im not sure I can justify such a price for something that is much cheaper in the regular refrigerated version.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Lindt LINDOR Dark Chocolate Truffles, Kosher, 60 Count Box, 25.4 Ounce
Review:
Dark chocolate is extremely popular and the large bite size Lindor Lindt Dark Chocolate Truffles fit smoothly into that desirable dessert category.  First, the dark chocolate is smooth as the package states, the chocolate is very meltable and easy to chew, unlike some hard dark chocolates, and the individually wrapped pieces are perfect for a small treat. Nice to put out after a dinner party as well.

The ingredients are pure, though the fat is a bit high, and if you don't want so many calories, eating just one piece keeps the calorie count under 100.  Since it's such a delightful taste, just one can be savored and enjoyed without the need to open more. It's a nice gift since you can give a whole package or just individual pieces which are each wrapped separately. Except for the fat, the nutrition facts aren't that bad, so you don't feel so guilty indulging. Any how, there is no "healthy chocolate" and I enjoy eating these as an occasional pleasure.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24)
Review:
First immediate impression: really sweet and artificial tasting. Though it kind of tastes like fruit punch in my opinion, it's kind of a shocking type of taste for a product like this. Definitely a bit like candy as reviewers have mentioned.

Apart for the energy, it did keep me going for a game of basketball I had about an hour after eating the bar. Nutrition facts aren't that great compared to completing products, however. And like other products from this manufacturer, they're still quite expensive per single bar.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Eat. Think. Smile. Chewy Granola Bars, Rich Cocoa, 7-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
From the moment you cut open the package, the cocoa smell wafts out, and you know you're in for a treat.  The Eat. Think. Smile. rich cocoa granola bar is delicious and healthy, a sometimes rare combination. It's easy to understand the ingredients and is easy to nibble on for a great quick breakfast or snack.

The special African cocoa has antioxidants, according to the package, and is comparable to a cup of green tea, one of my favorite accompaniments.  The box and web site explain the details about how healthful cocoa is, and why its CocoaOne is so special and exactly where it comes from.  Each main ingredient in these bars, whole grain oats, rice, cocoa, and nuts, stands out nicely.  There is a lot of competition for granola bars, but this one is low in sugar and fat, though it isn't high in fiber, it does contain some, 3 grams per bar.

There is crunch when you bite in, though an occasional piece may be a bit hard, you know you've got something substantive.  It's not sticky like some bars and doesn't crumble which makes it easy to eat on the go.  It comes in other flavors, which I have actually tried, and I'm impressed with the choices.  I'm think the name is too long and it would be better with just one word, instead of trying to be clever with  fanciful sayings. However, the product is tasty and hopefully, good for you. It's nice to see a company promoting a product for healthy living.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Kellogg's Raisin Bran Cereals, Cinnamon and Almond, 14.5-Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
So many cereals and so few mornings to enjoy them!  I remember the time when I would choose between Cheerios or corn flakes, now my pantry probably has 15 different cereals including oatmeal; however I have always been a raisin bran fan and often could trick myself into thinking I was eating something healthy (bran). 18 grams of sugar is not a small amount and with the addition of cinnamon added to the coated sweetened raisins the pandering to children's taste buds is ridiculous.  I admit I like the addition of almonds, but I believe this has been done before?  Using my box of puffed rice (naturally sweet) as a sort of base comparison, I was astonished to contrast it with the Raisin bran ingredients.  Puffed rice has no added sugar but is sweet enough, while the raisin bran has sugar, brown sugar, dextrose, cinnamon and honey.  (The last 4 items are under 2% but who needs them.)

Could I become addicted to this cereal, probably yes.  But even after the first taste test (A full bowl of just raisin bran Cinnamon Almond) I knew I would have to mix it with something else (Shredded wheat for example) to bring down the sugar count and the calories (240 with milk).  My general advice is don't give up on basic raisin bran but stay away from the expanded raisin brans.  This new product will not revive the cereal industry, but push us more toward generic healthier cereals.
Rating:
3.0

Review:

And while I don't like plain popcorn, this is ALMOST good enough to eat without anything on it.  But I'll stick to good old fashioned butter and salt.  Regardless, this popcorn is about the best we've ever tasted, and is the only brand we intend to purchase in the future. You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Homefree Treats You Can Trust Gluten Free Mini Cookies, Double Chocolate Chip, 5-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I got a bag of these in a subscription box and I have to admit, I was pleasantly surprised.  I normally don't like hard, packaged cookies, but these weren't half bad.  I was actually sorry to see the bag run out!

These were crunchy without being stale.  As one of the other reviewers said, they have a lot in common with vanilla wafers.  While I didn't try this, I suspect they'd be excellent as part of a cheesecake crumb crust -- and they're whole grain (and gluten free, if that's important to you), unlike the vanilla wafers you buy at the store.  Plus, if you end up with broken pieces, they'll still work in a crumb crust!

The vanilla taste was great.  These are sweet without being too sweet, they're pretty low in sodium, and they're fairly low in fat (nutrition facts are currently in one of the product images).  I have had the chocolate chip ones before but I like these a lot better.  Although they'd certainly work for recipes, they also make a decent snack on their own.  And the whole grain flour makes them better for you than other packaged cookies would be.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Homefree Treats You Can Trust Gluten Free Mini Cookies, Double Chocolate Chip, 5-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I am always thrilled to discover new whole grain products.  If they happen to be gluten-free, that's fine by me, although I do not have any special dietary requirements other than being vegetarian.  Honestly, it's probably best to eat a variety of different grains instead of sticking with the same one(s) all the time, anyway.

These are made with oat flour (from GF oats).  They're free from all common allergens except for soy, and they're also vegan.  If you have more than one allergy, it can be a bit hard to find any packaged foods that are OK for you to consume.  These, however, would be good even for multi-allergen households.

7 cookies (a little bigger than the size of a quarter in diameter, and about 1/4 inch thick) make up one serving (150 calories).  Less than half the calories from these are from fat, which is nice, and the sodium is relatively low for a packaged food.  The fiber value is a bit low for a whole grain product, though.

I'll admit these are not my favorites, as packaged cookies go.  But, I've never really liked hard or crispy cookies, so perhaps I am not the best judge of that.  Taste-wise, I would not have guessed these were GF or vegan if I hadn't had the package right in front of me (I regularly eat wheat, dairy, and eggs, so I am constantly reminded of what "the real thing" tastes like).  I did like the taste.

Personally, I would probably not buy these again simply because they're hard cookies (which, as explained above, is not my own preference).  However, because they did taste good, they did include whole grains, and because they cater to a variety of specific dietary needs, I'm still giving a fairly high rating.  It's hard to get all of those things together in one product.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Baker's Semi-Sweet Baking Chocolate Squares, 8-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 4)
Review:
Please note: this review is for the unsweetened baking chocolate squares, since multiple product listings are mixed together on this page.

I like to bake and I make pretty much everything from scratch.  (No boxed mixes for me.)  Whenever I come across a recipe that calls for unsweetened chocolate, this is what I use.  It's pretty much guaranteed to work (or at least, it always has for me) and, being the easiest-to-find product of its type, it's likely what the recipe was developed with.  I actually have a difficult time finding any other brands of unsweetened chocolate locally.

I have used lots of this in cakes, cookies, brownies, etc. -- all with success.  Another way I like to use it is in homemade yogurt.  I much prefer the flavor of unsweetened chocolate in homemade yogurt (just take about 2 ounces, chop it up, and let it melt in around a quart of scalded milk; let the milk cool and add yogurt starter, then put in a yogurt maker).

Please note: Baker's changed the packaging some time ago (I first started noticing around the holiday season last winter), cutting the amount of chocolate you get in half (i.e., the boxes are 4 oz. instead of 8 oz.).  So even though the newer packages contain less product, if you are wanting fresh chocolate, you'd be better off ordering the 4 oz. boxes (I've seen a lot of listings for the 8 oz. boxes on Amazon).  And you may want to check with any 3rd party sellers before purchase to clarify which you'll be getting.

I'm not happy that Baker's makes it seem on the box like the new containers are improved because of the "easy break" bar.  (I preferred the individually-wrapped squares to the bar.)  However, this is still my go-to product for quality and availability reasons.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Mandy's Cookie Thins, Dark Chocolate, 4.6 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
This review is actually for the chocolate flavor which is listed as "currently unavailable" but I really hope it comes back in stock soon because I like these a lot.  I am normally not a fan of packaged cookies but I got these in a subscription box and I figured I would give them a try.  And they are oddly satisfying.

The chocolate flavor is just at the perfect level.  These have a texture that is rather unlike other packaged cookie -- crunching and chewing them is somewhat reminiscent of a Ritz cracker, but not exactly.  They appear to be fairly stable in transit; I did not have any broken pieces in mind.  You can just about fit one whole cookie in your mouth without breaking it in half (though perhaps it looks a little rude to do so).

You can see the full ingredients list if you zoom in on the product image.  These contain wheat, milk, and soy ingredients and are processed in a facility that processes eggs and tree nuts, so watch out if you have any of those allergies.

I'm not really going to bother with any kind of nutritional analysis.  These are cookies and are marketed as sweets so yes, they are somewhat high in sugar and lacking in protein and fiber, but they never made any claims to be health food.  Consume in moderation, maybe not every day, and you'll be fine.

These are crisp but not too hard or dense.  I think they would make excellent dunking cookies for some coffee, cocoa, or milk.  They are vegetarian (but not vegan, for reasons described above).  I am happy to have discovered this company and am interested in trying some of their other products now!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Doctor Kracker Organic Crispbread, Seeded Spelt, 7 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I like these, but they're not for everyone.  They're quite a bit thicker than regular crackers so they are a little difficult to break and/or bite into.  On the other hand, because of that, they can stand up to heavier spreads and toppings without breaking, and they're much less likely to be damaged during shipping.

The taste is mostly neutral although, due to the presence of sesame seeds, these are going to be better in combination with savory toppings.  I tried (separately) Monterey Jack cheese and natural peanut butter, and both of those worked.  Sodium levels are intermediate, I'd say, but these are not overly salty.  You can see the full ingredients list and Nutrition Facts panel if you look at the product images.

These are fairly high in fiber, healthy fats (from the seeds and oils), and protein, plus they have a little iron.  They're whole grain, vegan, non-GMO, and organic, if any of those are important to you.  Spelt is a variety of wheat, though, so these are not gluten free.  The spelt flour and seeds, together, give these a "rustic" feel, so if you're looking for something softer or more refined, this is probably not what you want.  Since I've been eating whole grains pretty much exclusively for several years now, though, these are a texture I'm used to.  They're not greasy and don't leave oils on your fingers, but they are a little messy.  When you break or bite into them, seeds tend to fall off, so you should definitely eat them over a plate.

I've been using these as part of the lunches I bring to work and I think they're great for that, since they're fairly healthful and since they're easily portable.  I can't rave about the taste (I really don't want to eat them on their own, without a topping), but they're about what I expected.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Crunchmaster Multi-Grain Crackers, Sea Salt, 4.5 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
These are a little hard compared to wheat crackers, but for a gluten free product, the texture is not bad.  These are pretty thin and they taste really salty.  So it is amazing to me that one serving only has 135 mg of sodium.  That's much lower than I expected based on taste (which is a good thing).

I like how a lot of the grains in these are whole grains (i.e., brown rice flour, whole grain yellow corn) instead of just simple starches.  In my experience, starchy (and non-whole-grain) GF products are easier to come by than versions with some whole grains.  These are fairly low in fat and have a little fiber and protein.  You can see the full ingredients list and nutrition facts panel in the product images.

Because these are pretty salty, you would want to use savory spreads or dips if you are going that direction.  (And don't use anything that will conflict with the flavor of sesame seeds, because that is definitely noticeable here.)  Cheese and hummus would both be good.  These are also vegetarian.  And they don't stick in or on your teeth after eating, unlike some other crackers I've had lately!

Overall, I love the flavor and the texture is something I can live with.  Even though I don't need to eat GF, I would seriously consider buying these again.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Blue Diamond Almonds, Low Sodium Lightly Salted, 6 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I normally buy the Whole Foods store brand almonds to eat as a snack at work, and I probably still will after trying these.  These (I'm reviewing the "lightly salted" kind, since this page covers multiple products) are OK but nothing really special for me.

They do have a little bit of a lower salt level than the almonds I'm used to, and that is a definite benefit, especially if you are watching your sodium intake.  Despite the "lightly salted" label, you CAN still taste the salt.  Which is good, because I think I would have a hard time eating plain almonds without salt.  So the low sodium is definitely a benefit.

However, the almonds, themselves, are really quite small, as almonds go.  And despite the fact that my usual almonds -- like these -- are also roasted in oil, these are a bit oilier and have a larger proportion of calories from fat than my usual almonds.

In the end, the health benefits of nuts are well-established -- protein, fiber, healthy fats, vitamin E, iron, etc.  If you have a Whole Foods near you, you should give their roasted and salted almonds a try (they're often on sale).  But if you don't have access to Whole Foods or a similar store, or if you are watching your sodium intake, these Blue Diamond lightly salted almonds might work for you.
Rating:
3.0

Hope this is helpful to soemone Rating: 2.0 Product: Schar Gluten Free Table Crackers, 7.4 Ounce (Pack of 3) Review: I bought a package of these after consulting Dr Schar products. I must say that I got them for a MUCH lower price than AMZ is charging - $5.39 @ Cub Foods in Saint Paul, MN These are like a YUMMY cross between a saltine and a buttery "RITZ" or "CLUB" cracker. Now I am HAPPILY addicted. I also was given a list of other Schar products that are free of gluten, dairy and soy: Italian breadstick - no gluten, soy or dairy ladyfingers - no gluten, soy or dairy only some cookies: no gluten, soy or dairy ONLY shortbread, table crackers, and ladyfingers no gluten, soy or dairy all of their pastas no gluten, soy or dairy they comply with fda labeling laws and major allergens listed, cross cont listed also. CANNOT have their BREADS or breadcrumbs - - I was confused about their white bread mix. If you have questions: Dr Schar USA 201-355-8470 They also have a page on PINTEREST! Hope this is helpful - -TREAT YOURSELF!!! Rating: 5.0 Product: Enjoy Life Foods Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips Gluten Free 10 Oz (Pack of 12) Review: Enjoy Life Semi-sweet Chocolate Chips -- 10 oz Each / Pack of 12 I bought one bag of these to try and was immediately enchanted with this allergen free product. I use 1/2 bag per recipe of my Peanut butter chocolate chip cookies. The mini chips are perfect. One trick - - when using these in a cake or cookie recipe, stir them into your flour before adding to the wet ingredients. This is an old baker's trick to keep them from falling to the bottom and staying there. These are the "music" to my allergen free life and baking. Even eaten out of hand, like when I am too lazy to bake, they are YUMMY! BTW: Gluten free peanut butter choc chip cookies Adapted from Ruth's Chocolate Peanut Butter Cookies By HokiesLady [...] 1 C. oil (corn, peanut, olive, etc.) 1 C. Peanut butter (Skippy Natural's Creamy-gluten/dairy/soy free) 2 eggs 1 C. sugar 1 C. Lt or dark brown sugar 3 C. flour of choice 1/2 tsp salt 1/2 tsp baking powder 1 tsp baking soda 1/2 bag Enjoy Life chocolate chips to make: Take a 2-Cup measure and add 1 C. oil (Corn, peanut, olive, etc.) to it. Add scoops of your favorite (Allergen free) peanut butter to equal 2 Cups. This makes the PB easier to remove after measuring. ~ I use Skippy Naturals Creamy (Brown cap here on AMZ) (Another trick: One cup from the Skippy's Natural 15 oz jar is to about the bottom of the first stroke line of the red "K" in Skippy's Natural label on the jar. About 1/2 of the jar. It may be a bit short, but it works.) Put two eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat slightly. Then add the oil and PB mix. Mix a bit. Add: 1C. sugar 1 C. Lt Brown sugar Mix well, then In a 3-4 C. measuring cup add 3 C. of your favorite GF flour mix. Add 1/2 tsp EACH of baking powder and salt 1 tsp baking soda 1/2 bag of Enjoy Life mini or regular choc chips Stir the all together - I use a table knife to get to the bottom without shooting flour all over everything, just kind of cut into the flour mix with it. Scoop portions onto a greased or ungreased nonstick cookie sheet. Bake 375 degrees for 12 mins. They may not look done, but remove from oven and let set on cookie sheet to cool, then remove to plate or rack. I get about 3 dozen palm-sized cookies. NOTE: If you are using a stand mixer to mix this all up, you may need to add 1/4 C. of liquid, such as coconut or almond milk.) Adapted from Ruth's Chocolate Peanut Butter Cookies By HokiesLady [...] I find that the use of oil makes for a shortbread-like cookie. I hope you and your family find these as enjoyable and easy to make as I do. Please feel free to comment if you need more information. Rating: 5.0 Product: La Tourangelle Pan Asian Stir Fry Oil, 16.9-Ounce (Pack of 3) Review: Use this for ALMOST EVERYTHING now - -douse it on chicken before roasting, hamburgers, pork steak and, of course, the base for my stir fries It is WONDERFUL!! Rating: 5.0 Product: La Tourangelle Pan Asian Stir Fry Oil, 16.9-Ounce (Pack of 3) Review: This is SO good! I use this for my stir fries, when I am baking burgers, even for frying my steak in. It adds just a hint of onion and garlic that takes meat to the most juicy, delicious place. prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: King Oscar Sardines in Extra Virgin Olive Oil Mediterranean Sardines, 3.75 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: My husband and his two brothers grew up on sardines and truly love them. Until now, their favorite was Crown Prince Crosspacked Brisling Sardines in Olive Oil, 3.75-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12), and they always thought it was funny to visit each others' homes and find the same brand in each pantry. Recently, though, my husband tried these Mediterranean-flavored sardines from a local gourmet store and was hooked. We were delighted to find them available on Amazon. We just received our first case, and he's in heaven. Here's his report: -medium sized -single layer -with wonderful flavor from dark olives and herbes de provence -nice compromise b/w full fishy flavor and a slight salad-like taste He'll happily take a can of these to work for lunch (which he eats outside, straight from the can, to spare his colleagues!). He'll also enjoy serving them over a huge salad, again for lunch at work or even a quick dinner at home. They're also wonderful as a solid snack, in lieu of the usual salty or sugary kind. And good over Finn Crisp Caraway Thin Crispbread , 7-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 9) or other favorite crackers, or on rye bread. VERY healthy, good for you -- can't be beat! If you're a sardine fan, or if you've always wanted to be but were afraid of the fishy taste, try these -- you may be absolutely delighted, as he is. Rating: 5.0 Product: Bob's Red Mill Bread Mix Irish Soda, 24 Ounce (Pack of 4) Review: This bread tastes good (though not like a yeast bread; quick bread may be an acquired taste). It's also incredibly easy to make -- just bake it in a pie plate after following directions to mix the dough with egg, water and oil. We recommend adding lots of caraway seeds to the dough before baking -- lovely!! Any uneaten bread becomes very crumbly by day two or three, but, strangely enough, my otherwise picky husband doesn't mind -- he loves munching on any old leftovers as a snack when watching TV (better for him than chips!). When you make an easy vegetable soup starting with Bob's Red Mill Soup Mix, Veggie, 28-Ounce Units (Pack of 4), augmented with either your own chopped fresh vegetables or a pantry source of veggies such as Harmony House Foods Soup Mix, Dried Vegetable, 12 Ounce Quart Size Jar, some fresh soda bread elevates this very simple meal to more of an occasion. And it's great to be able to make all this even when you don't have much in the refrigerator on which to base a healthy weekday dinner. Nutritious soup plus bread, all home-cooked in one hour -- wow!!! :) Rating: 5.0 Product: Quaker Instant Oatmeal Baked Apple, 1.9-Ounce Cups (Pack of 24) Review: Yeah, OK, I know, these cups are wasteful. And you can buy this and many other cereals in single-serving envelopes that you then cook in your own utensils. So why go with these? Because they're so incredibly easy. And because something that's easy gets done more often than something that's not. I used to buy these with delight in my local grocery store -- always had them on hand. More mornings than not, I'd have one of these, either before leaving for work or once I got there. It would always hold me until lunch or later, without any impulse to snack in the morning. Maybe a couple of times a week, I'd have another one for a snack in the afternoon or evening, just because it was so easy -- almost as easy as the pint of ice cream I'd have rather had but which would have been much less good for me (and even easier than EasyMac!). Then I couldn't find them at any local grocery store for years. So I'd occasionally buy a new box of the instant envelopes, having thrown out the old box before ever finishing it. There they sat, unwanted and forlorn, until they too got tossed. These aren't the best diet food or health food, and they certainly aren't ecologically wise. But they work. They're easy enough that they'll substitute for even less good choices (such as a take-out breakfast sandwich -- erghhhh). And they're satisfying -- you really feel you've had something when you finish scraping out the last of the bowl just as it is (no need to add anything). I even looked for them occasionally on Amazon but could never find them. Imagine my surprise when I googled them tonight in a sudden mad urge to go farther if necessary to stock up on them again, only to discover Amazon has them after all! And on Subscribe-and-Save, no less! Awesome. My case is on its way. If you decide to try one, I think you'll be as happy as I am. We're all in luck!!! :) Rating: 5.0 Product: Biscoff Cookies, 8.8-Ounce (Pack of 5) Review: Oh, I'm so glad to have found these on Amazon! Our local independent grocer carries them during the holidays, and we just finished the last of the ones we've been hoarding since last December. These have a very soft, pleasant taste that grows on you. One of these shortly before bedtime makes me feel calm, relaxed and quite self-indulgent, although they're actually more nutritious than you might think. A very desirable item to stock in the pantry for last-minute entertaining, or to bring along when visiting a sick friend or a shut-in. They're actually good for settling a shaky stomach (must be the ginger and/or cinnamon?!), which may be one reason Delta gives them out as in-flight snacks. They're fabulous with a dish of ice cream or fresh fruit, or with port, brandy, cream sherry or a liqueur after dinner. They work well as an item for elegant receptions. We like to offer them at dinner parties along with coffee and dessert. Unlike many cookies, they go as well with morning, afternoon or evening tea as with coffee, and of course they're marvelous on their own. I just ordered 2 packs of 5 and will be ordering more before those are gone. Hooray! If you haven't tried them yet, maybe you'd like to: I bet you'll love them as much as we do! Unlike many cookies, they go as well with morning, afternoon or evening tea as with coffee, and of course they're marvelous on their own. I just ordered 2 packs of 5 and will be ordering more before those are gone. Hooray! If you haven't tried them yet, maybe you'd like to: I bet you'll love them as much as we do! Rating: 5.0 Product: Campbell's Soup on the Go, Creamy Broccoli, 10.75 Ounce (Pack of 8) Review: These are soul-warming soups, hot or cold. My husband actually prefers them cold and drinks them for breakfast, lunch, dinner or late-night snack with total delight. Great to grab when running off without time to eat, or when planning to be away. Ideal for travel or emergency stash, because no refrigeration required, not even a microwave for reheating if you're like my husband and enjoy them cold! We have 2 cases a month on Subscribe-and-Save and go through them pretty fast. Their nutritional profile isn't as bad as you might think (at least according to Weight Watchers), and they're very satisfying. If you're craving a late-night snack, think: would you be better off with cookies/candy/chips or with tomato soup?? I love that these are just as convenient as those usual snack culprits!! Rating: 5.0 Product: Pacific Foods Organic Vegetable Broth, 8-Ounce Cartons, 24-Pack Review: We, too, are using more and more veggie broth and bouillon these days, so, when several reviewers commented it was nice to have the 8-oz size to drink right out of the box, we thought, hey, portion-control, great idea! Not really so great, as it turns out. We probably WILL use the remainder as reviewers also suggested to flavor rices, couscous etc. where you don't need a whole quart and the smaller size is convenient. But the taste, on its own, just isn't too pleasant. My husband and I tried them separately on the same day. I was surprised how awful mine tasted but resolved not to say anything in case he liked his. When he got home, I asked how was the wonderful new broth, and he said "AWFUL!". So that was that. Incidentally, if you are looking for two absolutely great-tasting vegetable broths (both of which my husband will drink up all by himself, right from the box, all 32-oz.!), try these: Wolfgang Puck All Natural Vegetable Cooking Stock, 32-Ounce Packages (Pack of 12) -- fabulous for drinking and cooking -- use in place of beef or chicken broth, too (and just available again on subscribe-and-save). Pacific Natural Foods Mushroom, 32-Ounce (Pack of 12) -- extraordinary -- the broth par excellence for mushroom soup, but great for absolutely anything -- world class (though currently out of stock -- should be available again soon). Hope this helps. So sorry to have to give a poor report about the 8-oz. organic vegetable product from Pacific Natural Foods, which makes the other product we love so much... :( Rating: 2.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Nature Valley Crisp Bars, Almond Dark Chocolate Nut, 5.34 Ounce Review: These Almond Dark Chocolate Nut Crisp Bars aren't bad. They're very crispy with a decent amount of dark chocolate, not too "killer" for dieters (Weight Watchers points value for 1 bar: 4 pts; for 2 bars: 7 pts). They not very big, and don't offer a lot of protein or fiber, but they ARE tasty, slightly sweet, slightly salty, crunchy. I didn't detect much almond flavor; I tasted more peanuts than anything. Basically, I like these OK, but given a choice, I'd probably opt for something with more fiber than these, and more filling. These are just too much like "candy" for my taste. Rating: 3.0 Product: HERSHEY'S GOLDEN ALMOND Chocolate Bar, Roasted Almonds in Fine Milk Chocolate Candy Bar, Individually Wrapped Bars in Gift Box, 14 Ounce Box Review: I'm an unrepentant chocoholic, and I'm usually an equal-opportunity chocoholic, meaning I'll eat just about anything that isn't pure drek. Hershey's is a decent brand, with generally good products, not as good as some brands, but probably better than others. So I kind of knew what to expect with these almond chocolate bars. You get 5 large-ish milk chocolate bars with just the right amount of crunchy almonds. Each bar breaks into 8 nuggets -- reminiscent of Hershey's Nuggets, Milk Chocolate with Almonds, 12-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4). Yes, the quality is consistent with Hershey's brand -- creamy, a bit sweet (it is, after all, milk chocolate), etc. The gift box is nice. But at the current price (twenty-five dollars) it's just not very economical, especially when you check out other options. If this were Scharffen Berger or Guittard quality, it might be worth the extra cost. But for Hershey's? You be the judge. Only you know if it's worth it to you. I'll pass. Rating: 3.0 Product: Stella D'Oro Cookies, Almond Delight, 9 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: I've purchased a few Stella D'oro varieties over the years but haven't been a steady customer, so I really don't have much to compare these to as far as taste/quality over a period of time. I do know that I like these. Probably not enough to put them on subscribe and save, but enough to purchase again occasionally. First things first: these are not overly sweet and they're rather dry, so it's clear they're intended to be eaten with coffee or tea or even wine. The flavor is there -- vanilla in some, lemon in others, chocolate -- but it's very subtle. The icing and sprinkles really bring nothing to the party -- the icing is a thin "smear," without flavor. But flavor and "mouth feel" are overall pleasant. They're also quite "sturdy" -- mine survived transport in less than optimum exterior packaging without a single broken cookie. Seriously -- not a one broke. Even with that, they're still tender - not "hard" and crunchy at all. And you do get quite a lot of them -- they come in a plastic tray that is 9.5" x 5.5" x 2" that is filled full. As I said, I'll likely order these sometime in the future, possibly adding them into my "cookie rotation" of brands/types that I like to purchase occasionally. Definitely worth 4 stars: I like them. Rating: 4.0 Product: OliveNation Honey Roasted Sesame Chips, 8 Ounce Review: Like others, I'm sure, I first tasted these in a "pub mix" blend of pretzel stix, cheese twists, and rice treats. It was love at first taste, and I spent some time trying to find a source for just these sesame chips. Tried a couple of other options, but this is the clear winner! It comes closest to the taste of the sesame treats in the pub mix -- a little salty, a little sweet, and a tender "crunch" that is ... well ... just about perfect. I eat them "straight up," of course, but one of my favorite ways to use them is in my own savory trail mix: these crackers, mini pretzels, cheeze crackers (or goldfish crackers), honey roasted almonds, and corn chex cereal. I usually have a couple of bowls of this out for cocktail parties and it always goes over well. Will continue to purchase these as long as they're still available. These OliveNation chips have the best flavor and definitely are the freshest tasting. Solid 5 stars! Rating: 5.0 Product: HERSHEY'S SPECIAL DARK Nuggets, Gluten-Free Mildly Sweet Dark Chocolate Candy with Almonds, 12 Ounce Bag (Pack of 4) Review: Oh my. Well, there went the diet, big time. The milk chocolate is creamy goodness, and the toffee chips and finely chopped almonds add just the right amount of sweet slightly salty crunch. These are absolutely addictive, and I have to seriously limit my consumption if I have any hope of staying on track diet-wise. Will definitely keep these around -- despite the temptation. They're really THAT good. Rating: 5.0 Product: Ghirardelli Chocolate Squares, Peppermint Bark, 7.06 oz., 3 Count Review: Certain members of my family are mint+chocolate addicts. Peppermint bark, filled peppermint chocolates, chocolate mint cookies, anything that combines mint with chocolate. This year, we got both the dark and milk chocolate varieties of these Ghirardelli peppermint bark squares. We liked both flavors, probably preferred the dark chocolate, but found both to have a nice balance of mint to chocolate. The crushed peppermint candy bits in the white chocolate top add a nice crunch, too. The price here is very good, too. Definitely a keeper! Rating: 4.0 Product: Twix Cookie Bars, Caramel Milk Chocolate, 1.79-Ounce Packages (Pack of 36) Review: A crunchy cookie topped with caramel, all covered in milk chocolate. What's not to like? These make a nice snack in the afternoon with a cup of tea. They're more like a cookie than a candy bar (to me, anyway). Amazon's price is pretty good, too, for 36 "regular sized" packages (2 cookie bars per package). Will order again, for sure. The syrup is thick and syrupy, perfect for adding a touch of sweetness to cocktails or desserts.  I'm definitely going to buy more of this!

Product:
Queen Anne, Cherry Cordials, Dark Chocolate, 10 Pieces, 6.6oz Box (Pack of 2)
Review:
I received a box of milk chocolate Queen Anne cherry cordials for Valentine's.  These were the first I had eaten in some years as I prefer liquid center cordials.  The chocolate is very good, the cherry firm, the center a tasty mixture of liquid and creme fondant and the texture pleasing,  but they are very sweet.  I decided to buy a box of dark chocolate cordials to see if, perhaps, they would be less sweet.  As expected, they are less sweet than the milk chocolate variety but still very sweet.  These are not the cordials which most people would enjoy snacking on, one piece is enough to satisfy a sweet tooth.  Which means, of course, that you are unlikely to eat most of the box in one sitting.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
ALMOND JOY, Chocolate Coconut Candy Bar (Pack of 36)
Review:
We recently sampled several brands of chocolate coconut candy including Russell Stover, Anastasia's, and Whitman's.  Our conclusion is that we have yet to find any better than Mounds and Almond Joy.  The three brands listed are not even as good.  Neither are coconut bon bons or rainbow coconut slices from Cracker barrel.  Lindt isn't bad, but still not as good.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Margaret Holmes, Tomato, Okra & Corn, 14.5oz Can (Pack of 6)
Review:
I found this delicious treat at Dollar Tree. I was intrigued so went on line and discovered that the Margaret Holmes brand is part of the McCalls Farm group, specializing in Southern style canned foods. "In the early 1930s, Ed Holmes began canning white acre peas and squash; now the brand includes a wide variety of Southern-style fruits and vegetables."

This is not the thick style my mother and grandmother made. Instead, it is almost a thick soup. It is good as is but was better when I drained a can of beans and made a quick succotash. It would make a good starter for a variety of other dishes including gumbo. Well seasoned out of the can, I like a little more salt and spice so added a little Tony's All Purpose Creole Seasoning. Delicious. It was good enough that I am going to try other products from this company.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
SweetGourmet Mello Cream Autumn Mix - Candy Corn Mix (1.5Lb)
Review:
Most of the critical reviews concern sellers and shipping.  We bought this candy corn at a local candy shop so had no problems.  The candy is sweet and soft with a strong hint of vanilla.  It is also made in the USA unlike most brands in local grocers which are made in Mexico.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
CADBURY Chocolate Candy Bar, Royal Dark Chocolate, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 14)
Review:
My seven year old and I both love these chocolate bars.  If I buy just one, she gets at least half.  She has already made a significant dent in the box I received for Christmas.  Note that these are made by Hershey in the U.S., not by Cadbury in England.  Even though Hershey does not use the original recipe to make this candy, they, at this time at least, do not use standard Hershey milk chocolate either.

5.0
Product:
Pickapeppa Pepper Sampler (3 Pack)
Review:
Pickapeppa has always been an outstanding sauce for seafood, pork and some cheeses (not to mention fried potatoes).  New flavors have been added and this three bottle set has two of the best new ones - spicy mango and gingery mango plus a bottle of original.  One can usually find original at supermarkets in our area but it is not always easy to find all of the other flavors.

Product:
Nestle Butterfinger Peanut Butter Cups Share Pack, 3 Ounce (Pack of 18)
Review:
Creamy peanut butter cups with the taste of a Butterfinger without the crunch.  The ones I bought have Product of United Kingdom on the label.  These are good, but we prefer regular Butterfingers.

They have a higher sugar content than some snanks, the main ingredients being tapioca syrup, cane sugar, and white grape juice concentrate, with natural flavors, black carrot for color, vitamin C added, etc. They are an attractive snack for children in convenient tear-0pen packets. They can also be dropped into day packs, lunch boxes, etc., or be kept in a desk drawer at work. They have an expiration date on the box, but have a relatively long shelf life. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kashi GOLEAN Bar, Chocolate Almond Toffee, 2.75-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12) Review: This is a diet bar of sorts, although it has 290 calories. It can be used as a breakfast bar. It has 13 grams of protein and 6 grams of fiber. It is a bit high on sodium with 250 mg, and has an equal amount of potassium. The texture is chewy and the flavor is good. It tends to be filling, which offsets the calories. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kashi Cherry Dark Chocolate Granola Bars 6 Count, 7.4 ounces (Pack of 4) Review: More filling and not as sweet as the Atkins Day Break Chocolate Chip Crisp - 5 x 1.2 Oz Bars (Pack of 6) reviewed separately. This bar claims 120 calories but has less nutrition with 5 grams of protein, 4 grams of fiber, and no significant amount of essential vitamins and minerals. It is less heat sensitive which makes it easier to ship and carry in a day pack, etc. The taste is good, somewhat on the drier side. I would note that the price will vary depending on the source. They are commonly available locally in sources such as Krogers. Rating: 4.0 Product: Kashi TLC Chewy Granola Bars Cherry Dark Chocolate 6 - 1.2 Oz (35g) Bars (Pack of 6) Review: This is a good product but the listed Amazon price is high. Krogers has them for about $3 for a box of 6. There is a "best by" date on the top of the box (in white lettering in the green rectangle). The boxes that I purchased were fresh and were not dry. Ingredients are also clearly listed on the box - they contain wheat, soy, milk, almond and peanut ingredients - if you have an intolerance for those products you obviously should not be eating the bars. I personally had no problem with the bars, and found them to be a good diet bar. I also eat Kashi cereal (both cold and hot varieties, e.g., Kashi Golean Cereal, 13.1 Ounce) The individual bars are listed as having 5 grams of protein and 4 grams of fiber with 24 grams of carbohydrate. It is listed as 120 calories per bar. Rating: 5.0 Product: Power Crunch High Protein Energy Snack, Cookies & Creme, 1.4-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12) Review: Normally I would have rated this product high as a high-protein bar with a good flavor. However, the manufacturer has loaded the bar with artificial flavor and artificial colors (yellow 5&6, red 3, blue 1). Therefore I do not recommend it as a diet or health product. Rating: 1.0 Product: Kashi GOLEAN Crunch! Cereal, 15-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) Review: This might be an excellent cereal, but the boxes that I bought had large pieces stuck together that were hard as a rock and dangerous to the fillings in your teeth. They can be manually broken apart, but that is a lot of extra trouble. Other than that, the flavor is good. It does have a significant amount of fiber, and a reasonable amount of protein. There is a potential problem with sodium deficiency if you eat too many foods low in sodium (that can cause muscle cramps, especially in your legs). Rating: 3.0 Product: Simply7 Quinoa Chips, Gluten Free, Barbeque, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: These chips have a nice flavor, and the Amazon price is lower than local grocery stores. The problem has been noted by other reviewers. The manufacturer has lowered his costs by loading them with potato starch which adds nothing except calories. If I want potato chips, I will buy potato chips. There are 140 calories per ounce, with only 1 gram of protein and 1 gram of fiber. In comparison, Beanitos Pinto Bean chips have the same calories, but have 4 grams of protein and 5 grams of fiber (with zero potato starch). per ounce. Review:
I purchase whole natural almonds in bulk for healthy snacks to munch and lunch. However they're not a fun addition to morning oatmeal, just a little too much crunch for a mushy texture despite the berries added. Slicing almonds by hand is a risk for missing fingers or parts thereof; a major bummer for a "healthier lifestyle"!

All kidding aside, Fisher nuts has provided an EASY option for adding sliced almonds to my morning oatmeal and a healthier lifestyle with all fingers in a healthy, all-intact condition. Thanks for the opportunity to try these out.

Rating: 5.0 Product: Twinings of London Pure Camomile Herbal Tea Bags, 20 Count Review: I recently ran into an aunt and as we talked she mentioned giving up diet cola drinks. She does not like the aspartame and was sure it had caused her some bad side effects. She mentioned that this tea was delicately flavored, not bold and intense. She also said this tea did not cause her to get jittery as other teas and cola drinks had. Just to try it, I bought a box and she was correct. Just as she said, the taste was delicate and fruity and it does seem like you're getting less caffeine, although it's possible that brewing it cold has that effect. It's handy and as you can drink it straight from tap or filtered water. Rating: 5.0 Product: Erin Baker's Breakfast Cookies, Banana Walnut, Whole Grain, Vegan, Non-GMO, 3-ounce (Pack of 12) Review: These breakfast cookies are so delicious, they'll make you want to get out of bed early. They genuinely have that caramel apple taste and although I no longer ea real caramel apples, because of my dental work, these are a very fine replacement. The texture is perfect and the taste even better. If you need a quick breakfast and love sugary caramel apples, this is perfect for you. Rating: 5.0 Product: RiceSelect Texmati Light Brown Rice, Long Grain American Basmati, 32 oz Jars (Pack of 4) Review: This long grain,American Basmati brown rice is sensational. I have switched from my old brand of rice to this one for nutritional reasons being that brown rice contains nutrients like zinc, magnesium and manganese. It has more fiber It's so flavorful, I added some garlic,onion and celery as I boiled it. The aroma was captivating, without exageration. It tasted delicious and I just wish I had more time to cook. It takes a little longer to cook than white rice but it's worth it. Rating: 5.0 Product: Gatorade Performance Series Carbohydrate Energy Formula, Wild Berry, 12-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 24) Review: I've always loved Gatorade since its beginnings. Because I live an active lifestyle, I sweat. I work out,jog and I am human, I sweat. I've relied on Gatorade drinks for years to replenish my electrolytes. I can feel the energy after having had a drink and I love this new wild berry flavor. This is a healthy drink I would recommend to anyone with an active physical life and as we all know, the flavors are delicious. Yes, I would recommend this new flavored , high energy Gatorade to anyone who is physically active and needs to replace the sweat of working out. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kashi, Breakfast Cereal, Organic Autumn Wheat, Non-GMO Project Verified, 16.3 oz(Pack of 4) Review:
 Finding healthy foods that actually taste good is a quest of mine. I love the taste of Kashi's Autumn Wheat cereal. Knowing that it is a natural product and is healthy is fine but he added benefit of tasting good is even better. I highly recommend this for anyone, especially those who are health conscious ! Rating: 5.0 Product: New York Style Bagel Crisps, Plain, 7.2 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: These tasty bagel snacks are perfect for snack time. They taste delicious and have good healthy ingrediants. A little more salty than I would use, BUT STILL NICE. I recommend there knowing you'll fall in love with these delicious, crispy snacks. Review:
This food pack of Alpine Spiced Apple Cider Original Instant Drink Mix, 10-Count .74-Ounce Pouches  (pack of 12) is what I consider a worthwhile purchase. This apple cider tastes good as a standalone powder in hot microwaved water andor as a mix with tea (I have used this mix with some Celestial brand tea flavors). There are even cider recipes listed with one of the boxes I have opened within this pack (recipes for mulled spiced cider, apple pie shake, and warm caramel apple drink. I also like that I could just microwave plain old tap water for just one minute and 30 seconds, throw a pack of the apple cider mix in the water and I have a delicious apple cider drink either as a standalone andor mixed with any of the store bought tea mixes that my husband and I have.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Lipton Green Tea Pyramids, Mandarin Orange 20 ct (Pack of 6) Review: I enjoy Lipton brands a lot and my only other preferred tea is Luzianne. Lipton's Earl Grey Pyramid Tea Bags are pretty bad. Though I really like the design of their pyramid bags, and really like the Earl Gray flavor; there is something very off with the flavor from this tea. It's like a very strange combination. The Bergamot flavor is missing from this, no question. You can't even smell it when you open the package. The ingredients mention some type of marigold flowers which do not mix well with the Earl Gray. I would skip this particular product; it just doesn't taste at all like true Earl Gray Tea. Rating: 2.0 Product: Duncan Hines Decadent Brownie Mix, Chocolate Peanut Butter, 16.8 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: This Duncan Hines Brownie Mix bakes up easy and fast. Directions call for 1 or 2 eggs, oil and water. I like cake like brownies and always opt for 2 eggs. Using a 9x9 pan, they are usually done in about 30 minutes. They taste rich but not sugary, and excellent topped with a dollop of ice cream. Rating: 5.0 Product: Tropicana Orange Juice, 10 Ounce (Pack of 24) Review: There is no question that the Tropicana Orange Juice, 10 Ounce is a great size for travel, breakfast portioning, and a regular beverage anywhere in-between. Yes it does have "natural flavors" not found in regular orange juice that make me wonder just what that means, but that plus filtered water and concentrated orange juice make up this drink. No fat, no cholesterol. Sugar is 28g, though the label doesn't indicate any is added so hopefully that's all natural from the oranges. What gets me about this Tropicana Orange Juice is consistency between cases. I got one case that tasted perfect, but the very next case was thick and off. It even had 3 months on the expiration date so that wasn't the issue. I see from other review's I'm not the only one with this problem, so it's something to consider if you go with this brand. Rating: 3.0 Product: Swiss Miss Hot Cocoa Mix, Sensible Sweets, Light, 8 count,0.29 ounce, (Pack of 6) Review: I have enjoyed Swiss Miss for years because it's easy to make with just hot water. It's easy to make, just add hot water and stir; you can substitute milk for water if you have it available, but that's what makes this product so versatile. I was concerned that this 'diet' version might not be as tasty as regular Swiss Miss, however it tastes pretty okay. Much better than the regular 'unsweetened version'. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kraft Salad Dressing, Honey Mustard, 16-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 6) Review: I prefer using this dressing for dipping tenders. Adds a nice touch to nuggets, tenders and occasionally hot wings (as an alternative to ranch or blue cheese). Lid stays relatively clean, I recommend removing the label from the lid for less mess. You will have to remove the lid entirely to peal off the internal 'safety seal'. Rating: 4.0 Product: Arm & Hammer Baking Soda Fridge Freezer Package, 16-Ounce Review: The Arm & Hammer Fridge/Freezer Package is a great idea and one tough product. This product has removable sides that reveal a cloth-like face. This allows air to go in one side, become freshened, and exit either side. This pack is great for use in freezers, which I mainly use it for, to help cut down on the freezer burn smell that can collect on bags and containers. When thirty days are up, you can pop open the top and use the baking soda for various cleaning purposes, although it wouldn't be useful for cooking purposes. I have even refilled the package with fresh baking soda from a bigger container and sealed the top back and gotten the same results as if I had used a new fridge/freezer package. This is a great idea and can really help if you have freezer burn odor or a fridge that doesn't smell fresh. Rating: 5.0 Product: Dove Milk Chocolate, Silky Smooth Promises, 9.5-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4) Review: Dove's silky smooth milk chocolate promises are really delicious and pack a great message. On the inside of each individual wrapper is a fun and useful inspirational message to motivate and encourage you. Compared to other milk chocolate products, these Dove Promises are slightly more expensive, however I feel they do have a better quality to justify the slight mark up in price. Great for a little 'escape' from everyday life and well worth trying. In the non-sweet snack category, I'd put them right up there in the pantheon with Combos (obviously Pepperoni Pizza as the best kind) and Doritos (preferably Cool Ranch, but I'll hear arguments for other flavors). Rating: 5.0 Product: Casina Rossa Truffle and Salt - Premium Gourmet Sea Salt - 3.5oz. Review: I was bored a few weekends back, so I ordered this as well as some black truffle oil and white truffle oil. Figured I'd have myself a little truff party. Well let me tell you, it's been a 2-week non-stop party in my mouth. And you can be invited! Well I guess the party would be in your mouth, but I digress. My kitchen now smells like Umamiville, USA. This is some seriously pungent stuff. Mrs. Philyodaddy put the three aforementioned products in one drawer, which she started calling the truffle drawer (very clever lady that Mrs. P). More like flavor country. So far I have applied small doses of this product on: sandwiches, steak, salmon, other fish, cheese, chicken, pork, lamb, my finger, and other animals I cannot currently think of. Everything was improved. As you can see, I have an extremely healthy diet. I might be going off the deep end a little, because Mrs. Philyodaddy is "getting sick of truffles". Like that's possible. Hey Mrs. P, maybe you should get sick of expensive purses or renttherunway. The ratio is 95 parts salt for 5 parts truffle, not that I could tell. It seems that there is real black truffle in as well as some sort of truffle flavor, but this is my first truffle salt, so I don't know if that's par for the truffcourse. I would say, of the three truffle related products I've tried so far I like the salt the best, and a little goes a long way. Try it out, unless you don't like delicious things. Rating: 5.0 Product: Huy Fong - Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce (Net Wt. 17 Oz.) - 3 Pack Review: Sriracha, while hard to spell, makes everything taste better. It is spicy in a much better way than Tabasco and also better than most other western/Mexican style hot sauces. Tabasco is overrated by the way. Fact. Deal with it. If I may be allowed use an analogy in SAT form, it would probably look something like- Sriracha : Tabasco :: Philyodaddy : People who stand on the left side of an escalator. See what I did there? Here is a list of things that are NOT made better by this Thai (apparently its from Thailand, now I know) delicacy: Cereal Fruit Fruit-based deserts That is all I got. Will update if I can think of anything else. Not likely. In addition to being great on cooked foods, it represents the single easiest way to prepare food. Pork, Chicken, Fish, just rub that red stuff all over it and put it in the pan/oven/Waring Pro DF280 Professional Deep Fryer, Brushed Stainless. Dinner for days. You're welcome. All that being said, I wouldn't pay more than $3.99 for this bottle, making this current price a pretty bad deal. Certainly not deducting any stars though from this tremendous product. Go on with your bad self, Huy Fong. Rating: 5.0 Product: REESE'S Chocolate Candy, Peanut Butter Cusp, 1.5 Ounce (Pack of 36) Review: Don't know who this Reese guy is, but shout out to him. Reese's really are the height of the candy industry. Shame on you, wannabe's. "If you come at the king, you best not miss" - Omar Little, The Wire. "Reese's are the best" - Philyodaddy, reviewer. Reese's are the Honey Nut Cheerios Cereal, 12.25 Ounce (Pack of 4) of the Candy aisle. Best in Class. Pretty sure they are very healthy as I would like to eat several a day and don't have the diabetes yet. If the packages include a calorie content sectsh, I certainly don't notice because I'm too busy devouring these morsels of heaven. 1.5 ounces of divinity right to the dome. Recommended way to consume: Dipped in Nutella. Can they make a Nutella-filled reeses? Wow, just give me the Nobel Candy prize, right now. Lastly, the full size cups (or even the super-large "Big Cup", which are also Philyodaddy-approved - please Reese's purists, don't nail me to the cross) are far superior to the little, dainty guys that come in the tin foil. Don't bring that weak crap up in this. You got the choc-pb ratio ALL WRONG. I'll eat those little guys if I am stranded on a dessert island or stealing your kid's halloween candy, but otherwise: no way, no how. I swear I'm not fat. By the way see what I did with "dessert island" - pretty clever, right? p.s. As for all the people who wrote reviews of this product claiming it is super fresh, what in the world are you talking about? It is a processed food. Did you think that they just picked your pack of 36 right off the Chocolate Peanut Butter tree before hand-delivering it to you in a refrigerated container? I want my steak dry-aged, my wine in a bottle, my Iphone made in China, and my g-damn Reese's from a warehouse in orange packaging. p.p.s. I learned the following from Wikipedia while researching for this review. "They were created in 1928 by H. B. Reese, a former dairy farmer and shipping foreman for Milton S. Hershey." The more you know. Rating: 5.0 Product: Orbit Spearmint Sugarfree Gum, 14 Pieces (12 Pack) Review: Remix to what? Similarly to R. Kelly's jam "Remix to Ignition" - The Orbit Strawberry Remix Sugarfree Gum is probably far more famous than the original. That being said, I like this gum. It is very strong-flavored, so weak gum-likers need not apply. It is true that the flavor does not last as long as other Orbit delights like the Wrigleys Orbit Bubblemint, 14-Count (Pack of 12). You can't win 'em all. Truth be told, that is a better gum. This is more of a special occasion gum, when you're really feeling the need to take the vacation to flavor country. I keep this gum at work so that I can make sure that my oral fixation always has 12 x 20 pieces on standby. Review over. Product:
CLIF Nut Butter Filled - Chocolate Hazelnut Butter - (1.76 Ounce Protein Snack Bar, 12 Count) (Packaging may vary)
Review:
First of all my kids LOVE this bar, they would eat the whole case in one sitting - absolute LOVE.  I, on the other hand, don't like it at all.  Thus the mid star rating.

The bar is all natural, organic, non-GMO and full of fatty peanut butter, wrapped in chocolatey crunchy oats.  I think where the bar loses for me is the chocolate taste is not great.  I like deep dark bitter chocolate and perhaps this one is a bit too sweet for me.

Great for instant calories - about 230 of them, 100 straight from fat.  The bar will hold you between meals.

Super for kids, NOT for adults.  Let's leave it at that.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Nature Valley Backpacker Chocolate Chip Chewy Oatmeal Bites 6-1.24 oz. Pouches
Review:
I really take offense at a solid brand like Nature Valley offering these addicting tiny bites to kids.

They are chocolatey and have a bit of a coconut flavor to them, although I only found Palm oil, not coconut in the ingredients.  Each little tiny bag has about a dozen or so tiny bite-sized bits.  Each bag has 150 calories, over one-third of those FAT and 24 more simple sugar carbs to boot, and 8 calories of protein, as well.  8 calories of protein.  8.

The label on the box says,  "16 grams of whole grains and no artificial flavors, sweeteners, or colors."  So, you kind of think you are making a healthy choice.  And you are wrong.  You are feeding your child pure diabetes in bite-sized bits.  The fat comes primarily from Canola oil.  AND, WHAT IS Canola oil?  It's like Canadian Oil because they invented it and now 90% is a Monsanto creation.  Enough said about that?

I didn't see an age on here, but toddlers and youngers have an added danger of choking, these are pretty small bits - see the picture I included.

My son sat down to try a bag of these, I gave him one pouch to each.  He ended up finding the box and then eating the ENTIRE BOX.  6 in a box x 150 calories each pouch = 900 calories.  O.M.G. and then he went on to eat his regular lunch.  Granted the kid is super skinny but NO CHILD NEEDS 900 calories in one sitting.

I am not a big fan of these.  I am really mad at Nature Valley, famous for their oat bars, natural granola, to market such an addictive and sugary fat product to youngsters.  Corporate Accountability I am calling you out on this one!!
Rating:
1.0

Sweet Leaf Liquid Stevia Sweetner,  Cinnamon - 2 oz - Liquid
Review:
I had been using plain stevia with a shake of cinnamon in my espresso.  This product is too sweet/sickeningly cinnamony.  I will use up the whole bottle, but not buy it again.  I've experimented using less and that's not as bad, but the taste stays with you.  I will go back to using plain stevia with a shake of actual cinnamon.

2.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co Bestie Almond Butter, Non-GMO, Gluten Free, Vegan, No Sugar Added, 11 Ounce Jars, 6 Count
Review:
This nut butter is so unbelievable good you have got to hold yourself back from sucking down the entire jar!  lol.  Seriously!

Kidding, but just a little bit.  The taste is phenomenal, the cashews taste great and make a phenomenal butter.  As these are my FAVE nuts, I am totally psyched!  This butter is oily.  No two ways about it.  Many natural nut butters are.  This is NOT JIFF, so you need to get over the oily smooth texture.  Stir as well as you can and then put on your Ezekial toast and OMG best breakfast EVER!  YUM!  Just watch the serving size ;-)  And no, the entire jar is NOT one serving!!

GREAT GREAT GREAT nut butter.  No sugar, bit of sunflower oil and touch of sea salt.  All WIN!

5.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co Bestie Almond Butter, Non-GMO, Gluten Free, Vegan, No Sugar Added, 11 Ounce Jars, 6 Count
Review:
I hit the gym at 4 am.  I have to eat something before I go and almost always my food choice is an Ezekial bread, over-toasted so it is hard and 1 tablespoon of almond butter.  I was very happy with the BESTIE brand.  It is on par with the very expensive brands I usually buy.  Since I used every last scrape of nut butter in a jar, I was really happy with this size.  It won't go stale.  (Sometimes the one from Costco is so big, by the end, you are out of the oil and it less butter and more like concrete.)

This is the third product I have from this company and they have all been outstanding.  Really great nut butters.

Don't worry about changing brands, this is a solid choice.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peeled Snacks Organic Peas Please, Garden Herb, 3.3 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I got these thinking they were dehydrated veggies, peas to be exact.  I mean, the company motto is "To make you feel good about snacking."
Uh, NO.  Not the case.  Each 3.3 ounce bag has 3 and a half servings.  And you can easily kill the whole bag.  EASILY.  And if you did kill the whole bag, thinking, "OH, VEGGIES, GREAT," you would ingest, oh, 400 calories!  Enough for a small meal!!  And you would have ingested 4.5 grams of fat TIMES 3.3 ounces, so that's uh, close to FIFTEEN grams of fat in each bag?!?!?  WHHHHAAAT?  In one 3.3 ounce bag?!

Yeah, a bag of these healthy pea snacks could put your training program right over the rails.

Take heart, as there is actually organic whole green pea flour in here, it is the first ingredient.  And then there's brown rice flour and then oil.  LOTS and LOTS of oil.  And cheddar cheese, yeast, etc.

They do taste pretty good, but these are NOT veggies.  Lipstick on the pig does not make it more beautiful.  It just makes it WEIRD.  And that's how I felt trying these out.  WEIRD.

If you need the splurge, go get some proper Lays chips, go crazy, get a flavor.  Get some pretzels.  Have a piece of cheese with them.  But don't think you are doing yourself a solid by eating these peas.  PLEASE.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Vanilla Bean Grass-Fed Ghee Butter by 4th & Heart, 9 Ounce, Pasture Raised, Non-GMO, Lactose Free, Certified Paleo, Keto-Friendly
Review:
AMAZING!  Great taste - really sweet, you can taste the grass-fed in this ghee.  It is really, really, good.  Use it in cooking, oil the pans, I also LOVE it on popcorn.  With a bit of Himalayan salt.  Unbelievably good.  Smooth, creamy, super taste.  I love it.  Turns out that this ghee comes in other flavors!  I can't WAIT to try the garlic one.

I highly recommend you give this one a try.  Two thumbs up!

5.0
