prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: All Natural Imported Turkish Dried Figs - .55 lbs (250 grams each) Pack of 3 Review: I accepted a review sample because dried figs are an integral part of my diet when fresh ones are not in season. Since there are always figs in my pantry I was able to directly compare these to the usual California brands that I purchase. First, these are completely different. They are large, soft and moist in the center, and slightly sticky on the outside. Even the premium California figs I purchase locally seem mummified compared to these. The size is another factor - these are much larger. Second, these have a natural sweetness that exceeds the California ones. Indeed, it comes close to the over ripe fresh figs of which I am fond when they are in season. Of course, there is nothing to my palate that compares to a fresh fig, but these will do nicely when the fresh ones are not in season. I did a quick taste test when I was comparing these using a few cheeses and a wine samples to augment the flavors. I found that the sweetness of these figs is prefect paired with pecorino romano (a very strong cheese of sheep milk), while the California fig against which I tested it was bland and overpowered. The three wines I tried were an Italian white (Gavi), a California red (pinor noir) and an Italian red (valpolicella ripasso). This fig went well with the Gavi and valpolicella, but not the pinot. The California fig was so tasteless in comparison that it went with (but was not enhanced by) all three wines. My conclusion is paring a contrasting cheese - especially a strong one - with either a crisp, dry white or heavier, dry red wine is a perfect match. I mention this because for cheese and wine sampling parties this is perfect for serving after the tasting because the high fiber will counter the tendency of the cheese to constipate guests. Additional factors: the figs do not look exactly like those in the product images (at the time of this review). They are actually larger and flatter; and, the complete nutritional information in on the product photo of the actual container so I am not going to repeat it here. Also, the containers are relatively small (but this is a three pack, so the pricing is still competitive with my locally purchased ones). They are approximately four inches in diameter by two inches high. Finally, the packaging recommends that you refrigerate these after opening them. I do not - they dry out the figs. I store mine in a tightly sealed glass container in my pantry. Rating: 5.0 Product: Cinnamon Organic Saigon - Fine Powder - Naturally Sweet Flavor - Perfect for Cinnamon Rolls, Apple Pie, Baking, Smoothies - Unprocessed & Hand Harvested - 100% Satisfaction Review: Compared to cinnamon sticks and the usual grocery store fare Saigon cinnamon is potent, more aromatic and literally explodes with flavor. Use two thirds of what you would normally use or it will be bitter. In fact, like other brands I have tried this is fresh and potent enough to get by with a half of what you would normally use. You can always add a pinch more, but cannot remove it. Experiment if you have never used this Vietnamese spice because it's definitely like cinnamon on steroids. I use this mixed with either honey or unsweetened applesauce as a topping on baked sweet potatoes. I also add a pinch to coffee grounds before brewing when I want a special treat. This does NOT come in sticks because the nature of the bark from which this comes is too delicate to harvest in stick form. On the other hand, I have never had a cinnamon stick that came close to flavor and fragrance as this stuff, so do not let the powdered form fool you into thinking that there is something better out there. There isn't. If you cook or bake with cinnamon and have never experienced this variety it's definitely worth checking out. Rating: 5.0 Product: Dancing Moon Sumatra Mandheling Whole Bean Organic Fair Trade Antioxidant Coffee, 2 lbs. Review: I received this as a free review sample to try after criticizing the roast of the Dancing Moon Ethiopian Yirgacheffe, which I thought was over roasted. This one is perfectly roasted for the bean type. It's dark (the Sumatra Mandheling is best that way), but not oily, which would indicate over roasting. The flavor was typical Mandheling, with a full, rich body, low acidity and complex with earthy dominating, but a touch of sweet and - to my palate - an ineffable flavor that I cannot identify, but lingers in a pleasant way. When I test coffee I have a specific process. I always grind with a manual, ceramic burr grinder so as to not burn or burnish the beans, and I use a bottled water (Acqua Panna) when brewing because that water is totally neutral. Sadly that water is too expensive for daily brewing, but it contributes to a perfect cup of coffee. I also brew two ways: in a French Press and in a Bialetti 6799 Moka Express 3-Cup Stovetop Espresso Maker. This particular bean and grind brewed perfectly in both. I had expected a better brew from the French press, but surprisingly the moka did an equally nice job. In fact that brewer brought out nuances that the French press did not. My only complaint is there is no roast date on the bag. There is a 'use by' sticker, but that does not tell you how long ago it has been roasted - and is important to we coffee fanatics. Bottom line: I loved this particular bean and roast so much that I will probably be ordering a bag every few months - it's that good. Rating: 5.0 Product: Viva Naturals Organic Quinoa, 4 LB - 100% Royal Bolivian Whole Grain Review: I received a bag of this as a review sample and had other quinoa in my pantry to which to compare against. The grains in this bag were dry, fresh and had a slightly grassy flavor when I tasted a few grains. In contrast, the other brand I have in my pantry was not as pleasant to the palate (raw). The grains in this bag were smaller and more uniform as well. This one soaked and cooked about five minutes quicker as well, compared to the brand I had been using. As for the claims that this is non-GMO I have no way to verify that, but it's an important feature for me. I endeavor to eat only natural foods that are as pure as possible. Other reviewers have provided recipes and other information, so I will not repeat them. I will say that I've\ been eating quinoa for years because it is healthier on my system than most other grains. This is one of the higher quality bags that I have some across and I do know the difference. If you are exploring the health benefits there is plenty of information on the web. If you already consume quinoa this is truly a quality grain that is noticeably better than bulk bags (and even the giant plastic jars that some brands use). Rating: 5.0 Product: Thai Kitchen Fish Sauce, 6.76 oz Review: I can purchase this locally from a number of sources, including the dominant supermarket chain in Central Florida. Therefore my review will focus on this fish sauce and not address price or shipping. Not all fish sauces are created equal. I spent a lot of my life in Asia and was first introduced to this in the Philippines where it's called patis. This is identical to a high quality patis in all respects. Do be aware that this, like patis or other Thai brands, is extremely high in sodium. A single gram of this sauce contains 890mg. That means that a teaspoon contains a whopping 4450mg, so use it very sparingly if you have sodium restrictions. My main use is to chop fresh bird's eye peppers and make a combination dipping sauce and condiment that is called phrik nam pla in Thai. It's also delicious by itself on on grilled eggplant and zucchini, and especially pork (which I have not eaten in decades but did enjoy with this sauce when I did consume it.) Actually, this is perfect on mixed grilled or fried vegetables and will enhance many dishes if used in lieu of salt or soy sauce. Bottom line: this is a quality fish sauce that is identical to patis and the equal of any brand I have used. Rating: 5.0 Product: Thai Kitchen Fish Sauce, 6.76 oz Review: This is identical to the the top brands of the Philippine version called patis. It has the same purity and flavor, and can easily compete with my other favorite brand made by Tiparos. I switched to this brand mainly for convenience when I discovered it on a shelf at my local grocery store. That was a shock in itself, but a pleasant one. I use this - sparingly - on grilled eggplant and zucchini, and to make a hot dipping sauce called nam pra prik. That sauce can be easily made by finely chopping hot peppers (bird's eye chillies are the best) and adding them to this fish sauce. Although I haven't eaten pork in decades this was a perfect condiment for it when I did. The flavor of mixed grilled or fried vegetables is also greatly enhanced by using a few drops of this in lieu of salt or soy sauce. Do be aware that this, like patis or other Thai brands, is extremely high in sodium. A single gram of this sauce contains 890mg. That means that a teaspoon contains a whopping 4450mg, so use it very sparingly if you have sodium restrictions. Rating: 5.0 Product: Joyfuel Organic Raw Cacao Powder, Rich Dark Chocolate, 16 Ounce (1 lb) Bag Review: When I received this as a review sample I just had to try a little on my finger. It had that rich, slightly bitter taste of an excellent grade of cacao. I stirred a little into a cup of coffee and it complemented it perfectly. I was impressed by how easily it dissolved into the brew as though it were sugar. But know that it's anything but sweet (no quality cacao is). I know that this is supposed to have health benefits, some of which I know first hand from using cacao for quite some time. I have not had this long enough to say one way or the other. What I can say, though, is I have tried a lot of cacao in my life and this one is everything the product description claims as far as quality goes. In fact, if you make mole poblano from scratch, you'll appreciate this because it has a richness that you will not find in grocery store cacao or cocoa. The reason why I awarded this five stars are it is genuine Criollo, it's non GMO (a big deal for me), and the intense flavor and characteristic bitter aftertaste. If you do a lot of gourmet cooking using cacao this is worth every penny. If you are looking for the health benefits, I am not going to make claims other than to say that this is an exceptionally high quality grade. For me it's going to be a cooking ingredient, something to enrich after dinner coffee for me and guests, and as a sprinkle over confections made with mascapone cheese. I am sure I'll think of other uses, but when this runs out I am purchasing another bag. Rating: 5.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Boost Calorie Smart 100 Calories, Balanced Nutritional Drink, Vanilla Caramel, 4 Fluid Ounce (Pack of 4)(16 Bottles Total)
Review:
There is honestly so much that I have loved about Boost. They have had really good energy drinks that have definitely been great supplements for me and my whole family. But honestly, with all the nutrition, they have wanted to take a step back and try to do something in the way with what Slim-Fast had done for so many years, and try to make a leaner drink line for your life. This honestly is a nice stepping stone with their 100 calorie smart nutritional drink tastes not too shabby, and has just as much taste as the regular line of nutritional supplemental drinks. What I do like about it is that they do taste great in chocolate drinks. The sincere bad news is that you only get 4 bottles, rather than 6 unlike their lines of other drinks from their supplemental line. Still, they do taste great for the money, but I do wish that more could have been done for the money alone with this one that could have been more of a boost.

Healthy Choice Zesty Gumbo Soup, 15-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:
I absolutely love a nice, hot steaming bowl of soup once in awhile. Fortunately, Healthy Choice makes a nice arrangement of taste and quality with their soups. Their Zesty Gumbo soup however, isn't one of their best flavors. While the soup does blend in a unique blend of chicken, rice celery and flavor, there unfortunately lacks a bit of spice in the flavor by not adding enough garlic or zest from onions or cheese to the taste of the tongue. On top of that, it also lacks by not adding enough sausage in the gumbo, unlike Cambell's Chunky or Progresso's Chicken & Sausage Gumbo. It isn't a bad soup for the price if you're health-smart, but at least it is better than Cambell's putting sea salt in their lower sodium soups. I just hope that there is an improved formula in this gumbo.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Stash Tea English Breakfast Single-Cup Tea for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, 12 Count (Pack of 6)
Review:
This Stash Tea, Lemon Ginger Single-Cup is a really tasty zinger.  The lemon and ginger are strong flavors, and the tea color is far darker than most lemon ginger teas I've had.  I opened one of the single serves and found that the tea is more finely ground than those in loose tea mixes or tea bags.  Maybe this finer grinding allows more flavor to be brewed into the cup.

I like it plain when it's hot and with honey for a sweeter taste when served as iced tea.

If you're fond of citrus and ginger, you'll like this tea.  The convenience of the single serving cups is an added bonus.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
LÄRABAR Renola Grain-Free Granola, Cocoa Coconut, 1.18 oz, 15 Pack
Review:
I write this with the perspective of someone who does not NEED non-gluten, non-soy, low sodium foods.  It's simply the opinion of someone who enjoys delicious foods and snacks.  Larabar's Renola is a tasty granola substitute for those who are looking for a non-wheat granola product.

However, when I eat granola, I want crunch and this doesn't have it.  It does have almonds, pecans, cashews, sunflower and pumpkin  seeds and you'd expect a wonderfully crunchy texture from them, but maybe the fruit (raisins) and tapioca syrup soften them.

The flavor is sweet (dried molasses) and satisfying for a sweet tooth urge.  The cinnamon is mild and tasty, too.  They make the nuggets taste good.

The 200 calories for a 1.25 oz. serving seems awfully high, especially when 130 of them come from fat.  Unless you are desperate for a tiny splurge, I can think of better ways to consume 10% of the USDA's recommended daily allotment of a 2,000 calorie diet.  Please understand, if your needs are for non-gluten, this can more than meet your desire for a quick snack.  But, if you can partake of other options, I'd take a pass on this product.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
FISHER Snack Honey Roasted Peanuts, Golden Roast, 14 oz
Review:
These FISHER Honey Dry Roast Peanuts are delicious!  We happen to have an unopened jar of the Planters' dry roasted nuts with honey and so, we did a  'blind' taste test.  We prefer these FISHER nuts.  Both brands are good.  Maybe it's the ratio of sweet and salty, but the FISHER's is better in our opinions.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Traditional Medicinals Organic Belly Comfort Peppermint Digestive Tea, 16 Tea Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
If you follow the directions on the box, steeping your tea, you will have a delicious, spicy cup of ginger tea.  This is real ginger taste, not an artificial one.

I could not remember what brand of ginger tea I'd bought previously.  By reading the product description and consumer reviews, Traditional Medicinals Organic Ginger Aid seemed like a decent choice.  I am very happy with my selection.  I served it to a friend who loved it and shared half of my six boxes with her.  We'll be ordering more, I'm certain.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Super Fine Almond Flour, 16 Ounce Packages (Pack of 4)
Review:
I bought Bob's Red Mill Almond Meal/Flour with confidence, as I have used other products from this company and liked them.  Let me tell you why I bought it.  I wanted to make a pastry (almond crescents/horns) that requires one pound of almond paste.  At my local supermarket this sells for nearly $1/ounce--far too costly!  I looked at Amazon's price and determined that I could make almond paste for less than half that price.

The box came well-packaged and swiftly with Amazon Prime delivery.  I made two pounds of almond paste from just one bag of almond flour and will freeze the second pound for making marzipan.  The remaining three bags are stored in freezer bags in my freezer and will eventually be used in pie crusts, cookies, etc.

The almond flour blended perfectly with the other ingredients and produced an excellent paste.  The quality was very good; there were no dark spots (from almond skins), the flour had no lumps and appeared to be fresh.

This is a brand you can rely on and I do--again and again.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Belly Flops (Irregular Jelly Beans) by Jelly Belly - 2 lb Bag; 32 oz
Review:
If you've eaten Jelly Belly beans, you know how tasty they are.  Each tiny 'bean' is a colorful burst of gummy flavor.  In this package, you will find the appropriately named mistakes, 'Belly Flops'.  These are the beans that didn't meet production standards for size, shape, or perhaps, became stuck to another bean--twins, how yummy.  There's absolutely no difference in taste, just their appearance.  Each two-pounds bag contains a delicious, large variety of flavors of these cute, little beans.

Whether you buy them for yourself or, give them as a gift, they're sure to bring smiles of appreciation.  We mix the 'Flops' with the regular beans.  When scooping up a handful you'll never know what surprises you may encounter, making this treat even more fun to eat.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
FISHER Snack Praline Pecans Stand-Up, Resealable Bag, 5.5 oz
Review:
FISHER's Roasted Salted Pecans are scrumptious!  Each nut (some are full halves, some are large pieces) has a light sprinkling of salt and is perfectly roasted.  These nuts are good to eat right out of the re-sealable package and can be stored for future snacking without their becoming soggy.

A serving size is 1 ounce (about 1/4 cup) and contains 200 calories.  The problem is that they're so good, it's hard to stop with one serving.

The pecans are good on salads, on top of ice cream and I've even tried baking chocolate chip cookies with them.  Just use unsalted butter and add about half of the salt your usual recipe calls for.  I put these FISHER's Roaste4d Salted Pecans out for company with dried fruits, cheeses, and crackers.  Everyone complimented the nuts first.
Rating:
5.0

golds.output: I've been on the hunt for a good vegan jerky lately, and this Louisville Vegan Jerky has definitely made a dent in my search.  The smoked chipotle flavor is really tasty, and it's a good balance of smoky and spicy.  The texture is a bit chewy, but not in a way that's unpleasant.  It's definitely a good source of protein, with 21 grams per serving.  I'm happy to find a vegan jerky that's both tasty and satisfying.  I'd say it's a solid option for anyone looking for a plant-based protein snack.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Nutiva USDA Certified Organic, non-GMO, Unrefined Granulated Coconut Sugar, 1-pound (Pack of 3) Review: As coconut sugars go, the Nutiva Organic Sugar, Coconut, 1 Pound (Pack of 3) is a good way to go if you need three pounds. I question the labeling as Organic Superfood because I do not consider any sugar to be a superfood, but in moderation, if you are going to use sugar, this is one to consider. The color of the sugar is brown, the texture is moist and fine. It doesn't clump as quickly as brown sugar, but I haven't had an opened bag around long enough for that to occur. Each pound is in a sturdy resealable bag and there's an interesting recipe on the back of the bag which I intend to try. If this is your first experience with coconut sugar, don't be misled by the very white packaging and expect the product to be white like the coconut flesh represented on the package. This is a whole other product which has a very caramel like, rich texture that lends itself to rich uses. Rating: 5.0 Product: FISHER Chef's Naturals Walnut Halves & Pieces, No Preservatives, Non-GMO, 16 oz Review: Fisher Chef's Natural Walnuts get 5 stars for being non GMO certified and for being mostly halves of the nuts and not too many small pieces. They seem to be expensive, though, for non-Organic walnut halves. I bake a lot and have an ample supply of walnuts, pecans and almonds at the very least in the pantry and freezer. Seriously, I must go through a pound or two a week. I recently opened another brand's sealed and "fresh" bag of walnuts that were rancid, so I will never buy that brand again. These, on the other hand, were delicious straight out of the bag. I'm using these nuts in their out of the bag unchopped form and will use my other favorite bag for recipes requiring smaller pieces. These are especially tasty when baked and bitten into while warm, as the flavors and oils come forward. They are also excellent when spiced as a snack with cocktails! I prefer pecans over walnuts, but I tend to look for quality nuts at a reasonable price and would repurchase these if the price was right. Rating: 5.0 Product: Navitas Organics Cacao Nibs, 8 oz. Bag — Organic, Non-GMO, Fair Trade, Gluten-Free Review: I've been purchasing the Navitas Naturals Cacao Powder, Organic, 16-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 2) for years and made a discovery I'd like to share. When out of cocoa powder, I needed to bake a batch of Alice Medrich's Best Cocoa Brownies for an event and was short on time. Remembering the cacao powder in the cupboard, I took a chance and was rewarded with a batch of brownies that drew more compliments than ever before, and I'm always praised for the brownies I bake. They were especially bittersweet and didn't require the addition of espresso powder which I often add to chocolate baked recipes. The ultra fudgy brownies were great with nuts, without nuts, and in the fresh batch I baked yesterday, I brought out the chocolate flavor the best so far with the addition of rehydrated cherries, cranberries and chopped figs. I'd recommend thinking out of the box with this cacao powder and although it may lose some of the nutritional benefits with cooking, it sure does produce great baked goods if you are willing to taste your batter, adjust as necessary, and take a chance. The above mentioned recipe was a perfect use because the cacao powder is cooked with butter and sugar initially and that's used instead of the typical chocolate chunks in brownie recipes. Oh yes, in all recipes, I also added some chocolate chips -- found the extra bitter chips weren't as good as the semi-sweet because of the natural bitterness of the cacao powder. Rating: 5.0 Product: Bobo's Oat Bar (Banana Chocolate Chip, 12 Pack of 3 oz Bars) Gluten Free Whole Grain Rolled Oat Bar - Great Tasting Vegan On-The-Go Snack, Made in the USA Review: I've purchased 4 boxes of Bobo's Oat Bars in the Chocolate variety from Amazon in the past month. An acquaintance had told me how delicious they were, so I took a chance and purchased my first box before I embarked on a trip, planning to take some along for the journey. Unfortunately for my wallet, every person but one to whom I gave a bar loved these, so I sent some a box to enjoy. Prior to my first purchase, I did not realize these are soft, sort of brownie like in texture, a little sweet in a molasses sort of way (no molasses in the recipe, though), crumbly, and with two servings in a single bar. Fortunately, I placed a bar in a small resealable plastic bag for the airplane trip, so I was able to break off a little piece any time I felt hungry. That bag was a saving grace because when a bar was gone, I replaced it with another and you won't believe how often I pulled out that little bag. I ordered the first box as a gift after I put a little bite into my father's mouth while he was busy enjoying himself at a slot machine and I realized that he needed to keep these on hand for him and Mom to have on the days they go out. For those who have few teeth, these are edible because of the soft texture, yet they provide an enjoyable flavor. Hiker's took these along for a day trip, not worrying about the double serving per package, happily eating the entire bar. As they put it, they felt like they had a brownie along for the trek, much more enjoyable than other bars they'd taken in the past. One sister has enjoyed these on days when she's been unable to break for lunch at work, having them with coffee or tea and some deep breaths. Without eggs, butter or flour, they are terrific, even though Earth Balance has never been my favorite flavor. I'll admit that I was expecting a firmer bar with visible chocolate chips, but after the surprise of a crumbly moist baked good with a not very sweet cocoa flavor, I was hooked. I will gladly try the other varieties when I can find them for a lower cost than over two dollars per bar. A retail value of about thirty dollars is too high for a dozen bars, so I've deducted a star from this review. The one friend who did not love her Bobo's Oat Bar thought it tasted like cardboard and she claimed to have forced it down at work. She loves the SOYJOY bars which I do not care for, so I guess the world is balanced. Rating: 4.0 Product: Nutiva Certified Organic, non-GMO, Vegan Hazelnut Spread with Cocoa, Chia and Flaxseed, Classic Chocolate, 13-ounce Review: I prefer the darkest, most bitter chocolates. Hazelnuts are a favorite, but I love nearly all nuts if they are fresh. Sugar seldom entices me, but watch out if a bag of savory snacks is opened in the house. The nutiva organic hazelnut spread surprised me because the 13 ounce jar is smaller than I imagined it would be. The information on the label appealed to me because the product is organic, non GMO, gluten-free, vegan, and it contains 12 grams of sugar in 2 tablespoons which is more than I will use at a time. The calories in that serving ar 210 with 15 grams of fat. It has no cholesterol. In this spread that contains 40% less sugar than the leading brand which we all know is Nutella, the first ingredient is cane sugar. I'm surprised to read that this may contain traces of milk solids which to me says it would not be vegan, but what do I know? I again was surprised when I opened the jar of classic organic hazelnut spread with cocoa and after prying off the seal, discovered a very thin product which I tried to stir with a very fancy spoon. There was nothing solid at the bottom of the jar, it was all the same thin consistency which reminded me of Hershey's syrup from years ago. I coated the spoon and tasted this product only to discover that I love it. It is not overly sweet and the cocoa comes through clearly with a very strong hazelnut aftertaste. There are no synthetic additives in this fair trade certified product of the United States. It is recommended that this not be refrigerated even after opening the jar which makes it much easier to keep in an office setting inside a desk drawer for quick access. I think it's that good. Rating: 5.0 Product: KIND Bars, Dark Chocolate Nuts & Sea Salt, Gluten Free, 1.4 Ounce Bars, 12 Count Review: I received the package of KIND Nuts & Spices, Dark Chocolate Nuts & Sea Salt, 12-Count Bars in the early evening, so it had been sitting in the shipper's truck all day in the heat. Unfortunately, when I opened the package, each bar was soft because the chocolate was melted and sticking to the wrapper. Regardless, when brought back to a temperature closer to the 80 degree range, I eagerly tore open a cellophane package and carefully peeled it back to try my first KIND bar. With the first bite, I was impressed by the great flavor of fresh nuts and simple dark chocolate, even after exposed to the environmental heat. On the second bite, I was hit with the sea salt, making me think about how smart it is to add sea salt instead of using salted nuts which I sometimes do when making chocolate covered nuts. That creates an inconsistent salt burst which I find appealing. At the small size of 1.4 ounces, it's loaded with fiber from the nuts and chicory root fiber, with relatively little sugars. I personally would seldom consider eating one of these as a meal, but would have it as a filling food when needed in times where a meal could not be obtained. I would supplement this and would not rely on this alone for nutrition! Without further information on what else is included in the diet, I don't understand how the "Yale-Griffin Prevention Research Center indicates that eating 2 KIND bars each day helps maintain your weight through low glycemic, deliciously satisfying, nutritionally rich ingredients that will keep you fuller longer." I think that 400 calories of intake per day is too much for any snack item. With that being said, I now carry one of these bars with me instead of another grain type bar for the times when I absolutely need something to eat or desire a chocolate fix. When I have these, I no longer carry a little bag of nuts either. Because I haven't yet purchased bars which haven't been heated, I can only say that those I've received are not visually appealing and require eating directly from the cellophane because the bits of chocolate fall away. Despite that flaw, these are a great snack item that I will be purchasing and will try other varieties as well. I would like to see these offered at a better value when purchased in a box rather than the current cost at about eighteen dollars for a pound box of twelve bars. Rating: 4.0 Product: Vedica Organics - Organic Turmeric (Curcumin) Spice Powder (3 oz) Review: Seems like everyone is into turmeric these days. You can buy it by the ounce, pound or capsule. I like this particular organic turmeric powder but think it is currently overpriced. It is securely packaged in a sealed plastic jar with a dispensing cap and screw top and since the powder is vibrant in color and I want it to stay that way, I have transferred mine into a glass jar and keep it in a cabinet. The powder tastes very good and blends well with other spices for assorted curry blends. There are currently a number of organic turmeric powders available and this one is fine. Vedica Organics provided a sample for review at an extremely reduced cost. Product:
La Tourangelle Roasted Walnut Oil 16.9 Fl. Oz., All-Natural, Artisanal, Great for Salads, Grilled Fish and Meat, or Pasta
Review:
I have used this oil for salad dressings and to drizzle over veggies instead of butter. I can't say that is adds flavor, but it is definitely more healthy to use than other oils. This particular oil should not be used for frying as it does not have a high heat tolerance. I have used it in baked recipes and it does well. I have also bought the Special Edition Walnut oil directly from the company. It is a lot more expensive, but it does have a definite nutty flavor. I have also used the Special Edition on veggies, and it does add a good nutty flavor.

I have used a number of the La Tourangelle oils and have not been disappointed with any of them. I have completely eliminated the use of non-nut oils to improve the quality of fats that we eat. When buying these nut oils, it is important to pay attention to which can be used with low heat or medium to high heat. It is also important to note which require refrigeration after opening - some do and some don't. To be on the safe side, I refrigerate all of them after opening. I think it helps to keep them fresher.

Although some of the Amazon reviews dock stars for dented cans, this is not fair to the product, nor does it deteriorate or affect the quality of the product. This is a 5 star product and reviews should not reflect Amazon's shipping practices.

La Tourangelle Roasted Hazelnut Oil 8.45 Fl. Oz, All-Natural, Artisanal, Great for Salads, Fruit, Fish, Marinades or Vegetables
Review:
This one of the many La Tourangelle oils that I use. I particularly like this one because it can be used at higher temperatures. I haven't use vegetable or canola oils for a very long time, and prefer to use the healthier nuts oils for all of my cooking. This, and other, nut oils are used exclusively for all frying and baking. I substitute nut oils for oils used in all of my recipes, and the work wonderfully. In fact, my bread recipes seem to work better using these oils.

Although nut oils still include fats, they are healthy fats, and do not have a negative effect on cholesterol or weight gain. Your body needs fats to function, but healthy fats are more beneficial.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Frontier Garlic Powder, 16 Ounce Bags (Pack of 2) 
Review:
I use a lot of garlic powder, and I have found that the garlic powder purchased from the store is truly a powder. It is hard to mix with other ingredient, especially liquid, and tends to clump. I would describe this garlic powder as more of a fine granulated garlic. The smell is much more like fresh garlic. I can't say that I save money buying this garlic powder as 2 lbs. in the store actually costs a bit less in this area. The whole idea of using herbs and spices is to enhance flavor and aroma, and this garlic powder is the best for that. I would rather pay a little more to accomplish the desired results in dishes that I make. I like that Amazon is offering this garlic and saving me a trip to the store. I bought shaker bottles from Amazon, and filled one with this garlic powder. The rest of it went into the freezer to keep it fresher for longer.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Red Quinoa, 25 Lb Bag
Review:
For the last couple of years, we have been using the pearl, or white, quinoa for its health value because reviews have described the flavor of red quinoa as being strong. I mistakenly assumed that strong would not be good. More recently, I tried a couple of small bags of the red quinoa to see if we liked it. All I can say is "Wow". The difference is like night and day. The white quinoa has little flavor and needs additives to have any at all. When eating it, it doesn't stay together at all. All of the little, teensy pieces can be difficult to keep together without some sort of sauce or a spoon. In contrast, the red quinoa, has a crunchy texture, and a nutty flavor. Granted, I still add garlic and onion powders in addition to other spices when I cook it, but we love the texture and the color. I did rinse this quinoa a couple of times before soaking just to make sure there weren't any hulls or dust in it. I think it's better to do this than take a chance it has been cleaned enough. I did find it to be clean, and little, if anything, rinsed out of it. I would highly recommend this quinoa to anyone that has not yet tried the red variety and to those that have. I still also use the pearl quinoa as an additive for pot roast, stews, and other things that I only want the nutritive value without the crunch, but the red variety is our alternative to rice or potatoes.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Frontier Bulk Whole Certified Organic Mustard Seed, Brown, 1 lb
Review:
I bought both this mustard seed and the yellow mustard seed. The brown mustard seed is much harder to find locally. I grind this seed with the yellow mustard seed to make homemade Dijon mustard. Making homemade mustard is so easy, and doesn't compare to anything you would buy in the store. My recipe for Dijon mustard is:
Ingredients:
* 1/2 cup dry white wine
* 1/2 cup white wine vinegar
* 1/4 cup brown mustard seeds (about 1 1/2 oz.)
* 1/4 cup yellow mustard seeds (about 1 1/2 oz.)
* 3 garlic cloves, minced
* 1/2 tsp. kosher salt
Directions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a small glass bowl, stir and cover tightly. Let sit at room temperature for 2 days.
2. Transfer to a blender and blend until the desired consistency. Keep in mind that it's not possible for this mustard to reach a completely smooth consistency. Store tightly covered in the refrigerator for up to 3 months.

This mustard seems to increase potency as it is stored. It tastes more like a horseradish mustard over time.

Product:
Skippy Reduced Fat Creamy Peanut Butter Spread, 16.3 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
The Skippy Reduced Fat Creamy Peanut Butter is still pretty good stuff. It has a nice, smooth texture, just like the regular peanut butter. But there is a distinct difference in taste. The truth is that the regular peanut butter has a richer taste, one in which the peanutty flavor comes through more distinctly. So, if you're on a diet or must watch your fat intake, you'll want to buy the reduced fat variety. But if you're sensitive to the taste, buy the regular.

The taste issue doesn't seem to be a problem of you're baking. I've made peanut butter cookies with both the regular and the reduced fat, and I can't tell the difference in the taste of the cookies.

And the milk chocolate shell has a smooth texture and a pleasant taste that perfectly complements the peanut butter. These are a truly wonderful product.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

Product:
Planters Cashews in Milk Chocolate, 3.5-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 12)
Review:
I bought this 9-ounce can of Planter Cashews (halves and pieces) at my local Grocery store. Good product. The taste is excellent, although a bit too salty for me. They were nice and fresh and tasty and didn't last nearly long enough. Next time it will be a bigger size package.

Halves and pieces. Hmmmm. Where and how do they get all the broken cashews? I couldn't find a single non-broken one. Oh well, I guess that's truth in labeling. But, how do they all get broken? Is there someone in charge of breaking them as they come down the production line? If they're accidentally broken and won't sell for as much as the non-broken ones, why isn't the price cheaper? Oh well, does it really matter? Once they're in my mouth, all will get broken.

Gary Peterson
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Hampton Farms Salted & Roasted In-shell Peanuts * Large Bag * Net Wt. 80 Oz (5 Lbs.)
Review:
I enjoy late night snacking while reading or watching TV. I'm on a diet emphasizing cutting out as much sugar as possible and peanuts fit the bill with less than one gram per serving.. By the way, my bag is only 12 ounces and is branded with the "San Diego Padres Baseball Club" imprinted on the label. Probably a local variant. Same salted in the shell nuts. Different size bag. Same Hampton Farms logo. Maybe every city large enough to have a baseball club has it's own variant. Interesting way to sell more nuts, I suppose. In any case, they're quite good nuts. Mine seemed a little stale (not a problem) and I would have preferred them to be a little saltier. My last bag of peanuts was a five-pound bag of Hoodies that was stale to the point of inedible. These are good. I'll buy them again.

Gary Peterson
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Crunchmaster Artisan Four Cheese Rice Cracker, 3.5-Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I picked up these Crunchmaster Rice (Artisan Four Cheese) Crackers at a nearby Costco Store. They looked good, and a lady gave me one to taste. They were good. Into the cart went a six package box. They're the same as these, only packed together in a slightly different way.

The crackers are excellent. They're real crunchy, way moreso than most crackers and they have the faint taste and smell of cheese. They're lightly salted and have a very low fat content. I enjoy them by themselves as snacks, or I eat them with smoked oysters or sardines as a light lunch. Or, I have them with a variety of spreads. They're pretty versatile, and delicious I should add.

Gary Peterson
Rating:
5.0
Product:
NongShim Bowl Noodle Soup, Spicy Chicken, 3.03 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
This afternoon I had a Nongshim Bowl Noodle Soup of the Spicy Chicken variety. It's a quick lunch (four minutes) and quite tasty. My only gripes would be that it's too high in sodium, a complaint shared by almost all noodle bowls, and that it doesn't have enough protein for a good meal. I can easily add the latter. I also had a big Delicious Apple to supply something fresh and something with a lot of fiber. Altogether, the combination made a good lunch, and it was quick and easy.

Gary Peterson
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Amy's Organic Chili, Medium Black Bean, 14.7 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
Some time ago, I tried the Amy's Spicy Organic Chili and liked it very much. So, when I was back at the nearby Fresh and Easy store and looking over the chili, I spotted the Amy's Medium Organic Chili. Into the cart a can went. Well, I like this one too and it's actually a bit zesty. I thought I'd add some Frank's Hot Sauce if it wasn't tasty enough, but it turned out that there was no need. This is good stuff. It's meatless, but has beans, soybeans and tofu so the protein content is actually fairly high but the fat content is rather low. If I had any criticism, i night be that the sodium content is too high. But, all in all, it's a rather good chili. Given the choice, I think I'd slightly prefer the spicy variety.

Gary Peterson
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Amy's Organic Chili, Medium Black Bean, 14.7 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
My nearby Fresh and Easy Neighborhood Market carries a lot of gourmet and health-related items and I like to try them. One I picked up recently was Amy's Organic Chili. I bought both the regular and the spicy varieties and I'm reviewing the spicy one here. It's quite good for a canned chili. I'd say it's at least as good as any other canned brand I've ever tried. Plus it's fairly low in fat and seems to lack that oily topping I associate with canned chili. I't's a little higher in sodium than I'd like, but not by much. The taste is quite good. It's somewhat zesty but I'd rate the spicyness as mild. The meat is ground and occurs as tittle interspersed grains rather than larger chunks. Of course, it's organic. I've always liked chili and this is a good one that I can keep stashed in my pantry. Amy's is a good brand and I'm very satisfied.

Gsry Peterson
Rating:
5.0
Product:
David Seeds Pumpkin Seeds, 5-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
If you're ever looking for a light snack to accompany watching television, a ball game or something like that, try David Pumpkin Seeds. They're lightly roasted, lightly salted and all natural. And they're delicious!

Some people eat the entire seed, but I only eat the kernels. Thus, I have to crack each seed, extract the kernel and dispose of the hulls. This process can be somewhat time consuming, but like everything else, you get better and better with practice. Still, some people would regard this as a negative, but I would regard it as a positive. I can sometimes spend all evening consuming a delicious snack and watching TV and consume less than a single serving which amounts to 280 calories. Plus, seeds and nuts carry a heavy caloric load in general, to be sure, but they also carry a lot of vitamins, minerals, unsaturated vegetable fat and fiber. They may have calories, but they aren't empty calories! I worry a little about the salt content, but the David seeds are only lightly salted and I don't consume the entire seed.

These David Pumpkin Seeds are a fine light snack. Prepare to get addicted. I'll bet you can't eat just one, or one pack. They can be a little hard to find, but finding large quantities online is easy. Good snacking!

Gary Peterson

5.0

Rating: 5.0 Product: Thai Kitchen Coconut Milk, 13.66 fl oz (Pack of 12) Review: This brand does make a superior coconut milk, but Amazon buyers are always on the lookout for a good deal. The only difference between this Lite Coconut Milk and Thai Kitchen Pure Coconut Milk, 13.66-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12) is water! That being said, stretch your dollar and buy the regular version. To cut calories and fat, add the water yourself. Rating: 2.0 Product: CLIF MOJO - Sweet and Salty Trail Mix Bar - Dark Chocolate Almond Coconut - (1.6 Ounce Snack Bar, 12 Count) Review: I love the salty zip that seems inherent to most Mojo bars; this one doesn't have it. But, that's okay! What is does have is almonds, chocolate and coconut, along with the signature soy rice crisps. It is delicious and fairly hearty, probably due to the 8 grams of protein. One of the perks of being a buyer at a grocery store is getting free samples like this! The only downfall is having to buy them after getting hooked by the taste. Rating: 5.0 Product: Zevia All Natural Soda, Grape, 12-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24) Review: I grew up in an exclusively diet cola home. I got to nearly hate diet soda... uhg.. Even now, I would rather drink water to "real" OR diet soda. I loved to sneak sugary grape soda as a child, however. Correct me if I'm wrong, but I don't think diet grape soda even existed when I was a youngster. This stuff takes me back to the forbidden treat of my past. It even smells the same. If you grew up, like me, loving grape soda, try this product. You won't be disappointed! Rating: 5.0 Product: Spectrum Naturals Canola Mayonnaise, 11.25 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: I often come across a product that repels me. Then, occasionally, my taste buds change direction to the point of craving the aforementioned "repulsion." The first time I can remember this phenomenon was with Kombucha. I hated the vinegary bite, but kept drinking the beverage because of its health benefits. Now, I have to ration the stuff to protect my wallet. More recently, I fell into the same trap with this mayo. On first try, I felt like the product simply tasted "wrong." I disliked it, but I'm thrifty; I didn't toss it in the trash. By the 3rd or 4th try, my brain had accepted that this tasted different. I began to appreciate the merits the flavor does have. The texture is different, too. Most mayonnaise seems more whipped (with air in it). This is smoother and creamier. Actually, more like the food prep mayo I used to use when I worked in a deli. I guess another comparison would be with orange drinks. If you grew up on SunnyD Sunny Delight , Orange, 48-Ounce Single Serve Bottles (Pack of 8), than fresh squeezed orange juice would seem completely off the mark. You would, however, come around eventually. Rating: 5.0 Product: Luna Bars, Chocolate Peppermint Stick, 1.69-Ounce Bars (Pack of 15) Review: Pretty standard fare for a Luna Bar, which is pretty much a good thing. Soy crisps laden with pretzel pieces, peanuts, peanut butter smears and peanut butter chips; there is a peanut butter-y sort of candy coating on the bottom portion. If only there were dark chocolate chips or pieces tossed in the mix... I guess I'm just a chocoholic, but the Luna Bar Chocolate Dipped Coconut, 25.4-Ounce, 15-Bars really raised the bar on Luna products for me. All in all, a pretty tasty treat! prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Lindt Excellence Bar, 70% Cocoa Smooth Dark Chocolate, Gluten Free, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: I am a huge fan of coconut. This candy bar is one of my favorite coconut treats. It is not disgustingly sweet, rather it has a delicate coconut flavor. Normally, I dislike white chocolate but with the coconut, this candy bar is amazing. The consistency and intensity of the bar is not like a mounds bar. This is an actual candy bar with no filling. The coconut flavor is melded with the chocolate. The bar is fairly large. I typically take three to four days to eat one bar - the restraint is hard, but at 240 calories a serving restraint is necessary. Flecks of this bar are great on ice cream but also in thicker, warmer beverages. Rating: 5.0 Product: Nature's Path Organic Chewy Granola Bars, Sunny Hemp Plus, 7.4 Ounce Box (Pack of 6) Review: I love this bar and that is probably because I love any treat that combines peanuts and chocolate. I don't consider this a health bar. This has a good amount of sugar and a good amount of fat. I eat them because they are a great cheat treat. When I eat well all day, I look forward to this soft but chewy bar that has real peanuts and what seems to be real chocolate (I detest bars that proclaim to have real chocolate but instead incorporate a fake chocolaty substance). What I like about this bar: 1) The taste - Wow! For a granola bar the taste is phenomenal. The picture on the box does not lie. You can see peanuts and oats and the chocolate topping tastes awesome. The texture of the oats/nuts melds well with the oats and nuts. 2) Portable and easy to pack - If you try to stay aware of your daily calorie intake, it is always great to have easy to carry snacks with their calories clearly labeled. Who has time to count out the exact number of pretzels that comprise 150 calories? That is part of the appeal of a granola bar. You've got a 150 calorie food item that can be placed in a purse or coat pocket and you are out the door. 3) The company has made a conscious effort to reduce packaging in order to reduce impact on the environment. The box is made of 100% recycled materials. What is questionable about this bar: 1) This is a snack/treat bar and nothing else - This is not a healthful nutrition bar. The product packaging does not necessarily say this is healthful. It does use the words "organic goodness" and boasts "9 grams of whole grains". These notations may make some think this is a really healthy treat. But it's not. The bar has low fiber (2g) and pretty high sugar for a 150 calorie bar (11 grams). 2)If you use snacks to hold you over, you probably should find a snack with at least 4 grams of fiber. The 2 gram bar is not going to tide you over very long. If you feed these to your kids, there is a good likelihood they will like them. They are pretty sweet. But again with the sugar, what else are you giving your kids during the day? Four grams of sugar is equivalent to 1 teaspoon of sugar. So you have about 2 and 3/4 teaspoons in this bar. With everything else your kids consume during the day, (chocolate milk? orange juice? sandwich with jam?), the sugar in this bar may not be worth it to you. Kids usually need 1200 to 1700 calories a day. While there is no prescribed amount of sugar for a kid during the day, I have read that the calories from added sugar should be limited to 10% which, on the low end, would translate to 7 teaspoons of sugar and 11 teaspoons on the high end. Summary: Nature's Path has created a very tasty granola bar with quality ingredients. Props to the company for not saying this was a health or nutrition bar on the box. I am reviewing this as a treat bar and as a treat, it is a delicious option. If it were being reviewed for health, I would not be able to give it four stars as it has high sugar, high fat and low fiber. Don't expect it to hold you over for hours but do expect it to satisfy your sweet tooth. These granola bars are made in the United States. Rating: 4.0 Product: Banana Nut Cheerios Cereal, 10.9 Ounce (Pack of 4) Review: I love plain cheerios but sometimes a little cheerio diversity is called for. The banana nut flavor is not overly sweet and there is a distinctive banana taste, almost a slightly burnt banana taste. I love pairing a bowl of these cheerios with so delicious coconut milk and sliced banana pieces. The combination of the three easily keep me satiated from breakfast until lunch. I occasionally mix this banana nut flavor with chocolate cheerios for an even sweeter, exceptional treat. While I do not find the banana nut flavor to be overly sweet, one should not overlook that sugar is the second ingredient for this food and, the sugar content is relatively high -- especially for frequent use by children. Four grams of sugar is equivalent to 1 teaspoon of sugar. So you have about 2 and 1/4 teaspoons in a single 3/4 cup serving of banana nut cheerios. With everything else your kids consume during the day, (chocolate milk? orange juice? sandwich with jam?), the sugar in this cereal may be high for frequent consumption. Kids usually need 1200 to 1700 calories a day. While there is no prescribed amount of sugar for a kid during the day, I have read that the calories from added sugar should be limited to 10% which, on the low end, would translate to 7 teaspoons of sugar and 11 teaspoons on the high end. If you child is getting 2 and 1/4 teaspoons with this cereal, your child has consumed a fair amount of sugar for the morning. When paired with fresh bananas, this cereal can be filling but if limiting sugar for your kids (or your own meals), you might want to use sparingly. Rating: 4.0 Product: Wolfgang Puck Organic Signature Butternut Squash Soup, 14.5 oz. (Pack of 12) Review: This is a good soup -- there is no doubt. The corn, carrots and potatoes are plentiful (no skimping on ingredients in the cans I've tried). Together, the ingredients make a thick and hearty soup that is perfect for a cold winter day. I did not feel the need to add salt -- the corn is not bland in flavor and the soup already has a lot of sodium. Moreover, I felt no need to add crackers. The soup can hold its own. Some posters have noted that this soup has a high level of fat. It does -- 13g per one cup serving. Fat, of course, is not bad in moderation. In my quest for the perfect corn soup, however, I have found an alternative option. It is worth noting here for those who may have particular dietary considerations. Imagine foods makes an organic sweet corn soup that has 3g of fat per 1 cup serving. The soup comes in a boxed container and is just a corn base. There are no special flavorings. As a base, it is a good corn soup but when you add several cups of frozen corn kernels (and cooked potatoes if you have the time and desire), you can have a soup just as hearty and delicious as Wolfgang Pucks but with less fat and calories. This option does require about five minutes more of your time (if only adding frozen corn). Wolfgang Puck's soup is quick -- in two minutes you have a steaming bowl of great corn soup and you don't have to wait for kernels to thaw. If you are not looking closely at fat (or eat fat it in moderation) and want something quick, this soup is great. If you are looking for a healthy alternative, I would take a little more time and build a hearty soup using the organic sweet corn soup from Imagine. Rating: 4.0 Product: Pacific Natural Foods All Natural Chipotle Sweet Potato Soup, 17 Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12) Review: First, I typically love products produced by Pacific Natural Foods. This was not a winner in my book. The smell was the first thing that turned me off. I had to wait five minutes to even try the soup because it smelled so awful. When I tasted it, the spices used were overpowering and it was difficult to taste any sweet potato. What I could taste reminded me of curry and it seems like the soup could be married well with rice. Unfortunately as the soup is now, it would be too runny to pour over rice. I suppose a person could add some sweet potato and regular potatoes to make it thicker. I drowned the soup with saltines and it was edible but not enjoyable. I'm giving it two stars because I think with modifications it could be used for different non-soup purposes. Better luck next time Pacific. Rating: 2.0 Product: Artisana Macadamia/Cashew Butter (100% Organic), 8-Ounce Packages (Pack of 2) Review: After trying Artisana's Cacao Bliss, I wanted to sample some of the manufacturer's other products. I really enjoy macademia nuts and thought the Macadamia with Cashews butter would be a good product to try. This product is made with just two ingredients -- macadamias and cashews -- and I can say that this product demonstrates what a healthy, good for you food should taste like. Unlike Cacao Bliss, which is a solid product at room temperature, the macadamia cashew butter is easily retrieved from the container. There was some oil separation but after a little stirring, one can take a butter knife and quickly spread the substance on a piece of toast or apple slices; the product is incredibly smooth out of the jar. When looking at the butter, you will see little pieces of nuts which makes this product product have some texture. This macadamia cashew butter is not as chunky as most chunky peanut butters; the chunks in this product are much finer. I found the flavor to be very much influenced by the raw cashews and actually considered my jar to be more of a cashew butter than a macadamia butter. It is recommended that this product be refrigerated for a longer life. While not noted explicitly on the product's label, I could see nothing that would contradict my belief that this is a vegan product. There is no milk, honey, eggs or other animal-based substances that go into the formulation of this product. According to the product packaging, this product is "made in a facility that processes tree nuts and soy, but does not process peanuts, gluten, dairy, cholesterol or GMO's." This is my second good experience with Artisana products. For holiday gift giving, I'm definitely going to be packaging several of Artisana's products in gift baskets. They are tasty, natural and unique. A note on another place to buy this product, iherb.com. I turn to iherb with frequency to purchase Artisana products. The site has free shipping over a certain threshold and offers thousands upon thousands of natural and organic food products. If interested in trying iherb, you can use my code LEK375 for a five or ten dollar discount depending on order size. This product is made in the United States Rating: 4.0 Product: Crystal Light Drink Mix - MARGARITA, 1.62 oz. (Pack of 6) Review: My husband and I drink a good amount of Crystal Light powdered beverages. I was initially leery of purchasing this particular flavor but after trying Crystal Light Moctails Mojito, 1.41-Ounce (Pack of 4) and finding it great, I thought I would give this one a try. In terms of flavor, I find this acceptable. It tastes like a very mild margarita (without alcohol). It even smells like a margarita. While I think Crystal Light has done a good job imitating a margarita, it is not my favorite Crystal Light product. If you live near a Meijer, you can buy a five pack canister of the Margarita drink mix (as well as Crystal Light Mocktails Appletini, 1.69-Ounce (Pack of 4) and Crystal Light Moctails Mojito, 1.41-Ounce (Pack of 4)) for about 2.79. If you recycle your plastics, be aware that Crystal Light sells its product in a #5 container. Unless you live in a relatively progressive place, #5 plastics are typically very difficult to recycle. Whole Foods engages in a recycling initiative to collect #5 plastics but if you don't live near one and you care about recycling, these can be a challenging item to deal with. At the end of the day, this is a beverage that I would drink again but I don't know if I would purchase it if some of my other Crystal Light favorites were available like Crystal Light Sunrise Ruby Red Grapefruit, 3.4-Ounce Unit (Pack of 6) and Crystal Light Moctails Mojito, 1.41-Ounce (Pack of 4). The combination of pecan and almond butter is a perfect blend of nutty and sweet, and the brownie batter flavor is rich and decadent.  It's the perfect spread for toast, crackers, or even just a spoon!  I love that it's unroasted, so it has a more natural flavor.  It's also a great source of protein and healthy fats, which is a bonus.  I'm definitely going

You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Oreo Red Velvet Sandwich Cookies, 10.7 Ounce
Review:
I never purchase cookies--it's just my husband and I, and we don't need the temptation--but I do love Oreos, and I also love red velvet cake, so I couldn't resist trying this new release.  Unfortunately, the flavor was extremely disappointing.  First of all, the cookie part didn't really taste like anything.  Red velvet, like Devil's food, is a type of CHOCOLATE, and there was very little chocolate flavor in these cookies.  Next, the filling was describe on the package as "cream cheese flavored creme."  It tasted nothing at all like the unique flavor of sweetened cream cheese, which is tangy without being overly sweet; instead, this filling was just a super-sweet cream.  Honestly if I was going to splurge on something, I wish I had just purchased regular Oreos, because these were not worth it at all.  I hope my co-workers like them, because they will be getting the leftovers.  Although they are edible as a sweet, cream-filled store-bought cookie, I certainly don't recommend these as a red velvet treat.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
HERSHEY'S Nuggets Holiday Chocolate Candy, Milk Chocolate w/Toffee & Almonds, 60 Ounce Bulk Bag
Review:
I am usually someone who prefers dark chocolate--I like the richness of the dark chocolate, and I find some milk chocolates too artificial tasting.  This Hershey variety is definitely an exception.  It is labelled "Extra Creamy" milk chocolate, and it's true--although sweeter than dark chocolate, these nuggets are definitely more creamy than the standard milk chocolate.  The little toffee bits--along with the crushed almonds--add a delicious bit of extra sweetness and crunch.

Four of these little nuggets makes a single serving, which is a reasonable amount of calories at 200, but a bit high in fat, carbs, and sugar for me (13g, 21g, and 20g, respectively).  So, I just eat two nuggets at a time for a yummy little 100 calorie treat.  If you enjoy a toffee (or caramel, since I think it's quite similar) flavor, I would definitley recommend these nuggets and this generous 60-ounce bag.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
ZonePerfect Nutrition Snack Bars, Chocolate Almond Raisin. 1.76 oz, (12 Count)
Review:
I am always looking for nutrition snack bars that will help me refuel after workouts, curb between meal hunger pangs, and hopefully, taste great, too!  I was encourged by the nutritional profile of the Zone Perfect bar, and I decided to give the Fudge Graham variety a try.  This bar comes in at 210 calories, with 7 grams of fat (4 saturated, 0 trans), 21 grams carbs, 1 gram fiber, and an excellent 16 grams protein.  The Fudge Gramam flavor has a nice texture--sort of like a Rice Crispie treat--and is covered in a fudge coating, but this had a bit of an artificial taste to me.  In addition, I didn't detect any graham flavor, which I found disappointing.  The bar did taste good, but I've also had better (the Pria Complete Peanut Butter Crunch are really delicious!), and I would've liked to see more fiber as well.  Overall, this is not a bad choice, but keep in mind that there may be better options available.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Pressed by KIND Fruit Bars, Mango Apple Chia, No Sugar Added, Gluten Free, 1.2oz, 12 Count
Review:
I thought these bars would be a good way to help me get in more fruit and vegetable servings--I like pineapple, bananas, kale, and spinach, so win-win, right?  Well, in reality, not so much.  The first thing that you notice upon opening these bars is that not only do they look like molded spinach, but also they SMELL very strongly of spinach, too.  Now, as I said, I LIKE spinach, and normally, I don't mind the scent of it at all.  However, it is much different in bar form!  The bar does taste significantly fruity, so if I can sort of hold my breath and get past the smell, I can manage to eat it, although obviously, this is not ideal.  The other issue I have with these bars is that the spinach/kale gets stuck between your teeth VERY easily, even worse than eating the fresh version of this items.  So in the end, these bars are really NOT worth it to me, which is too bad, as they could have been a nutritious, convenient snack.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Nature Valley Chewy Granola Bars, Vanilla Yogurt, 1.2 oz, 6-Count Boxes (Pack of 12)
Review:
I wasn't sure if I would like these granola bars; although I like yogurt, I didn't really like the idea of a yogurt coating.  However, my niece's love of the bars encouraged me to try them for myself, and I was pleasantly surprised to discover that they are delicious!  The granola part is sweet and chewy, and the additional sweetness of the yogurt is a perfect compliment.  I've tried all the flavors but like the vanilla the best, as the others were a bit TOO sweet for my liking.  If you are a fan of granola bars and yogurt, you are likely to enjoy this winning combination.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Eat. Think. Smile. Baked Nutrition Bar, Orange Cranberry, 1.8-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12)
Review:
I was excited to try this product, as I usually have bars for breakfast, but it is getting harder to find ones that have good nutritional profiles in breakfast-appropriate (i.e., non-chocolate) flavors.  I love cranberry, so this bar seemed nearly perfect, especially given that I checked out the nutritional content prior to ordering.  At 4 grams, the amount of protein was a bit low for my liking, but the bar made up for this by being low in both sugar (12 grams) and saturated fat (1 gram) while being very high in fiber (7 grams).

The texture of this bar is the first thing that struck me as a bit odd.  Although it is moist (i.e., as opposed to hard and crunchy), it is not chewy; in fact, it breaks apart easily and is a bit on the crumbly side.  (I suppose it is somewhat similar to a a CLIF brand bar.)  The taste, however, was quite disappointing:  rather than the tart taste of cranberry or the sweetness of orange, I detected only a bitter flavor.  It tasted almost as if the bar had been flavored with the bitter rind of the orange.  There did seem to be little fruit pieces in the bar that may have been cranberry, but unfortunately, the unpleasant bitterness overpowered everything else.

I thought the first bar that I tried was just okay, but the second one seemed worse, and now I'm afraid I might have to toss the whole box (which I HATE to do--I hate being wasteful, so I might try dipping them in yogurt or something just to get through them).  Perhaps another flavor by this brand would be better, but unfortunately, I can't recommend these.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
FISHER Snack Honey Roasted Peanuts, Golden Roast, 14 oz
Review:
I consider nuts one of the most healthy things you can eat--I keep them on hand for snacks, salads, meal throw-ins, whatever!  I typically buy store brand unsalted peanuts, so I was interested to see how these low-salt peanuts from Fisher would compare.  The combination of dry roasting and sea salt gives these nuts an almost seasoned taste--they are delicious!  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them.
Rating:
5.0

golds.output: I'm really impressed with Mavuno Harvest Fair Trade Organic Dried Fruit!  It's so convenient to have a snack that's both delicious and ethically sourced.  The banana flavor is perfectly balanced, not too sweet or artificial tasting.  I love that it's a good source of potassium and fiber, and it's a great alternative to sugary snacks.  I've been enjoying it as a midday pick-me-up or a healthy addition to my yogurt.  I'm definitely going to buy this again!

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Natural Nectar Cracklebred, Sun Dried Tomato and Oregano, Gluten Free, 3.5-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I love these crackers!  I'm new to gluten free, and have not tried many gluten free products. I don't know how these compare to other gluten free crackers.  But I do know that they are as good or better than any regular cracker I've tried.  Cracklebred crackers are light and airy, but very crispy.  They are a little delicate but still hold up under a gentle spread of hummus.  This variety is flavored with sun dried tomato and oregano, but I honestly did not pick up on those flavors.  I thought they tasted slightly savory, but I still enjoyed them with a spread of blueberry jam.  Each cracker contains just 17 calories so they are guilt free.  Yum :)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
ORCHARD VALLEY HARVEST Cranberry Almond Cashew Trail Mix, Non-GMO, No Artificial Ingredients, 1 oz (Pack of 8)
Review:
I like the mix of fruits and nuts in this package of Orchard Valley Harvest mix. The walnuts, almonds, pistachios, and cranberries all taste very fresh. The package that I received in January expires in November of the same year. Each packet holds 1 ounce of snacks and it's just enough to hit the spot as a snack. Very lightly salted with sea salt, each packet contains just 15mg of sodium.

I immediately noticed that the contents of each packet are not consistent with each other. Every package contains at least one piece of the variety. The amount of pistachios and almonds varies widely. In half of the 8 packets, there was only 1 pistachio. Most of the remaining packets had 2 pistachios, although one package had 5 of the little green nuts. Almonds also varied from 2 to 5 nuts. Some packages had a higher ratio of cranberries to nuts. I attached 2 images showing 2 different opened packages.

The cranberries are sweetened with sugar, not HFCS, and also contain a small amount of expeller pressed sunflower oil to keep them soft. There is additional oil added to the mixture, but I'm not sure why. Maybe to keep the nuts from drying out? Sunflower oil is not a good source of ALA, containing only 1% ALA. Regardless, there isn't enough to make my hands feel too oily.

Each package contains about half of your daily recommended amount of alpha linolenic acid (ALA) not to be confused with the other ALA, alpha lipoic acid. This Omega 3 fatty acid is found in nuts and other plant foods.

Overall, I really like this snack! It's satisfying and tastes great, and I know that I'm not eating something I shouldn't. I would easily add these to my shopping list.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Crunchy Coconut Granola, 18 Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
I bought this because I love coconut, and the ingredient label looked simple and healthy compared to most other brands of granola.  I was glad that I tried this product and really love it.  The coconut flavor is very delicate, though, it was not as intense as I had hoped.  Still, the flavor is very good.  It does contain sugar, but the 4 grams of sugar per serving is low compared to other granola brands.  I also appreciate that this is not a hard granola, so it's easy to eat.  It's just crispy enough so that it holds up under milk.  I like it with Almond Breeze brand coconut milk.  Delicious!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Rhythm Superfoods Kale Chips, Variety Pack, Original/Zesty Nacho/Kool Ranch/Mango Habanero, Organic and Non-GMO, 2 Oz (Pack of 4), Vegan/Gluten-Free Superfood Snacks
Review:
I already love kale chips, and usually make them from scratch. These are very different in texture, but I really did enjoy them. This is the first time that I've tasted a flavored kale chip, and I love them. I brought the package to work and we shared it, and everyone that tried these kool ranch kale chips liked them, even Miss Picky. The bag didn't last long! They were crispy and tasty, and were not too salty. They only contain 220mg sodium per serving (half a bag) which surprised me since similar products usually contain more. The serving contains 140 calories and 6 grams of protein. Kale is loaded with vitamins, so it's a sneaky way to slip in some nutrients.  Although I loved the flavor, I was less than enthused about the clumps of kale chips that were stuck together due to the seasoning. They were tasty, but it was easy to get greedy with the clumps and leave the little bits and pieces for my coworkers to taste. The next time I get these kale chips, I'll try adding the leftover crumbs to a salad to add flavor to my lunch. And there will be a next time! I'll still make plain kale chips from scratch, but I can't make flavored chips to taste like this.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Colavita Instant Polenta Cornmeal, 16 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
This polenta is delicious! It really does cook up properly in just 5 minutes. It has good flavor and the texture is good. I always cook it with a little less water, then pour it into a pan to make polenta squares. I can grill them or saute in a pan. They freeze well, so I can pull out just enough for dinner. This was my first experience with a quick cooking polenta. I have always taken the time to make old fashioned polenta, and it is worth the effort. But for an instant product, the Colavita polenta works out very well.

Someone else mentioned that this polenta is non-GMO, but the box didn't reflect that. I contacted the company and verified that it is indeed non-GMO, which makes it an even better choice for many people.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Rishi Tea Organic Black Tea, Earl Grey Loose Tea, 3.3-Ounce Tin (Pack of 3)
Review:
Earl Grey Tea can be overwhelming. Generally, when an Earl Grey calls itself "Bold", they aren't joking. Personally, if there is too much bergamot oil in the tea, it is too overpowering for me to drink. I like to drink an aromatic tea, not a cup of perfume. The Rishi Earl Grey tea is described as "bold and sweetly smooth with an enlivening aroma of bergamot citrus." I think that sums it up very well. I was a little concerned when I popped the lid on the tin, as the scent was very powerful.  However, it is a pleasant smelling tea that does not overwhelm me when the cup reaches the mouth. I can taste a high quality, rich black tea with sweet and lightly citrus tones.

I also feel good about drinking this tea because it is a Fair Trade Certified tea that is shade grown from heirloom tea trees. It's organic as well as Kosher. Rishi also says this tea can be steeped multiple times, so this tea is also very economical. I'll definitely be trying more Rishi teas.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nutiva Organic Coconut Flour, 4 Pound
Review:
I really enjoy Nutiva coconut flour. It always smells fresh and it tastes wonderful.  I had been buying it in 3 pound bags that were clear plastic and did not zip close. I had to transfer them to containers that blocked the light. I like the new package since it blocks light and helps keep it fresh. The zipper was a little tricky to close, but it works.  I mainly use this coconut flour in morning smoothies to add texture and a big boost of fiber. I've used other brands that had a finer texture, but this one is fine for my purposes and it's often more affordable than others. It can be used in baking if you use it as a substitute for a small amount of the grain flour in your recipe, but it doesn't stand alone as a replacement. I've bought this several times and hope to continue using it in the future.  FYI the bag I just received has an expiration date of one year away.
Rating:
5.0

Product:
Heinz 57 Sauce, 20-Ounce Squeeze Bottle (Pack of 4)
Review:
I have liked this sauce for as long as I can remember. I use it on steaks, chops, chicken and even to eat French fries or tater tots. I even use it as a basting sauce for sausages or meat on the grill. I like some steaks plain but this sauce just adds zing to any kind of meat.

Sometimes I mix in some Frank's Red Hot sauce to even make it hotter to use when grilling out. It is also a great addition to barbeque wings mixed with Buffalo Sauce. We also pressure cook pork or beef and shred it for pulled meat sandwiches and this flavor just sets it off.

* Ribs
* Sausage
* Steaks
* Shrimp
* Hamburger for tacos
* Hamburger sandwiches
* French fries, onion rings or tater tots
* Chicken wings
* It has 100's of uses

It does contain a lot of salt at 200 mg and 8% of your daily allotment for just one tablespoon. It also has 4 grams of sugar. I love it as my favorite steak sauce and I recommend it to you.

Product:
Starbucks Pike's Place Kcups-Medium Roast, 0.44 oz, 16 ct
Review:
Even though this is a medium roast blend of coffee it has the traditional rich, bold and full bodied Starbuck's flavor and aroma.  I drink my coffee with sweet and low and creamer in it and a cup of this coffee is tasty and satisfying.  I blend the large cup serving of 9.5 ounces and it is just the right strength for me.

This is an excellent coffee and I recommend it to you.  I have posted a photo for your information.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Knorr Pasta Sides, Beef 4.3 oz
Review:
My wife and I cook for only the two of us and we have found these Knorr side dishes to be just right to go along with our dinner meal. They taste good and they are easy to prepare quickly. My wife likes fettuccini and we add parmesan cheese to jazz up the flavor and make it taste a little richer.  It is good with pork chops or chicken for example.

The package makes 2 servings and that is just right for us. Each serving has 290 calories after being prepared and only 2 sugars which is important for us. I like the product for its ease of preparation, fast cooking and good taste. I rated it at 4 stars.

This is just the right size to prepare for 2 people for dinner, we like it. It is fast and easy to fix!

This is a pretty good little side for not a lot of work or cooking time. We liked it a lot.
