4.0
Product:
Dei Fratelli Pizza Sauce - All Natural - No Water Added - Never from Tomato Paste - 5th Generation Recipe (15 oz. cans; 12 pack)
Review:
We like to make homemade pizzas and we have found this sauce to be of excellent taste and quality. It is very thick and slightly sweet with the right amount of spice in it for an excellent tasting home pizza. I have included photographs of the can and nutrition label for your information.

It tastes good and makes a better pizza than the other brands we have used. We rate this product as a 5 star product. It sells for about $1.50 a can so you may have to look around for the right price and shipping costs. It is a great product.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Chef Paul Magic Seasoning Blends Herbal Pizza and Pasta MagicBtls - 3 oz
Review:
This pizza and pasta seasoning is just what it says it is, MAGIC!  It provides the right blend of spices for your Italian cooking and it is great when mixed into pizza or pasta sauce, meatballs, or any dish.  The wonderful thing about it is that it adds no calories, no fat, no salt, no carbohydrates and no MSG to your food.  It also contains no preservatives.

It is also very good for soups, salads, egg dishes and almost any casserole. There are some very good recipes on his web site and I like the breakfast pizza, it is pretty good.  We love this product and as I write this review I see that we are almost out of it so it is time to buy some more!  I recommend it to you.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Dreamfields Pasta Healthy Carb Living - Elbows - 13.25 ounces
Review:
My family likes pasta in all forms but some of us have to watch how much we eat as it can be bad on your blood sugar levels.  We started using this brand of pasta and it does reduce our sugar levels when compared to using regular pasta.

I love this elbow pasta in our chili and as the cold weather has shown up we just had a pot of it last week.  It has a great taste and it is a good source of fiber.  Each serving has 190 calories and it contains 5 grams of dietary fiber per serving.  Using this pasta has helped us to still be able to enjoy our favorite foods in moderation and still be careful of our carbohydrates.  Using Dreamfield's calculations they claim that their glycemic index is 13 versus regular pasta with an index of 38.  I can only judge that my blood sugar is lower when we eat this pasta when compared to others.  Like everything else you have to eat this in moderation.

This is a good product and I recommend it to you.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kitchen Basics Beef Stock, 32 Fl Oz
Review:
We love a lot of dishes with gravy, broth or sauces.  Yesterday my wife made a large homemade batch of chicken and egg noodles.  Many times you don't get enough broth and you have to add more as the egg noodles soak up a lot of the broth.  She likes this Kitchen Basics Cooking Stock as she can get it in the unsalted version.  She adds this into the chicken and WOW does it help to make a great dinner!  This is even good the next day to add in more broth to warm up your leftovers.  It is much better than using water and it doesn't dilute the flavor of your meal.

We like this broth a lot and we recommend it to you as a 5 star product.
Rating:
5.0

Product:
240 Bestpresso Nespresso Compatible Gourmet Coffee Capsules - Variety Pack - Natural Espresso Flavors - Nespresso Pods Alternative - Certified Italian Espresso
Review:
These pods are inconsistent. Some way too long with little coffee, almost clear, while some run for only 4-5 seconds.

When a pod did work correctly it was decent, but not on par with nespresso.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
SOS Hydration Inc Berry 20 Pack Electrolyte Hydration Powder Mix
Review:
SOS Rehydrate is designed for people doing endurance type of sports like running, triathlons, tennis, or soccer to mention a few.

SOS Rehydrate comes as a powder and you simply mix it with water; it is not a tablet like products from NUUN as an example. The first thing I noticed was the fact that it dissolved almost instantly  unlike a different rehydration drink I had tried in the past (NUUN). SOS Rehydrate had a refreshing flavor and tasted really good. It did not leave an after-taste in my mouth which is good.

SOS Rehydrate should definitely be consumed with cold water in my opinion. The flavor did not work well with water at room temperature. However, even though I did not experience the great flavor as before I did feel refreshed and ready to go within a few minutes. Again there was no bad aftertaste in my mouth.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kashi Go Lean Vanilla Clusters Plant-Powered Cereal, 10.8 Ounce
Review:
At first, I really didn't want to try this cereal after I looked at the ingredient list and the cereal sitting in my bowl with some milk. Was I going to turn into a modern day Euell Gibbons? Was my colon going to implode from all the fiber? After a playful smack on the head from the wife I decided to dive in.

The clusters have a pleasant, crumbly texture, while their taste is a lot like sweet popcorn. Even though popcorn wasn't invited to this pepita fiesta, thats still the dominant sensation. Fluffy, slightly buttery, and with a syrupy vanilla sugar glaze: this is what Id imagine vanilla cupcake popcorn is like. Its kind of like a healthier Rice Krispies Treats cereal.

I never thought I would like any cereal using the words 'plant power' or gluten free.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
The Spice Lab Pink Himalayan Salt - Gourmet Pure Crystal - Nutrient and Mineral Dense for Health - Kosher and Natural Certified (1 Kilo Coarse Refill Bag)
Review:
Very good flavor and interesting color. You can put this in your grinder, but you'll ruin your salt.

Salt should be broken down in a mortar & pestle and served, on the side, in a pinch bowl.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nescafe Taster's Choice Instant Coffee Beverage, Vanilla, Net Wt. 1.69 Ounce (Pack of 8)
Review:
Nescafe has always been a very good instant coffee. I always keep some around. Now I normally prefer to brew my coffee in a French press or a single cone filter over the cup. I love freshly roasted coffee, so finding places that roast it daily is key. But many mornings or sometimes after dinner I will make Nescafe.

To me it's the best instant. The Starbuck's instant is too strong (although good for Mochas with milk), and many other brands just taste bitter and cheap.

Not sure about now, but Nescafe was the ONLY instant that many restaurants kept around. It was better than keeping coffee on a hot plate for too long, and it was quick to make.

Each of these little packs makes one cup of coffee...just add hot water and you're ready to go.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Aquafusion Low Calorie Drink Mix, Blackberry Plum, 7 count (Pack of 12)
Review:
My family loves powdered drink pouches. As long as they contain healthy ingredients I'm okay with that as it gets them to drink more water.

The AquaFusion mixes are real sugar and stevia. Not the best ingredients, but not the worst either. But, holy cow batman, are they sweet. Each pouch is supposed to be 2 servings, but that's too much. We cut it pouch down to 4 servings and it's just right.

The flavor is good. The blackberry is more pronounced than the plum, but it's good overall.

The only odd thing is the color. We've never used clear mixes before. Generally something berry flavored is blue or purple. Don't forget that you've added the AquaFusion already as you can't see it unless you try it.

All in all, not bad. But way too sweet in it's original serving suggestion. Knock it down to 4 servings per pouch and you'll be good to go.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Newman's Own Organic Mints, Peppermint, 1.76-oz. (Pack of 6)
Review:
The number one factor concerning any candy is flavor. The cinnamon is spot-on. Not too hot, not tool mild. It's 100% organic but made in Mexico. The color is a light grey.

5.0

I like the packaging, portability, lack of need for refridgeration, and concentrated aspect. Coffee-mate claims this is a triple strenght formula, but I think results will vary from person to person. I would put it at more of a double strength level. But it tastes pretty much the same as their little cup packages or the big container you need to refridgerate, so all is good. The fact that it is so portable and doesn't need refrideration is a definite plus. It may take you a few tried to figure out how much you need in your mug or travel container though. You do pay extra for this convenience though. ~ Kort Rating: 4.0 Product: Two Rivers Light Roast Coffee Pods Variety Pack for Keurig K-Cup Makers, 40 Count Review: I have a Keurig K-Cup machine but I admit that it is not my favorite coffee. I usually make a pot of regular drip coffee in the morning it gets used throughout the day. I also have a Nespresso machine which I love, but that is in another class. K-cups are not for you if you want a big, rich steaming mug of coffee. Most cups I've tried lack flavor and punch unless made at the absolute smallest size. Even then, they might not be the greatest coffee. For me, I usually need to brew two for a satisfying cuppa. What I find K-cups great for are an office environment, or if you want a quick cup of coffee that is freshly brewed. While not normally a flavored coffee person, this format lets me try different things. That is where the Two Rivers 40-count Mega Coffee selection shines. You get a wide variety of coffees (no decaf in mine) at a fair price. I would say that about half of them are flavored. They come loose in a box so half the fun is picking through them to find what you want to drink. I've only had a few of them (Workaholics Strait Grizzly, Hamilton Mocha Swirl, and Brooklyn Red Velvet), but brewed at the smallest size, I found them each to be distinctive and flavorful. This 40-pack *IS* for someone who wants to try different coffees and doesn't mind a small cup and would make a nice gift for someone in your life who owns a Kuerig and is adventurous when it comes to coffee. It is also good for helping you track down what K-Cups are good and which aren't so hot. I'm looking forward to seeing what my "mystery" cup is, but am saving it for last. I received a sample pack for objective review purposes. ~ Kort Rating: 4.0 Product: Community Coffee 100% Pure Chicory Medium Roast Premium Ground 12 Oz Bag (6 Pack), Rich Flavorful Taste Naturally Decaf Review: I've purchased this chicory directly from Community Coffee in the past and thought I'd share my experience here. I rarely see any chicory in my local supermarket and then usually only the pre-blended French Market City Roast, which I think is good, but not great. I prefer to have total control over how much chicory I add to my coffee, and blend in a bit less than the manufacturer recommends dependent on the strength of the coffee. Chicory seems to work best with a heartier roast, mellowing it out and making it less acidic. My recommendation would be to try adding one scoop to every 3 scoops of coffee and then adjusting it to taste. Also be sure to use a bit less overall when adding chicory. I find a little goes a long way. I DO NOT recommend drinking it in place of coffee, though I've read that they used to do that when beans were scarce. It's okay (when drunk hot), but it works much better as a coffee enhancer. Chicory is not for everyone however, so if possible, try before you buy. Six bags will last you quite a while! I've had nothing but good experience with Community Coffee products and their Pure Chicory is no exception. I've yet to find a better economical 100% chicory. Try mixing this with Community Coffee's Private Reserve Whole Bean Coffee, Louisiana Blend - Medium-Dark Roast for an exceptional cup of coffee! ~ Kort Rating: 5.0 Product: Coffee Mate Coffee Creamer, Pumpkin Spice Table-Top Pump Bottle, 21.1-Ounce Review: Coffee-mate creamer is one of my few indulgences. My daily cuppa wouldn't be the same without it. I know it isn't the healthiest product on Earth with numerous artificial ingredients, but is are low cal and adds to the flavor of my coffee. I usually have vanilla or hazelnut, but thought I would give Pumpkin Spice a go. There is a tea by that name which I like to drink during the cooler months. These special edition flavors can be fun to try and have on occasion. I'm impressed with Pumpkin Spice. It is actually a flavor I'd have on a regular basis. Cinnamon and sweetness pervade with pleasant pumpkin undertone. This is thick like the more concentrated Coffee-mate creamer that Nestle just started offering in squeeze bottles. One squirt is good for a regular cup for me, and three is great for my large travel mug. It is sweet enough that I don't have to add any additional sweetener. The pump is handy as well. It was easy to assemble and once I figured out how to twist the top just right to release the pump I was in business. It has a solid feel when pressing it down and it doesn't drip. This size and format would work well in an office environment, but knowing how much coffee I drink, it is good for home use as well. I hope they release a "Natural Bliss" version, but I'm content to enjoy Pumpkin Spice, artificial ingredients and all. ~ Kort Rating: 4.0 Product: Java Factory Single Cup Coffee for Keurig K Cup Brewers, Dark and Handsome Dark Roast, 24 Count Review: Java Factory's offering has above average variety for a multi-pack. Translation -- I like most of them. Smooth Caffeinator and Wakey Wakey are not ones I would choose to drink, but they were not undrinkable. They just weren't to my tastes, a bit on the light side. The other Cup varieties are darn good, even the flavored ones which are normally not my favorites. Dark & Handsome makes a great morning cup, and Da Bomb is a rich tasting caffeine explosion. The two flavored varieties make good dessert coffees, or regular cups for those who are into that. Actually, Vanilla Dream might just be the best tasting out of the bunch. All cups worked flawlessly with my Keurig. If getting another mixed pack, this would be on my shortlist. I received a sample of this product for objective review purposes. ~ Kort Rating: 5.0 Product: Lavazza Gran Selezione Ground Coffee Blend, Dark Roast, 12-Ounce Bag Review: I'm a coffee maven and take great pride in making that perfect cup of joe. I've tried all kinds of coffee, and as my wife has observed, have my coffee-making technique down to a science. I'm always on the lookout for a coffee with good flavor. For maximum freshness I prefer to grind my own beans, preferably freshly roasted. The LavAzza Gran Selezione Ground Coffee Blend comes finely ground (ideal for espressos and drip makers). Given it's already ground and roasted in Italy, I was impressed with how fresh tasting it is. It made a rich, smooth pot of coffee. Gran Selezione is labeled "intense and chocolaty" and though I detect it, my wife didn't really notice. She complimented me on how delicious the coffee I had made for her was (I did not tell her it was LavAzza until afterwards). It passed the wife test and she wanted me to brew it again the next day. I like that LavAzza is a family owned business that is responsible with their sourcing. This coffee tastes like it was roasted with care and is something I would have no hesitation getting again. On a scale of 1-10, it is an intensity level of 7 -- a moderate dark roast. For a coffee of this price range, it's an exceptional value. I would recommend it for anyone who wants a quality cup of coffee and prefers the convenience of pre-ground beans. ~ Kort Rating: 5.0 Product: Kauai Coffee Single-serve Pods, Island Sunrise Mild Roast – 100% Premium Arabica Coffee from Hawaii’s Largest Coffee Grower, Keurig-Compatible Cups - 12 Count Review: I love Kona coffee. That and Blue Mountain are my favorites. A couple of months ago, I found Kauai ground coffee on sale at my local grocer and gave it a shot. Both myself and my wife were impressed. It has most of the characteristics of a rich and mellow Kona coffee without the huge price tag. Even in pre-ground form it was good. Fast forward a few weeks and I get these K-cup single-serve compatibles from Amazon. I've found many K-cups to be a bit weak and unimpressive, but was pleased to find that these compatibles live up to the Kauai standard. While perhaps oh-so-slightly weaker than what I would brew in the regular coffee maker, they still retain their flavor as single-serve options. The format is not quite K-cup, but worked well in my unit and looks like it is more environmentally friendly. I only use my Keurig occasionally, but I've found a K-cup that I am happy to stock for those occasions! ~ Kort Rating: 4.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. UPDATE: Maybe it is an acquired taste???? Still BITTER!!! The bag says "Italy's Favorite Coffee" Well you know what comes to my mind?? I guess if we lived in Italy and wanted American coffee the Can of Maxwell House Coffee would say "America's Favorite Coffee" We know that is not true????? I can see how one reviewer said that it was burnt. I am not sure about their method or any method of making this. I can only say that the flavor is mild. If you want Toffee on the mild side then this is great and deserves five stars. For my personal taste and probably most people that like English Butter Toffee are going to like Aunt Mae's because it is more traditional and very thick. golds.output: I'm a big fan of Quaker oatmeal, and this gluten-free version with maple and brown sugar is a winner! It's a quick and easy way to get a nutritious breakfast, and the flavor is delicious. I usually use skim milk, but you could also use water.  I like to let it sit for a few minutes before eating to get a thicker consistency.  It's a great option for those who are looking for a gluten-free alternative to traditional oatmeal.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Quaker Instant Oatmeal Original, 12 Packets per Box (Pack of 4)
Review:
I usually get the low sugar version of this, and I bought this by accident.  The extra sugar, of course, makes it extra yummy.  No, it's not traditional oatmeal and instead instant, with the drawbacks of salt and no control over the flavoring amounts, but it makes a quick and nutritious breakfast.  I tend to use skim milk instead of water for a creamier texture.  Because I like thicker oatmeal, I use a little less liquid than called for and let it sit for a few minutes before eating.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Oatmeal Packets by thinkThin, Instant Protein & Fiber Hot Oatmeal for On The Go- 10g Protein, 5g Fiber, Vegan - Madagascar Vanilla with Almonds and Pecans, 1.76 oz Packets (6 Boxes/6 Packets Per Box)
Review:
When I opened my first packet of thinkThin oatmeal, I was surprised by how little was there compared to an average packet of Quaker Instant Oatmeal.  And the instructions directed me to add 1/2 cup of water to that small portion.  My first try resulted in too-thin oatmeal, so the next time I used 1/3 cup (and 1 minute in the microwave).  That ended up with a thicker hot cereal more to my tastes, but I had to let it sit more afterward to better "cook" the oatmeal.

The taste is pretty good for an instant hot cereal, but there's a weird, powdery, tongue-coating sensation that comes with it even though the oatmeal is moist.  It's not a taste, per se, or even a true chalkiness.  It's just . . . strange.  Once I got used to it, however, it didn't bother me.  I do like that the berries -- the blueberries, in particular -- aren't chewy after preparation like so many other dehydrated fruit products.  Because there are no artificial flavors, you don't get that cloying artificial "berry" taste that some products have.  Yeah, it doesn't taste like fresh berries, but it's much better than most.  The cereal contains soy and milk, although I don't see anything milk-like in the ingredient list.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Lindt Excellence Bar, 70% Cocoa Smooth Dark Chocolate, Gluten Free, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I love Lindt chocolate, and this collection has something for everyone, which made it great to use as stocking stuffers this past Christmas.  I'm more of a dark chocolate woman, so the extra creamy milk didn't appeal to me, although my mother-in-law loved hers.  These are solid bars -- that is, they don't have creamy fillings.  For example, the intense orange has bits of orange rind in it rather than an orange filling.  The 70% and 85% dark chocolate bars are great for cooking or snacking.  All bars arrived unbroken, unmelted, and fresh.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
5.0
Product:
CAILLER L'Art du Brut, Milk Chocolate with whole Almonds, Hazelnuts & Raisins,  6.9 ounce bars (Pack of 2)
Review:
This milk chocolate bar with almonds, hazelnuts, and raisins is heavy on the milk and sugar, light on the chocolate flavor, but still delicious.  It is packed with nuts and raisins -- they stick up through the top of the segments.  If you are a lover of milk chocolate, nuts, and fruit, then you've probably found your bar.

Each bar is a hefty 6.87 ounces.  To give you a comparison, Ghirardelli and Lindt large bars run about 3.5 ounces.  Although Cailler is manufactured by Swiss Nestlé, the high milk content is more reminscent of Cadbury than the Nestlé bars Americans are used to.  The milk tends to give the chocolate a creamier texture, though less intense flavor.

This chocolate bar satisfies my sweet tooth and cravings for nuts more than it does when my craving for chocolate, probably because I usually reach for dark chocolate instead of milk chocolate.  If you like milk chocolate more than dark, you will likely love these bars.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Skippy Natural Creamy Peanut Butter Spread with Honey, 15 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
This Skippy peanut butter tastes like those honey-roasted peanuts you sometimes get in a bar -- and it's just as addictive.  It's smooth, sweet, and full of peanut flavor.  Of course, if you prefer non-sweet peanut butter, then run away as fast as you can.  This peanut butter contains more sugar per serving than than regular Jif -- 5 versus 3 grams -- so don't buy this thinking it's more healthy.  It contains no mono- or diglycerides, however.

I grew up on Skippy peanut butter, but when I tasted Jif as an adult, I was hooked on the sweeter taste and switched brands.  Of course, I've also eaten natural peanut butters over the years, and they usually contained no sugar.  I was surprised that this "natural" brand had so much sugar added.  Kids and those of us with a sweet tooth will love the taste of this Skippy; I'm not sure health-conscious parents will.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Food Should Taste Good, Tortilla Chips, Multigrain Bean Chips, Pinto Bean, 5.5 oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
These sturdy chips taste great, with the nutty flavor of beans and seeds.  Although they are salted, the salt is not overbearing, and the grain flavor comes through as the strongest flavor.

Despite the ingredients of pinto beans, sunflower seeds, flax seeds, sesame seeds, and quinoa, these are still chips, and therefore are not as healthy as eating these ingredients separately.  They also contain stone ground corn (second ingredient, after pinto beans), brown rice flour, and cane sugar.  The serving size of 10 chips/1 oz. contains 3 g of fiber, 3 g of protein, and 2 g of sugar.  To compare, the Snyders pretzels I have in my pantry have, in 1 ounce, the same amount of fiber but only 1 gram of protei and no sugar in a single serving.  One ounce of these chips has 140 calories; one ounce of the pretzel have only 100 calories.

As a side to a sandwich or as a snack, these multigrain bean chips are great, as long as you accept that they are still extra calories without much nutritional content.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Hershey's Caramels, Dark Chocolate Caramels, 7.2 Ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
These individually wrapped caramels have the perfect dark chocolate to caramel ratio.  The caramels are soft and buttery tasting, and the chocolate is, well, Hershey's.  I love that I can put out a bowl of these, and they don't get stale or mushed together because of the wrapping.  They are perfect for Christmas stockings, sitting on a desk, or just snacking.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:

Review:

This soup is outstanding on its own, and for low carbers/diabetics, it is a special treat. I use this mostly as a sauce for chicken, pork chops, veggies. I treat it like mushroom soup for a sauce, thinning with cream or broth if needed, which normally I don't.  It has just a bit of spiciness to it, and for me it makes a big difference in ease of prep and added variety to what are sometimes bland dishes. prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: FISHER Snack Honey Roasted Peanuts, Golden Roast, 14 oz Review: These are good. Fresh, salt-free and very plump, crunchy and sweet. Just the way I like peanuts. Unless you are a salt-freak, I'd say these are far better than the salted ones. Rating: 5.0 Product: FISHER Snack Honey Roasted Peanuts, Golden Roast, 14 oz Review: Very nice peanuts--a tad salty however. I frequently enjoy a handful of peanuts before dinner as a snack or with drinks. Can't eat tree nuts (allergic) but luckily, I'm not allergic to peanuts and I really like them. This was always a family tradition--my mom and dad and I would have a few peanuts before dinner with a sherry or glass of wine or whiskey. I still like to do that. These nuts are very fresh and roasted well. I'd consider buying salt-free ones, next time, because I just don't like so much salt nor should I eat so much salt in my diet. Rating: 4.0 Product: Ghiradelli Hot Chocolate, Double Chocolate, 16oz Review: Whoah! I just peeled myself off the ceiling after drinking a cup of this. This might be better named "Double Sugar" Flavor Hot Chocolate mix. First, the good stuff. There is no doubt in my mind that Ghirardelli continues to make a distinctive, excellent quality chocolate. The cocoa used in this mix is smooth, dark, fruity and aromatic. Nothing else like it that I've ever tasted. Now, the criticism. There is just too much sugar in the mix. The recommended proportion of mix to 8 oz milk is four tablespoons. (By the by, there is no powdered milk in here. You must add your own milk--or soymilk or rice milk--great option for lactose-intolerant types.) People, you are using a quarter cup of mix at 4 Tbs and most of the mix seems to be granulated sugar, which you can taste and crunch in your mouth if you sample the dry mix. Cutting down fifty percent on the mix gave me an acceptable cup of cocoa but...it was no longer double chocolate and it had naturally a poorer mouth feel and aroma. Double Chocolate Mix is some of the best cocoa I WOULD have had, if Ghirardelli could see their way to making a lower sugar version, and please, no sugar substitute, which I don't like to use. Summary; great chocolate flavor, unsurpassed. But overly sweet. If you don't like supersweet cocoa, pass this up. If you do love extremely sweet hot drinks, you will absolutely adore this mix. Rating: 5.0 Product: Barista Prima Italian Roast Coffee Keurig Vue Portion Pack, 24 count Review: If you like strong, dark coffee, the Barista Italian roast for the Vue cup is excellent. I make it on the STRONG setting for 8oz and it's perfect. In fact, it's better than what I make in my regular pot unless I have very fresh coffee just ground from beans. The color is a rich, blackish brown, the roast is dark but not burnt-tasting and of all the coffees for the Vue I've tried, this one wins hands-down. I have the same blend in K-cups (for the office, where the K version sits) and they are not as good, for some reason. The Vue is not the most economical way to make coffee (that would probably be a plastic Melitta filter with a paper cone and a mug or a French Press) but the Keurig is fast and convenient. And I get the coffee the strength and temperature just the way I like it. Rating: 5.0 Product: Barista Prima House Blend Keurig K-Cups,18 Count Review: I had a sampler and tried Italian Roast, Columbian, House Blend and a few other Barista blends. By far, the House Blend is my favorite. It's dark but not burnt, not overly strong and it has character. It stands up to milk and sugar but is pleasant when drunk black. Of all the coffees I've tried in the Keurig, this one is by far the best. It's balanced and hearty. Rating: 5.0 Product: Krusteaz Belgian Supreme Waffle Mix, 28-Ounce Box (Pack of 4) Review: This is an excellent mix for waffles. You can make them with or without the egg and oil, but they are better with those ingredients added. Waffles are not diet food. There is a trick to make really crisp light waffles, however. Make up the mix according to directions but do it this way: 1. Substitute melted butter for some or all of the oil. 2. Separate the egg. Add the yolk as you mix the rest of the ingredients, then beat the egg white until stiff and fold it in as the last step (put the whipped egg white on top of the batter, turn it in with a spatula, cutting it in gently until it is just mixed and the egg white is not showing lumps of white.) This trick will also work with any gluten free mix you may use (and those flours tend to be heavier than this mix.) I also add a pinch of ground cloves or cinnamon to add some flavor. Naturally, using a very good waffle maker, such as this one, will insure you get the lightest, fluffiest waffles you can make. There are many good ones on the market but I use a relatively simple one Presto Waffler. The key is to flip the waffle during cooking to make sure the center is evenly baked. There are ways to top the waffles that may surprise you. My dad's favorite was cream cheese and apple butter. I had them with strawberries and huge mounds of whipped cream in Luxembourg, and the best way I ever had them was with cherries (rather like pie filling) and whipped cream in a little mountain village in Germany. Those were awesome. As I said, not diet food, though you can simply dust them with powdered sugar and they still are pretty darn tasty. Rating: 5.0 Product: Cafe Escapes Milk Chocolate Hot Cocoa Keurig Vue Portion Pack, 32 Count Review: This hot chocolate is nice and convenient and you can brew it strong or less strong because the VUE lets you customize temperature and volume. But sad to say, I found it too sweet. The reason for it's being sweet is that in addition to sugar, it is sweetened with sucralose (aka Splenda.) This is a new trend in foods-- a mix of natural and artificial sweeteners. (Have you seen chewing gum? Even the non-sugar-free varieties have aspartame?) The reason for using a mix of natural and artificial is interesting but I believe in this case, using sucralose lowers the calorie count of the cocoa and it also allows more sweetener in a smaller cup size, as sucralose takes up less space than granulated sugar. I had to tease out the ingredient info by carefully reading the box, as it doesn't say so on the cup. Here's the good news, if you don't want sucralose, or even if you don't want sugar AND sucralose, you can buy packet cocoas and make a cup of hot water with the VUE, any volume and temp you choose. Just mix it up yourself. The only powdered mix I ever liked was Caotina (from Switzerland) which was not so sweet as American varieties but I can't find it in the US. However, I have guests who adore hot chocolate when they visit my office or home, so I keep Swiss Miss on hand. In any case, for the Cafe Escapes, blech! Rating: 1.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Dentyne Pure Sugar Free Gum (Mint with Herbal Accents 9 Piece Pack of 10) Review: i got the melon while it was still under $9 and don't know why the price nearly doubled in 2016. in the meantime i will wait till the herbal goes on sale to try it. this gum comes in larger chicklets that are not as minty as the usual dentyne, and chews softer as not to press or stick to dental work. it also does not taste rubbery once the flavor is gone as other dentyne do. i prefer chicklet gum because i can carry it raw in a pocket without wrappers or worrying it's going to melt like paper wrapped sticks. i will update this review once the herbal prices lower and i can better distinguish between the flavors. the melon gum tastes to me like wrigley's juicy fruit with added mint. Rating: 5.0 Product: EZ-Sweetz (2.0oz - Liquid Sweetener 800 Servings/Bottle) (Original, 1 Pack) Review: I consume 2,000 Splenda packets each year, so before I ordered my next case, I decided to give this liquid version a try. I was very pleased with how noticeably better it tasted in my home brewed Iced Dilmah Tea, 100% Pure Ceylon Tea, Loose Leaf, 4.4-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6), though it takes 2 drops to equal a packet's sweetening power. each gallon of tea I brew normally requires 16 packets (one per 8oz cup), while over 30 drops were needed to match that sweetness here. As I brew 4 gallons at a time, not having to rip open, tap empty and dispose of 64 packets was nice, but that still does not make up for this liquid's triple net sweetening cost. Should I find it again under $5/ounce I would get more, barring that - I'll probably go back to using cheaper packets. Rating: 5.0 Product: Dilmah Tea, 100% Pure Ceylon Tea, Loose Leaf, 4.41-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) Review: I used to buy Ceylon labeled tea exported from middle eastern countries Ahmad 500g Loose Ceylon Tea, 1.23-Ounce Packet (Pack of 4) for around $12 per kilo, only to later learn about high mountain genuine (lion&sword seal) Ceylon from Sri Lanka. Being able to buy the real thing on Amazon for $20 per kilo was an amazing find for me, as I brew a Gallon per day using a drip style coffee maker. Only 1g per cup is needed here, not the typical 2g per cup you may need with cheaper loosely packed leafy Ceylons, so each box can yeild over a hundred 8oz cups of tea - as no leaf rinsing is needed. This is NOT some low quality crushed leaf dust, just a fine packed leaf that requires a paper filter to brew to yield a crystal clear amber tea - don't use a hole steeper - only a fine screen will do. This is an affordable leaf type especially for ice tea lovers. This malty neutral pH tea, combines well with fruit, spices, citrus, and even milk. UPDATE: I'm just about to reorder and wanted to share that drip method ice tea *makers Mr. Coffee TM3-2W 3-Quart Iced Tea Maker like me - can save even more money by using only 1/2g per cup - and you will still get a dark amber full flavor tea. So for every gallon (16 cups) I brew, I use just 8g of this tea leaf, with 16x yellow 1g Splenda packets, and get perfect lightly sweet sugar free tea every time! That gets my cost per large 8oz cup of fresh brewed no preservative iced tea down under 10. Flavor with a tablespoon of cranberry or grapefruit juice for an extra kick. This tea the best balance of quality and afford ability. I have tried other Dilmah teas including; Ran Watte, Uda Watte, Supreme, Earl Grey, and these little blue boxes are the only ones worth reordering. Rating: 5.0 Product: Dilmah Tea, Earl Grey Tea, Loose Leaf, 4.4-Ounce Tins (Pack of 3) Review: the Bergamot used here smells and tastes like rancid Lychee nuts, so if you are just looking for a pleasant black tea, pick something else. A tea at this price point should not be using "flavoring" but the real essence, oil or dehydrated Bergamot citrus fruit. The leaves are cut up into 2mm bits, so you must use a paper filter when seeping this loose tea. The double capped tin does a fine job of air sealing the tea, so there is no need for an inner foil wrapper as others have contested. Rating: 3.0 Product: Golden Valley Natural Turkey Jerky, Teriyaki, 3.25 Ounce Pouches (Pack of 8) Review: I have tried every GoldenValleyNatural.com Jerky product. By far the best are all the Sweet N'Spicy and Peppered Flavors. Beef tends to be smoky and fatty, while Turkey is dry and flaky, making their Buffalo meat varieties the best of them all. Avoid their Low Carb Jerky unless you are willing to bite off tic-tac size bites and chew for a minute each time. All the Teriyaki Jerkys have the texture and taste like sweet Corned Beef, so I'd skip them as well. If you want to try different flavors, instead of 8 of the same from Amazon, just go directly to their web sight and buy them for only 15% more than Amazon's sale price. Rating: 5.0 Product: Lindt Excellence Bar, 70% Cocoa Smooth Dark Chocolate, Gluten Free, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: salt is good in chocolate only if it's a few large grains scattered about (like chocolate chips on a cookie) so you taste the good chocolate, then get hit by a bit of a salt surprise. here lindt just diluted extra salt into an average chocolate, and the results are just awful - and thanks to amazon i'm now stuck with 5 more bars of this junk. Rating: 2.0 Product: Barry's Irish Breakfast Tea, 80-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 3) Review: This is not a cheap Yorkshire Gold knockoff, rather it's an acidic Indian black with a distinct bergamot note, like a pathetic attempt at Earl Grey. Either everyone giving this tea 5 stars was born in the UK, or they are clueless about what good black teas are being enjoyed in other parts of the World. This is even worse chilled as an ice tea, since it clouds up within hours. 05/29/2014
The price has gone up substantially. Check to see if local stores have a similar product for less. When I bought it in January of this year, it worked out to $2.38 a bag. Currently, it's $4.42 for the same amount. I'll have to rethink this.

Bob's Red Mill Flour Garbanzo Bean, 16-ounces (Pack of 4)
Review:
I've had a yen for my "super duper gut bombs" (oatmeal patties) but since I'm vegan now, it wasn't an option to make them with eggs. AHA! Garbanzo flour to the rescue and this brand is the best I've ever had. It held the patties together fully as well--or better--than eggs did. I'm a happy camper. BTW, I do the "throw together" method of cooking. Ingredients are quick oats, garbanzo flour, chopped fresh mushrooms, chopped onion, Braggs, coconut aminos, olive oil, garlic granules, Italian seasoning, sea salt and enough water to combine everything.  Baked them on an oiled cookie sheet @ 350 until brown, turned once. The mushrooms keep them moist. YUM!!

Product:

Review:
My doctor prescribed fava beans for my tremor in June of this year. Since then, I have bought boxes of fava beans. These are the best quality for the best price of any of the ones available and they aren't readily available! I have them on subscription to get the better price and use a package of them every three days or so. I have recommended them to others. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is because some of the beans are not completely peeled and I have to laboriously clean them off. Inevitably, there are little pieces of the germ under the "flap" of the bean that, for all the world, look like bugs when they're cooked. Otherwise, if you have to eat fava beans on a regular basis (I eat a cup of cooked beans twice a day) you can't go wrong with these.

Sincerely Nuts Raw Brazil Nuts No Shell (2Lb Bag) | Premium Healthy Snack Food | Whole, Kosher, Vegan, Gluten Free | Keto & Paleo Diety Friendly | Gourmet Snack | Source of Vitamins & Minerals
Review:
These things are big fat plump hunks of deliciousness and pretty low in carbs (as nuts go).  I like mine without salt and extra crunchy (singed is good) so raw nuts are what I buy and then I give them a nice intense ride in the toaster oven.  I've been buying nuts online for years and have had some successes and some failures; these are a 100% success.  They are huge (some competitors' are a bit smaller), whole (not that I really mind fragments but there are none to be found here) and they taste like Brazil Nuts (I've had some that must have been sharing the production line with peanuts - I love peanuts but I don't want to taste them when I'm eating Brazil Nuts).  Very good stuff.

May 2016: just ordered a 3# bag because I have been going through these way too fast.  Best compliment I know how to give is to reorder!

Product:
Mauna Loa Macadamias, Unsalted Dry Roasted, 4.5-Ounce Containers (Pack of 6)
Review:
I am not a salt person - I'm on high blood pressure meds, yes, but have never been a big fan of salt except on french fries and onion rings (which I allow myself only infrequently) anyway.  It's hard to find good quality nuts of any kind that are unsalted.  These are first quality AND unsalted.  I eat them out of the can when I can't resist, but I mostly use them in stir-fry concoctions (the bottled sauces I use generally have way too much sodium all by themselves).  They are excellent with shrimp or with scallops.  Good stuff and the AMZN price (plus no tax and no shipping) makes them much more reasonable than local stores.

5.0
Product:
Al Dente Carba-Nada Egg Fettuccine, 10-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
I'm doing the low carb/high fat lifestyle and one of the toughest things for me was/is walking away from noodles/pasta.  I allow myself this occasionally and it is a reasonably acceptable alternative to pasta.  I've always thought of pasta as a blank slate - it tastes like whatever you put on it - but this is a little different.  It doesn't taste like anything, no matter what you put on it, but it's *there* and provides some pasta-like texture and pasta-like interest in the dish.  I do enjoy it and will continue to buy it.  If you're avoiding carbs and think you have to swear off pasta completely, this really is worth a shot.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Bibigo Korean Gochujang Sauce, 11.46 Ounce, 2 Count
Review:
I'm all about the sauces - I claim to be able to cook but mostly I experiment with Indo-Asian condiments and noodles or vegetables and such.  If my guests like what I came up with I take the credit, otherwise I blame the sauce I snuck in on them.

Other reviewers have already pointed out that this is pretty thick - it's not a paste but it's definitely not watery thin, and it's not oily thin either (think of sesame oil or chili oil - it's not like that).  To my taste, both the sweet and spicy elements are right there prominently in your face without a lot of subtlety which suits me just fine.  There is a slight smokiness to the flavor and it has a pretty spicy kick for a finish so there's more to it than just fire and sugar.

I love hot stuff and can deal with quite a bit of heat, but I must say this would be a little over the top as the only sauce in, say, a stir fry.  The heat builds as you keep eating and it will get your attention.  (Lest you assume I'm a wimp, I'm the guy who brings his own chili oil/chili paste to the Asian buffet when a group of coworkers go out for lunch.)

I marinated some raw shrimp in it before steaming with veggies and sticky rice and that was a perfect use for it.  It's also great as a flavor variation if you like doctoring up ramen noodles as I do sometime.  But my favorite use so far is to add it to pizza - it enhances pretty much any variation.  I was an early adopter of Sriracha sauce for this purpose, 20+ years ago, and I completely burned out on that stuff a long time back.  This has about the same punch but a completely different taste that works with old-school pepperoni and red sauce, chicken and white sauce, olive oil based pizza, veggie, you name it.  Just a bit here and there as an enhancement and you can transform what was an excellent pizza pie into a completely different, but still excellent pizza pie.  A two-fer!

One caveat: Gochujang is a Korean staple, not an exotic rarity.  You can buy it in paste form for a lot less and mix up your own version of this sauce with, e.g., sesame oil and soy sauce and a few other odds and ends.  It's a convenience item and if you buy this product you are paying a premium for the convenience.

I racked my brain to justify fewer than 5 stars because this is a Vine review of a free product, the presence of which appears to cause some folks all kinds of heartburn.  Apparently the only proper atonement for receiving a review sample at no cost is to despise the product you're reviewing, but I think this stuff is really tasty so...five stars.  Haters gonna hate :-)
Rating:
5.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Crunchmaster Crackers Multi-Seed Orginal - 2 / 4.5 Oz Bags Gluten Free Review: I absolutely love these Crunchmaster crackers! I discovered them by accident when my wife asked me to go to the supermarket to get some Mary's Gone Crackers, Original, 6.5 Ounce or an equivalent brown rice cracker. They were too expensive at $5+ a box, so I grabbed 2 of these instead. They're thin, crunchy, and super tasty. We like these better because they're airy. Mary's is too dense. Made with wholesome ingredients, I don't have to feel bad about eating these as a snack. There aren't any ingredients you can't pronounce, and I feel good that they're high quality ingredients-- certified gluten-free and non-GMO verified. One serving is 140 calories, with 45 of them being fat. Sodium content is low at 5% of your daily recommended intake, while giving you 8% of your daily fiber. I've also tried the Sea Salt flavor, but didn't like it as much. The Original is a lot better, in my opinion. First, the shape is more fun (hexagons) and it's flavored with tamari soy sauce. The sesame taste is also very pronounced. I got them from Stop & Shop for $2.50 a bag on sale. I'll gladly buy these again. Currently, they are available on AmazonFresh for the same price. Kids love these too. My friend's 3 year old kept coming back for more! Rating: 5.0 Product: Quaker Yogurt Chewy Granola Bar, Blueberry, 6.1-Ounce Packages (Pack of 6) Review: Think of this as a candy/snack bar rather than a granola bar and you will not be disappointed. It's very sweet and tasty, but there's little or no nutritional value in here, despite being made from oats. The product is heavily processed and definitely what anyone would call healthy. Made with natural and artificial flavors, the ingredients list is very long (see bottom of review). It's loaded with sugar and not something you want to give yourself or your kids on a regular basis. Note how many times sugar or its variants appear in the list (glucose, fructose). Each bar is 1.23 oz. Daily value: Fiber 1g (5%), Vitamin A (0%), Vitamin C (0%), Calcium (10%), Iron (2%). 150 calories per bar (40 from fat), 11g of sugar. I'm giving the product 4 stars based on taste and texture. It's chewy, but not hard like Nature Valley granola bars. Ingredients: granola (whole grain rolled oats, whole grain rolled wheat, brown sugar, sunflower oil, high fructose corn syrup, dried coconut, honey, sodium bicarbonate, natural flavor, whey and whey protein concentrate), yogurt flavored coating (sugar, palm kernel and palm oil, whey protein concentrate, yogurt flavored powder, soy lecithin, natural flavor, artificial color, citric acid, salt), corn syrup, high fructose corn syrup, brown rice crisp (whole grain brown rice, sugar, malted barley flour, salt), brown sugar, glycerin, vegetable shortening (canola oil, palm and palm kernel oils), corn flakes (milled corn, sugar, salt, malted barley extract), whey mineral concentrate, oat flour, rice flour, sweetened dried strawberries (glucose syrup, strawberries, high fructose corn syrup, modified potato starch, sodium alginate), corn syrup solids, sorbitol, salt, sugar, modified food starch, soy lecithin, natural flavor, malted barley flour, sodium bicarbonate, BHT (a preservative), citric acid, water. Made in Canada. Rating: 4.0 Product: Thai Kitchen Gluten Free Green Curry Paste, 4 oz Review: I used to buy this Thai Kitchen red curry paste when I was in college. Sadly, the recipe seems to have changed. It lacks flavor and intensity. I had to use a whole jar, whereas in the past, I could make a whole pot of soup with as little as a third of a jar. I'm going back to buying Thai red curry from Asian supermarkets. Rating: 1.0 Product: Organic Chocolate Chip Pancake and Waffle Mix by Birch Benders, Whole Grain, Non-GMO, 16oz Review: * NOTE: This review is for the Organic Pancake and Waffle Mix. (Several varieties are co-mingled on this page.) * We didn't like this pancake mix. In terms of ease, the instructions say to just add water, but the resulting taste is not very good if you do just that. My wife and I made them several times over the last week and were not satisfied with the flavor and texture. She said they were "mushy". I didn't like that they weren't fluffy. They are dense and too elastic, but not in a good way. This is owing to the potato starch and cassava starch in the recipe. When I made them, one side looked wrinkly when I flipped them prematurely, due to how potato starch cooks. To me, pancakes should be airy and spongey. Good pancakes sop up the syrup poured on top of them. These don't do that. Making them with eggs greatly improves the appearance and taste, but they're still not as good as all flour pancakes. Rating: 3.0 Product: Blue Diamond Almonds, Bold Habanero BBQ, 16 Ounce (Pack of 3) Review: The heat here is very very mild. I've had habanero sauces and chips that were so hot they made me cry for help. These are not like that. Only occasionally will you get a little kick. It's actually mostly tangy and tomato-y. The dusting of flavoring on the outside of the nuts will coat your fingers in an orange film. Satisfyingly crunchy and tangy, it's really hard to stop eating these. Even though the habanero kick isn't there as promised on the label, it's still really tasty. I highly recommend these. Sodium content is very low at 4% per serving. High in Vitamin E (35%) and magnesium (20%). This 1 pound bag (x3 bags) is a great deal compared to buying the 6 oz tins at the store, however, when my local Walgreens has buy 1 get 1, the price drops to about $0.35/oz. Blue Diamond makes about 8 other flavors that I know of. My favorites are the Soy Wasabi, Honey Roasted, Smokehouse, Dijon Mustard. Rating: 4.0 Product: HEALTH WARRIOR Chia Bars, Acai Berry, Gluten Free, Vegan, 25g bars, 15 Count Review:
    I'm not a huge fan of snack bars like Clif Bars, but I love these. Chia seeds may seem like the latest health food craze, but they've actually been eaten for thousands of years by peoples in Meso-America. Valued for their dense nutritional content, they were an important food crop for the Mayans, not just the stuff covering tacky terracotta heads. I've been eating them for a number of years for their high protein content, fiber, and high levels of plant-based Omega-3 fatty acids. Acai berry is another health food supplement additive. It's been around for longer (mostly for use in juices and shakes) and many people have heard of it, even if just by name. They are native to South America and grow on palm trees like a huge cluster of grapes. It's much better tasting than the coffee one, in my opinion. The coffee one doesn't taste much like coffee (or a really weak coffee). I love the way these bars are moist, with a satisfyingly dense and chewy mouth-feel. Chia seeds themselves don't have much of a taste, but they provide a lot of crunchy texture like poppy seeds or sesame seeds. The taste of the bar is tart and sweet, and all in balance. I don't think they're ideal for intense sports activity unless you have water readily available, however, due to the nature of how chia seeds interact with liquid (e.g. saliva) in your mouth. After finishing the bar, you may feel some loose residual seeds just kind of hanging out in your mouth. They will require sloshing out with water to clean up. For me, they don't get stuck in my teeth, but feeling around with my tongue, there are loose seed particles around the inside the mouth like the cheek pockets. That's a natural property of chia seeds themselves and not a fault of this product since chia seeds swells in water and form a sticky, gelatinous outer coating. My only problem with this product is how expensive it is for how small it is. That's partly a result of high demand for chia seeds, which has sent prices quadrupling or more since I started eating them 4 years ago. I do love these bars and don't feel guilty eating them because they are so packed with nutrients. Rating: 5.0 Product: FISHER Snack Honey Roasted Peanuts, Golden Roast, 14 oz Review: I'm not sure you need to read a review on peanuts. But here goes. What you see is what you get, folks. This is a jar of peanuts. Jar is plastic and recyclable, with a freshness seal under the lid to peel away. Or keep it partially attached like I do. The nuts are in mostly halves (with a scattering of wholes), and pretty much like you see in the photo, though the image has been touched up to remove the dust that settled at the bottom of the can. The peanuts in the picture look too clean compared to the real thing. A fair percentage of the peanuts still have some of their outer skin on them. I'd say about 10% or less do. This is bonus to me, since some fiber is retained. Peanuts are high in fiber and protein. Taste is about as expected, with a good crunchiness. If you are watching your sodium intake like I am, go for the unsalted variety. The peanuts can also be ground up for things like Thai dishes or ice cream topping. Label says "Packed in USA". No mention of where they are grown. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Spicely Organic Coriander Seeds Whole (0.30 OZ ecoBox) Review: These coriander seeds has some really strong flavor to it. They are not the hardcore type of spice but more mild and soothing. The seeds are whole and dried so they're easy to use in cooking. I personally grind them into smaller pieces for meat dishes. The reason why this seed goes great with meat dishes is because it has a citrus or lemony fragrance. You can throw in the seeds when the oil is hot and let it soak up all the flavor then remove the seeds or you can leave it in there. That is up to you. For vegetable dishes I like to remove the seeds after the oil are soaked up in the flavor. You can use the oil for salad dressing or simply for cooking. For the benefits of eating this seed/culinary practice; - Control of Blood Sugar (great for people who are diabetic) - Contains all sort of wonderful minerals such as iron, copper, calcium, potassium, manganese, zinc and also fiber. - Contains Vitamin A, K, and C - Aids digestion I have received a reduced price for the coriander seeds for testing/reviewing purposes. All of my reviews are 100% honest and from my own experience. I do not promise a good rating. I am not affiliated with this company nor compensated in any way. Thank you for reading and I hope this review will help you in your purchase. Rating: 5.0 Product: Organic ACAI Powder (Freeze-Dried) - 4oz Resealable Bag - 100% Raw Antioxidant Superfood Berry From Brazil - by Feel Good Organics Review: This is my first time having acai powder or anything with acai in it. My first impression was that this acai berry smells very similar and almost identical to blueberry. Acai powder is packed with goodies for your body such as antioxidant, fiber, vitamin A and C. It is a great vegan, gluten free treat and very healthy. The powder is very dark in color. I tasted the powder raw and it's actually pretty good. Leaves a slight sweet aftertaste. I don't have a blender which I hope to get one soon to experiment more with this acai powder. I will mix it with yogurt next time I purchase some too. What I did here was taking: - 2 teaspoons of acai - 1 teaspoon of matcha (green tea powder) with a bit of hot water. I whisk them together with a chasen and the result was a dark green colored tea. Then I added coconut milk and mixed that good. Last but not least I sprinkled a pinch of the acai powder. It seems to me that acai powder doesn't dissolve so easily and need a good whisk or blend. At the end of the last sip, I noticed some dark residue left on the bottom. It's a bit gritty or crunchy. I think it's from the seeds of the acai berry. The taste is superb and healthy and it is organic as labeled. I have received a reduced price for the acai powder for testing/reviewing purposes. All of my reviews are 100% honest and from my own experience. I do not promise a good rating. I am not affiliated with this company nor compensated in any way. Thank you for reading and I hope this review will help you in your purchase. Rating: 5.0 Product: Organic Matcha Green Tea Powder - Japanese Culinary Grade Matcha - 4 oz (113 grams) - Increases Energy and Focus and Naturally Supports Weight Loss - From Kiss Me Organics Review: This is a large bag 4 Oz of organic cooking grade matcha from Kiss Me Organics. First of all I was running out of ceremonial grade matcha and I am FRICKING happy that I got to review this. And yes I did receive a discount for the matcha to test and review. All of my feedback and review are 100% honest and my own. This organic matcha is a product of Japan and it smells absolutely amazing. Compare to the organic matcha that was product of China you can easily distinguish the difference between them. The organic matcha from Japan smells like REAL fresh and good quality matcha. From this experience I will never buy matcha that are from China EVEN if they are organics. Compare to cooking grade matcha from China I'd say this matcha would be a ceremonial grade. LOL. There is a notice on the back that it is best to consume the whole bag within 2 months upon opening. I might just squeeze it to 3 months because I will use this for drinking mainly since it tastes almost as good as ceremonial grade. Of course it is not ceremonial grade because you can tell by the color and smell. The color is still very green but with a slight touch of yellow. The smell is extremely green and fresh like real green tea. It took me into my imagination of nature Anyways lets get to the good part shall we. I put about a teaspoon of the matcha into a small bowl. I smooth out some of the clumps with the spoon. Slowly pour the hot water and mix until the matcha dissolves. As you can see in the last picture I added some milk to the matcha. The texture is very smooth and creamy. The taste is exceptional! I can still taste the matcha and it is very fresh. If you want to drink this matcha alone, it might be bitter for you. I added Premium Organic Stevia Powder 30g - USDA Certified All Natural Alternative Sweetener 320x Sweeter than Sugar No Artificial additives & fillers ingredients, Industrial Grade Highly Concentrated Extract to make it sweeter. Without adding sugar. I have a BBQ party coming up and I cant wait to share this with everyone! I will serve it as tea, latte and sprinkle on ice cream. Don't be shy to explore different recipes with this matcha! Rating: 5.0 Product: Little Duck Organics, I Love Tiny Fruits, 100% Organic Freeze Dried Snacks, Apple and Banana, 6 Count Review: This super healthy snack is delightfully delicious. It is sweet but there is no added sugar. The only ingredients are banana and blueberry. It is certified organic and Non GMO. I do have to point out a whooping $20 a pouch is incredibly expensive. It's not surprising that the pouch is very light because the fruits are freeze dried. Also the ratio of banana to blueberry is like 3:10 which is uncalled for. If you can afford it definitely give it a try, you won't be disappointed in taste wise. The banana bits texture is similar to rice puffs or rice crispy. It is puffy and fun to bite into. While the blueberry are either crunchy or chewy. Rating: 4.0 Product: CHOMPS Grass Fed Beef Jerky Snack Sticks, Paleo & Keto Friendly, Whole30 Approved, Non-GMO Gluten & Sugar Free 100 Calorie Snacks, 1.15 Ounce Stick, Pack of 24 Review: Literally just bought this jerky and it has an expiration date of 1 month. Bought on july, expires august... The jalapeo jerky is more disappointing than the expiration date. The spice is bland and feels like its just pepper. This is not even spicy. Wheel shows right on the hot but this is definitely not hot at all. Rating: 1.0 Product: Japan Ceremonial 100% Wholesome Organic Matcha Green Tea Powder, Diet Drink, Detox, Energy Booster Review: First of all I want to thank the seller for shipping Jun Nippon Matcha directly to me. I received this product exchange for my honest and unbiased review and feedback The packaging was simple and efficient which I always come to appreciate. I am very sensitive and picky when it comes to matcha because every little detail count matters to me; The color, scent, texture and taste. Jun Nippon Matcha almost hit a perfect score: - The color of the Matcha was of a fresh bright spring green which I rate it 5 out of 5 - The scent was a light earthy green tea which received a 5 out of 5 - The texture is very smooth and had little to no clumps 5 out of 5 (thanks to the packaging as well). - The taste is definitely very green and smooth. Sweet at first sip. After taste was slightly bitter. However comparing it to the other ceremonial matcha that Ive tested it is a slightly lower quality. Therefore I gave it a 4 out of 5. Ive tried drinking the matcha as it is and Ive also mixed it with yogurt which tastes amazing. A sifter helped out a lot so its very necessary. The best way to get rid of clumps is with a sifter AND adding the hot water little by little as you mix in the cup or bowl. You should not just pour all the hot water in at once because that would form clumps. I also did the same with the yogurt. I used organic whole milk yogurt (unsweetened) because it is healthy and has a very thick and creamy texture. I find that the only kind of yogurt fit for this high quality matcha. I used about 5 table spoon of the yogurt and 2 teaspoon of matcha. I sprinkled a little amount of the matcha on top of the yogurt and mix and a little more and repeat. The result is a light creamy green yogurt treat. You can add a little bit of honey and mix well. You can consume the yogurt OR it can also be used for a face mask. Since matcha is anti-inflammatory, high in antioxidant and full of nutrient it is perfect for treating acne. It will also give the face a natural glow. Rating: 5.0 Product: Vanilla Bean Grinder, Whole Dried Vanilla Beans For Grinding Vanilla Powder Flakes Into Recipes, Drinks, Smoothies, Soups, Add Fresh Vanilla Flavor to Anything (2 Grinders) Review: These bourbon vanilla beans are from Madagascar. The process is dried then cut up into small chunks. Vanilla bean contains some minerals that the body needs, such as; magnesium, potassium and calcium. It is also known as an aphrodisiac. The vanilla chunks itself smells very intense and appetizing. They do have a slight liquorice aroma. I added some to my cinnamon milk tea and I could taste the fresh vanilla flavor. I had some residue left on the bottom of my cup after finishing and I scooped the remaining powder and just ate them. They were tasty and a bit chewy. I noticed that vanilla ice cream I purchased in the past had these small dark particles are actually the same as what Im getting right now. These vanilla chunks will come handy for upcoming Summer treats. Notice that there is a built in grinder. Its a simple and convenient to grind the chunks into fine powder. Sometimes when I grind the chunks, I get a couple pieces that I can chew on. Its not the best grinder but its really convenient. The way I use the grinder is just like traditional pepper shaker that has a grinding mechanism on the bottom. You twist a couple times facing down and viola. If you want to get more of a powder consistency you might want to use a different grinder or do it manually with mortar and pestle. Review:
This is the best of the extra virgin coconut oil products that I have tried.  The texture is rich and creamy, it's dissolves perfectly and it does not have hard clumps.  The fragrance is good and and it tastes fine.  I would recommend this brand to anyone looking for a good all purpose coconut oil.

5.0
Product:
Amazon Brand - Happy Belly Yogurt Trail Mix, 44 oz
Review:
This is even better than I thought it would be!  The nut is excellent.  It is basically good mixed nuts.  The dried fruits taste great.  They aren't too sweet, so even though I am diabetic I was able to eat them without my blood sugar going up too much.  Sweetened fruits can have a negative effect on me.  The yogurt drops don't taste like traditional yogurt, in my opinion they taste like white chocolate.  This is the best trail mixes that I have ever tried.  I would like to continue getting this.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Truvia Spoonable Natural Stevia Sweetener, 9.8 oz Jar
Review:
I have been using sugar substitutes for years.  This is the first time that I have tried Truvia.  I use Erythritol and Stevia separately a lot.  I like the taste of both even though Erythritol can have a cool aftertaste.  This is excellent for sweetening hot beverages.  It tastes good and melts quickly.  My only problem with it is that it doesn't melt easily in cold beverages.  I use this in my coffee and hot tea, but I don't like to use it in any cold beverages because there is usually a undissolved residue in the bottom.  This is a very good sugar substitute and I like the convenience of the spoonable container.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Yogi Tea - Vanilla Spice Perfect Energy - Energizes and Supports Focus - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total
Review:
If you love mint, then you will like this tea.  If you only like mint as an added flavor note, then this may be a bit too intense for you.  I enjoyed the flavor.  I had not had mint tea before, but I love lots of different teas.  I was surprised at how much it reminded me of eating food with chewing gum in your mouth if you eat anything with it.  I like mine sweet and it isn't bad with lemon if you like it that way.  The mint is dominant and strong, so it may not be suited to all tastes.  I didn't really get an energy burst from it, so I can't really comment on how that feels.  I probably wouldn't regularly buy it, but it isn't bad.  If you like mint, give it a try.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Amazon Brand - Happy Belly Sweetened Dried Mango Slices, 12 Ounce Pack of 2
Review:
These are very good quality dried mango slices.  The slices clearly come from ripe fruit that is process while fresh.  The texture is chewy and flexible instead of tough like some other brands.  The slices are also large rather than chopped up which makes them perfect for eating alone and easily chopped to add to other things.  The only problem that I have with them is the amount of sugar that they are coated in.  Mangoes are already a naturally sweet fruit and with so much sugar added they become more like eating candy than a good healthy treat.  My husband loves mangoes, but he thinks that these are too sweet.  We prefer less sugar on dried fruits in general and I like to get them unsweetened when possible.  Happy Belly has high quality products, so I would recommend that you give these a try if you like dried mangoes.
Rating:
3.0

Product:
Giant Crab Flavored Shrimp Chips (3 X 200g Boxes)
Review:
These are great! They taste just like prawn chips hard to tell difference even though they are crab. These are the same chips they use on the Pu-Pu platters here in Rhode Island.in some of the better Chinese restaurants. They are really easy to make and fun to watch as they grow in the oil. All you do is take a frying pan and put an inch of oil in, when oil is hot at about 350 drop these little wafers in and they will instantly grow to 3 to 4 times their size. They poof up and that is it, just remove them from oil and serve. Be careful to not make oil too hot as these burn easily. Everyone in my family loves these including my dogs and the parrot.

Review:

I then decided to make rice with it.  I used 2 cups of this with 1 cup Basmati rice and about 1/2 lb of  peeled raw shrimp, 1 tablespoon freeze dried shallots(Harmony house brand) , threw everything in pan and cooked it for the 10-15 minutes that the rice needed and wow!  It came out excellent! The flavor of coconut is there along with cilantro and slight hint of curry and tiny bit of heat.

I also used this as a base for an Indian chicken curry and have to say it made it much better than usual. I prefer the Indian style curry to Thai and this is just perfect in it. As a soup base I would recommend equal parts of homemade chicken stock as this stuff is overpowering otherwise. By the way I used Patak's mild curry paste with this. You can spice it up and add more heat as you like as the others are just too hot for my taste. The price is right and I like this size, you can refrigerate the leftovers or freeze it in small container.

Product:
 ECOTEAS Organic Yerba Mate Pure Loose Leaf 1 Pound (Pack of 3) 
Review:
Based on the current retail price for 3 one pound packages of $22.73, this product is fairly priced. I can buy it locally for $7.99 per pound at our local health food store.  It is a great tea "staple" to have on hand because you can mix it with other herbal, black or green teas.  It definitely gives you a non-jittery energy boost and it is an excellent source of chromium plus it has some iron, magnesium, niacin, zinc and riboflavin.

Please note this one major difference that I just picked up on:  The kind that I purchased is called "Green Energy" and it is packed with vitamins including riboflavin, niacin, iron, magnesium and zinc.  No chromium, however. It has 80 mg of caffeine.  As far as I can see, "Green Energy" is only available on Amazon as tea bags not loose leaf.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Celestial Seasonings Sugar Cookie Sleigh Ride Tea Bags, 20 ct
Review:
This tea is very tasty and has a wonderful, velvety texture in your mouth.  I am not sure how Celestial Seasonings accomplished this, but they have created buttery softness and wonderful sweetness in this enticing and aromatic caffeine free holiday tea.  Pair this with turbinado sugar and you have a delicious and soothing hot beverage.  I found this for $2.49 after the holidays at my local health food store.  Now I will have to stock up on more.  There are three other teas in the holiday selections - Nutcracker Sweet (with caffeine), Sugar Plum and Gingerbread Sweet (both caffeine-free herbal teas) and Candy Cane Lane - caffeine free green tea with other flavors.
Nutcracker Sweet is a flavorful mix of black tea, vanilla and other spices.  It has a little bite as compared with this flavor - most likely from the addition of black tea.  I have yet to try to the three other flavors.

5.0
Product:
Celestial Seasonings Tension Tamer Tea, 20 ct
Review:
This tea is like drinking a ginger-y lemon drop after you add your choice of sweetener. It is very flavorful and has already become a favorite at our house.  It is also a good tea to mix with black or green tea if you want to add some caffeine.  Since it's caffeine-free, it's very versatile.  It might even make a good lemonade style cold drink.  I'll test it out.
Happy Sipping!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Kashi Vive Probiotic Digestive Wellness Cereal, 12-Ounce Box (Pack of 4)
Review:
I tested out this cereal this morning. The taste was fine. It didn't have a lot of appealing crunch to it, however - more of a dull crunch. I would like to see if Kashi offers a similar cereal with more protein, since I found that this cereal actually made me hungry in a shorter period of time as compared with when I eat a piece of toasted Mestemacher whole grain German bread (also available on Amazon)slathered with Smart Balance and ground chia seeds (lots of good fat).  The serving size of Kashi Vive is 1 1/4 cups with 170 calories per serving, 12 grams of fiber, 2.5 grams of fat, 10 grams of sugar and 4 grams of protein.  Total carbs are 43 grams with net carbs of 31 grams, so still a healthy dose of carbs.  Mestemacher sunflower seed bread in comparison is densely packed with whole grains, 140 calories per slice, 3 grams of fat, 0 grams of sugar, 6 grams of dietary fiber, 23 grams of carbs, so 17 grams of net carbs and 5 grams of protein. The bread also has 15% of iron which is naturally occurring due to the whole grains.  By comparison, Kashi Vive has 8% of RDA of iron and 20% each of calcium and Vitamin D.  It has whole grain and sesame flour, but is not 100% whole grain.  It also contains wheat bran, rice and yellow corn meal.

It's all about moderation, and this cereal is great as another means of adding fiber, calcium and Vitamin D to your diet.  You may find this cereal at your local Big Lots for $2.80 per box.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Wholesome Organic Raw Blue Agave Nectar, Syrup, Low Glycemic Sweetener, Non GMO, 23.5 oz (Pack of 6)
Review:
I have been using Raw Agave Nectar as a sweetener almost exclusively for a number of months now.  I am even enrolled in the automatic subscription program, however I am in the process of re-thinking my decision. First off, there is quite a bit of information on the Internet that points to the fact that agave nectar is really a manufactured  and not a naturally occurring product - agave syrup - and that it is really a form of high fructose syrup.  There is also a concern about the plant source and how it could be potentially harmful to some individuals.  This product is expensive, and if you use it regularly, you may find that you are using quite a bit even if it is sweeter than sugar.  And if you are using a lot, shouldn't you be concerned about what you are really ingesting?
Go to [...] for some insight into this.  Could it be that the sweetener that I have grown to love (and it tastes great - like a maple syrup substitute) and that I use primarily throughout the day in tea and in yogurt/kefir is worse for me or no better than table sugar?  Should I be frowning when my son uses pancake syrup and I choose to use raw agave "nectar"?
I guess the old saying still rings true - if it sounds or tastes too good to be true, then maybe it just isn't as good as it appears to be.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Tofu Shirataki Noodles 10 Bags Angel Hair Shape
Review:
I bought 3 pasta shape varieties of these 8 oz. 2-serving bags of noodles in liquid in the refrigerated tofu section of our local grocery store for $1.99 per bag yesterday.  I am puzzled how they can be sold and shipped since the front of the bag states "perishable - keep refrigerated".  I opened the bag and smelled the noodles, and they did have a rather strange, strong odor.  I immediate poured the noodles into a strainer and then rinsed them under cold water.  I put them in a sauce pan with a small amount of Lorivo expeller-pressed peanut oil and let them sit for a while, stirring occasionally.  I decided to add Guilin chili sauce, garlic powder, powdered ginger, a small amount rice vinegar, water, 3 - 4 tsp. coconut sap sugar and 1/2 large can drained bean sprouts.  I warmed this mixture for awhile - maybe 20 or more minutes.  It worked!  I created a palatable side dish with a good- tasting broth and appealing consistency.

I served this side dish with broiled tuna, mahi mahi, and a Spring greens salad mix with balsamic vinegar and olive oil.
I wish that these noodles were available in larger sized bags at a lower price per serving, but $1 per person for two modest serving sizes per bag isn't outrageous unless you compare this with the cost of regular pasta.  I added the bean sprouts because the noodles alone didn't look like enough food for 3 people, and I thought that adding bean sprouts would offset any texture issues with the noodles. This recipe has now worked out twice with no real concern about cooking time for the noodles. Maybe the vinegar is the key, but the noodles are just like any other noodles when prepared this way and they make a great noodles with Asian-style broth meal or side dish.  And finally ... a use for those canned bean sprouts!

Update:  I have now mixed these with baked tofu and Asian-style sauce. That combo worked out great.  Also I took the wide noodles, rinsed them and then put them in spaghetti sauce to simmer.  They tasted fine. Texture-wise, they will always be somewhat slimy and slippery and not al dente like well-prepared pasta, but otherwise, they worked out well. Just remember - just 40 calories - in an entire bag! And next to no carbohydrates!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Nature's Way Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil- Pure, Cold-pressed, Organic, Non-GMO, Gluten-free- 16 Ounce
Review:
This coconut oil is an excellent multi-purpose product.  I have used it for cooking, broiling, eating by the spoonful and as a skin moisturizer and massage oil.
Last night I put a few pats of this coconut oil on salmon with a salt and herb mix.  I broiled the salmon and it tasted amazing.  The coconut oil definitely enhanced the flavor.
I have been using this oil for frying eggs as well.  It does not seem to burn as quickly as olive oil or butter and it also seems that less is needed for frying - probably since it's easier to use small amounts since it is in solid form.
This coconut oil also worked well for sauteing tofu and broccoli with Bragg's liquid unfermented soy.
It's also tasty on a baked potato and I find that I can skip the salt and still enjoy the flavor.  You can also add it to rice or rice and beans or french fries for a tropical splash of flavor.
I combined this coconut oil with olive oil to saute vegetables for a pasta dish and it worked beautifully.
It has mild, fresh flavor and a little seems to go a long way.

April 19, 2012

Still loving this coconut oil.  It tastes great so you could literally eat a spoonful or two if you were hungry and needed instant energy.
I packed it for a trip to Florida.  It was solid when I arrived, but liquified once I hit the warmer weather.
It also works great in a hot bath for instant moisturizing and it's the perfect after sun moisturizer.  It smells so good that you could use it as a very mild perfume and moisturizer just by rubbing it into your arms and legs until the oil is absorbed - seriously!
Rating:
5.0
