Product:
Wild Planet, Wild Pink Shrimp,  4 Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:
After doing a lot of research on farm raised shrimp (the kind prevalent at the grocery store and in cans anymore) I have been looking for alternatives.  These shrimp are sustainably wild caught so you don't have to worry about shrimp raised in a cesspool of antibiotics, bacteria etc.  They are wonderful and the price is right.

I noticed a lot of reviews mentioning a fishy taste.  Because canned shrimp are cooked during the canning process they can taste very strong.  Canned shrimp should always be rinsed!  Empty into a fine mesh collander and *gently* rinse under nice cool water.  Shake gently a couple times and then tap them out on a couple of clean paper towels.  The flavor of these when rinsed is absolutely 5 stars.  Mild, delicate, but with that nice texture for salads and small sandwiches.

If you've been eating what amounts to catfood labeled "canned shrimp" you will be delighted by this brand.  But always gently rinse them first.

5.0

These Artichoke hearts are consistently tasty and of high quality and having them quartered for me is also a great benefit and value.  I love them.

Oregon Fruit Products has been in business for many years and (I believe) they are committed to high quality.  Although I don't believe that these Cherries are "Organic" I still trust Oregon Fruit Products to use the most sustainable methods available. Product:

Review:
I tried this cake mix and it came out lacking.  I've tried several brands of gluten free cake mixes and this one was second from the worst.  It was dry and the texture was not great.

I used it to make a gluten-free pineapple upside down cake and we also had a non gluten-free one and not only could you tell the difference, no one wanted the gluten free version.  If you have to dabble with the cake mix so much, then its not a successful cake mix IMHO.  Otherwise, why not just get a good gluten free baking book and make one from scratch?

Much better luck with Pamela's mixes and Kinnikinnick.  I don't think Kinnikinnick has a yellow cake mix, but they do have white and chocolate...and you can't tell they are gluten-free in the least.

Am not planning on buying this mix again, unless they improve it.

There is definitely a good garlic and onion flavor and I could see using this on grilled chicken or as a spice when you make potatoes in those sealed  bags over the grill.  A definite MUST for camping and grilling events and weekends.

Product:
Annie's Gluten Free  Rice Pasta & Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese, 12 Boxes, 6oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
I generally like Annie's products and really appreciate what they are trying to do, especially in offering gluten-free items.  That being said, I tried this Mac & Cheese made with rice pasta and was seriously underwhelmed.

For one thing, there weren't that many servings, especially if you are making this a main part of your meal.  Secondly, the cheese mix was very bland.  I had to doll it up with pepper and even some garlic salt before I could eat any of it.  Even then...there is no way this tastes in any way, shape, or form like regular Mac & Cheese.

The rice pasta cooked up nicely, which is a plus, but I would never use the cheese mix again.  So I guess I might as well, at that point, buy my own rice pasta and mix up my own cheesy mixture to go over it.  Takes more work, but why use something convenient like Mac & Cheese in a box if you don't end up enjoying the end product?

Definitely a pass.  Sadly.  If Annie's takes it back to the drawing board and makes the cheesy mix something tastier I would be willing to give it a second try.

Product:
 Peanut Butter & Co. The Bees Knees (Honey) Peanut Butter, Gluten Free, 16 oz Jars (Pack of 6) 
Review:
I bought this on a whim and have now have started buying it on a regular basis.  The white chocolate flavor paired with the peanut butter is marvelous.  However, if you are looking for an overwhelming chocolate flavor then this might not be for you, because its a subtle mix.

I've used this on waffles, pancakes, toast, crackers and even made wraps out of it.  You really don't need to add jam when you use this flavored peanut better.  In fact, except for raspberry, jams don't always go with this flavor combo.

The peanut butter is nice and smooth and not too sugary.  I'm glad I found this brand and, so far, this is my favorite one...save for the maple one they also make that comes in a close second.

Recommended for both kids and adults.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Peanut Butter & Co. The Bees Knees (Honey) Peanut Butter, Gluten Free, 16 oz Jars (Pack of 6) 
Review:
When you eat a lot of peanut butter, you can get tired of the same old same old.  Then you take a chance on something new on the shelf and go...mmmm...where has THIS been?

I bought this Mighty Maple peanut butter because it looked interesting.  I also bought the White Chocolate one at the same time.  I actually prefer the White Chocolate flavor slightly over this one, but the maple-flavored peanut butter is pretty good.  I think it's actually tad sweeter tasting than the white chocolate one.

I have used this on toast, in wraps, and on crackers.  You really don't need any jam or honey when you use these flavored peanut butters.  The only thing I find missing with this one (and the other) is that I tend to like crunchy peanut butter, but for a smooth one...this comes in a close second to the Peanut Butter & Co White Chocolate in my opinion.

I think the chocolate flavors might appeal more to kids, and the maple more to adults.

I aim to try this one out when making peanut butter candy for the holiday season.

4.0

 Lakewood Organic PURE Black Cherry Juice, 32-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 6) 
Review:
This black cherry juice is postively wonderful tasting.  It isn't too sweet or too tart and honestly tastes like you're eating black cherries...a terrific treat!  I also deeply appreciate that its organic and doesn't have all those added sugars like so many other juices out there.  Sure, this is more expensive, but its well worth it.

Cherries, like blueberries and blackberries and the like, are really really wonderful for your health.  I either drink this straight or mix it with sparkling water and make myself a tasty and good-for-you black cherry "soda."  It is also a nice juice to use for making punch for a party.

Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Spaghetti with Spinach, 12 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I have tried many different kinds of gluten free pasta and Tinkyada absolutely makes the very best.  Not only does it cook like regular spiral pasta, but if you don't tell anyone they really can't tell its not gluten pasta.  I have a recipe I like to make that calls for spiral pasta and despaired of finding anything that would work, but I tried this one and it was great.  I took it to a picnic and, as I said, if I hadn't told the people it was gluten free (for my gluten free friends) they wouldn't have known.

This gluten free spiral pasta also does come in the veggie colored spirals, which is how I make a favorite pasta dish.  But it works just as well with these regular spirals, if not looking quite so colorful.

I cook these spiral noodles as recommended on the package, but I also pull some out to check for the appropriate level of doneness, as I prefer them not to be mushy.  Rinse them off and cool down and add your chopped veggies, olives, pickled artichokes, maybe some pepperoni and onions, etc and some kind of dressing such as Italian and then you can keep in the fridge. Review:
I'm sorry, I love Strawberry/Rhubarb, but this is SUGAR thinned w/a hint of strawberry/rhubarb. If I didn't know better the stuff was taken from a #10 mass produced can (maybe in small packets for restaurants, etc) and filled with this jar. Then sealed it, slapped on a cheap stick on/or made it themselves off the pc.  I don't know but I am very disappointed.
Save your money unless this is the kind of stuff your looking for, then go to Cisco (restaurant supplies) and buy a #10 can for $25.00.
I grew up on a farm/dairy where my grandmother made this (preserves only) and it was thick, freshly cut, ripened rhubarb/strawberries and she refused to sell it. She would donate to church functions however (down by the Rio Grande).
Small batches may be true, but I am guessing it has to do with the amount of jars they can get into a home canner.

Review:
The chocolate cookies come in a huge, ice-packing container. The ribbon and gift wrapping are outstanding also: can't beat them.
The name rings of 'High Dollar'.
That said, I was very disappointed in how SMALL the cookies are. I don't expect one of those huge chocolate-gooey ones from Ur grocery store, but come'on! I think I'd save a bunch of do-ra-me if I get some good OTC bread/cookies in a tin, etal. They have them in the big retail chains, or Rx stores. Take those cookies, wrap them on your own wrap (gift wrapped by U ALWAYS impresses the receiver!>.at least me...it doesn't matter how it comes out; the wrapping, it's the thought someone would make the 'try') Hint: kids and husbands.
Anyway, that's my opinion. $ is hard to come by, and as great-granddad use to say...'it all turns out the same way...and the same end.'
Rating:

Product:
Ferrero Rocher Fine Hazelnut Chocolates, Chocolate Gift Box, Diamond, 48 Count, 21.2oz
Review:
They receive 3*. The price purchase is high-dollar.  The (hazelnut) chocolate has multiple flavors. Too many in my opinion, i.e., too many cooks in the kitchen spoil the food. The different flavors compete with each other for taste (dominance).  The nut overwhelms any chocolate and the cracked mixed nuts on the outside of the chocolate add distraction.
It ends up (in my opinion) as a soft (gooey) sweet 'something' with complex flavors.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Hills Bros Cappuccino, French Vanilla, 16 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
If you follow the instructions on the box, you WILL be disappointed! To make it taste as 'rich'
 as a cappuccino should taste, you have to DOUBLE the amount of mocha. It's very difficult to mix w/o making a mess. No matter how you make the brew you're going to have to break up a bunch of lumps of it; that didn't get mixed into the water, and that will cause a mess. Doing it inside a cup/mug you are going to have residue mocha marks all over the sides and top edges. You can't help it IF you wish to just drink a good cup of hot choc.
The best way I was able to use to accomplish the recipe w/o the mess on the sides of the mug, etc., was to put the steaming hot water in a blender, then set it on mix, putting the cappuccino slowly; you don't want the mix to hit the bottom! Once you get all the mixture in the hot water, and setting it on stir/blend, place the top on quickly and hit the fastest button you have on your blender.  Keep it there until you see no powder on the sides or the bottom, and no lumps in the water.
I made the mixture, usng the double mixture w/hot milk, coz' if you use water, as they say, all you are going to get is muddy water (in my opinion). Right after I see the mixture is about hot choc. should look/a little 'thick' not watery, I immediately pour the mix into a mug and place the balance in a container w/easy spout and stick it in the fridge.
When you take the remainder of the mixture you have left in the fridge, no matter how well you blended it, some of the cappuccino will have settled on the bottom. You will have to shake the container vigoriously, turning it upside down, then put it in your mug(s) and 'nuke'.
A good cup of hot choc, I like, is somewhat a little thicker than milk, and leaves a froth on the top (so you can add your marshmellows; however, this brand, cappuccino, isn't going to work w/the addition.
Now, all that I have written is what you will have to do no matter the brand name or flavor, size of mixture, etc., you are going to have the same issues that I have written.....that is what you get when you go 'instant'.
The ole' fashioned way of making hot choc. is my preferred method. You get your small pot, pour the milk into it and get it to boiling. Slowly had your hot chocolate. You stir in the pot using the same method I have written and you are going to have a good cup of hot choc.
Hot choc. should be made w/whole milk, but not h.and h.  Hot choc. is a cup of 'joy' for any time you wish to feel special....whether it be by yourself, wiith pet, or family. It's special. Taking the time to do it right makes the occasion even more enjoyable...if you don't hurry. Making hot choc. can't be rushed.
Rating:
2.0

It's milk and dark choc. (2 different) and 1 with a caramel ctr.
I didn't count but there was a LOT of candies.

  However, I am updating my review because I want to point out that this product is sold for $8.99 on their website with a discounted price for shipping on multiple items.  That price puts it right in line with a very fair price point.  If you go through Amazon, you pay for the convenience and that's okay as well!

I personally did not have a taste for this particular product.  My love for coconut must not be that deep!  I understand we all have our own tastes and some are acquired. That was on her storm prep list!  During a recent hurricane, I had these sent to my sister. She was able to pass them out to neighbors who were all helping each other clean up and rebuild the destruction. They were a welcome sight! The chips were fresh and the individual bags made it so convenient!  Utz chips have been around for years and their name equals quality! So whether you want a portion controlled snack, preparing for a party or like my mom, a storm, this is a great choice!

Then the next batch I ordered was bad, even though the expiration date was not until 2016! The cream and liquid had gone sour and curdled, meaning they separated into a pulp and clear water and the water tasted off. It would not dissolve in coffee. Amazon refunded me and I ordered another batch. It came in different packaging (and also a 2016 expiration date) but was the same pulp/water consistency and sour taste. Although very convenient in small boxes, as it lasts and does not go bad, provided it is good when you first receive it, if you only use a little each day, but watch out if you get a 25-pack order, like I did, and they are all trash. You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

Product:
Raw Shelled Pumpkin Seeds - Pepitas, 2 Pound
Review:
I could not find these locally, but of course, I did find them on amazon.com!  Raw seeds are flexible.  Most of the time, I  just eat them raw, because I'm on a salt-restricted diet.  On the rare occasions I want them roasted, I can do that wihout adding any salt.  When making them up for guests, I can add sea salt before roasting.  That's what I mean by "flexible".  Raw seeds can be kept  refrigerated for 1-2 months in a tightly sealed container without loss of flavor, but frozen can be kept for a year.

Not only are they flexible, but they are outstandingly good!  I use them a lot in vegetable salads, but sometimes I just eat a handful or two as a light snack. If you want to dry roast your own, here's how I do it: Heat oven to its lowest temperature(160-170 degrees F.  Spread seeds in a single layer on a cookie sheet and roast for 15-20 minutes.  Higher temperature will cause break down of fats, creating free radicals you don't want.  (Commercially roasted are generally heated to much higher temps)  Remember, too, that roasted seeds have a shorter shelf life than raw.  So there you have it.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Spicy World Shredded Desiccated Unsweetened Coconut, 2 Pound
Review:
I ordered the wrong product.  What I should have ordered was coconut MILK powder.  However, once I opened it and discovered my error, I decided to use it in some of my Indian recipes.  It's just fine  in curries and other things, like berry or other smoothies where some texture is okay.  I  can use it also in baking and on icings that I might have used flaked coconut on.  It won't be wasted, but if you plan to use it like milk, be sure before ordering

Review:
I usually do some research before buying what for me is a new product.  I bought a small amount in a local store, and it was good, so then I researched prices, locally and on Amazon.com.  I have only used almond flour so far for baking gluten free cookies, but have some other recipes I want to try, which means that I will be using it in larger amounts.  Not only was the price better (plus  Amazon's Prime program two-day delivery), but I found that Anthony's Almond flour tasted richer (fresher?).  With all these pluses -  fresher, faster delivery, richer taste - I'm really very happy with it.

I recommend Anthony's Almonds Blanched Almond Flour for anyone who loves to bake, whether regular or gluten-free.

First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Emerald Cocoa Roast Almonds, Dark Chocolate, 10 oz Canister (Pack of 4) Review: These Emerald "Cocoa Roast Almonds" are a low carb snack that bring a bit of dark chocolate flavor to good tasting almonds. These do have artificial sweeteners, but for those of us that have to watch our sugar intake, this is a very viable treat. Highly Recommended! CFH Rating: 4.0 Product: thinkThin BITES 100 Calorie Chocolate Toffee Nut, Gluten Free, 5-Count (0.88-Ounce) Bars (Pack of 6) Review: These thinkThin "100 Chocolate Toffee Nut Bites" are good tasting and filling. These are not as pictured on the box, but are rather a soft cake with a chocolate coating. The taste is better than most "diet" snacks and they are also diabetic friendly at less than 6 Net Carbs per bar and only 100 Calories. These do contain Maltitol and that can cause "gastric distress" that varies in severity from person to person, so you might want to see how these effect you before enjoying one of these and heading out to your weekly Book Club meeting. Recommended! I do like thinkThin BITES 100 Calorie Cookies and Cream, 5-Count, 4.4-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) CFH Rating: 4.0 Product: Nature Valley Granola Bars, Sweet and Salty Nut, Roasted Mixed Nut, 7.4 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: These Nature Valley "Sweet & Salty Nut Granola Bars" are good for between meal snacks and are fairly filling. While not very big, these bars pack a lot of flavor and energy that make them a real treat and I like that my kids will eat these in place of a candy bar. The only issue with these is that the bottom peanut butter layer can be come very soft and messy when heated up by a warm day of from being held in the hand too long, but I have learned to eat these held in the open wrapper to avoid the problem. My family also enjoys Nature Valley Sweet & Salty Nut Granola Bars, Peanut, 6-Count Boxes (Pack of 12) Recommended! CFH Rating: 4.0 Product: Blue Diamond Almonds, Bold Jalapeno Smokehouse, 6 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: The Blue Diamond Jalapeno Smokehouse Almonds are great tasting, with a strong smoky flavor and a nice jalapeno bite. These have a decent amount of spicy heat to them, but it isn't too overpowering. My wife picked these up for a long road trip and they were the first snack to get finished up. Highly Recommended! CFH Rating: 5.0 Product: Kashi TLC Chewy Granola Bar, Peanut Peanut Butter, 1.2oz 6-Count Bars(Pack of 6) Review: These Kashi Layered Granola Bars, Dark Chocolate Coconut are quite good and make great between meal snacks. I keep these in my desk drawer to keep my blood sugar up if I should miss lunch for whatever reason. Highly Recommended! CFH Rating: 5.0 Product: HERSHEY'S Dark Chocolate Candy Bars,Sugar Free, 3 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: Hershey's Sugar Free Dark Chocolate candy bars tastes very close to the full sugar version. Dark Chocolate was always one of my favorite treats before coming a Type 2 diabetic, so it is great being able to have it again in a sugar free version. There is a little bit of an after taste with these but dark chocolate is usually bitter so it isn't really an issue for me (but my wife says she notices more than I do). I should mention that eating too many of these (more than 3 or 4) does cause me some "gastric distress", so you might want to try them at home before eating a bunch while out in public. Recommended Rating: 5.0 Product: FiberPlus Antioxidant Bars, Chocolate Chip, 5-Count Bars 1.2 oz(Pack of 12) Review: The Kellogg's Chocolate Chip "FiberPlus Antioxidant Bars" are surprisingly good tasting and are very filling. My wife bought me these to use as snack bars since I try to keep my total Carb intake as low as possible, and the high fiber content gives these each of these about 17 Net Carbs. They also have 120 Calories and about 2g of Protein. The flavor is a lot better than most of other high fiber snack bars I have tried and these will become one of my regular treats. Highly Recommended! I also like FiberPlus Antioxidant Bars, Dark Chocolate Almond, 5-Count Bars (Pack of 12). Product:
 Back To Nature Organic Cherry Vanilla Granola, 12-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6)
Review:
The crunchy oats and tart cherries in this granola will steal your heart. The addition of vanilla also makes this cereal more unique. I like that this is organic - even the vanilla is organic. You will also like the fact that you are eating 34g of whole grains per serving. What can I say? I love this granola. It is possibly the best granola on the planet.

~The Rebecca Review
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Spectrum Culinary Organic Unrefined Virgin Coconut Oil, 14 fl. oz. (Pack of 3)
Review:
As far as taste goes this is the best coconut oil I've tried. It has a slightly sweet flavor and melts very easily in coffee. I started using this daily by putting one tablespoon in my coffee. Imagine my surprise when I stepped on my scale and was five pounds lighter. I'd heard that coconut oil helped to increase the metabolism but I didn't realize eating one bottle of coconut oil would help me lose five pounds. It seems ironic that you could lose fat by eating fat but that really seems to be what happened. I also noticed my brain functioning better and I seem more alert and in a good mood. This coconut oil can be used for medium heat cooking as well. It is unrefined, organic and virgin. What more can you wish for? I'll be buying this again.

~The Rebecca Review
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tazo Organic Baked Cinnamon Apple Herbal Infusion, Caffeine Free, 20-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
As someone who has formerly raved about Tazo's Teas I can say that my first experience with this tea was less than satisfactory. Using two teabags with 12 ounces of water produced a flavorless tea that didn't even have the hint of cinnamon let alone the fragrance of apples. Realizing that the weakness of the tea was the reason for my dissatisfaction I tried brewing the tea by using four teabags and 12 ounces of water. This produced a very acceptable tea with a full-bodied taste and the delicious fragrance of freshly picked apples. The ingredients in this tea include: African Rooibos, cinnamon, natural flavors, apple and chamomile. While this tea is not a five-star tea it is at least slightly comforting in the winter and if you brew it for longer than you would normally brew tea then you might find it to be delicious instead of disappointing.

~The Rebecca Review
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Nature's Path Organic Chewy Granola Bars, Sunny Hemp Plus, 7.4 Ounce Box (Pack of 6)
Review:
I hate making breakfast so these bars are perfect for winter mornings. Why save the flavor of pumpkin and spice for only the holiday season? These are delicious year round. They do however contain quite a bit of sugar so maybe they should be a treat and not a staple. Either way I'm happy when I eat one because these are a source of Omega-3. I can't see why anyone would say these are bland. They are bursting with flavor. My box says best before OCT 2012 so it is a fresh box. I could see how these would not taste good if they were stale.

~The Rebecca Review
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Newman's Own Organics Organic Premium Chocolate Bar, Dark 54% Cocoa, 2.25-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12)
Review:
So many dark chocolates are bitter or sour. Newman's Own Organics Dark Chocolate is as near perfect as a dark chocolate can be. It is creamy and dreamy and will give you the most seductive chocolate experience of your life. It really is that good. I also like that it is not overly sweet but just sweet enough to satisfy your craving. The vanilla flavor is also very subtle. Usually I'd say try a bar before you buy 12 but this time I'm saying buy 12 so you don't run out.

~The Rebecca Review
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Numi Organic Tea Golden Chai, Full Leaf Black Tea, 18-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 3)
Review:
I'm used to drinking much stronger flavored chai teas so this one seemed like it wasn't spicy at all. You can barely taste the ginger. I think this tea would be much better if they added some peppercorns which is traditional. What this tastes like is a weak black tea with little flavor. I normally love Numi teas but this one seems too weak for me and I used two teabags per mug. So if you like stronger chai teas this may not suit you. It needs a lot more spices in my opinion.

~The Rebecca Review
Rating:
3.0
Product:
ALMOND JOY, Chocolate Coconut Candy Bar (Pack of 36)
Review:
Part of my husband's job is to spoil his clients by bringing them cakes or candy or sometimes even lunch. I usually know what he is buying because he brings home the empty boxes (like Twinkie boxes) for recycling. I then of course have to look at the empty boxes wishing he would have saved me one treat. Well finally he did remember to bring me two Almond Joys. I must say they are one of my favorite chocolate candies. The crunch of the almond goes so well with the smooth chewy coconut all encased in a bliss of melting chocolate. One bite and you are hooked.

~The Rebecca Review

Eden Foods Organic Red Quinoa, 16 Ounces
Review:
The word "Organic" in the product title is misleading because the product is not marked USDA Organic. As I see it, the wording is intended to deceive. Why bother with Eden when Alter Eco and other brands are certified and labeled as USDA Organic. While it is true that the Eden product states "OCIA Certified Organic", the USDA Organic label is missing. As a consumer, I have tried both brands, and I prefer the one that's properly labeled.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Grassfed Organic Cultured Ghee 14 Oz. - Pure Indian Foods(R) Brand
Review:
The uncultured ghee consistently caused me diarrhea. This cultured ghee has been tolerable. The following is a suggested explanation on the product website:

"Why Cultured Ghee? Milk contains lactose, a natural sugar which gives it that delicate sweet taste. In order for the body to breakdown lactose into its basic components of simple sugars called glucose and galactose, an enzyme called lactase must be present. Many people lack this valuable enzyme in their digestive system causing a common digestive problem known as lactose intolerance. In order to metabolize lactose, lactase must always be present. During the natural bacterial fermentation process of milk or cream, lactose is converted into lactic acid. This makes for a much more digestible product for many people. Remember, generally ghee does not cause a problem with lactose intolerance. This is because during the ghee making process, the lactose is removed even if the butter used to make the ghee was not made from fermented cream."

The product website also states: "Fermentation process produces flavor compounds such as diacetyl, giving this product a more buttery taste. Many people prefer the taste and aroma of freshly fermented foods."

Diacetyl however is not entirely safe. In particular, its vapors are dangerous, as is noted on Wikipedia. Chronic exposure to its vapors is associated with lung disease and Alzheimer's. Technically, diacetyl can be removed, but there is no indication of PureIndianFoods doing this. Other similar compounds as a result of fermentation may also exist, but I can't be sure. As such, you probably do not want to heat this product much, or you may breathe in the diacetyl vapors. Eating the limited amount of diacetyl should probably be quite fine, however.

My LDL cholesterol rose substantially after eating this product for a few weeks. This is not unexpected considering the saturated fatty acid profile of the product. Although my HDL cholesterol also rose, I would rather not get in the LDL danger zone. Of course this is not enough evidence for any connection, but one may very well exist. If you decide to use it regularly, I recommend keeping track of all available lipid level indicators routinely.

On the positive side, vegetables do taste better with ghee. I didn't cook with the ghee, however, and only added it later.
Rating:
3.0
</similarpairs>

If you want particular M&M colors you can go to their website and order the colors you want--almost any color.  You can also have them printed with names if you like.  It's very expensive, but it could be worth it to you.  I ordered a bunch of Tiffany Blue and Frosted White M&M's as part of wedding favors.  They were very unique.

Edited to Add:  And now Amazon has them in stock.  Just received a box today and I am delighted.  In my opinion, this is the best flavor.

Product:
Pocky Biscuit Stick, Strawberry, 2.47 Ounce (Pack of 10)
Review:
I first had these in Japan fifteen years ago.  I always looked forward to a package of Pocky when I traveled to Japan.  Seriously, these were a whole lot better than a typical Japanese treat of a roll filled with red bean paste.  There just weren't many chocolate treats in Japan at that time.  And then, they started appearing in Asian grocery stores in this country.  Only the small boxes.  It was nice to buy a box now and then to remind me of Japan.  But now, they are showing up in Walmart and Costco.  Even though they are delicious they are not the treat they used to be--for me.

These seem a little different from the ones in Japan.  The chocolate is the same and the size is the same, but I think the stick is more pretzel-like in Japan.  They are still very good and I think I could eat them all day If I let myself buy one of the giant packages like the one above.

These were fun to look forward to in Japan or to buy in Asian supermarkets in this country to remind me of Japan.  They are good, but we have so many different treat choices in the U.S. that these don't seem that special now that they are everywhere.  Still, they might be different enough from the usual treats to make it big in the U.S.  Definitely worth trying!

I wish they were a little saltier and less sweet, but overall they are good.  I keep a box in my car so I can avoid fast food.

I was always tempted by the barrels, but managed to stay away from that big size.  I rarely buy them anymore because they are so calorie laden.  But, when I walk by them in the grocery store I can hear them call my name.  I am taken back to my Utz Cheese Ball days and have many happy memories.

If you like the real green tea that is served in Japan then you will be very disappointed in this tea.

This green tea is nothing like the flavorful, thick, green tea I have been served many times in Japan.  Now, I don't expect thick from a tea bag, but
I do expect some green tea flavor. There isn't any of that flavor in this.

Maybe this green tea is better for you than the fragrant authentic green tea beause it has so much less caffeine.  I don't know, but for me it is very boring.  Anybody want 18 tea bags?

I am sorry to hear that some people received crumbs instead of cookies.  That's a shame.  If they had received whole cookies they would have been leaving great reviews like I am.  These are rich and delicious.  I have a family cookie recipe we call "Almond Crescents".  They look different, but they taste almost exactly like these wonderful cookiers even though we usually use finely chopped almonds when we make then.  These have chunks of pecans in them.  They really do melt in your mouth if you let them last that long.  Very buttery tasting.  They are crumbly, but if you are careful you will get every bite and not make a mess.

For once, I haven't looked at the calories.  It's the holidays.  I don't care.

I bought my tin at Costco for a lot less than they are being sold for here.  You pay something for the convenience of mailing, but it's not worth it if they come as a can of crumbs.  I would probably still eat them and love them.

Product:
Nutiva Organic Coconut Manna from Fresh, non-GMO, Sustainably Farmed Coconuts, 15-ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
****
This Nutiva Organic Coconut Manna is actually a type of coconut cream or coconut butter NOT coconut oil. The difference is that the cream or butter is much thicker, has whole coconut in it, and a very strong coconut flavor. You would not use the coconut manna for cooking. It is used more as a spread (which you wouldn't usually do with coconut oil) or can even be eaten by itself or made into a candy (because it is slightly sweet). It can be added to smoothies or used in many other creative ways. Think of it like whole coconut meat in a creamy form.

The reason I did not give this coconut manna five stars is because it is packaged in a difficult way. First of all, the container is plastic. In order to use the coconut manna, the container must be heated gradually to a very warm room temperature (say 80 degrees, I'd think) or else put in hot water for 30 minutes, stirred, and left in hot water for 30 more minutes. This is very inconvenient, plus the plastic container is not good for all of the repeated heatings.

Other than that, it's a great product. It is very slightly sweet and tastes strongly like coconut. The consistency is a bit gritty or grainy due to part of the coconut flesh that is powder and has been reconstituted, but I found that fine, not off-putting at all. It's great all by itself, added to smoothies, or put into the freezer in molds for a whole foods raw candy.

Recommended.
****

Product:
The Good Bean Chickpea Snacks, Sea Salt, Gluten and Nut Free, 2.5-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
*****
These are my very favorite snacks, and I like this flavor. My favorite flavor is the the smoky chili & lime followed by the sweet cinnamon. Still, these are good! They are crunchy too. If you like to munch on simple wholesome snacks, you'll like this one, I think.

Each bag comes with two servings in it for a total of (if you eat both servings, which I do) 280 calories, 4g fat, 46g carbohydrates, and 14g protein. This snack is gluten-free and uses non-gmo garbanzo beans. The ingredients are roasted chickpeas, evaporated can juice (ie, sugar), coarse salt, gum arabic, expeller-pressed canola oil (non-gmo), and Vitamin E. Half of the package (or one serving) isn't that much food, plus then you have the problem of keeping the rest of the package crunchy--if you leave them out in a bowl they will be not so crunchy the next day. I'm not sure why they add the sugar, but the taste is really fantastic without being sweet, so maybe it keeps them from being bitter.

Sometimes if I just want to have a delicious snack and I'm hungry and able to handle the carbs, I have these. They take a while to eat (they can be a bit hard on your teeth as they are very, very crunchy) and fill you up, plus if you drink lots of water (or other beverage) with it, you'll be really full afterwards.

They can be purchased alone in a six-pack here or as part of the sampler set. I have noticed mixed reviews here, so they are not to everyone's tastes; if you're not sure you'll like them, you can always order them as part of the sampler.

Highly recommended.
*****

Product:
Bare Natural Apple Chips, Cinnamon, Gluten Free + Baked, Single Serve Bag - 1.7 Oz (10 Count)
Review:
*****
These apple chips are tart, very crispy, and yummy! They don't have the processed or chemically taste that some dried apples have. They also are not soggy at all--I like my apple chips very crispy! They are 100% certified organic, baked with no added sugar, no preservatives or chemicals, no pesticides or herbicides, gluten free, and made from Washington State apples with five apples in every bag. These are a truly healthy and delicious snack.

These particular chips are only just barely sweet, mostly tart. If you want sweet apple chips, you can buy Fuji apple chips from the same company that are just as crisp and good. I like to mix both together for a sweet-tart combo.

I would recommend (and it's way more economical) to buy these in bulk. If you like tart apples at all, and you like your chips crispy, then you have nothing to lose.

Note: Each of the many dried fruits that are prepared and processed by Bare Fruits--each one is different--some are chewy, some crispy, but all are natural and vary as the natural fruits vary. In my opinion, their brand would tend to appeal to people who like things without added sugars and preservatives and whose taste buds and teeth can handle less processed food. The apple chips are very easy on the teeth, though...just so you know, not every product is like that

Highly recommended.
*****

Product:
Yogi Tea - Green Tea Super Antioxidant - Helps Reduce Free Radicals - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total
Review:
*****
What a wonderful tea this is! Herb-y tasting in a good way, and slightly sweet (from the licorice root) with lemongrass overtones and jasmine reminisces. This Green Tea Super Anti-Oxidant from Yogi Tea is one of my favorite teas. It has everything to make it a perfect everyday green tea. It is made from Organic Lemongrass, Organic Green Tea Leaf, Organic Licorice Root, Jasmine Green Tea Leaf, Organic Alfalfa Leaf, Organic Burdock Root, Organic Dandelion Root, Grapeseed Extract, Irish Moss Powder, and Emblic Fruit (Amla) Extract.

Green Tea Super Anti-Oxidant comes with an expiration date (a good thing, because it's not full of preservatives, plus you can tell if it is fresh). Yogi Tea seems to be another company (like Numi, Aspen, Traditional Medicinals) that values sustainable and healthy practices. Their web site, yogitea.com, is beautifully designed, with info about each tea they make.

According to Yogi Tea, this tea is 80% organic and is intended combat the damage of free radicals in the body that accelerate aging. It contains 21mg of caffeine (compared to 90mg in an 8oz cup of coffee).

Yogi Green Tea Super Anti-Oxidant makes me glad every day that I stopped drinking coffee and switched to teas---it's that good! If you've only tried commercial brands like Stash and Celestial Seasoning, and you think you don't like tea because they taste fake and full of strong flavorings, then you owe it to yourself to give this tea a try. If you enjoy Stash and Celestial Seasonings, love their strong flavors, and disagree with me, you may not like this tea as it is subtle and a very different tea-drinking experience. You'll know what type of tea drinker you are!

Highly recommended.
*****
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Yogi Tea - Green Tea Super Antioxidant - Helps Reduce Free Radicals - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total
Review:
*****

This Organic Green Tea Kombucha Decaf from Yogi Tea is certainly unique. It tastes like a mixture of passion fruit, plum, ginger, and green tea. It is mild, and not bitter at all, even when you leave the tea bag in the whole time you drink the tea, as I do. Best of all, it is an easy, convenient way of benefiting from Kombucha, if you don't grow your own (and I don't anymore, as it is not easy or convenient for me). I have never before obtained my Kombucha from a tea; this is a tasty way to do so.

I am definitely impressed with this tea and with Yogi Teas in general. Organic Green Tea Kombucha Decaf comes with an expiration date (a good thing, because it's not full of preservatives, plus you can tell if it is fresh). Yogi Tea seems to be another company (like Numi, Aspen, Traditional Medicinals) that values sustainable and healthy practices. Their web site has a helpful glossary of tea ingredients and is beautifully designed, with info about each tea they make.

Yogi Tea writes this on the box about the tea's benefits: "Green Tea Decaf Kombucha uses the same delicious recipe as our Green Tea Kombucha but is naturally decaffeinated. Our organically certified CO2 decaffeination method removes only the caffeine while leaving all of the beneficial polyphenolic elements of Organic Green Tea (Camellia sinensis) intact. This method also maintains the antioxidant properties and delicate flavor of our delicious, organically-grown Green Tea.* Unlike other green teas, this special organic Green Tea has a delicate flavor with no bitterness. This formula incorporates the natural antioxidant properties of Green Tea with a concentrated, purified extract of Kombucha-Pure(tm). This extract is made from Kombucha grown in a unique medium of 32 supporting Chinese herbs and is produced without the use of refined sugar or black tea. For centuries, practitioners of herbal medicine have used Kombucha to detoxify the body, enhance the immune system, fight fatigue and soothe an upset stomach.* This convenient form of Kombucha can be taken daily for maximum health benefits."

Yogi Tea's use of "Kombucha-Pure", grown in 32 Chinese herbs and WITHOUT black tea or sugar is very, very appealing, and a new and exciting way of producing Kombucha.

Note that Yogi Tea also makes a caffeinated version of this tea that has exactly the same ingredients except that the organic green tea does include caffeine.

Highly recommended.

*****

This Green Tea Energy from Yogi Tea is a "natural energy boost".  It's an unusual, rather herb-y tasting natural herbal tea made from organic green tea leaf, Asian (Panax) ginseng, organic lemongrass, organic spearmint leaf, ginseng-eleuthero extract (Panax ginseng, Panax quinquefolium, Eleutherococcus senticosus), and kombucha . The taste is very difficult for me, and the kombucha comes across extra strong. I predict that you'll either love or hate the taste of this tea; try it first before you buy it in large quantities.

I am definitely impressed with this tea and with Yogi Teas in general. Green Tea Energy comes with an expiration date (a good thing, because it's not full of preservatives, plus you can tell if it is fresh). Yogi Tea seems to be another company (like Numi, Aspen, Traditional Medicinals) that values sustainable and healthy practices. According to Yogi Tea, this tea is 70% organic and is intended to enhance the immune system and to fight fatigue. It contains 28mg of caffeine (compared to 90mg in an 8oz cup of coffee).

I gave this tea only four stars because the taste is so hard for me to handle. It is, however, a quality tea, and if you like it, there are many benefits to be gained.

Recommended, if you can stand the taste.

I'm a huge fan of teas' Tea Black Tea Lattes!  They're so delicious and satisfying.  I love that they're organic, cane sugar sweetened, and fat-free.  The caffeine kick is perfect for a morning pick-me-up, and the antioxidant-rich blend is a great way to start my day.  I've tried a lot of different black teas, but Teas' Tea Black Tea Latte is my go-to.  It's a great value for the price, and I'm always happy to stock up when I see it on sale.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Caffe D'Vita Sugar Free Mocha Instant Cappuccino, 8.5-Ounce Canisters (Pack of 6) Review: I finally found this in my local Smart & Final store where I got a big can for $5. I couldn't find it in any of my local supermarkets. I LOVE cappuccino, hot and iced, one of my guilty pleasures since I try hard to stay away from coffee but I can't turn away a good cup of cappuccino. The taste is great, NOT at all bitter, but the problem is it does NOT dissolve well at all in cold milk nor cold water. What I do is heat some water first just to the point of enough heat to dissolve the mix and then I'll put in the refrigerator for an hour or in the freezer for 15-30 minutes. Then i'll add the cold milk on top and it tastes wonderful!! Rating: 5.0 Product: Yogi Tea - Kava Stress Relief - Eases Tension and Promotes Relaxation - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total Review: I LOVE the fact that Yogi did NOT add any type of mint herb again which just makes it taste bitter and makes me think i'm drinking wrigley's mint chewing gum rather than a tasty mild herbal drink. I like the malted, carob creamy taste with pleasantly fragrant sarsparilla, cinnamon and ginger and hazelnut flavoring. I usually use rooibos tea for my anxiety to calm my nerves but when I saw this at my local Safeway and saw the ingredients, I knew I had to try it. It IS very calming such that I'm not so nervous or anxious and I can actually sleep well at night. The kava root in it helps me think more clearly and less anxiously. Usually, I use yerba mate for stress, but this tea does a great job helping me with stress as well as tastes much better than bitter yerba mate. I usually make an herbal concoction iced drink of rooibos Davidson's Organic Tea South African Rooibos, 100-Count Tea Bags (high # of teabags for the price) or Twinings Rooibos Organic, 20-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6 ) (great taste for the price) and this tea, and Joint Flexor Herbal Tea to maintain my joints against arthritis, hawthorn Traditional Medicinals Heart Tea with Hawthorn, 16-Count Tea Bags, 1.13 oz, (Pack of 6) also to help stabilize against arthritis as well as help with my body's blood circulation, and bilberry herbs for better vision and lately, passionflower tea for a more relaxed mood, Tadin Tea, Pasiflora (Passion Flower) Tea, 24-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 12). I'll make a large quantity of this drink each morning, cool it in the refrigerator, maybe add organic raw honey Heavenly Organics Organic Wild Forest Raw Honey Unheated -- 12 oz when the tea cools (heat inactivates honey enzymes), and when I come home in the afternoon or night, I've got an instant healthy cold refreshing drink without needing to resort to unhealthy acidy oversugared soda or corn fructose drinks. The concoction has helped me resist serious sneezing allergies and I get less colds and they're less severe than usual as well as help me with my anxiety. However, because the kava kava is very strong and potent (and too much can toxify the liver), I only add it to my concoction a couple of times a week. Rooibos is a lot less strong and doesn't get my mind as cloudy as adding the kava kava. Note: if you have any loose herbs, muslin bags such as Cotton Muslin Bags 4x6 Inches 25 Count Pack are great to pack them in wihout having to deal with trying to remove loose herbs in your teas. Rating: 5.0 Product: Yogi Tea - Echinacea Immune Support - Supports Immune Function - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total Review: Usually I don't like strong herbal teas like Celestial Seasoning, but when I've got a cold, this tea hits the spot. It has a strong aromatic fragrance from the licorice and it tastes pretty sharp and stinging from the black pepper and ginger but that just tells me it's working well and working on my body to help soothe and heal it. I've given it to friends when they have colds and it's not a miracle cure tea but definitely a light healer for them in addition to their regular medicines. I usually add my favorite tea (rooibos) into it which seems to make it taste a lot better and make me less stressed, less anxious, more awakened, and more relaxed. I'll also add lemon and when it cools to lukewarm (heat kills the honey's enzymes), I'll add organic raw honey for even more healthful healing benefits. Rating: 4.0 Product: Ahmad Tea Blackcurrant Burst Black Tea, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6) Review: I have never tried Ahmad tea although I had heard Ahmad's brand quality was high and I was looking for a better blackcurrant tea ever since Twining's changed their blackcurrant tea formula into something with yucky flowery herbs. Well, I couldn't taste any herbs in Ahmad's blackcurrant tea. In fact, I couldn't taste/smell any blackcurrant at all. The tea leaves OVERPOWER whatever blackcurrant flavor is there. If you're looking for a blackcurrant tea, Ahmad's would not be a good choice. Rating: 3.0 Product: Yogi Tea - Peach DeTox - Healthy Warming Blend - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total Review: I bought this for my mom to help with her arthritis that she keeps complaining about and wouldn't you know that she did NOT want to take it. (She likes pure chinese green tea better.) So I decided to take it myself since I had spent the money for it. I HATE the spearmint & peppermint herbs (they remind me too much of the chewing gum and I wish yogi would take them out)-- Rooibos tea is my usual tea since it's sooo relaxing for my anxiety. As far as taste, a lemon or orange flavored tea are more to my liking. So I treated it like an iced tea and just got a large heat-proof container with a lid and into it using a large funnel, I combined: -1 bag of this tea with -1 bag of my Davidson's Organic Tea South African Rooibos, 100-Count Tea Bags and -1 bag of a NON-HERBAL TEA (I love Tazo teas and tried them with this joint comfort tea, but there are too many yucky herbs like hibiscus and spearmint in Tazo teas which adds to the already bitter herbs in the joint comfort herbs, so something non-herbal is best like in Bigelow teas) Bigelow Lemon Lift Tea, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)(sometimes with a REAL lemon) (OR Bigelow Constant Comment Tea, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6) or Bigelow Raspberry Royale Tea, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)) in boiling water and left them to steep and cool in the refrigerator in the morning and drank the cold tea in the afternoon/evenings and was able to tolerate it. (Sometimes I'll add Heavenly Organics Organic Wild Forest Raw Honey Unheated -- 12 oz to it when it has cooled down.) This tea CERTAINLY relieved MY joints. I usually have a hard time stretching but after a week of drinking this tea, I felt almost like an athlete as far as my joints were concerned. The yucca root extract, cat's claw bark extract (uncaria tomentosa alkaloids), and devil's claw root extract in it certainly help with relieving any joint pain. Also, I notice that I have fewer allergy sneeze/running nose attacks that I usually have and fewer colds. It's an excellent tea if you want to relieve your joints and a great value for your money especially with Subscribe & Save. Note: if you have any loose herbs, muslin bags such as Cotton Muslin Bags 4x6 Inches 25 Count Pack are great to pack them in without having to deal with trying to remove loose herbs in your teas and/or if you want to try different mixes of herbal bagged teas to get different medicinal effects or want to try different new herbs. The bags help to easily remove the herbs, even if bagged and you don't accidentally drink any of the herbs which can be pretty yucky tasting. Rating: 5.0 Product: The Republic of Tea Double Green Matcha, Gourmet Blend of Organic Green Tea And Matcha Powder (50 Tea Bags) Review: I love Republic of Tea's rooibos teas. I bought mine at Whole Foods. Republic of Tea's teas quality rival Numi's but I think this rooibos tea is even higher in quality than Numi's since you get "double" the dose of usual rooibos so that you get a deeper taste of rooibos and you can see and smell the red rooibos powder lightly dusted off the teabags. And the packaging is compact and attractive, great as a gift. What I like about rooibos is that it doesn't have that yucky tasting flowery herbal taste of hibiscus, rosehips, etc that teas like Celestial Seasoning are notoriously known for. Also, you don't have to feel like Superman trying to break into their teabags (like Numi's) since there are no enclosed individual protective packets around each tea bag. Rooibos teas are nutty and mellow in taste. Rooibos is healthy, great for skin ailments and calming for anxiety/nervous tension (which is why I love it so much), and it has no caffeine. I double my health with it by adding raw unprocessed honey but it's really already slightly sweetened so that you don't need a lot of sweetener. The tea is even better iced. If it weren't so expensive, I'd get it more often but am forced with the lower cost alternative with Twining's rooibos teas which has a more "hay" taste/smell. Rating: 5.0 Product: Numi Organic Tea Rooibos Chai, 18 Bags, Caffeine Free Herbal Teasan, Organic Rooibos Tea Blended with Chai Spices (Packaging May Vary), Premium Organic Non-Caffeinated Rooibos Chai Tisane, Red Tea Review: I was 1st introduced to Numi teas when I was drawn to the artistic, beautiful packaging of Numi's rooibos tea (the version with the artistic drawing of elephants in an african savannah) at Safeway supermarket as I needed a small food item but that had an expensive-look to serve as a "community" gift for everyday munching or drinking for coworkers at work for our small kitchen/computer/lunchroom at a prestigious company. After finding their rooibos tea so wonderfully tasting as well as relaxing to my nerves as I get anxious and nervous, rooibos tea has been my #1 breakfast tea to drink in the morning. Their rooibos is much milder than you find with the more affordable Twinings tea but rooibos tastes a little nutty and you don't need sugar since it has a very mildly sweet taste. I, however, will also add organic raw honey to it to give me the benefits not only of the herb but also the benefits of the organic unprocessed honey which makes it a complete healthful breakfast tea for me. There's a VERY TINY cut in the corner to indicate where to rip the teabag package but what I don't like about Numi teas is sometimes, the cut is not there and so that same small paper-plastic packaging that holds each tea bag is difficult to open OR when you rip it at the cut end, the rip still doesn't result in the opening of the tea bag pkg - it's protective with tough plastic on the inside and you NEED scissors or else you won't be able to open it unless you're Superman. But what i love about their teas is that, like another reviewer posted, they don't taste like the usual flowery herbs (like licorice, flowery herbs/roots/leaves, mint, hibiscus, rosehips, etc.) which is what i hate about Celestial Seasonings Tea and why i moved away from Twinings blackcurrant tea when they changed the formula. So you get the benefit of the herb in the tea without the yucky flowery herbal tastes/flavors. Product:
Skinny Dipped Almonds, Dark Chocolate Almonds Raspberry, 1.5oz, 7g plant based protein, Non GMO project verified, gluten free, 9g sugar, 230 calories (pack of 10)
Review:
This is nice change for eating a nut snack. These are packaged in individual serving bags for portion control and easy portability.  The almonds are coated in chocolate and then they have a dusting of red powder on them that taste like raspberry. They are a little messy to eat if you touch them with your fingers because the red powder goes everywhere. There is a lot of extra red powder in each pouch. When I poured into my hand my hand was filled with red powder. These taste good and are not super sweet, they are not like candy. Rating 4 stars = Like It for a good tasting gluten free snack.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Enjoy Life Chewy Bars, Soy free, Nut free, Gluten free, Dairy free, Non GMO, Caramel Apple, 6 Boxes (30 Bars)
Review:
This is a dry dense bar with no texture, it is like a compressed powder. The flavor is dense chocolate but there is a bit of a chalk taste.

The bars are tiny, at one ounce per bar. From the photo on the box you would assume that the two pieces shown were one bar that was broken in half hence the broken off end part that is shown -- but actually what you see there are two separate bars with some crumbs removed from one end which is really, really misleading. Look at the other reviews for photos of the actual size of the bar compared to the packaging.

The one ounce bar has 120 calories and 35 grams of fat.

They are gluten free, dairy free, nut free, and soy free. They are non-GMO. They contain xanthum gum and gum arabic in case you need that information.

I rate these 2 stars = I Don't Like It due to both the taste being not that great and the small size being not of good value. There are a lot of bars on the market and there are better ones out there.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
FISHER Snack Cashew Halves & Pieces, Stand-Up Bag, Gluten Free, 5 oz
Review:
The complicated thing about these salted whole cashews is they contain "soybean, cottonseed, peanut and/or sunflower oil". I liked the taste of these salted cashews, they were a just-right saltiness level for me. I am allergic to soy though, and I don't need extra oils added into the cashews. I stared to wonder if I was wrong in my thinking so I did some research online and found that indeed some cashews use a salt water brine with no oil, and homemade recipes call for olive oil with salt. I am rating 3 stars = It's Okay as I don't like the oil choices in this product due to highly allergenic soy, the peanut allergy issue for those assuming cashews would not contain peanuts. We usually buy raw cashews or organic salted cashews.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
SoFit Fruit and Protein Squeeze, Mango Orange, 4.2 Ounce (Pack of 8)
Review:
This is our family's  first use of a snack of this type. You unscrew the cap and consumed this fruit pure, it is not a liquid juice but has more of a consistency of baby food. This is made from pear juice , fruit pure of blueberry raspberry, strawberry, and apple. It contains way dairy for the protein and honey for sweetness. It contains 20 g of carbs, of which 17 g are sugars. There are 6 g of protein. It is 100 cal.  It is gluten-free and is non- GMO.

 It can be served at room temperature or chilled and it is shelf stable to be stored at room temperature. I felt the flavor was a strong fruit taste such as you may have tasted in a protein smoothie powder product or  fruit flavors of a workout  electrolyte  replacement drink.  It does not taste like fresh real fruit to me. I personally wouldn't choose to eat this but my teenage son who is an athlete who is on a high-protein diet  of six meals a day liked the flavor and enjoyed this type of new to us snack food.  This son of mine refuses to eat dried fruit as a snack so perhaps this type of food product is a way to get some fruits into someone as in on the go snack food.  It's hard to rate food products when one person like loves it in another doesn't I will say 4 stars = I like it.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Nutiva Certified Organic, non-GMO, Vegan Hazelnut Spread with Cocoa, Chia and Flaxseed, Classic Chocolate, 13-ounce
Review:
This is a healthier alternative to Nutella and the consistency (spreadability) is better than Jason's as is the taste. Nutella was the first chocolate hazelnut spread I ever tried back when it was the only one on the market in USA. It was super sweet and made with corn syrup. I stopped eating it due to the unhealthiness of it and because to me it started to taste more like canned frosting. Jason's was the next I tried. Jason's is less sweet but needs a lot of stirring which is a challenge and it separates easily and can have some grit to it, it's not super smooth. Now I have tried Nutiva and it is amazing. The consistency is just like creamy peanut butter, no grit, smooth and spreadable. It has a deep chocolate taste and a good hazlenut flavor and it is not sickening sweet. This has 40% less sugar than Nutella.

Nutiva's ingredients that are notable are first, it's organic. Second, it contains sustainable non-problematic (no gorilla controversy) palm oil and coconut oil which help it have a smooth consistency. Mine arrived with no pooling or separation of oils. It also has chia oil which boosts the omega 3 count which Nutiva uses to promote this as a healthy food but let's not get carried away. This is what it is: a dessert like chocolate hazelnut treat, I am not looking to justify eating this treat by saying it's a health food. Nutiva is now my favorite chocolate hazelnut spread, it's a treat not a daily food for me. Highly recommended, 5 stars = I Love It.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Schr Gluten Free Chocolate Hazelnut Bars, 3-Count (6-Pack) 
Review:
Crisp thin wafers with hazelnut in between plus dipped in chocolate. Heaven! These taste fantastic and I cannot tell they are gluten-free, taste like a normal wafer cookie but more gourmet with the good chocolate flavor and the hazelnut that is not too sweet.

Expensive but not meant for eating in excess. They are a special treat. I rate them 5 stars = I Love It.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Go Raw Organic Superfood Sprouted Cookie Crisps, Sweet Crunch (pack of 6 bags)
Review:
I love these "original" flavor super cookies. I had no idea what they would taste like: the taste is coconut.

This is a raw food product, dehydrated at under 105 degrees, this is considered a live food. The ingredients are coconut, sprouted sesame seeds, and dates (all organic).

Has no: GMOs, trans fats, or cholesterol.

These have a good flavor and a sweet taste, they don't taste un-sweet despite having no sugar or added fruit juices.

Oddly I find all the super cookie products by Go Raw to be filling and I actually often eat about 8 which is less than half a serving. The serving size is 18. They help satisfy my taste for something cookie like and something sweet, I am trying to eat grain free and to reduce sugar intake as I am pre-diabetic.
Rating:
5.0

prompt.content:

Product:
Bob's Red Mill Organic Whole Grain, Kamut Cereal, 24 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)
Review:
I'd never heard of Kamut before it showed up in my Gold Box deals (since I had purchased some other Red Mill products), but decided to give it a try based on the positive reviews. I'm glad I did. As a hot breakfast cereal, it has a nutty flavor and a consistency similar to MaltoMeal, but is much better for you! The taste took a little getting used to (it's best with some milk and brown sugar) but I now like it quite a bit. I've added it to my breakfast mix, and alternate it with oatmeal. I've also started mixing in a tablespoon or two of flax seed from time to time. It also goes really well with fresh berries, or even frozen blueberries if you thaw them out first.

While not quite supplanting oatmeal as my hot cereal of choice, Kamut has proven to be well worth the purchase; tasty, healthy, and organic. What more can you ask for from a product purchased on a whim?

*****UPDATE 07/15/2010*****

I tried making the "Pharaohs Muffins" recipe on the back of the package and loved it! I added chopped dates, raisins, and ginger, as well as a pinch of cinnamon. I also omitted the butter and sugar, and instead used apple sauce. The muffins turned out extremely well, and I'll be making them again. My wife also loved them, as did the coworkers I shared them with. They were pretty surprised to find out they clock in at 145 calories and have virtually no fat! So give them a try--they are worth it.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Gatorade Performance Series Nutrition Shake, Vanilla, 11-Ounce Cans (Pack of 6)
Review:
These Gatorade nutrition shakes are easily the best tasting energy/nutrition/protein shakes I've ever tasted. The consistency is nice and smooth with zero chalkiness, which most energy shakes are ruined by. This one is just perfect as far as flavor and consistency.

To other reviewers saying the shakes have too many calories and not enough protein: these are not intended specifically as protein shakes. That's why they're called "Nutrition" shakes. If you want a specific protein shake, there are many of them available. I look at these as a light meal replacement or as an after work out energy replacement.

An interesting note: The cans are made of steel not aluminum; they are much heavier and stronger than aluminum cans which means they can be stored in a gym back and not accidentally get burst open.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Golden Valley Natural Buffalo Jerky, Original, 3-Ounce Pouch (Pack of 8)
Review:
I've always thought buffalo jerky is much better tasting that beef jerky, as well as being leaner, and hence better for you. This buffalo jerky doesn't disappoint in the flavor department. It is slightly sweet, and has a very nice texture. However, some of the portions were a little dry and hard for my taste. There are also the occasional pieces of fat that I found in one bag. That is the disadvantage of buying 8 bags at a time online; you can't visually inspect what you're getting and not select bags that contain too much fat. You can contact Golden Valley and they will replace any bag that has too much fat for your taste, but expect 2-3 weeks before they'll deliver the replacement bag. Still, better customer service than most companies!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Rishi Tea Organic Black Tea, Earl Grey Loose Tea, 3.3-Ounce Tin (Pack of 3)
Review:
I've always enjoyed a good cup of Earl Grey (especially when coupled with a good book) but have not really gotten loose leaf before. This Rishi Earl Grey is very nice, not overly heavy with no licorice undertones that I really find unappealing in some Earl Gery varieties. The tea takes four minutes to steep, and when done is quite aromatic. I would recommend this one without reservation.

*****Update 10-10-2009*****

I had to come update this review to express how much I LOVE this tea. It's easily one of the most enjoyable teas I've experienced (I'm drinking a cup of it as I update this review) and it always makes me happy when I brew a cup. This is a lovely tea!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Traditional Medicinals Organic Chamomile Herbal Leaf Tea, 16 Tea Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
Traditional Medicinals makes some really nice tea, and their organic peppermint is one of the best. It is strong; none of that weak fare you get at your local grocery store. You can really taste the peppermint oil on your tongue, almost as if it were brewed from fresh peppermint. It is not sweet; add some honey or raw sugar if you like it that way. Excellent for your digestive track and memory, peppermint tea is a wonderful study aid and will help you stay focused without getting the jitters of caffeine.

A first class tea, and easy to recommend to anyone who enjoys herbals.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Fruit Harvest Cereal, Strawberry Blueberry, 12.2-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 4)
Review:
This is one of my favorite breakfast cereals. I think what distinguishes it most is the quality of the freeze-dried fruit. When combined with milk, the fruit rehydrates quite well, tasting neither soggy nor chewy like so many others.

It might not be the healthiest cereal available, but it is low in sugar, tastes great, and beats eating Grape Nuts or granola every morning. If you want a real treat, mix in some fresh blueberries...
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Reeses Puffs, Peanut Butter, 22.9 Ounce (Pack of 3)
Review:
I'm at risk of obesity and cardiac failure because of this breakfast cereal. Not far down the ingredient list you can find "crack cocaine," which gives these puffs their signature taste and addictive quality. I eat these for breakfast. I eat them as a snack. I eat them for desert. I hoard them from the other members of my family. These are high-risk behaviors that have started to concern those who love me. But they are all wrong. I don't have a problem. I have tasty Reese's Puffs. This "Family Size" is really an "Individual Size." Because I am not sharing, not with you, not with anyone. I will shovel these tasty chocolate and peanut butter puffs down my gullet until I die a very happy man, likely not far in the distant future. So take your opinions and condemnation elsewhere, breakfast confection hater. Enjoy your flavorless wheat sticks and low fat yogurt in the dark comfort of your empty, soulless existence. I will chow down on my Reese's Puffs until I collapse face-first into my cereal bowl.
Rating:
5.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Spicy World Turmeric Powder (Ground), 14 Ounce
Review:
This Spicy World Turmeric Powder is the BEST BUY that I have found. Since I have been using this spice in many foods, I love the taste of it and the fact that it gives my white sauces that GOLDEN YELLOW color, turns plain white rice into yellow (Saffron looking rice).
This particular spice not only tastes wonderful, it is so healthy to eat. I went to Google and typed in benefits of turmeric and was amazed at all of the benefits of this tasty herb! And so you will know---Turmeric is what gives MUSTARD it's yellow color and wonderful flavor!

If you love that special taste in foods that people ask you "What is in the dish, it tastes great?" then you may want to consider this.
For the price and the quality, this is the best one that I found online.

Storage - I placed the spice into a zip-lock back and sealed it tightly and then placed a rubber band on it. So I will remember what the bag has in it I place the cut out of the Spicy World label on top of the bag with scotch tape.

HINT: Be careful handing this spice with your fingers as it will stain your fingers a mustard yellow. Also if spilled onto your clothes it may stain. I wear an apron in my kitchen and scrub my hands after using this herb.

Highly recommend this!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Frontier Five Spice Powder, 1.92-Ounce Bottle
Review:
For me, I regularly prepare Oriental dishes, mostly Refried Rice, Lo Mein, and Stir Fry dishes. Of course I try to duplicate that restaurant Oriental taste as much as possible. I watch many cooking shows on TV and on SEVERAL of the shows, chefs used Five Spice Powder Seasoning. Thus one has so many positive reviews, I decided to try it for myself.

The results for me is just amazing and I found my Oriental dishes have much better flavor as I am now using thus spice regularly. In addition to using it for Oriental dushes, I tried this in my spaghetti and even in my a Taco meat. Wow, these dishes had more flavor and much zestier!

However, what you need to know us that this Seasoning is very, very strong. When I cook with it, I just use a very tiny pinch of it. That way it is not overpowering in her dish.

The taste of is is sweet, sour, hot, yet comforting. In my opinion, it brings to my dushes the question What is that special flavor in this food? Since I add just a tiny amount of this seasoning, the food is a delight I have really received compliments.

One more thing: Thus spice is in a glass jar and closes up well to lock in the marvelous flavor.

Highly recommended.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nu-Salt Substitute Shaker, 3 Ounce
Review:
Personally, I love the taste of salt, and love to eat salty foods. Hence, I found myself eating too much salt and my fingers began to swell, especially the first thing in the morning. So I realized that I was eating and retaining too much salt! Then a couple of weeks ago, I was in my local market and noticed the Nu-Salt Salt Substitute and decided to give it a try. The taste I find is very pleasant and very similar to that of salt. Moreover, I noticed is now that I can sprinkle lots of this on my food and this satisfies my need for that salty taste, and my fingers no longer swell. And best of all, I lost 4 pounds due to water weight that came off!

**May I suggest that you DO NOT use this while you are cooking foods, instead, wait until the food is cooked and at the table then add this Salt Substitute. It goes much further and last longer this way.

This is a superb product and if you love the taste of salt like I do and you are on a restricted salt intake diet, this is the product to buy!

Product:
Fiber One Chewy Bar, Oats and Peanut Butter, 1.4 Ounce, 5 Count, Pack of 12
Review:
For many years before I tried this Fiber One Oats & Peanut Butter Chewy Bar, I was Peanut Butter Candy Bar junkie! For that matter, anything with peanut butter in it was just want I wanted. However, I realized that I need more fiber. So decided to give these chewy bars a try and this is what I found:

1) They are sweet enough to make my sweet tooth happy.
2) They have plenty of peanuts and peanut flavor to suit me.
3) Love the chewy texture, it is more like eating a regular candy bar, but I do not feel the guilt.
4) These are a necessity for me as I keep one in my purse at all times to keep with me as I have low blood sugar and have to eat often. This keeps something in my stomach until I can eat a regular meal.
5) Fiber: At 4.5 grams, this is a nice serving. And it works well for me as I eat other foods with fiber during the day.

Great product!

This one the Beef Pot Roast is wonderful and my favorite of this line. For me, I add some garlic powder, a little black pepper and maybe seasoned salt to enhance it. Then I eat this with 2 slices of bread for a really nice lunch. Keep in mind this is FAST FOOD/Convenience food yet it still tastes good for that type of food. Does it taste like homemade? No, but more so than other brands I tried. For a quick lunch at work or at home and one that will save you time and money, consider this.

1) Noodles fit easily into a tablespoon or soup spoon!

2) Plenty of noodles in this soup.

Highly recommend this!

Highly recommend this!

Being finely ground I use less and it lasts longer and how could it be any more convenient than having it show up at my door along with my frequent Amazon orders. At $13 for a 2 pack this is a good price for a respectable coffee and I wouldn't hesitate at $17. I enjoy #4 also which is much stronger but #5 is a bit too bold for me.

Review:
I just finished my bag of this coffee and won't be reordering more.

These things are a preference to each drinker, and while I drank all of it up without issue, I didn't look forward to doing so as much as some others.

I grind it a bit coarse because lately I've been using my Gevalia drip with a metal basket/filter. I do make it very strong using the 8 cup setting while grinding it for about 3 cups in my big mug. I typically add a dash of liquid Coffee Mate, and with this I wanted 3 dashes.

It's not bad coffee, it just had a different taste that I didn't care for. In 35 years I've tried a lot of coffees and I can like Folgers Columbian to espresso, I prefer it dark roast and I'm not real fussy about coffee like some are.

I won't tell you not to try it, because this blend may suit you fine, it just had a something about it's taste that didn't work for me. I'm sorry, but I don't even know how to describe it, but it wasn't as mellow as I'd hoped for.

Call it good coffee that just wasn't for me.

I apologize for writing all of this down when I know the temptation of one click ordering combined with the crunchy, delectable, mouth watering thought of honey roasted cashews, that you can no doubt resist while out shopping, is like a tall glass of refreshment on a hot afternoon while getting a backrub and checking your winning lotto ticket. Check on that though, because pricing does fluctuate here on the big river. These grinders do work well, but aren't adjustable and they give you a medium to medium coarse grind.

Good purchase and recomended.

5.0

Hershey's Nuggets Chocolates Assortment, 38.5 oz (Old)
Review:
I really like these, like to the point of actually using the L word. You do have to be careful of addiction however.

So I ordered these up and all went smoothly for me, then I dumped out a pile of them so that I could find and eat three of the extra creamy almond  toffee nuggets first, and then I put the bag away on a top cupboard shelf, out of sight,.....out of mind.

Nope, it didn't work. Soon I was thinking about the milk chocolate, the milk chocolate with almonds and the dark chocolate with almonds too.

How about you? What are you thinking about right now?

I know! Yes they're fresh, yes the shipping was fine, uh huh, there's nothing wrong with the price that I paid, it's pretty close to a regular store price.

Ahhh,....Go ahead, you know that you deserve it for something that you've done recently.

Now go ahead click on it, it's only that color meaning caution, you're just one click from having this bag arrive at your door too, and then you'll feel all better.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Equal Exchange Organic Whole Bean Coffee, Mind Body Soul, 12-Ounce Bag
Review:
I just finished my bag of this whole bean coffee and this is one of the best that I've ever tasted.

I usually use a little creamer, but I had to try this one out black just because. Just because how the heck could I do a real review without doing it. Just like when I used a little creamer though, this coffee is so smooth that it's like the difference between drinking good bottled water instead of from the tap it's so smooth.

It's pretty dark without the bitter taste that you can get from dark roast at times. Please don't think me crazy, but I use the recommended amount of coffee for 8 cups to make 17 ounces for my morning mug that goes in a 20 ounce mug, so that it's very full with an ounce and a half of creamer like Coffee Mate added, but I often use the cans of evaporated milk also.

If the coffee isn't good when it's made strong like this, it can be brutal to drink. But the Love Buzz (I like the name too) the Love buzz isn't bitter and it's so free of acid that it seems impossible. I expect acid when I make it so strong and that's why I normally use a dash of creamer.

My French press is at my other home where I'm not, so I've been using my Gevalia drip with the metal screen as a substitute. This works out pretty well and I've held off on picking up another press, because I've already been here longer than planned. I want to fly back with a bag of the Love Buzz just so that I can press it though because I want to try that so badly.

So I've got more on the way because as of today, throughout my 35 years of drinking coffee this is my new favorite, just the best.

Don't even think about if you maybe want to try it, it can't be everyone's favorite, but I don't think that you'll be disappointed.
Rating:
5.0

Review:
If you're still eating refined flour, sugar, and artificial sweeteners, this cereal (and all the Ezekiel products) will probably taste like granulated styrofoam to you. We train our palettes, for better or for worse.

I have been eating Ezekiel for at least 20 years.  I don't eat sugar, artificial sweeteners, refined grains, red meat, or artificial anything, and this cereal tastes sweet and crunchy and nutty to me. I usually eat it with a handful of chopped walnuts, cut up a banana or peach, and add almond milk. It's low on the glycemic index, which is also an enormous plus if you're trying to eat healthy. And it's filling; unlike when you eat those sugary cereals, you won't be hungry in an hour.

When I walk into the grocery store, and 99% of the groceries are all about sugar and carbohydrate addictions and foods all pumped up with chemicals and addictive substances, I feel discriminated against. It's much harder to eat right in this country. I can't even find Ezekiel in most stores. I hope, I hope, I hope they never go out of business!
