Product:
Traditional Medicinals Organic Chamomile Herbal Leaf Tea, 16 Tea Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
Quite honestly, I don't like herbal teas, but I've been drinking them most of my adult life because they're good for me. You can add various milks and sweeteners, but mostly I take mine straight and think pleasant thoughts.
But I'm at a point in my life where sleep isn't a sure thing, and I won't use drugs to make me sleep that would have catastrophic side effects, so I take a cocktail of supplements that are (knock wood) helping me slip into that nether world of dreams and rest, but it comes slowly if at all, and I've tried several herbal blends of chamomile, passion flower, etc., without much success.
I found this one, while searching for something else and decided what the heck, and ordered it. It's not instant, as in something that will conk me right out, but if I drink it an hour or more before bedtime, it takes the edge off the day. Linden Flower appears to have a ton of benefits, everything from taming high blood pressure, to clearing mucus and yes, treating insomnia.
I thought I'd look at some other Linden teas, but the Lemon Balm and Hawthorne in this one seem to work together, so I'm not going to try anything else just yet. Also it's organic, which is pretty high on my list of priorities. The taste is about like all herbal teas, grassy, and I definitely don't wake up feeling drugged. I would buy it by subscribe and save or in multi-packs if they were available.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Chios Mastiha Tears Gum Greek 100% Natural Mastic Packs From Mastic Growers (50gr Small Tears)
Review:
I'm placing my second order for this gum. It's definitely helping my digestion issues, and I'm sort of addicted to chewing it. It's not like the gum we usually chew, and there's a bit of a learning curve. You have to test each of the tears by chewing down on it carefully to see how moist or dry it is. Some will break into tiny shards, and some will be so sticky you'll spend the better part of the day cleaning it off your teeth. I've found that what works best for me is to save a little piece of my gum from the previous day, start chewing it to get it softened back up, and then add a piece or two of new Mastic Tears to it. My jaws get a real workout. The first few times they were actually a little sore, so I guess it's good from that standpoint as well.

This trail mix is so delicious.  I had to stop myself from finishing the bag in one day.  The chocolate is like M&M's, meaning they melt in your mouth . . . .  Hands, be clean.  And the nuts are not all peanuts; we also get almonds and cashews.  Yes, cashews!  My belly is more than happy.  Love, love, love this trail mix.

Product:
Viva Naturals Organic Coconut Sugar: Non-GMO, Low-Glycemic Sweetener, 6 lbs Bag
Review:
If you're wondering what coconut sugar is, the ingredient reads coconut nectar and nothing else.  It looks like coarse white sugar dyed brown, or dark brown sugar that's loose and dry.  It smells like the husk of a coconut and tastes sweet and nutty.

I baked a batch of cookies - half using regular sugar cane sugar, the other half using coconut sugar.  Then, I asked the family to compare without telling them which was which.  They chose because they had to, my husband asking if it was a trick question.  In the end, my daughter like the coconut sugar cookies.  My husband and son chose the white sugar cookies.  Like the rest of my family, I honestly couldn't tell the difference.

I made chicken wings in the oven.  It's a recipe I've used for years using soy sauce, honey, and sugar.  This time, I substituted coconut sugar.  Here, the difference was noticeable.  I could smell and taste the bolder, nuttier flavor.  I didn't tell the family I had changed the recipe, though, and no one commented on it.

I'm going to keep experimenting with coconut sugar.  It's not going to replace my sugar cane sugar, because there are times when I don't want that nutty flavor or brown color coming through.  It's a definite green light for cookies, as no one can tell it's even there.

This product was provided for review by Viva Labs.

I'm using it on my skin and lips, which makes me smell like the tropics.  The only problem is I can't seal up the packet.  There's way more in it than I'll ever need for one application.  Still better than dipping my hand in a tub, though.

Product:

Review:
I was looking forward to something the size of a jar of hand cream.  What I got could compete with a can of Crisco.  But lard, this is not.  Nope, it's too runny to be lard, and too thick to be oil.  I guess I could use it for cosmetic purposes, but that would mean dipping my hand in it.  Instead, I fried up some sausage.  This stuff heats up well and fries great.  I'm no fan of coconut flavors, but this didn't taste like coconut at all.  I like it, but I wish it came in a squeeze bottle.  It's about the right consistency for that.

UPDATE 5/19/16:  After cooking up some foods with milder flavors, yes, I can taste the coconut.  It does lend an interesting twist to the recipes!

Even my pickiest eater son has munched on his fair share.  My daughter says she likes them.  My husband is keeping his promise, and yes, I'm doing what I can to help out.  These are soft, chewy granola bars, not the crunchy sort.  All that chocolate makes them more cookie than whole earth healthy, but then they're only 100 Calories or less per each.  That's not so bad, is it?

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Sincerely Nuts Organic Dried Cherries - One Lb. Bag - Divinely Fresh and Delicious - Packed with Healthy Nutrients - Zero Cholesterol - Kosher Certified Review: These cherries are a bit hard, but they are easily softened up by soaking. I use them in baking and in the trail mix I make with organic peanuts, organic raisins, organic shredded coconut, organic cacao nibs, and a touch of stevia. They have a delicious, tart flavor. Rating: 5.0 Product: Navitas Organics Cacao Nibs, 8 oz. Bag — Organic, Non-GMO, Fair Trade, Gluten-Free Review: For those who want to get all the benefits of dark chocolate without any processing, this is for you. These are raw, natural "nibs" of cacao. They aren't sweet like chocolate candy, and they can take some getting used to, but you don't need to eat a lot of this food to get the health benefits, only about a half teaspoonful of them per day. Over the last four years there have been dozens of scientific studies analyzing and confirming substantial health benefits from a small amount of dark chocolate consumed daily. The latest findings from a Harvard study released in early 2011 indicate that as little as 6 gm. of dark chocolate (about 30 calories) is a sufficient daily "dose." That means you need very little of pure chocolate like these nibs. The original German studies in 2007 used Ritter Sport dark chocolate, but I haven't so far been able to discover which kind of Ritter's dark chocolate was used by the researchers. However, since Ritter's only makes two types, 50% cacao and 71% cacao, this product's content of cacao goes far beyond the parameters of the dark chocolate used in that study. The health benefits of dark chocolate are due to the flavonoids contained in cocoa. Flavonoids act as antioxidants in the body, which both prevent and reduce inflammation. Over many years of medical research, inflammation has been found to contribute to or directly cause a host of diseases, including high blood pressure, heart disease, and cancer, as well as autoimmune diseases like arthritis. Flavonoids are found in the pigments of fruits and vegetables which give them their color. The darker and deeper the color of a fruit or vegetable, the greater the amount of flavonoids it contains. Cocoa is derived from the dark-brown cacao bean, which is the fruit of the tropical tree, theobroma cacao. In any chocolate product, such as this one, the higher the percentage of cocoa/cacao, the more flavonoids the chocolate contains. Dark chocolate such as this product is better for your health than milk chocolate because it contains more antioxidants, which are good for you, and less sugar, which is not good for you--especially if you have diabetes or are struggling with your weight. The FDA defines categories of chocolate based on how much cocoa/cacao is in a given product: 1. Unsweetened chocolate with no additives is 100% cocoa. Most all brands of unsweetened baker's chocolate fall into this category. Their ingredient list will state simply, "chocolate." This product is unprocessed cacao. 2. Bittersweet chocolate contains 35-99% cocoa (35% is the minimum), and it must contain less than 12% milk solids. There is a large range of products in this category, and the product names reflect the amount of chocolate they contain. Unsweetened chocolate is very bitter, and the more cocoa in a product, the less room for sugar, and the more bitter it will be. In order to avoid frightening off customers who are used to sweet chocolate, marketers often substitute the words "dark," "extra dark" or "intense" for "bitter" if that word is not paired with "sweet," for example as "bittersweet" or "extra bittersweet." This product lies at the top of this range. 3. Sweet chocolate contains 15-34% cocoa (15% is the minimum), and it must contain less than 12% milk solids. It is sometimes also marketed as "dark chocolate," even though it has a much lower percentage of cocoa solids than bittersweet, which can cause consumers, in such cases, to purchase a product with less cocoa in it than they realized they were getting. Everything else besides the cocoa and milk solids is essentially sugar. 4. Milk chocolate is only required to have a minimum of 10% cocoa, a minimum of 12% milk solids and 3.39% milk fat. The rest is sugar and milk. Rating: 5.0 Product: Sincerely Nuts Dried Pineapple Chunks - Two Lb. Bag - Beyond Delicious - Astounding Freshness - Bursting with Wholesome Nutrients - Kosher Certified Review: I eat a lot of dried pineapple, and it's not available locally in my grocery store. I had previously purchased the NOW brand, but it comes in a much smaller size, and the price for this product is great. The pineapple is in bite-sized chunks, and it is chewy and delicious. I have purchased it three times now and will again. Rating: 5.0 Product: Nutiva USDA Certified Organic, non-GMO, Gluten-free, Unrefined Coconut Flour, 16-ounce (Pack of 6) Review: For some time now I have been grinding up coconut flakes to make my own rough-and-ready coconut flour, and I at last decided to simply purchase some coconut flour. I was interested to see that this flour has far, far less fat in it than ground up coconut flakes. I can only assume that this is because the coconut pulp that is dried to be ground into flour has first been squeezed to remove coconut oil, which is sold separately. I use this flour in muffins, soup, and vegan ice cream. It tastes almost as good as ground up coconut flakes for these three purposes, and it saves a lot of calories. My recipe for a really creamy, delicious, tropical ice cream is: 1 ripe mango, peeled 1 ripe banana, peeled 5 large frozen strawberries 1 cup fresh or canned pineapple, pre-frozen in ice cube tray 1/2 cup coconut flour 1 tablespoon vanilla extract (I make my own) 1 teaspoon stevia powder 1-1/2 to 2 cups frozen ice cubes (I freeze green tea that I have sweetened to taste with stevia) I blend all the non-frozen ingredients in my Vitamix first. Then I gradually add in the frozen ingredients, blending on high until it is well mixed and the consistency of a Dairy Queen Blizzard. Yum! Rating: 5.0 Product: Garden of Life Greens and Protein Powder - Organic Raw Protein and Greens with Probiotics/Enzymes, Vegan, Gluten-Free, Chocolate 22oz (1lb 6oz/611g) Powder Review: This is a high-quality, meal-replacement supplement. It tastes pretty good for a vegan product. Every vegan protein powder I've ever tried has been really awful tasting. This product does have a somewhat grainy texture, however, it mixes well using a mini-whisk or a fork, and of course there is no problem at all if you use a blender. I mixed it into room-temperature, purified water, and I did not feel the need to try it at a later time with herbal tea or almond milk to improve the taste, as I do with regular, vegan protein powder. It tasted fine just with water. This product is certified USDA organic and non-GMO. It is vegan, Kosher, dairy-free, and soy-free. It also contains probiotics, enzymes and fiber. It is sweetened with stevia, and has no bitter aftertaste. In short, there are no bad ingredients at all and plenty of excellent ones. This product is fairly expensive, at about $1.50 per serving, but that's not too bad as far as healthy, meal-replacement products go. I found it quite filling. Rating: 5.0 Product: Frontier Natural Products Organic Bac'Uns Bacon Flavored Soy Bits - 1 lb Review: These are a delicious, organic version of soy, vegan, fake-bacon bits. They taste wonderful on salad, and I especially like them when I make toast, spread homemade guacamole on it, and sprinkle thesse Bac'Uns on top. Yummy! They also taste good sprinkled over potato salad. On top of all that, they are a terrific, low-calorie source of protein. Rating: 5.0 Product: Enjoy Life Baking Chocolate, Soy free, Nut free, Gluten free, Dairy free, Non GMO, Vegan, Paleo, Semi Sweet Mini Chips, 10 Ounce Bags (Pack of 6) Review: These vegan, mini chocolate chips taste delicious and they are terrific to bake with. I had not used mini chips before, and they work great for better distribution of chips throughout the chocolate chip cookies I made. Below is the recipe I used, which is one I developed for myself after a lot of experimenting with ways to avoid using sugar yet still have cookies taste sweet. I have included some pictures of the cookies I baked as well as what the dough looks like when made in a food processor. I will definitely purchase these chocolate chips again! Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Mix these dry ingredients together well or sift them together if preferred: 2 cups whole wheat pastry flour 2 tsp. stevia 1 tsp. baking powder 1/4 tsp. sea salt Puree in food processor: 1 medium, peeled and cored apple (or 1/2 cup applesauce) 60 gm pitted dates 1/2 cup coconut oil 1 tablespoon vanilla extract (I make my own) 1/4 cup maple syrup Gradually add in 1/2 of the dry ingredients to the pureed mixture in the food processor. Remove the pureed mixture from the food processor and place in a bowl. Stir in the rest of the dry mixture and add last: 1 cup Enjoy Life Semi-Sweet Chocolate Mini-Chips For convenience, I use my toaster oven rather than turning on my regular-sized oven (easier to deal with and uses less electricity). As stated above, I preheat my toaster oven to 325 degrees. I use a 1-tablespoon-size melon-ball scoop to measure out balls of cookie dough onto a greased silicone baking sheet which is specifically sized for a toaster oven. I press the cookie-dough balls flat. I then bake the cookies on the toaster-oven rack on its top level for 9-10 minutes. The cookies have a moist and chewy texture. This recipe makes about 44 cookies at approximately 75 calories each. Review:
Will give you the short and skinny from someone who bought-paid full price.  My requirements were:  low in fat, low in fiber, low in cholesterol, low in sugar, plant based proteins and with all that, it had to play nice with my pancreas.... oh, and with all that, I expected it to taste half way decent.

Vega Protein & Greens ticked all the required needs and even tastes all right-  As far as taste, it's a tad bit on the powdery/chalky taste for me, BUT, I think that's a small price to pay since it meets all the other requirements.

Someone who evidently received this free for a review made mention that it's pricey.  I'd have to ask, "compared to what?"  I have been paying $55.00 for another brand and yes, that brand tastes less chalky to me, but still Vega is doing what I need it to do, it fulfills all the requirements I had,and so as long as they don't change up the formula, I most likely will continue to buy this product.

I also forgot to mention it dissolves very easily, not many protein powders do, at least not without a blender or bullet type device.  The Vega Protein & Greens dissolves easily with just a shake or two.  That's a nice PLUS.

I DO NOT keep any other oil in the house other than Coconut oil, so basically I use it for everything in the kitchen for cooking and I even use it on my Formica counter tops, around the house, on my skin .... I'm a coconut oil fanatic.  The one thing I DO NOT use this type oil for is my essential oils.... I buy a cheaper version for that one application.

Island Fresh Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, so far, has passed all my tests of what I will buy more than once....  In a nutshell:  it smells good, tastes good, feels good and in its hardened state is not 'pithy' feeling like a few other oils I've purchased.  It's also competitively priced ... who could ask for more?  I am sold !!!!

Product:
Eden Organic Cannellini White Kidney Beans, No Salt Added, 15-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:
These beans are a staple in our cupboard.  We add them to everything from salads, to stir fries, to  sauts.  Would probably use dried beans for soup, but these canned beans are a quick, healthy, delicious convenience food. Always ready, you don't have to think to soak them the night before.  They can be tossed into just about any vegetable dish for protein and flavor. They love garlic and good olive oil for seasoning.  If you like dips, they'd make a great base.  At just over $2.00 a can, the Amazon price on these is great, too.  No BPA in the can, and Eden Foods is a wonderful little company that I feel good supporting.  (No, I don't own or work for Eden Foods.  Don't even know anyone who works there.  They are domiciled in the state where I spent my earlier years, but I've never even been to the city of their location.)
9-9-14 update.  I no longer recommend this product and have stopped purchasing it myself.  I have stopped purchasing all Eden products.  These canellini beans are even better:  Bioitalia Cannellini Organic Beans, 14 Ounce (Pack of 12), also available on Amazon where I purchase them on subscribe and save for less than $2 a can.
(Also, no BPA)

Open the can, drain off the liquid, and throw the beans in the Vitamix with a couple cloves of fresh garlic, a little lemon juice, some good tahini, a drizzle of good extra virgin olive oil, freshly ground salt and pepper to taste.  Eat with good whole grain crackers or pocket bread.  Faster, healthier and less expensive than running out to the fast food restaurant for carry out.  This is one of our convenience foods, always in stock. (And, yes, of course accompany with sliced cucumbers, tomatoes and a few Kalamata olives.)

I hesitated to review this for selfish reason because I want it to be in stock when I want to order more. I am so excited that I could find it on Amazon.  Previously, I would only order my olive oil from a company in California, but for this olive oil I overcome my environmental scruples and buy something shipped in from another country. I am an experienced cook. I am blown away by the flavor of this olive oil.  For those having trouble will spillage, pull the spout up straight until it is fully extended before you twist off the cap.  This is a good, useful cap. prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Coconut Oil Virgin Organic Non GE 20 Ounces
Review:
This oil has a rancid, off-putting odor that smells NOTHING like coconut, more like yeast.  It also has a TERRIBLE taste.  DO NOT BUY!!!

I consume a jar of coconut oil a week because I take it as a supplement and cook with it.  Jarrow, Spectrum, Nutiva, Vitacost and Swanson are MUCH better.  Their coconut oils smell really good with a fresh, coconut scent and taste great too.

I was surprised because I use other NOW products and am happy with them. The quality, judging by my experience & others', is that this may just be a faulty jar but the quality isn't consistent.  I don't see bad reviews from the other oils I use & I have never had a bad batch from the others I have mentioned.
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Nutiva Organic, Cold-Pressed, Unrefined, Virgin Coconut Oil from Fresh, non-GMO, Sustainably Farmed Coconuts, 29-ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
Jarrow EVCO is becoming too expensive but other brands in its price range fell short. Nutiva is almost as good in flavor & aroma. It's at the moment more cost effective & I like that I now have options at this price point.  Good coconut flavor & aroma; my household uses it as the Primary oil for all cooking uses & as a health supplement. We go through at least 16oz per week.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Pompeian Robust Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 48 Ounce
Review:
the oil is EXCELLENT!! Robust with a vibrant green, earthy taste without overpowering. Great for using in recipes, savory or sweet, and for dipping bread. Amazon pricing not so good.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Swad Indian Spice Turmeric Haldi Powder, 14 Ounce
Review:
This stuff is on the slight bitter side.  It's not bad per se, I like bitter but this spice did not seem 'rounded' and pleasant on its own to me.  There's no aftertaste that I can detect and my food still tastes good using it, but I can tell it's not the usual brand I buy.

I bought this to get bulk for the money since I blow through Turmeric at a ridiculous rate.  I use A LOT of the stuff, in just about everything savory to assist with joint health and because I love the taste of turmeric.  I also love the color it imparts to food.  I will finish the package but will likely try another brand the next go around.

If I had to pick between having this and none, I would buy again.  Because of the price point, I likely will buy again, many times, just not as a first choice.

I will update this review after I've had a chance to try the tea recipes listed in other reviews.  It just might change my mind!  Hopefully I'll end up liking this better (it wouldn't be the first time that a product I didn't like at first ended up being my favorite goto so, we'll see).

Hope this helps.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
ZICO Pure Premium Coconut Water, Natural, 33.8 fl oz Container (Count of 6)
Review:
I love coconut water and was quite pleased with my old brand (98% coconut water, no pulp, no sugar added) but when I tasted this, I was immediately hooked.  Because it's 100% coconut water, no sugar added and not from concentrate (tetra packs), it tastes so good.  I don't mind pulp, but I like the ease of not having to strain the water to give to my finicky toddler.  There is no pulp in this particular Zico Natural Coconut Water 6 pack.

The 2% does make a difference.  I didn't even know my old brand was not 100% until I tasted how good and better Zico was.  I then grabbed a container of my old brand and read the ingredients.  I was surprised that I was paying for 2% water in each container.

I periodically buy coconuts from a local, natural food store so I am familiar with what virgin coconut water should taste like.  I appreciate that processing of Zico Natural flavor seems minimal.  It feels like it's hydrating the moment I swallow it, whether room temperature or cold, just like the coconuts I 'tap' myself.

Zico Natural flavor tastes so good, expensive though.  I search for sales at Amazon and my local grocery stores, then stock up!

Hope this helps.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
O.N.E. Coconut Water, 11.2-Ounce Aseptic Containers (Pack of 12)
Review:
I love coconut water and have been drinking it regularly for at least 5 years but probably more.  Lately, I buy the near expiration date coconut water for the affordability and because with Zico, it still tastes good (so far).  I must say though, that my recent purchase of this O.N.E coconut water in the 11.2 oz aseptic containers tasted so bad that I had to force myself to drink it down.  The expiration is not until August, 2013, which is 2 months away.  Still, I had to mix one container of this with 2 11.2 OZ containers of sweetened coconut water just to get it palatable enough to get it down.  The Zico on the other hand, expires this month, but still tastes good.

I will not order this particular O.N.E brand again, at least not close to expiration.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Lundberg Eco-Farmed Sweet Dreams Brown Rice Syrup - 21 Ounce - 1 Pack
Review:
New to brown rice syrup. Used NOW brand in hot mint tea (with raw honey) and liked it very much. Decided to venture out & found this. Tastes very different than the NOW brand. It's richer and turns the tea cloudy, tastes and looks as if a splash of milk was added to the tea. NOW brand left the tea clear.

I prefer the NOW brand in hot tea but prefer this for baking, cooking and as a topping (sweet potato, krispy treats, popcorn, greek yogurt, etc.)  It has a more complex and buttery background which is better suited to such applications.

DELICIOUS.
Rating:
4.0

Review:
As always, fresh aromatic herbs, great price for large quantity, and in re sealable bag. I buy Marshalls Creek herbs and spices, and especially love their proprietary blends like Momma D's Seasoning blend.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Das Foods Hawaiian Black Lava Salt- Sea Salt 6 Oz Jar
Review:
The black lava salt is *the* salt I must always have in the house. I have this variety, which is a very, very good quality brand and I also have a shaker jar of fine grind for adding at the table. The salt really *is* black and as you take pinches of it from jar to sprinkle on the food, it will turn your fingers black as if you had handled charcoal. It is absolutely delicious on fish and seafood, and I never eat my salmon with anything but this Das Foods salt. Das Foods salts, all I have purchased, are all fine quality and this is one of the best lava salts I've had. In my opinion it provides a fresh, kind of "oceany" taste to the fish that is a great addition to the dish. I highly recommend this, especially if you love salmon like I do. Great salt, great flavor.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
OliveNation Herbes de Provence 16 oz. - Fancy blend with Lavender
Review:
This is the real deal, with lavender, and the price can't be beat! I use a lot of this herb blend and was searching for some to replace what I used up. It wasn't easy finding an authentic blend that included lavender, but I stumbled onto this brand. This is wonderful, with a good aroma and a nice balance of herbs. And the price is ridiculously reasonable for a full pound.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Coffee Bean Direct Irish Breakfast Loose Leaf Tea, 2 Pound Bag
Review:
Tastes great and is a massive bag for the money. I really didn't realize how much 2# was until it came! I may never have to buy tea again.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Raspberry Oolong Tea 3 oz, By Higher Tea (40 Cups) Certified Organic Premium Loose Leaf Tea
Review:
I bought this accidentally. I spied it when looking at oolong to try as I had never tasted it. I thought I hit "add to cart" to save it whilst I looked at others and added them to decide about later. I hit the "buy now" instead, realizing that when I got text telling me it was arriving. Surprise! LOL

I had hesitated originally because $10 for just that few ounces was pricy for me right now. Oh. My. God!!!! This is the most delicious tea I have ever tried. I have a huge variety of teas from Amazon and am no stranger to many many varieties. I favor black teas always. But this Raspberry Oolong changed my "black only" daily drinking habit immediately. It is incredible! I used a tiny bit extra in my T-Sac DIY bag and that gave it more strength without bitterness. Never steep longer, just use a bit more.

I can't recommend this highly enough, and be assured it is worth every single penny and more. Try it!!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
PG Tips Gold Best Tasting Blend (160 Tea Bags)
Review:
This is a good everyday tea, when you want a big mug but don't want to make a pot. It makes a great iced tea too, very flavorful unlike the floor sweepings that pass as American tea bags or American knock offs of good U.K. teas (Twinings)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bigelow Cozy Chamomile Herbal Tea Bags 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6) Caffeine-Free Individual Herbal Tisane Bags, for Hot Tea or Iced Tea, Drink Plain or Sweetened with Honey or Sugar
Review:
I always use two bags of herbal tea in a normal size mug for more flavor. This works wonderfully on all my others, Cranberry apple, cranberry hibiscus, blueberry aa and others. I did the double bag with this, expecting a good distinct flavor like the others give me for two bags. Nope. It was very watery and insipid. It had a vague lemon taste, but so weak and watered down.

 I was so excited to try this, I love a good lemon taste in anything. This was horribly disappointing and I have to say, my sister agrees. I gave her a box from my six pack. I will try three bags per cup and see how that is. I hope it will be much better, as I am stuck with five boxes of this tasteless lemon water.

Update:  I tried to three-bag it in mug. I got much more lemon flavor, which would have been great had there not been a lot more mint flavor. I. Hate. Mint. Tea. Who does that? Mint and lemon? Its gross.
Rating:
3.0
</similarpairs>

I did notice the more I used it, the less I needed so maybe one has to wean of honey and sugar!

NOW I know - little dried pod type things that work beautifully when making chocolate tea!  I put them in an infuser along with loose leaf tea and let steep.  Delicious!!!

Product:
Molasses, Blackstrap, Unsulfured, Organic, 15 oz.
Review:
I have NEVER liked molasses but needed to find a way to get more iron into my body. I had heard that blackstrap molasses was the best to take so I purchased Plantation based on an article I read online.  I am here to tell you, this stuff is sweet rather than sharp and bitter.  I add my daily tablespoon in my morning coffee to sweeten and it is delicious!  I could probably eat the tablespoon just by licking the spoon but it is very sweet and I've been off white sugar long enough that too much sweet is a horrible taste to me.  This works perfectly.  I just use the stronger stuff for my baked beans - this is perfect for "medicinal" purposes!

If you need more iron, I'd recommend this.  If you don't like super strongly flavored molasses, this is one you'd like - not too strong, good flavor, sweet, and good for you!

prompt.content:

Product:
FISHER Snack Mixed Nuts with Peanuts, Stand-Up Bag, Gluten Free, 5.5 oz
Review:
These are too good. Like seriously, I like to eat nuts in a controlled manner, just one or two servings at a time. These only lasted three days in my house. It was so hard to not go back for more.

These nuts are pretty salty, which I absolutely love. The added oil does make for a great smooth taste. We generally buy our mixed nuts from Costco, and they are quite good, but these taste much better.

I am tempted to order more right away because they were so good, but I'm hesitant because I'm not sure that I could have self-control.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Simple Mills Almond Flour Mix, Chocolate Chip Cookie, Naturally Gluten Free, 9.4 oz
Review:
I have tried so many gluten free baking products that I was doubting these would be any good. Boy was I surprised. We have a family member with true celiac and also a few that have IBS or gluten sensitive. It's especially hard on birthdays because up until this point it was pointless to make cupcakes or cake for them. Now they will be able to enjoy dessert at parties too. Simple Mills is now my go to cake mix. The cupcakes were genuinely good and have a great texture. I only wish they had an option that was sweetened with stevia or erythritol to make it low-carb as well. With all the people I know that are on low carb diets I wouldn't be surprised if Simple Mills would give it a whirl. In the meantime these will work for those that aren't low carbers.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Simple Mills Almond Flour Mix, Chocolate Chip Cookie, Naturally Gluten Free, 9.4 oz
Review:

It's especially hard on birthdays because up until this point it was pointless to make cupcakes or cake for them. Now they will be able to enjoy dessert at parties too. Simple Mills is now my go to gluten free cake mix. The cupcakes were genuinely good and have a great texture. With all the people I know that are on low carb diets I wouldn't be surprised if Simple Mills would give it a whirl. In the meantime these will work for those that aren't low carbers.

JOLLY RANCHER Hard Candy, Blue Raspberry Flavor, 88 Ounce
Review:
5 lbs. of blue raspberry Jolly Ranchers is the perfect filler for our daughter's Elsa piñata. These icy looking hard candies most definitely wrap up our Frozen theme. This huge bag is all I needed for the party. If you haven't had blue raspberry Jolly Ranchers they are a great hard candy that is colorful, flavorful, and has the perfect combination of sweet and tart. I'm assuming that most people have tried them, so Ill spend my time on reviewing the packaging. I absolutely love the size for a party.  I didn't count the candy, but the nutrition label says each serving is 3 pieces and it contains ~139 servings. That's over 400 pieces of candy; All in one bag! No need to buy or open multiple packages. It's perfect for my use (filling a piñata) or would be great for Halloween. Each piece is individually wrapped. All-in-all I am a big fan of the large bag.
Rating:
5.0

Review:

We have signed up for subscribe and save shipping and it ends up costing about half as much as if we purchased it at our local grocery store. It even is cheaper per ounce than Costco's deluxe mixed nut mix, and the Planters mix tastes so much better.
Rating:
5.0

So, due to the awesomeness of these almonds, I think next time I order them I will break them up into smaller Ziplock bags in order to more clearly limit my intake.
Rating:
5.0

Review:

Light, great tasting, and filling.

As has been said in other reviews, at the time of this writing the price on Amazon is almost double that of Costco so shop around

Review:

I'm addicted to the frothy cup that the Senseo machine makes and wouldn't switch to a Kcup brewer.(the pods are also more ecologic than plastic Kcups and can be preserved well in any jar with a tight fitting lid)
 This Kona is rich and flavorful, but not strong enough for my taste.  I supplement it with about a quarter tsp of instant coffee--sometimes decaf and sometimes espresso.

Product:
Baronet Coffee Fair Trade Organic French Roast Dark Roast (140 g), 18-Count Coffee Pods (Pack of 3)
Review:
I have been using the decaf flavored version of Baronet pods for several months.  This was my first sample of the organic Fair Trade French Roast.  They are well packaged, but not individually wrapped.  Once opened, they should be stored in an airtight container.
  The flavor is strong and pleasant, with just a slight burnt aftertaste characteristic of French Roasts.  I mellow that taste down a bit by adding about a quarter tsp of instant coffee. The pods fit the Senseo brewer perfectly.  I an eager to try some of their other caffeinated pod varieties.

4.0

I am highly satisfied with the resulting brew, though I like my coffee really strong and add just a little freeze dried instant to the brewed cup. The pods are not individually wrapped, so you need to store them in an airtight container.  They stay fresh for several weeks opened if they are properly stored.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Glutenfreeda Gluten Free Instant Oatmeal, Apple Cinnamon with Flax, 8-packet Box, 8 Pack Review: This review is for the texture snobs in the world. As others have mentioned in their reviews, the flavor is great and the ingredients/nutrition are better. Hold on, though: there's a "but" coming. Remember the flavored instant oatmeal we ate before we knew what "organic" or "gluten" meant? Brightly colored "banana" bits held onto their fake yellow color and their cubic shape long after the hot water mushified the oats for us. We ate fake crap, and we liked it. We're older and wiser now, and want real bananas: real bananas that we re-hydrate ourselves with our steaming hot filtered water for optimum health and enjoyment. Except that rehydrated banana bits don't stay in bit form. Nor do they rehydrate to sliced banana consistency. Nay! Rehydrated banana bits taste like delicious, wholesome bananas, and have the consistency of runny snot. That's right: runny snot. I love everything else about this oatmeal, but when I want to feel snot run down my throat, I'll go out and contract the common cold, thank you very much. Based on other reviews, this doesn't throw everyone. Based on other reviews, you might love this oatmeal and shrug off the banana snot texture without a second thought. But if you're a huge texture snob, I thought you might want to know what you're getting into. I will shudder and finish the rest of my banana oatmeal one snot-filled bowl at a time (unless I can't take it anymore, at which point the food bank gets a wholesome and delicious donation), but I won't purchase this again. I think I'll slice bananas into gluten-free oatmeal the next time I feel a bananas-and-cream craving. Best of luck with your oatmeal experience, and thank you for pausing to read a different perspective. Rating: 3.0 Product: Karen's Naturals Organic Just Blueberries, 2 Ounce Pouch Organic All Natural Freeze-Dried Fruits & Vegetables, No Additives or Preservatives, Non-GMO Review: Hey, these are good! Ok, I wasn't terribly surprised by how good these are: I love freeze-dried fruit, I love blueberries, and I've never detected an "off" taste in Just Tomatoes products. Some freeze-dried fruit smells and tastes like a factory for some reason, and seems to be a brand-specific problem. These are nicely crunchy and nicely flavorful, but have a tamer flavor than some other dried food. They taste a little cooked: like homemade blueberry jam, actually, which is what I pretended I was eating. There are only 2 servings in the nice big pouch, even though it felt more like 8. I love that it's hard to over-indulge on these. They stain my fingers! I was surprised that berries without juice can do that, but these do! They're a little smaller than Kix pieces. I did get one bad or burnt one in the whole bag (I didn't spit it out to check, sorry!), but unless I find more in subsequent orders, I wouldn't worry about it too much. Hope you enjoy these as much as I do! Rating: 5.0 Product: Better Oats mmmMuffins Old Fashion Instant Oatmeal, Blueberry Flavor, 5 Pouches per 7.55-oz. Box (Pack of 3 Boxes) Review: This is delicious. Steaming fresh blueberry muffins with that dipped-sugar crust top flavor with only 2 minutes of microwave time and no mixing? Amazing. Mine blew up in the microwave and the tiny office kitchen smelled like a whole rack of muffins baking even though there's no oven in there. Of course, the "natural and artificial flavors" help. I would ignore the artificial flavors and continue eating this convenient breakfast favorite if not for the my wheat-senses tingling. I handle gluten better than most celiac sufferers, but this oatmeal really set me off. Many of the other "Better Oats" deliberately have wheat in them. This doesn't, but I suspect it has a fair bit by accident. My condolences to other wheat-free folk, as this is quite possibly the most delicious oatmeal I've ever eaten. Rating: 4.0 Product: Bare Natural Apple Chips, Cinnamon, Gluten Free + Baked, Single Serve Bag - 1.7 Oz (10 Count) Review: When I had more time, I dehydrated apple chips and my coworker/friends gobbled them up and went looking for more. I have significantly less time now, and I'm trying to lay off eating sugary dried fruit all day, but I couldn't resist buying these with an Amazon coupon. Apple Cinnamon flavor: way better than some truly funky tasting freeze-dried fruit we've had lately. Funky Monkey comes to mind, but it's unfair to pick them out because I can't remember the other one that was also so bad I threw it away without even offering it to the college students, who will eat practically everything. Sea Salt Caramel: The added caramel flavor is pretty subtle. If you want to eat some caramels, you'll be disappointed. That said? These are pretty good! The flavor isn't consistent, so you get the occasional Mmmmmmm piece in a sea of normal-tasting (and still delicious) apple chips. I was going to avoid the extra sugar in these, but they're 46 grams of sugar to the plain one's 42 grams. Not a huge difference, there. They're also 200 calories/bag compared to 180 calories/bag for the plain ones. If the sugar or calorie count is really important, however, you'll need to read your own bag. These things change! This has a *little* of that factory-floor taste, which I presume is nitrogen or another low-humidity, low-oxygen air replacement, and it dissipates pretty quickly. I recommend letting it oxygenate for a minute or two before you dig in, as nitrogen is harmless but can taste really "off" to us. (the same concept applies to letting a nitrogen-packed steak air in the fridge for 15-30 minutes before you cook it). Of course, dried-to-a-crisp fruits will get soft and lose their crunch if you leave them out, so consider resealing the little bags in a sandwich bag or a small plastic container, squeezing out as much air as you can without crushing the chips. I have now tried all flavors, and the Sea Salt Caramel is the only one that had any trace of this initial unpleasant flavor. Chili Lime: This stole the show at game night last night. Everyone wanted to try it, even the paleo kids who usually eschew cane sugar. The consensus: "Wow, that is really weird, and really GOOD!" Admittedly, I could taste the lime but not the cayenne. I am on my own in this: the other gamers all tasted it and loved it. I'm unlikely to buy these very often, but I'll have to try adding lime and cayenne to my homemade apple chips. Fuji Apple Flavor: Sweet, crunchy, good. I reached for this for some sugar cravings, and I didn't regret it! I love that the whole bag is <200 calories, so I can feel like I'm really cheating, but it's actually not a terrible health choice! I expected Fuji Apple to be my least favorite flavor because it's the plainest and I usually prefer granny smith's tartness, but this was actually my favorite! Granny Smith: I tried to save this for a friend's birthday because we both love Granny Smith the best in my homemade chips or when eating regular apples, but it was sitting on the table, and I caved. It's good! It's much less sour than I expected, and less sour than my own dehydrated granny smith apple chips, but it's still sweet and tasty, just not very sour. Rating: 5.0 Product: Nature's Path Organic Chewy Granola Bars, Sunny Hemp Plus, 7.4 Ounce Box (Pack of 6) Review: I had to double-check the expiration date: Yep, expires a year from now. Still, it smells and tastes like oil gone bad. There's soy. There's flax. There's something sweet. But it's all drowned out by the taste and smell of the bad oil. I opened two bars to be sure, and passed one to my coworker to smell. "Yeah, gross," she said. "I usually eat stale stuff, but I wouldn't eat that!" Although I purchased this exact product locally, I did not buy it from this retailer. I'm surprised and disappointed - their pumpkin granola cereal is my favorite cereal! I much prefer Cascadian Farm's crunchy pumpkin granola bars, but they're hard to find. Kashi's are good if you don't have a wheat or a gluten allergy. Rating: 1.0 Product: Yogi Tea - Vanilla Spice Perfect Energy - Energizes and Supports Focus - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total Review: I don't react well to caffeine. In low doses, it simply doesn't affect me. In higher doses (3+ cups of black tea), it just makes me ill. This perks me up, though. I don't know which herb is doing the job, but the overall affect is lovely. I still don't drink more than one - too much caffeine! My box says it has 72 mg of caffeine compared to ~90 mg in coffee, but check your own box if it's important - these things can and do change! The flavor is just fine. It won't be a favorite any time soon, but it's fine. It's a sweet flavor of medium intensity: not as light as Stash Tea Company Decaf Raspberry & White Tea, 18 Count Tea Bags in Foil (Pack of 6), but certainly not as bold and sour as Tazo Passion Herbal Infusion Tea, Caffeine Free, 20-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6) or Taylors of Harrogate, Raspberry and Vanilla Infusion, 20 Count Wrapped Tea Bag. I don't detect the black or green tea in this - I know there's plenty of both in there, but it still registers as "herbal" on my palate. I hope this helps - happy tea drinking! Rating: 5.0 Product: Funky Monkey Snacks Variety Pack, Freeze-Dried Fruit, 1-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)" /> Review: The pineapples hit it out of the park. WOW. They are crazy, crazy sweet and satisfied any candy craving I might have. They were so sweet that I was able to share my bag and nurse it through a day instead of gobbling it all down half-conscious of what I was eating. There was no subtlety, but I loved them. A++. The mango OJ was also sweet, and tasty. It got stuck in my teeth every time: annoying, but not bad. I'd eat it again. The bananas? Meh. Boring. They were the least sweet, the least flavorful, and the least interesting of the bunch. Some of the packages had a really yucky artificial taste to them, like a factory. It was bitter and unpleasant,and varied by package. I kept referring back to the packaging to see if there were unfamiliar ingredients (there weren't) or if it advertised being packed in a non-oxygen atmosphere that would have an off flavor to it. I tried airing them out, which didn't seem to help much. The apples were ALL gross. Factory, factory, factory. Some of my coworkers shared my distaste, and some didn't seem to notice it at all, but every package was the same. In the future, I'd order the pinepple guava, but no other flavor in this variety pack. Leave the factory IN the factory, please, and don't flavor my food with it! The crunch was universally good for all of these products, by the by. It's very satisfying, but you can get it in any sufficiently dried food. All freeze-dried food and many bake-dried foods will have it. Rating: 3.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product:

Review:
When I get a product or even look at something in the store first thing I do is look to see what's in it.  Unfortunately it didn't list all the ingredients online so I took a chance anyway.  First off let me say that this smells like heaven and tastes great too but if you have a heart condition you won't be able to drink it.  I was only able to take a few sips so that I could try it for the flavor.  DH said it did indeed make him get a little pick me up after drinking it so I will go with it does help energize you.  The flavor is perfectly balanced and not overwhelming so as long as you don't have a health issue give this a try.  It really is good and I do hope at some point the company can come out with this particular flavor in a decaf.

Review:

Each bar is a really good size and sooooooooo tasty.  I just love peanuts!!  We had a family cookout this weekend and I passed them around for each of us to try and the the overall vote was fantastic.  A great product from a great company.  I think the fact that the peanuts weren't ground up to small pieces added to the richess of the product.  The peanut size in the bars was half a peanut and there are loads of them.  Planters didn't use a pea shooter to put the best of their product together.  Some products will stress a certain item only to have very little in there.  Not so here.  This is a must have snack for anyone who loves or likes peanuts in its best forms.  YUMM!

They are cheaper than the brand name Nespresso pods so I guess you get what you pay for.  Hubby likes them a lot better than I do but he also likes a more bitter flavor to his coffee.  I will get more of them for him but as for me I will stick to the Nespresso ones.

Review:
This is another terrific nutiva coconut product.  This is my first time trying a refined coconut oil and I'm really glad I've got this in my cupboard now.
While I love the health benefits and taste of nutiva's unrefined coconut oil, there are some dishes that I simply do not like tasting coconutty (eggs for instance).  I can now use coconut oil as my primary cooking oil in more recipes.

Product:
Nutiva Organic Chips, Coconut, 1 Pound, 16 Ounce
Review:
If you're looking for a delicious, UNSWEETENED, coconut product with a lot of texture, this is the product for you.  I've found lots of great ways to incorporate these into a variety of foods.  They've found their way into waffles, banana pancakes, oatmeal, cookies, cakes, muffins, smoothies, yogurt parfaits, stir fry, etc.  They toast up nice and the large size gives them good "presence" in your recipes.
The flavor is subtle, especially if you are used to the sweetened, moist coconut products.  I've come to really enjoy this product a lot and am glad I gave it a try.
UPDATE:  These store very well in the frig--stay nice and fresh for months (as in I confess that I found a little bit left in a ziploc bag when cleaning the frig and they were still yum!)

Product:
Nutiva Organic Coconut Manna from Fresh, non-GMO, Sustainably Farmed Coconuts, 15-ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
NOTE: If you like this product and plan to use it, the quickest way to heat (and then properly store in a glass jar) is to put in the trunk of your car on a warm/hot day for a couple of hours...learned this as a soapmaker who uses lots of coconut oil! I then mixed well and poured it into a sterilized mason jar.

I LOVE the smell of the Coconut manna, but then I love the smell of all coconut.  I normally use coconut oil in quite a few recipes and this is a slightly different experience as it includes the actual coconut.  The problem for me is that the ground whole coconut tastes and has the texture of....ground whole coconut.  Adding the coconut oil for creaminess isn't changing the gritty to smooth.  It changes the velvety texture of the oil to gritty, pasty (think really really thick peanut butter).

The only way I use it is making fresh peanut butter or almond butter in the VitaMix using just the nuts and a spoonful of Manna.  Said peanut butter on sandwich with banana or used in peanut butter cookies is borderline sinful.  This is the only thing I've found tastes good with this product.  I use coconut oil for everything else.

I was adding it to various recipes but have found that the earthy/dirty (hard to describe) taste of the ground coconut just doesn't work with much.  In addition, it doesn't work well in smoothies in the vitamix as the manna never fully dissolves or incorporates in the drink.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Sahale Snacks Cranberry Almond With Black Pepper & Orange Zest Bar, No Artificial Flavors or Preservatives, 4 count
Review:
I have had hit and miss success trying sahale products, with my favorite being their snack blends.
I love their creativity and inventiveness (which sometimes goes over into sheer weirdness).
We keep these type of bars around solely for emergency snacking and meal replacement (mostly in our cars) to keep us from snacking on even unhealthier items.
This variety pack was definitely filled with unusual flavor combinations. The bars are TINY, barely over an ounce (think snack candy bar size from hallowwen mixes for reference).
They average about 200 calories each, all have some type of nuts as first ingredient, have about 10 grams of sugars and 5 grams of protein.
All oh them were good, but none were great, and none will be reordered by either of us.
Overall, we found them to be too chewy, gummy and sweet.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Kember's Gluten Free Taco Seasoning, 4 oz.
Review:
We eat a fair amount of taco seasoned meats in various menus so i was happy to see this gluten free blend
It arrived prompty and is packaged in a glass jar, excellent!
The flavor of the mix is excellent!
The price is way too high...it takes 1/4 cup mix per pound of meat, and the container appears to have about one cup of mix, maybe one and a quarter cup tops
I would like to see this offered in a 16 ounce container at a much more attractiv price per ounce
Rating:
4.0
Product:
NurturMe Organic Quinoa Squares, Cheddar + Broccoli, 5 Pouches (Pack of 6)
Review:
In the good/better/best world of nutrition I think these snacks fall into the good category,
If your child won't eat whole foods and 'needs' their snacks delivered in mini-packages these are a good choice.
Each package has about 8 smallish squares of snack, about 1/3 ounce of food.
I am not a fan of mini packs of food because of the waste and receptiveness of package sizes.
But there are times where those little packages are handy.
The squares taste good, you can taste the cheese and broccoli which I like and there isn't any bitter/off taste that happens with a lot of self-labeled 'healthy' snacks. We all liked the texture of the squares as well.
My 2 year old grandson is a great and adventurous eater and likes real food so I wasn't surprised he liked these.
Rating:
4.0

At one time she had me believing that cough drops were good for her overall breathing but I came to find out that what she really likes is hard candy in any form or shape. I conducted a brief experiment with her: I bought her a large bag of regular candy, like 20 lbs of variety type candy, and stopped giving her cough drops. Well, it seems that what she mostly wanted was hard candy in her mouth and she never once asked me for the cough drops while she had this sizable bag available. At her age and according to her doctor she should get away with almost anything so I did not sweat the situation. Her dental work is, of course, expensive for she is addicted to sugar in the form of hard candy. Getting back on track: while she was enjoying YummyEarth Organic Candy Drops, Wild Peppermint, 16-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4) she praised them daily. I liked the amount on each bag and the many kind and encouraging reviews I found prior to purchasing this item. 4 Stars and when the faithful bag of candy disappears in time record I will give her the last two, which I am sure she will go back to endorsing the healthy properties of this cough drop, wild peppermint and all!

Product:
 Kodiak Cakes All Natural Frontier Pancake, Flapjack and Waffle Mix, Original, 24 Ounce (Pack of 6) 
Review:
I am just dreaming because I haven't been camping since my Army days, but this would be the perfect start of the morning with a strong brewed coffee and powder milk for the kiddies. I was really pleased with my first batch of Flapjacks (I had never heard of that term, or if I did it did not stick), and was able to enjoy them thoroughly. Or should I say we, for I refuse to eat alone if I can help it. I normally make my own batter, an old family recipe that requires accurate measurements, plus a few ingredients, and more steps than one. When I am patient and careful, they are very good indeed, but as of last my so called pancakes have taken a turn toward the mediocre kind, and when I came across this great product called Kodiak Cakes Frontier Flapjack & Waffle Mix, 24-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6), I was very intrigued to say the least. So I purchased after reading the knowledgeable and glowing reviews by the well respected amazon reviewers, I never had seen so many enthusiastic reviews for Flapjacks (I love that name), and after reading the nutrition box to see how many carbs they were all about, I was gladly surprised and encouraged by the findings.
Boxes arrived, cabin like, outdoor like packaging, so much in fact, I was thinking of a mini camping trip on the backyard to add to the overall effect, perhaps myself cheating a little bit and going to my King Size where I reach deep levels of sleep without a hitch, but making sure to be the first one up to start the Flapjacks. I almost felt like hiding the boxes, and pretending it was all my skillful ways that made it happen. Enough to say is that I was able to put out an outstanding short/large stack of double fluffy (these did not flatten at all, even left overs remain inflated the next day) Flapjacks. Everyone agreed I had taken the concept to a higher level, and for a minute or two I took all the credit, when a sneaky little spy discovered the boxes. Add great syrup, Smuckers Sugar Free for the sugar intolerant, and regular Maple or your preference for the rest, quality butter (worry about heart attacks a little later), and eat them while they are hot!
The real beauty is that for regular Flapjacks all that is required is plain clean water from the streams, or the refrigerator in our case, and follow closely the sound advice found in the their website, kind of like the big no no's of making flapjacks, one of the most important: do not over steer the batter, do not overcooked, do not flatten (leave them be!), etc. I wanted to take the credit, but really, it belongs to Kodiak Cakes Frontier Flapjack & Waffle Mix! Will do the Waffle mix, but for now I am lazy and happy to use be using plain old water like in the old frontier! 4.5 Stars!
Rating:
4.0

Nutiva Organic, Raw, Shelled Hempseed from non-GMO, Sustainably Farmed Canadian Hemp, 1.1-ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
This hemp seed reminds me of finely chopped black walnuts in appearance and to my taste buds, it has a much milder black walnut taste. I really did not know what to expect for a nutty flavor, but was pleasantly surprised. I plan to use them as a nut substitute when I make banana bread. I was concerned since we were having such warm weather this past week that they would turn rancid during shipping, but they arrived fully sealed, fresh tasting, and thus far I have no shell complaint. I have also started using Nutiva's organic hemp oil for salad dressings and Pacific' hemp milk to decrease my use of diary. All products have proven enjoyable winners.

Product:
Next Organic Brazil Nuts Dark Chocolate Covered, 4-Ounce (Pack of 3)
Review:
I ordered these from Amazon, but they are not listing it as a verified purchase which is odd. I only mention this as I tend to believe the verified purchases eliminate the "shill factor." The nuts were delivered in perfect condition on a hot day. These candies are delicious and if you can resist not eating at least half of one package as a single serving, you have more self control than I! Organic dark chocolate covered Brazil nuts are difficult to find at a reasonable price. Now I wish I had purchased more while they were on sale. The nuts are fresh tasting medium sized covered in a glossy dark chocolate. This chocolate does not readily melt on your fingers, such as non-glossy chocolate typically does. I am enjoying these heavenly treats (5 pieces for 219 calories).
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nature's Path Organic Oats, Steel Cut, 30 Ounce Canister (Pack of 6) (Packaging may vary)
Review:
I'm a long time fan of McCann's oatmeal and a new fan of Country Choice (CC). The McCann's is cut larger so is a more chewier product. For those converting to steel cut oats, the finer cut of CC might make the transition easier. I could not tell a flavor difference between the two. Also for one serving I use one cup of boiling water w/ 1/3 cup of oatmeal. Here's my comparison based on Trader Joe's pricing:
McCann $4.99/28 oz., metal can, non-organic
Country Choice $2.99/30 oz., cardboard canister, organic
Surprisingly the CC has 5G of protein vs. 4G for McCann and 4G of fiber vs. 3G for McCann based on  c. dry of each. Clearly CC is the best value, particularly since it is organic and made in the USA. BUT when Amazon has the coupon code deal, it's more of a coin toss and personal preference.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Country Choice Organic Snacking Cookies, Iced Oatmeal, 7 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
If these had not been organic I'd only given 2 stars. I'm used to eating Nature's Path organic ginger spice cookies which is the one I'm using to compare. The NP ones have a stronger ginger flavor which I prefer. The crunch factor (hardness) is about the same. The price point is the biggest factor. The NP at $32 w/o coupon for 12 9 ox. boxes are approx. 4.75 pound (the last case I bought had a coupon so were $22 or 3.26/lb). These are about 6.50/lb. at Amazon's current price. I probably won't buy these again as I'll stick w/ Nature's Path. That said, I did give this brand's chocolate mint cookies 5 stars and I do plan on purchasing those again as well as trying their chocolate chip and oatmeal cranberry.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
YS Organic Bee Farms - Organic Honey, 16 oz gel
Review:
This is not your typical honey. Granted its organic and cream colored although it is not creamed honey. It is "pure" honey in the truest definition. The texture is solid, dense, somewhat waxy and velvety smooth with a pleasant floral taste. It describes itself as a gel, but I think it is much denser and although one gets a 1# jar, it is a small weighty jar. It softens easily on a piece of warm toast which is heavenly (no butter needed) or simply enjoy eating a spoonful by letting it melt in your mouth for a sensual treat. Due to its cost, which I think it is worth every cent, I won't be using it in tea. I'll continue using Rain Forest organic honey also sold on Amazon for that purpose. I think of this American/Canadian made honey as a true health food as it has numerous benefits. If you ever purchased the creamed South of France honey in the pail that Amazon used to carry, this honey's flavor and texture(when softened)will remind you of that incredible French honey. This is now my favorite honey. I encourage you to visit YS Organic Bee Farms website for additional information as they are a remarkable company. Also to comment on Swanson, the company that sold it, they were quick to fulfill and ship the order, both jars were well packed, they thanked me for my order a couple of times and sent a coupon for $5 off a future order which can be used in a direct order w/ them or on Amazon. So you know I'll be reordering this delightful honey and a few lucky friends may also receive a jar.
Rating:
5.0

Review:

golds.output: I've been a devoted fan of Maldon salt for years now, and this latest purchase solidified my unwavering love for this kitchen gem. The pyramid-shaped flakes are a delight to sprinkle on everything, offering a light, airy crunch that elevates any dish.  They're perfect for adding a touch of ocean-kissed flavor to grilled veggies, or a sprinkle of magic to my favorite salads.  While I have a collection of salts, from the earthy Hawaiian Red Alaea to the delicate Grey Hawaiian Lava, Maldon remains my go-to. It's not just a salt; it's a culinary experience.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Maldon Sea Salt Flakes, 8.5 ounce Box
Review:
I have been a fan for Maldon salt for many years now, once you discover this well known kitchen gem you will never look back, I stopped to write a review because I was making another purchase and realized that I never wrote anything about it on Amazon... The pyramid shaped flaky crystals can be sprinkled on for light as air like salt crunch or broken between the fingers as it gets sprinkled on anything and everything. Grilled veggies never had it so good. Salted Caramel is beyond luscious with this added in. I use this in place of most salt in my cooking even tough I have about ten vials of various salts ranging from Grey Hawaiian Lava, Pink Himalayan, Bamboo Jade, Hawaiian Red Alaea to a Black course grind  ( great with lemonade) on my counter, I cook a lot so I go a bit nuts with this stuff. This is worth the buck and lasts a while, I say try it once then see how you feel about it, I use this as my daily basic cooking salt but it's really so much more as the taste and texture surpasses anything else salt related that I have ever bought.

I also buy their peppercorns which are really zesty and the gorgeous pinkish smoked salt, this is so good that it best my usual stand by, Kosher salt which is nice and delicate but doesn't have the crunch and flavor of Maldon. This is the best salt hands down, soft and flaky, crunchy and slightly briny, it has a fresh ocean taste that truly tantalizes the taste buds.

- Kasia S.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Celestial Seasonings Madagascar Vanilla Red Tea Bags - 20 ct
Review:
I have loved tea ever since I was a little girl, and I can honestly say that Celestial Seasonings has been one of my favorite whimsical brands of teas supporting my habit of drinking this healthful and delicious brew. I don't know anyone who can resist the cozy boxes with cheery, charming artwork pleasing to the eye, all printed on 100% recycled cardboard, with the tea bags being large and very plain as their taste once dropped in the hot water is worth the bag looking the way it does while the cover art on the box really make this a better tea than some of the brand out there in their fancy boxes and shiny labels, that taste flat and bitter.

Madagascar Vanilla Red is a caffeine free blend of Rooibos, Natural French Vanilla Flavor and Vanilla bean. When sugar or honey or even milk are added it tastes like the sweetest, almost chewy vanilla one can sink their teeth into whenever a sweet craving kicks in. I swear it reminds me of the Madagascar Vanilla I use in all my baking for the intense and heady sweet aroma and it tastes like a bakery treaty in a cup and since it's healthy, easy to find and inexpensive it makes me a very satisfied customer. If I drink it plain, no sugar no nothing it tastes like a delicate exotic tea with a breath of sweetness, and this is one of the very few teas I can drink plain, quite a feat in my eyes.

I heartily recommend it for any tea fan, even if they don't think that Herbal/Caffeine type teas are their cup of tea, haha, this is better because its not decaf, its naturally caffeine free, omitting the artificial process and it simply makes me happy when I drink it.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Doctor Kracker Organic Crispbread, Seeded Spelt, 7 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
My first introduction to Doctor Kracker was through a random review on Amazon about eight years ago, dormant but not forgotten the review resurfaced when I finally saw a box of the flatbreads at my local Zabar's (perk of living in New York). While shopping I spotted them so of course my curiosity escalated and I took a box home, I love pumpkin and cheese, so these were totally up my alley, a few years later and I'm a still huge fan, in fact I'm munching on the now, watching Japanese Iron Chef on TV now, figuring I should review something that I'm so wild for.

These offer a major crunch, you almost have to chew these like a Viking with gusto but they are oh so good, the cheddar is quietly baked into to the batter with a few extra sprinkles on top and it provides a lightly salty and crispy background for the nutty pumpkin seeds which are sprinkled throughout each large slab, you can barely taste the cheese, just the salty residue really as these are nice and healthy, each packs 4 grams of fiber and 5 grams of protein per 100 calories ( 8 per box). This is a great treat to enjoy with beer if you want to go hang out with friends, or a nice piece under some creamy French Bree or nice slice of cured meat, even turkey and apples can become a lunch time snack with this flatbread under as it's sturdy enough to be a part of a meal. For me these make for a yummy bite, I can never get enough and I finish a box in no time, these are subtle but so refined that they beckon for me to keep coming back, anytime I'm at that store I have to get these because it's impossible to resists what awaits inside. These do not taste like junk food, they are very basic yet complex, at first they hardly taste like anything but the more you eat them the more you want, so keep some on hand once you start them.

- Kasia S.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Blue Diamond Natural Oven Roasted Almonds Vanilla Bean, 8-Ounce Jars (Pack of 6)
Review:
I have passed these in the store a few times before deciding to give them a try, and man I'm glad I did. The taste is really etheral, nothing artificial or fake, but a mellow, smooth buttery hint of vanilla - pretty subtle but addictive never the less. The first day I had this I ate about  of the container and had to stop myself from having any more.

These comes in a nice size, 8 oz plastic container, easy to take with me or keep on my desk at work, true that is distracts me, I find myself gazing at them and reaching to have a piece here and there, but they taste as good as candy and are healthy.

What I also love is the lack of corn syrup, this is sweet but has none of the appalling chemicals that food companies love to feed us with. This little nut, native to Iran is virtually carb free and has lots of fiber, vitamin E and is rich in mono unsaturated fat ( the good one that helps lower LDL cholesterol). It is possible that almonds benefit the skin - good complexion never hurts, and help prevent cancer, have anti-inflammatory properties and boosts immunity - phew, so much for such a little nut.

Also this price can't be beat, I will order my next batch from Amazon.

- Kasia S.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Ahmad Tea Peach & Passion Fruit Black Tea, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
If you're going to sip this lusciously delicious tea you might as well grab your kitty or puppy, a good book, blanket and snuggle up in the favorite armchair because good times are ahead!

Having the pleasure of all ready trying out some of the Ahmad teas I was pretty sure this was a good purchase but it ended up being tasty beyond my predictions. This tea tastes like a wonderful black smooth tea with the succulent mouth watering flavors of juicy apricots. I prefer a black tea with fruit blend to herbal fruit teas when I want something soothing because the black tea give the fruit unparallel depth and character.

This really bursts with flavor when sugar is added and it can be drank day and night. I'm really looking forward to tasting other Ahmad flavors like Strawberry and passion fruit and maybe their Earl Gray. This is easily one of my favorite teas and I can't see anyone not loving it from the first sip!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Ahmad Tea Peach & Passion Fruit Black Tea, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
I'm a tea lover and as much as I like super fancy blends, sometimes plain black tea is the most  soothing and simply satisfying.  This tea is a simple and delicious treat with some smooth creamy vanilla and if anything its even more comforting and luxurious than any of my favorite black teas. The taste is so natural and subtly sweet that it feels extra special and can really be drank at any time of the day instead of plain tea.

Im really looking forwards to trying all of the flavors Ahmad carries, and at these great prices I see no obstacles on my tea tasting journey!

Each bag is packaged beautifully in foil and the box can stand straight up, facing forward with this removable slit at the bottom for easy dispensing.

Lovely and tasty, simply great tea.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Arrowhead Mills Organic Spelt Flour, 2 Pound (Pack of 4)
Review:
I often use this organic flour to make warm and cozy muffins in the fall and winter seasons, my favorite are the Apple and Cinnamon Muffins from the Nigella Kitchen cookbook by my culinary muse Nigella Lawson.  Those are just divine and oh so easy, this wonderful organic flour lets me have fun in the kitchen because I can bake and try out new stuff and still make it healthy since the fiber in this product is impressive. Just  cup has 130 calories, 1 gram fat, 0 saturated, trans fat, cholesterol & sodium, 150 mg potassium, 25 g carb, 4 grams fiber, 0 sugar and 4 grams of protein with some niacin and riboflavin per serving.

Spelt is special and it's related to wheat; the earliest findings of it are from the 5th millennium BC, just north of the Black Sea in Transcaucasia. Europe munched on it for ages, I come from Europe but it was America that introduced me to it through British recipes, life is funny indeed! This grain has been traced from the Neolithic to the Bronze Age, it kept the human machine alive and growing so I figure it won't hurt to bake with it once in a while, turns out that the nutty taste and hearty bite aren't so hard to convert to, this can make delicious  breads, cookies or muffins, white flour isn't the only option anymore, the world of good grains lies in front of everyone, just takes a change and courage to cook with the ancient grains that have stood the test of time, the taste and health benefits are worth the try.  Spelt does contain gluten, which I don't have a problem digesting, just a fyi to bakers out there who have food sensitivities and allergies.

- Kasia S.
Rating:
5.0

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Bob's Red Mill Teff Flour, 24-ounce (Pack of 4) Review: Teff, a mainstay of diets in Ethiopia and popular in surrounding African countries as well, has the highest calcium content of any grain. Its actually a variety of millet thats easy to grow in diverse climates and under unpromising conditions and has a sweet, molasses-like taste. Its also gluten-free. You need to read Nutrition Facts on this grain to see the shocking amount of minerals and vitamins that it contains. Rare grain but healthy and delicious. Takes long time to cook so I mix it with many other grains like amaranth and barley which take long time to cook as well and the result is one fulfilling, nutritious mix that I add to all my soups. It is a different grain but a rare grain and I consume with all oher grains. Teff is never organic, produced in US, gluten free with calcium and magnesium, Teff is kissing cousin of Amaranth. Both have almost the same composition, mostly the same minerals and vitamins except Teff is high in manganese. I stopped consuming oats since I could never find oats having any Phytosterols and hardly any other minerals, so amaranth offer more nutrients, especially when it is raw and uncooked. If I was baking bread, Amaranth bread would offer more starch 111-71=40gr which translates into more calories but for cardio, it is well needed. Starch makes you feel full just like rice, potato, pasta unlike greens where you can eat and eat and still feel hungry but with starch it is like eating protein. The 50% extra starch difference is what pushes Amaranth to sell more than Teff. Teff vs. Amaranth in calories 708/716, calcium DV% 35/31, magnesium DV% 89/120, potassium DV% 24/28, zinc DV% 47/37... Teff is never USDA organic certified. Amaranth offers more selenium 52-12=40% and vitamin B5 28-18=10% which are essential nutrients. All those measurements where for one cup serving. Quinoa is a milder taste grain in comparison to Amaranth or Teff but regardless I consume it all. Quinoa cooks in ten minutes, no more no less, ready on the spot, whenever I wish, with no hassle, with great taste but Amaranth and Teff take longer, and I mean really, really longer. Cooking Teff and Amaranth is a process, time consuming regardless of the brand but I ground amaranth for calcium and magnesium with flax and sesame seed and consume it daily. Powder will go rancid so need to purchase what is needed and kept in freezer. Rating: 5.0 Product: Bob's Red Mill Whole Grain Teff, 24-ounce (Pack of 4) Review: Teff, a mainstay of diets in Ethiopia and popular in surrounding African countries as well, has the highest calcium content of any grain. Its actually a variety of millet thats easy to grow in diverse climates and under unpromising conditions and has a sweet, molasses-like taste. Its also gluten-free. Takes long time to cook so I mix it with many other grains like amaranth and barley which take long time to cook as well and the result is one fulfilling, nutritious mix that I add to all my soups.
