I stopped consuming oats since I could never find oats having any Phytosterols and hardly any other minerals, so amaranth offer more nutrients, especially when it is raw and uncooked. If I was baking bread, Amaranth bread would offer more starch 111-71=40gr which translates into more calories but for cardio, it is well needed. Starch makes you feel full just like rice, potato, pasta unlike greens where you can eat and eat and still feel hungry but with starch it is like eating protein. The 50% extra starch difference is what pushes Amaranth to sell more than Teff. Teff vs. Amaranth in calories 708/716, calcium DV% 35/31, magnesium DV% 89/120, potassium DV% 24/28, zinc DV% 47/37... Teff is never USDA organic certified. Amaranth offers more selenium 52-12=40% and vitamin B5 28-18=10% which are essential nutrients. All those measurements where for one cup serving. Quinoa is a milder taste grain in comparison to Amaranth or Teff but regardless I consume it all. Quinoa cooks in ten minutes, no more no less, ready on the spot, whenever I wish, with no hassle, with great taste but Amaranth and Teff take longer, and I mean really, really longer. Cooking Teff and Amaranth is a process, time consuming regardless of the brand but I ground amaranth for calcium and magnesium with flax and sesame seed and consume it daily. Powder will go rancid so need to purchase what is needed and kept in freezer. Seeds are the way to go. Rating: 5.0 Product: Bob's Red Mill Dried Tart Cherries, 8-Ounce Packages (Pack of 8) Review: Cherries contain melatonin, a natural antioxidant with a well-documented history of helping to regulate the sleep-wake cycle. Produced naturally by the body in small amounts, melatonin plays a role in inducing sleepiness at night and wakefulness during the day. Although melatonin is marketed as a supplement to help people fall asleep, I'm not a big advocate of going that rout since I care less for unregulated supplement industry. Consuming natural melatonin from whole foods like cherries is clearly another story since it is a fruit and my body more likely is going to use that very natural ingredient from a fruit in a much different way than it would via a pill. I do the same with ACV since I have no intention to go to store every single day. I am very healthy with no chronic or health issues and for years I have consumed cherries for inflammation since being in many sports, my body appreciates any help that it can get for all those bends and twists that it requires my joints to keep up those grueling exercises at a time. I just consume a spoon every single night straight out of the bottle, no mixing, no stories. Conventional cherries are one of the dirty dozens so USDA organic option is better choice for me. Furthermore the added sugar and oil, make this a very high calorie food with thirty one grams of sugar for one third cup serving size. Rating: 3.0 Product: Bumble Bee Salmon Pink Canned, 14.75-Ounce Cans (Pack of 4) Review: The cannery which produces this pink salmon for Chicken of the Sea, produces for majority of the sellers selling pink salmon. All come from one area in Alaska. It is the same can with different wrapping and sold for twice the cost in supermarkets but at Whole Foods Stores for $3.29 and Trader Joes for $2.99 year round except three months out of the year. Will never taste the same as the sockeye salmon fresh out of water, not few weeks old that I BBQ with the skin and eat the whole thing with just pitta bread, nothing added just pure salmon skin, meat and juicy oils. That is one real tasty delicious food out of this world. These are not as tasty but it is the best alternative and a very good alternative since ready whenever I want it to, in a can. Forget about the farm raised junk fish where they add carpet die. For something like $3.50 a pound, this is a very healthy protein source for me with many nutrients especially after pumping iron. Costco sells the worst tasting canned pink salmon, these are much better than Costco. Pink salmon is sold in cans hardly ever or infact never fresh unless you catch it yourself in Alaska. These are all small salmons so you will get couple of whole salmons in a can with all the bones and the skin. Product feature description is wrong. You can not take out the skin and the bone that easily so you may forget about buying this salmon if you can not consume it all. There is no vitamin A in this salmon either like some claims out there. I consume a lot of wild fish, sprats, sardines, herrings... No farm raised fish for me or fresh fish unless I catch it myself since fresh fish means few weeks old except shell fish which I get it in three days. The smaller the fish the more nutrition in the fish. I consume these salmon since these salmon stay in the rivers of cold Pacific in order not to be consumed by the bigger fish and feast on small bugs and fish which are high in nutrients. Few of the reviews on Amazon about these salmons consuming squid is misrepresentation. Bones means calcium. Skin means good polyunsaturated fat. I mix the whole can with few different vegetables and wolla, get my calcium, protein and all nutrients for $3.50 a pound. These pink canned salmons are in water not vegetable oil. I drain the water since I could care less for 2000 mg of salt in the can. Healthy, without any additives, growth hormones, pesticides, antibiotics, carpet dye, or sitting on a shelf exposed to air for few weeks... Sockeye salmon is the only fresh wild salmon you can get during the spring run and sold as smoked salmon which I consume but cost more. Atlantic and steelheads are only farm raised. Keta, Pink, Chum, Coho are always canned. Bravo. WARNING: 99% of all cans are lined in plastic which leach high levels of a chemical called Bisphenol A, which has been linked to cancer, clogging of arteries, birth defects, miscarriages, obesity, and insulin resistance, which can lead to Type II diabetes. Refer to the Environmental Working Group report on BPA for more information. This product claims that it has no BPA. It is generally safer to eat fresh than it is to eat canned goods. Canned goods, sometimes are contaminated with harmful agents such as botulism. Rating: 3.0 Product: Ahmad Tea Aromatic Earl Grey, 17.6-Ounce Tins (Pack of 3) Review: I consume few cups of tea on daily basis somewhere around 10 plus cups a day and I have been doing that for last few decades. I try all different brands all the time. I have bought this tea for $10 a can and that is from a busy tea shop that sells boxes after boxes. I use percolator and mix this tea with green tea and end up with an excellent tasting tea, cup after cup. This tea in no way is a full body Earl Grey tea. Ahmad Tea does not specify what kind of black tea. I would assume this is the same as less pricier English Breakfast Tea with added Bergamot flavouring. The real Earl Grey is sold in the green container which is pricier. After using this for one month, I stopped since for unknown reason this tea stained my teeth when infact I have not experienced such heavy staining with any other tea. Rating: 1.0 Product: Bob's Red Mill French Green Lentils, 24-ounce (Pack of 4) Review: French green lentils are not too popular and certainly expensive. I consumed this before I was able to get organic in bulk for $2.90 a pound. Takes longer to cook so better for soups. The taste is closer to green but for more money and available in organic form as well. Just because of the taste and the price, Bob will not sell it in four quantity bags like they do with red and green. Yellow is the most expensive, never in organic form, green and red always available in organic form. Red sells for 50% more than green. Green has more potassium than red and better for soups. This is conventional, not a GMO but certainly not organic. Excellent brand but organic is always better for the planet earth and its inhabitants if organic available. I consume red, yellow and last green lentils all the time. Red cooks fastest of all, tastes the best the same for yellows but yellows are rare. Green is firmer but not as tasty as red. Sometimes I consume lentils without adding anything to it but sometimes I do which tastes great. I do not soak lentils overnight just like I do with any type of bean since too much soaking will damage lentils but regardless soaking is a necessity since it allows heat faster without killing more nutrients. Lentils are soft unlike beans so just couple hours of soaking is good enough. Lentils need to be washed and rinsed few times since the dirt on the lentils causes foam regardless of the brand, organic or conventional, so rinse, rinse, rinse. I saut lots of fresh squash in EVOO with lots of spices, steam lentils in a separate pot, mix it together and place it all in a bowl where I add lots of fresh crushed bulbs of delicious CA garlic 2 x 2 Pound Fresh Garlic USA California Heirloom Monviso Gilroy Finest (4 Pounds Total) which are real spicy and burns my tongue with lots of Sumac and my favorite sardines not sold at Amazon. Delicious, delicious, delicious. I even have the left over next day which is more delicious. The most harmful and deadly diseases plaguing America today are caused by food; cheap, low quality processed foods high in sugar, fat, salt, genetically modified ingredients and pesticides. when you reach for whole, nutrient-dense, organic foods, you get a food-remedy tool kit that not only will ward off cancer and heart disease, but also colds, flu, allergies, and a host of other ailments that plague us every day. Rating: 3.0 Product: Bell Plantation PB2 Powdered Peanut Butter and PB2 with Premium Chocolate, 6.5 Ounce (Pack of 2) Review: I buy five pound peanuts in shell, unsalted without any oil roasting for $5.69. At $1.14 a pound it is one of the top daily ingredients of my diet. Difficult to find peanuts in shell, UNSALTED without any oil. Peanuts are very high in fatty acids where many other nuts lack and the price of peanuts are as great as their taste. No peanut butter for me since I consume the nut itself as medicine, a needed ingredient on a daily basis which is a priority to me for getting the fatty acids of ARACHIDONIC which converts LINOLENIC, MEAD for cartilage and ARACHIDIC an unsaturated fatty acid essential to the human body for healthy brain functioning and normal growth and development. I consume pistachios on daily basis as well for PALMITOLEIC fatty acid which increases insulin and almonds for PHYTOSTEROLS, VITAMIN E, CALCIUM and MAGNESIUM. I do extensive fatty acids blood tests which are expensive but it insures my healthy life style and peanuts are so important part of the equation. I could care less for sodium and processed peanuts since I have no assurance of what I get in processed peanuts regardless of powder, oil or butter at high prices and more importantly where nuts go rancid much quicker than when kept in a shell form. No sodium, without any oil is the way to go since roasted without shell are digested quicker which in return turn into unwanted calories where not roasted takes longer to digest which makes one stays full for a longer period of time. I bought PB2 at Costco and tried contacting the producer but they will not provide a table of their fatty acids or amino acids. In one word, this is a pure processed food with no table of what is in the mix. Even whey isolate powders provide a table of all their content when it comes to each acid but PB2 does not. It certainly provides the fact that ingredients are SUGAR and SALT with UNKNOWN fatty acid ratio of peanut proteins... What peanut proteins... It's perfect for a quick breakfast or a snack.  I love that it's baked fresh, so it's always warm and delicious.  I'll definitely be buying this again!

Product:
Bob's Red Mill Honey Almond Granola, 18 Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
My husband eats a LOT of granola.  This particular granola is my favorite to keep for him.  It is pleasantly sweet and flavorful, but not dosed with sugar and oil so the calories are not excessive.  The quality is consistently good.  I trust Bob's Red Mill products.  They are great.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Shredded Coconut (Unsweetened), 24-ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
Bob's Red Mill products are always fine quality and this shredded coconut is excellent.  I've learned to keep it in the freezer as it takes me a long time to use it up. The taste is fresh so it works with mixed fruits for a salad as well as in baked goods or frostings.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bumble Bee Pink Salmon, 14.75 oz
Review:
A staple in our home as we know salmon is good for us, complete with skin and bones, and easy to turn into salmon salad, croquettes, or a salmon loaf straight out of a can at a much lower price than fresh fish.  Its a great compromise in a household like ours where there are fish lovers and fish haters. Price is good.  Taste, if you like fish, is good.  Excellent nutritional source.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Zoe Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 25.5-Ounce Tins (Pack of 2)
Review:
There are a lot of fancy virgin olive oils around for a lot more price, but this oil has now been a staple in my kitchen for nine years.  It has a mild flavor so I can use it for just about anything I make.  The quality has been consistent over the years.  The size of the can is small enough and I use enough of it (Mediterranean diet!) that I don't find it requires decanting as the can empties.  I have learned how to handle the spout without any problems.  It is easy to keep the container clean.  The can is cheerful with its bright colors.  The price is reasonable, especially since Amazon has it in its subscribe and save program--although the discount is less now for buyers than it was when I first started buying it from Amazon.  Nothing pretentious, just a really good and reliable olive oil.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Coffee Bean Direct Dark Sumatra Gayoland, Organic Fair Trade Whole Bean Coffee, 16-Ounce Bags (Pack of 3)
Review:
I've purchased this coffee before and was happy with how it worked in my personal blend of dark roast coffee--Sumatra, Italian Espresso, Columbian and French Roast.  Mandheling has a bit of kick that really brightens my blend.  It has rich satisfying flavor both in my blend and when used by itself.  A very good coffee.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Thai Kitchen Seasoning, Lemongrass, 0.31-Ounce (Pack of 3)
Review:
Kaffir leaves are a common ingredient in Thai soups, especially those that contain shellfish or fish.  It has a delicate but distinctly citrus flavor that gives a special bouquet to the broth.  Fresh kaffir lime leaves can be hard to find so I decided to try these dried ones.  They work well.  The flavor is accurate.  One or two leaves is all that is needed in a broth.  Amazon packs these in threes so I think I have a supply that will last several years.  The price is reasonable.  Having these on the shelf makes it easier for me to cook up a great Thai soup of stew whenever I am in the mood.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Mestemacher, Pumpernickel with Whole Kernels, 17.6 oz
Review:
Great Westphalian pumpernickel straight from Germany.  It stays fresh when wrapped for quite a few weeks.  The pieces are large:  a half is enough for one sitting with soup or a salad.  The taste is rich and crunchy since it is full of grain kernals.  Great with cream cheese or as an accompaniment for good cheese, fruits and vegetables as an appetizer.  A nice break from traditional yeast breads or crackers.  Not very useful for making sandwiches as it tends to crumble.
Rating:
5.0

You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

Product:
Melinda's Naga Jolokia Hot Sauce, 5 Oz
Review:
I have to agree with the other reviews. This sauce is very flavorful and by far the hottest Melinda's will ever be able to make. I love Melinda's because they don't try to destroy you with heat, although this one has some SERIOUS kick to it. They really know how to make a flavorful hot sauce, and this one ties with the 4x Reserve as being my two favorites.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
TRY ME SAUCE YUCATAN SUNSHINE, 5 OZ, PACK OF 12
Review:
I had a hard time squeeking out 4 stars for this hot sauce. 3 1/2 would be more like it. The reason being it's too salty. Melinda's XXXX Reserve is balanced much better than this one and the habanero flavor shines through more with the Melinda's. The only reason I grabbed this one at the store was because it was $2.99 compared to Melinda's at $3.49. Seems trivial but this might last me one week.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Dave's Gourmet Sauce, Crazy Caribbean, 5 Ounce
Review:
I love Dave's Insanity anything. This Ghost Pepper is no exception. It's extremely hot but I can handle the tongue and mouth heat. It's what happens in the belly that can really mess you up with this stuff. Don't use this on dinner if you plan on going to the mall the next morning.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Dried Trinidad Moruga Scorpion Pepper Pods, 0.25 Ounce
Review:
You don't have to grind these or even eat them. Just use the pepper to add serious heat and flavor and then toss it. A friend of mine was visiting his father in South Carolina and found this same brand of dried Scorpion Peppers in a hot sauce store down there. He bought them for me because he knows I like the heat. I'm almost 50 now so my days of doing stupid stuff with hot sauce and peppers is over, but I can still handle a nice batch of inferno with a side of the runs now and then. I made a big batch of green chile stew with some leftover pulled pork I made and about 18 good sized roasted hatch peppers last Sunday. I decided to add one of these dried Scorpion Peppers to the stew for about 2 hours, at which point I fished out the pepper and tossed it in the garbage. I'l just say that it's a good thing we didn't have company for dinner. My wife can handle it but most people cannot. It was hot and it's the kind of hot that hits you immediately. No creeper with this one.....BAM!!!!! I personally love that and not many peppers can do that, they usually creep up on you. I cannot wait to try one of these in a wing sauce. I usually use Franks Red Hot, clarified butter, Dave's Original Insanity and a touch of honey or brown sugar for my wing sauce. I think I can omit the Daves Insanity next time and try one of these peppers. I'll probably reconstitute it in room temperature Franks for the entire day and then heat all the ingredients on the stovetop for a while. That should produce a wing with a good thwack of heat upon first biting in. You could also reconstitute these in olive oil to drizzle over potatoes or other veggies.

I wouldn't suggest playing any jokes on anyone with these. That's not funny and you would really ruin someones day if they ate one of these.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Trinidad Moruga Scorpion Hot Sauce (5 ounce)
Review:
This sauce has a nice flavor to it. At first it came across as being a bit salty but that was tasting it off a spoon. The only salt in the ingredients list is garlic salt and that's towards the bottom of the list. I'm not a total heat freak so this is about as hot as I can handle. It makes my head sweat and if I use too much of it my stomach is in bad shape as it cries out for me to stop. If you like this one try the Melinda's Naga Jolokia as well.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Trinidad Moruga Scorpion Hot Sauce (5 ounce)
Review:
This is a flavorful hot sauce that has a good kick to it.  If you can handle a good amount of heat and flavor is a top priority then this is the sauce for you. It's not a concentrated sauce and doesn't use extract so it's not going to drop you to your knee's the way some of the reviewers would like. Ingredients are Trinidad Moruga Scorpion Chiles, vinegar, onion, tomatoes, lemon juice, garlic, salt, spices.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Dave's Gourmet Naga Jholokia (Ghost Pepper) Hot Sauce, 5-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)
Review:
I find this to be rather tasty for such a hot sauce.  It doesn't take much of this to make my head bead with sweat and its not foul tasting by any means. I'd like to incorporate this into a wing sauce. My go to is still Melinda's Naga Jolokia but this is good and I'm glad it's in the arsenal.
Rating:
4.0

Product:

Review:
This is a pretty good bar.  If you like apple pie you should be able to tell that this is apple pie.  It has a decent taste and can supplement a meal if you chose to do so.  I can eat one of these in the morning and be good for a few hours.  There are no nuts and every ingredient is one that you can understand.  I really like Bonk bars and they haven't let me down yet.  You get all the protein, fat and carbs you need to keep you moving.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
B & M Brown Bread, Original Flavor, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
We have it at a local grocery store.  If you live in so cal try winco and you should find it by the whole chicken in a can.  Regardless, this is some good stuff.  Eat it out of the can or toast it.  However you want it the stuff is ready to go and it is good.  I have 6 in my stash as my wife wouldnt let me buy any more.  I am sneeking it in though.  It is pretty cheap and well, hey, its bread that can last up to 3 years.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tic Tac Mints, Cherry Cola Mixers, 1 oz. (12 Count)
Review:
This is for the Peach Lemonade version of tic tacs.  They are really good tasting and actually taste like peach and lemonade.  One thing I really like about these don't have an artificial sweetener taste.  I personally can not stand that and am happy that these just taste like peach and then lemonade.  I will definitely be trying the rest of these.

Price is pretty good, you are paying right under 1.30 for a pack which is pretty decent.  It is delivered to your door for nothing with prime.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Barney Butter Almond Butter, Bare Smooth, 16 Ounce (Pack of 3)
Review:
First of all, this tastes exactly like almonds without flavoring.  You can taste the almonds but it is a pretty bland taste.  You would need to add something if you wanted to get a stronger taste.  I am not saying this is bad, just be warned, you are going to get this explosion of flavor from this product.

The butter needs to be stirred if you want it to be smooth.  Once again, a spoon and a few moments and you have smooth almond butter.  It is a little on the dry side but once again, it is still a very good product.  Once it is stirred you can pretty much put it on anything.  It doesn't clump much and you don't really have to worry about ripping bread.  It should smooth over without any issues.

My only issue is the price point, you would do better buying the big jar, getting small Tupperware pieces and putting the almond butter in them.  It is a great product, that being said, getting a jar and separating it if you are on a budget makes more sense.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Wildway Banana Nut Gluten-free, Paleo, Grain Free Granola, 6 Pack
Review:
As many others have stated this is more of a chewy granola than a crunchy one.  It is pretty decent and I really like the coconut and cashew.taste.  The ingredients are easy to read and there is no sugar added.  This isn't to say there aren't any carbs.  There are nine grams of carbs of which five grams per serving are sugar.  You get four servings per container and the whole thing has 600 calories total.  This is a pretty decent snack.  You get a decent amount per serving at 1/4 cup and there is a good taste.

All in all this is a solid snack or whatever, I don't mind the lack of crunch and actually prefer this type of granola.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
FISHER Chef's Naturals Walnut Halves & Pieces, No Preservatives, Non-GMO, 16 oz
Review:
These are excellent walnuts.  I really like Fisher nuts and am happy to have gotten to have tried these.  They arrived fresh, they taste great and they go well in whatever you are going to make.  I make walnut pies over the holidays and these have been the best I have had recently.

Everything about these nuts is great.  That being said I have yet to meet a Fisher nut that I didn't like.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
ORCHARD VALLEY HARVEST Cranberry Almond Cashew Trail Mix, Non-GMO, No Artificial Ingredients, 1 oz (Pack of 8)
Review:
If you like dark chocolate and cherries you will like these.  There is just enough sweetness in them that you will want more.  They come in little pouches that have enough for a snack and be happy.

The taste of chocolate and cherry blend together well.  You can taste the cholate without if overwhelming the cherry.  My only issue is the chocolate might be a tad bit bitter.  If you don't like the taste of bitter chocolate you might not like this.  It is like eating a chocolate chip.  I don't mind the taste and am quite happy with how it tastes.

These are pretty good.  If you have someone that loves dark chocolate and cherries you could do worse then this.  Pricing is good and the flavor is really spot on.
Rating:
5.0

Product:
Kashi TLC Crackers, Fire Roasted Vegetable, 9-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
The pita chips we had been buying at our local supermarket where nice tasting but not whole grain. So I looked on Amazon for whole grain chips. I like Kashi, saw these, and decided to give them a chance.

I am very pleased. Wonderful taste, perfect texture and thickness. They are crisp and light. Great by themselves or with cheese or hummus. I think they have too much salt, especially for Kashi. It is just a little too heavy handed. But not enough to keep these from getting an overall 5.

Just take all the other chips in your house, donate them, have one last binge, whatever. After you get rid of them just get these. Your tastebuds will thank you, your doctor will thank you.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nature Valley Crunchy Granola Bars, Oats 'n Honey, 12-Count Bars (Pack of 12)
Review:
Making oat bars is apparently a pretty hard thing to get right. Over the years I have tried a lot of different brands and they are often too dry, tasteless, or just plain bad tasting. But this is one good tasting whole grain (very nice that they use whole grain) oats bar.

While you probably want to have some liquid available when you eat these they are not too dry. The taste is wholesome and flavorable. And they are not too sweet at all, just perfect for me, more of a hint of sweetness. Pretty good value as well, recommended.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Erin Baker's Breakfast Cookies, Chocolate Chunk Raisin, 3-Ounce Individually Wrapped Cookies (Pack of 12)
Review:
One of my favorite candies is rasinettes. This is the closest cookie I have found to that taste. It also has one of the best tasting chocolate tastes of any store bought cookie I have ever had. Add to that, they are invididually wrapped and a substantial size, this is a very good buy. Especially if you like soft cookies like I do. There is a good amount of rasins in the cookies, but they do not overwhelm at all the chocolate but compliment it.

I know Erin also sells just a chocolate cookie. If it is the same used here, I would highly recoomend that as well if you are not particularly fond of rasins or raisins or don't want them to get in the way of your chocolate.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Carr's Whole Wheat Crackers, 7-Ounce Units (Pack of 12)
Review:
I tried this with a cream-cheese appetizer I made recently and was really pleased. They are a little bit thicker than most snack crackers but the taste is not heavy at all. They remained firm even though the dish had a sauce and the crackers were partially in the sauce.

Very nice taste, heaty but not heavy, without getting in the way of what was on it. And whole wheat as well. Recommended.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Endangered Species Panther, Dark Chocolate (88%), 3-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12)
Review:
This is not your mom's Hershey bar. Even her 'special dark' Hershey bar. But that is a good thing. This bar is a very itense chocolate taste. And even though I am partial to 'dark chocolate' this was unlike anything I had tried before. There is no hint of sweet, is a savory experience. At first the unsweet intense taste was not the most pleasing. But as I finished the first bar and then had more in the coming days and weeks I started to very much enjoy the rich, savory, full chocolate taste.

It will take some getting use to though. But if you like mole, one of my favorite Mexican dishes, I think you will like this. If you are a fan of dark chocolate give this a try. Good price on Amazon, you get your money's worth and some of that money goes for good causes as well.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Lindt Excellence Bar, 70% Cocoa Smooth Dark Chocolate, Gluten Free, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
This is a nice way to enjoy healthy (high cocoa percentage) chocolate. It has a smooth, rich taste and it quickly becomes very enjoyable. Even my three year old quite enjoys it.

I am on a low carb high fat way of eating so this fits in. I searched the various chocolates and this came out best in that it doesn't use soy and also isn't processed in a way to reduce antioxidants. In fact it became one of the few choices on Amazon to meet those criteria and have a high cocoa percentage.

Granted soy lecithin in small amounts is probably OK. But you don't have to worry about it with this bar and very satisfying taste. And 2.5 squares is a large serving, all my family usually has less than one square and it satisfies. Highly recommended.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bear Valley Pemmican Bars, Carob Cocoa, 3.75-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12)
Review:
I bought these to be used essentially as breakfast. First off I find these delicious. They have almonds, raisins, sunflower seeds, and just enough of a cocoa taste. They are very dense and you will want to have a lot of water or other liquid available. They are also amazingly filling. Yes 440 calories (2 servings/ one par) so more of a meal replacement than a snack. But for breakfast a whole par gives you 16 grams of protein. Protein really helps get the mind/body going in the morning so they are excellent for that.

But you are also getting 24 grams of sugar. A little high. But at least it isn't from corn syrup or even sugar as a separate ingredient. I do highly recommend these for meal replacement, especially breakfast. I have them 3 times a week for breakfast and feel really good and satisfied until lunch. This is usually 4.5 hours away for me. I think they would be excellent for backpacking and camping as well. Or other meals in the day. Tasty and satisfying, with good ingredients.
Rating:

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Hormel Mary Kitchen Reduced Sodium Corned Beef Hash, 14 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: I read a cookbook recently where the author, in addition to giving recipes, interviewed famous and influential chefs of all sorts. One of the questions that the chefs were asked was "What do you eat when no one is watching?" In other words, what is your guilty pleasure that might not jive with your being a renowned chef. The answers were honest and amusing. Although I am only a foodie and not a chef, if I were asked that question my answer would be "Hormel Corned Beef Hash." First, let me be honest about what this is: this is not something that you would want to eat very often if you were worried about fat or sodium content; the potatoes are dehydrated; and the corned beef tastes a little like potted meat. Still, it is a real comfort food for me and I love it. I almost always add some freshly diced onions or shallots. I also add either diced bell pepper or minced Serrano. I put in it a hot skillet over medium heat and let it cook until crispy. I flip it and while the other side is cooking I cook an egg or two in a separate skillet and place them, sunny side up, on top of the hash. I like to finish it off with a generous dose of hot sauce. I buy this large size when I have guests (I have to admit that not all of my friends or family share my love for this product.) I also purchase the 15-Ounce and also the 7.5 oz can when it's just for me (and when I'm not having it for my main meal.) This is something that I always have on hand (I just hide it from my judgmental foodie friends.) :-) Rating: 5.0 Product: Coffee-mate 2Go Triple Strength Coffee Creamer, Extra Sweet and Creamy, 3 Ounce (Pack of 8) Review: I don't use creamer in my coffee or tea but many of my friends and customers do. I offer hot beverages where I work and for both our customers and my co-workers. I sometimes have real cream or a creamer on hand but it can go bad if I go a while before someone uses it all. This small, compact creamer is great to keep on hand since it doesn't need refrigeration to stay good. I have to be honest and say that I don't like non-dairy creamers or even creamers in general but I can say that my friends, co-workers and customers seem to like this just fine. It is very similar to what you get at a fast food restaurant in those little containers, only better. Rating: 4.0 Product: Thai Kitchen Coconut Milk, 13.66 fl oz (Pack of 12) Review: I have been using coconut milk for years, mostly for Thai dishes but also in place of milk or cream in recipes that call for those. Coconut milk is usually thick and needs to be remove from the can with a spoon or a spatula. For that reason I remove the whole lid with a can opener instead of piercing the top of the can and trying to pour it out. This is great for making a delicious meal quickly. I usually add a curry paste as well as veggies and some sort of protein, such as chicken or shrimp. The coconut milk gives the dish an authentic flavor and mellows the spice of the curry paste. Thai Kitchens is one of the more expensive brands on the market but it is consistently the best that I have used. I don't usually buy the organic version but I like this one as much as I do their non-organic product. Rating: 5.0 Product: Homemade Dressing Mix Variety Pack (French Garden, Napa Garden & Italian Garden), 3.3 to 4-Ounce Containers Review: When I first received my order of the Italian Dressing mix, I was a little wary. A lot of prepared herb and spice mixes on the market seem to be full chemicals that I can't pronounce and they taste very dull, extremely salty and have a strange, artificial after-taste. NOT THIS ONE! When my order arrived the first thing that I did was to taste the mixture straight out of the jar. I was surprised at how clean and fresh the taste was. I picked up on the herbs (I'm thinking oregano, basil, parsley, rosemary and maybe some mint), the sea salt and then the sweetness of the bell pepper combined with a tartness of the lemon juice. There was a slight bit of heat (the garlic?) and a nice, pure, food-like aftertaste. Next I mixed it with some fine olive oil and used it as a dip for some crusty Italian bread. Wonderful! Later in the week I used it, along with some Dijon Mustard, as a coating for a rack of lamb. I ended up adding a little crushed black pepper to the mix and it was great. Finally I used it as a salad dressing along with aged balsamic vinegar, wine vinegar and extra virgin olive oil. It took a few minutes to get the proportions right, and I did add a little chopped rosemary and some fresh minced garlic. It was much better than any prepared dressing that comes in a bottle. I was really impressed with the flavor and quality of this prepared mix, so much so that I ordered this variety pack. Here are my thoughts on the other two varieties that come with this set: * French Garden At first taste it seemed salter than the Italian version. The chives not only tasted fresh but still retained their classic oval shape (meaning that they were not over-processed or ground to death). The garlic and onions were strong, but not too. I also picked up on the parsley and I thought I tasted a little tarragon. I added this mix to a French style omelet (runny). Very nice! My fear of it being too salty was put to rest. I next sprinkled it on some grilled eggplant and I was blown away! It woke up the subtle flavors of the vegetable. I will be trying this is other dishes to be sure. * Napa Garden This mix had a different texture than the others, probably due to the tomato powder which added a wonderful richness to the blend. This one was not as salty as the other two. The pepper gave it a little heat but I usually like more (which is easy to add, hard to take out). I tried this (along with some olive oil) with spinach angel-hair pasta. That turn out to be a good choice. The mix did not overwhelm the flavor of the pasta but added that extra kick. I highly recommend this variety pack. All three will become staples in my spice cabinet. Rating: 5.0 Product: Roland Chipotle Peppers in Adobo Sauce, 7 Ounce (Pack of 24) Review: I love all things hot and Chipotle peppers are on the top of my list. I usually buy pounds of dried Chipotles during the Hatch, New Mexico Chile Festival. The heat of Chipotles are not overbearing (they are, after all, smoked Jalapenos) but the taste is warm and full of flavor. I had been buying the La Costena Chipotle Adobo Sauce and liked them fine. I recently tried the Roland brand and found them to be even better. The sauce seems richer and the peppers hotter. I often chop these up and mix them into ground beef for Chipotle burgers or, if I include to Adobo sauce, I can make Chipotle meatloaf with it. I keep several cans of both this and the Roland Chipotle paste on hand and I use them often. They taste great to me! Rating: 5.0 Product: Upper Crust Enterprises, Panko (Japanese Style Bread Crumb), 24-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6) Review: I first became aware of Japanese-style Panko bread crumbs when on my first visit to Tokyo back in the late 80's. I must have seen them before but it wasn't until I had Tempura made table-side that I noticed their exceptional quality. Larger and yet somehow lighter than traditional, western style crumbs they give a pleasing crunchiness and toasty taste to shrimp, chicken, mushrooms, onion rings, and many other foods. I use this product both with and without Tempura batter. I really love Tempura shrimp and the addition of the Panko crumbs on top of the batter is not only authentic but it significantly adds to the taste of the finished dish. Unlike finer ground bread crumbs the larger sized Panko crumbs don't burn or blacken before the meat or vegetable is done. This is especially helpful when deep-frying larger pieces of food. It is also good on casseroles and certain other dishes that you would usually add regular crumbs to. I have purchased many different brands over the years. Since Panko crumbs are so much larger and fluffier that a brand like Progresso you usually need more than you might think. I go through an eight or twelve ounce package in just one meal. This larger size 24 ounce package is just the right size. One thing that I really like about this package is that it has a very creative opening an inch or two from the top and it closes with a zip-lock style device. This may seem like a small thing but it is really convenient and helpful, especially for a larger package like this one. That, combined with the quality of the Panko crumbs makes this an exceptional product. Rating: 5.0 Product: Diedrich Coffee Variety Pack of Medium, Full and Dark Roasts K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, 22-Count K-Cups (Pack of 2) Review: I have given over 10 Keurig coffee makers as gifts (I do have 6 children after all) and I usually include a couple of variety boxes of coffee with the brewer (a flavored variety and this one). Product:
 Watkins All Natural Gourmet Spice Tin, Pure Ground Black Pepper, 6 Ounce 
Review:
I make dry rubs, marinades, and other things for BBQ that call for a lot of black pepper. Sometimes I use 3-4 ounces of it at a time, and it's tiresome grinding my own for that kind of quantity. So I went looking for pre-ground black pepper. I've tried at least a dozen brands, and I would say Watkins is right there at the top of the heap, one of the two or three best I've tried. The flavor is excellent and, while pre-ground pepper is not going to be quite as fresh as grinding it yourself, it seems to have come fresh and stayed fresh. The only thing I don't like about this product is that the tin, which is others quite attractive in a retro kind of way, but thin and flimsy; just the act of picking it up and setting it down on a counter can cause a small dent -- it's that thin! But I'm not docking it a star for that; it's just a container. The product itself -- the black pepper -- is extremely good and well worth the money.

Kirkland Signature Fine Ground Black Pepper, 12.3 oz
Review:
I use a huuuuuuuuuuge amount of black pepper to make spice rubs and at the grill. This is one of the five I've purchased in the quest to find the perfect one. I do believe this one is best in class. The flavor is excellent, but what I really like about it is that it has a skooch less sting than some of the others - a tiny bit less heat/bitterness. Plus, the pricing is more attractive than some of the boutique brands. I unreservedly give this product 5 stars.

Review:

Product:
RetailSource Death Sauce with Chipotle and Skull Key Chain, Original, 5 oz.
Review:
The flavor is excellent, probably in my Top 10 of hot sauces. Don't be fooled by the "Death Sauce" moniker. It's pretty mild. Even people unaccustomed to hot peppers will find this sauce "medium hot". True chili heads will find it very mild and more of a flavoring sauce than a hot sauce. Overall , it's a superb mild hot sauce with unparalleled flavor and I recommend it highly, unless you're seeking a truly hot hot sauce.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
The Original Habanero Shaker - 100% Custom Flaked Hot Habanero Chile Peppers
Review:
When I received this product, I immediately got a take-out pizza so I could pour this stuff all over it. Fantastic!  I like hot foods and normal pepper flakes as served, for example, in a pizzaria don't even register as "hot" in my mouth. I long ago switched over to habs and bhuts to get my heat supply. Being very used to and accustomed to the mighty habanero (I've grown them for years, too) I can attest that this product uses very good quality habs. A teaspoon or two in a recipe works wonders, and it works equally well as a condiment. For chiliheads and others just kind of tired of the usual boring, low-heat flakes, this can really perk things up!  Highly recommended.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Mexican SWP Decaf Organic Coffee, Whole Bean, Swiss Water Processed Decaf Coffee, Fresh Roasted Coffee LLC. (5 lb.)
Review:
I am big fan of this company's Ethiopian, so I thought I'd give the Mexican a shot.

The beans are very oily, literally shining with oil in the bag; I've never seen anything like it. I was wondering whether my burr grinder would get mucked up with all that oil, but it had no problem (though it did take a few more seconds than usual).

This coffee has an interesting and very different taste, very chocolaty. Kind of like a cafe mocha. I've never actually had a coffee that had such a pronounced chocolate taste before. It makes for a great iced coffee, because it almost tastes like a dessert drink. Hot, though ... I'm just not sure. I find it "drinkable" but nowhere near as good as the Ethiopian.

I appreciate the fair and reasonable pricing from FRC LLC. Their 2-pound bags for $21-$26 just really work for me. I find that kind of price much more acceptable than the $16+ a pound seen elsewhere from so many sellers. I also really like the 2-pound bag format, versus 12 oz and 1 pound bags, which I go through in 4-5 days. These 2 pounders last me a couple of weeks.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Peruvian Decaf Organic Fair Trade Coffee - SMBC, Whole Bean, Water Processed Decaf Coffee, Fresh Roasted Coffee LLC. (2 lb.)
Review:
I was very pleasantly surprised by this coffee! Having given up on caffeine for health reasons, I've been working my way through the Amazon decafs. A generally disappointing experience, though some are OK; the problem is that none of them really hit the sweet spot for me in terms of the right mix of flavor, fullness, roast, aroma, etc. So I've been in search of "The One" for quite a while -- an economical "anchor" coffee I can load up on in 5 lb bags while occasionally supplementing with a lb of more expensive beans -- and I'm thinking this is it.

I've already gone through several pounds of FRC's Ethipian, Mexican and Columbian decafs. I like the taste of the Ethiopian but find it a bit too mild. The Columbian is OK but nothing special, there are better, though not at FRC's price point. The Mexican I didn't care for at all. In general I find FRC's decaf's "good, but not great, at a very reasonable price". This one, however, is at least bordering on great.

This coffee is bold and right on the cusp between medium and dark roast, not solidly in either camp - which is exactly how I like my coffee - a "strong medium" roast. I would agree with the vendor's take on the cupping notes: almond, sweet cream, hints of chocolate.

The beans are very oily, which unfortunately is not usually a sign of quality, but nevertheless, I quite like the flavor, aroma and aftertaste of this coffee. I will for sure be ordering more bags of this one..
Rating:
5.0

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Yacon Syrup PREMIUM 100% Pure Raw All Natural Low Cal Sweetener (NON-GMO), 50% FOS Metabolism Booster | All Natural, NO Preservatives or Additives, 8 oz Review: I love trying out new foods, but I am always HIGHLY skeptical of any health claims made. There have been so many food fadsso many superfoods and garlic cures and the likethat I refuse to take any claims on face value. Those claims come straight from the Marketing Department. As a sweetener, this Yacon Syrup is just like molasses. Its almost identical in consistency, and very similar in flavor. There are slight differencesits a lighter, more subtle flavor than straight molasses. But that should give you a clue as to whether you will enjoy this or not. If you like molasses, youll like yacon syrup. I enjoyed it, and it was fun to try. As a health supplementwell, I suppose it is up to you whether you will buy what the marketing department is selling or not. The fact that you cant use this for cooking severely limits its usefulness. According to the manufacturer, you cant even put a spoonful into your coffee or tea without burning off its benefits. It is strictly served cold. Full disclosure: I received a sample for review. Rating: 3.0 Product: DeChunXian Yunnan Premium Pu-erh Puer Pu erh Dark Black Tea, Natural Organic Tea Leaves,produced From High Mountain Ancient Tree (Ripe Tea Brick) Review: My confession: I have always wanted to try authentic Pu-erh tea cakes, but I was intimidated by them. I had no idea what to buy, how to prepare them, what they would taste like thanks to Dechunxian Yunnan Premium 250g Pu-erh I have finally gotten to try them, and I realize how foolish I was for waiting so long. This is really good tea. In fact, it is so good that my wife simply refers to it as the good tea when requesting a cup. Its delicious. Like almost all traditional Asian foods, it makes numerous, spurious health claims. None of which I actually believe. This probably isn't going to slim you down or cure what ails you, but it will result in an absolutely wonderful cup of tea. The process of preparation does take some studying. Fortunately, there are numerous videos on the internet that will walk you through the process. It is nothing worse than Turkish coffee, which I also love and took some time to learn the proper preparation. To do it right you will need a few accompanying items, although you will probably be able to improvise. I don't have every recommended cup and tea pot, but it comes out just fine. I love how many cups of tea you can get from a single brewing. Normally the tea gets weaker and weaker, but this sustains its flavor. Ive tried both the ripe and raw varieties, and there is a noticeable difference. I liked the stronger, ripe version better myself. It really depends on how strong you like your tea. Rating: 5.0 Product: Stash Tea, Organic Premium Green Tea, 18 Count Box of Tea Bags Individually Wrapped in Foil (Pack of 6), Medium Caffiene Tea, Japanese Style Green Tea, Hot or Iced Review: Like many regular tea drinkers I prefer the loose-leaf variety when I am at home, but the afternoon cuppa at work calls for something a little less complicated. I am OK with sacrificing flavor for convenience, while saving some pennies at the same time. So far, I have been pleasantly surprised by Stash's brands of Certified Organic green teas. I have drank both this straight green tea and the Stash Premium Organic Earl Grey Black and Green Tea combination. The teas come from the Yamamotoyama Brazilian tea gardens, which were initially planted with Japanese seedlings. The processing methods and standards are all based on Japanese system. The flavor of this Premium Green Tea is really nice, with a subtle grassy flavor that I enjoy in decent green teas. I find that too many American-produced green teas are "watered down" in flavor, lacking the oomph that one finds in a true Japanese or Chinese green tea. This cup, however, is close to the real thing. It also gives off a nice green color, which is always a good sign. By no means the best tea you will ever drink, but this Premium Green Tea might just possibly the best inexpensive tea-bag style green tea on the market. Rating: 5.0 Product: Twinings of London Pure Camomile Herbal Tea Bags, 20 Count Review: Twining's can usually be counted on to put out a decent tea. They aren't really top grade, but nor are they bottom shelf and make for a fine daily bag tea. However, I found their Green Tea to be a bit bland. Indeed, it is the "light flavour strength", as it says on the box, but I wasn't prepared for just how light the flavor would be. Supposedly, the tea used here is sencha, but I have had many, many cups of sencha and it generally has a bolder, grassier flavor. Because the flavor is so light to begin with, you can't really pull more than one cup out of a bag either. The next cup is just pretty much colored water, which is disappointing. A nice strong tea usually yields a few cups, and that saves you some money in the long term. People who don't really enjoy the strong, grassy flavor of green tea might find this a nice balance. It is easy to make, easy to drink and will probably suit many people. I was looking for a decent bagged Green Tea to keep at work, but I think I will keep hunting as the flavor was too light for me. Rating: 3.0 Product: Good Earth Green Tea, Jasmine, 20-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6) Review: I got excited when I saw this in the tea collection at work. Jasmine Green Tea? I love Jasmine Green Tea! So I had a cup ... and it was awful. I thought maybe I somehow had a bad cup, so I tried a different tea bag ... yuck. It's hard to describe just how bad this tastes. Imagine a cup of green tea that someone poured some jasmine-scented perfume into. Or maybe dissolved some jasmine-flavored candy into. I saw someone say it was Pez flavored, and I can agree with that. But no matter how you describe it, it is undrinkable. Second cup was poured down the sink. And it isn't just the initial taste. Somehow this coats your tongue and the badness sticks with you. I suspect this box is going to be sitting around the office for a long, long time. Rating: 1.0 Product: ONE ORGANIC Matcha Green Tea Powder (250g) - USDA Certified Organic Review: We use this matcha green tea powder for pretty much everything other than making tea. My wife is Japanese, and likes making various matcha sweets--matcha cookies, matcha ice cream, matcha cheese cake, matcha muffins--pretty much every thing you can imagine. And while I am not Japanese, I love eating all the matcha creations she makes. We go through a fair share of matcha, and were eager to try this "One Organic Matcha green tea powder." This is culinary grade matcha, which is perfect for her purposes. It isn't that bright, vivid green of tea grade matcha, but doesn't cost as much either. And it comes in a nice big bag--we were both pleasantly surprised by the quantity. She has baked up a few treats using this matcha, and is happy with the results. It gives a nice, strong matcha flavor. You don't need to add a lot to get the matcha taste, so I have a feeling this bag is going to go a long way. Rating: 5.0 Product: Choice Organic Teas Green Tea, Genmaicha, 16 Count, Pack of 6 Review: I became a regular green tea drinker during the years I lived in Japan, and although I prefer loose-leaf tea I wanted some tea bags that I could drink at work. Genmai tea is one of my favorites, and I tried this "Choice Organic Genmai" thinking it might be an affordable, convenient way to brew up some of that delicious roasted rice flavor. Like many, I found these tea bags to be drinkable but weak. I wasn't expecting it to be as good as the loose-leaf tea I buy, but I also wasn't expecting it to be so watery. You can get a decent cup of tea out of it if you make a small cup, but I really wish it was more robust. I will keep drinking my way through the box I bought, but I don't think I will go back for seconds. There are probably better tea bag Genmais out there. prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Newman's Own Organic Black Tea - 100 Bags,7.1 OZ.
Review:
This tea is simply great, I also love the taste. It tastes so much better compared to the non-organic stuff, I honestly cannot even drink the other stuff anymore. This has a much more real tea taste as it should. 100 tea bags will go a long way for just one person.

You should however be advised that this seems to have a lot of caffeine in it, unless you do a short brew. One cup is enough to get my heart going a little, so I only make small batches at a time.

If you're looking for a nice iced tea recipe then I have one I made just for you :)

I spent a little over an hour perfecting this tea recipe to get an amazing iced tea each time. A lot of taste testing when into this tea to get it just right. The taste is not overpowering, but just enough where you can enjoy it as if you bought the perfect tea from the store. Makes one gallon.

Do not drink this tea until it's completely cold or else when you add ice it will be all watered down and taste bad.

The sugar may need to be adjusted to your liking. In this tea you can just taste it. Feel free to add an extra half cup if you like it really sweet, but I find it's overpowering for a tea.

What you will need:

Royal Tea Black Organic - Of course :)

Organic Meyer Lemon - Not as sour as regular lemons, has a more tropical taste too. These might be hard to find. Do not use pure lemon juice! You can check doortodoororganics.com if they deliver to your area.

Organic Sugar - Regular sugar may be used if preferred. You could also use raw organic honey, about 8 tablespoons. If you use honey make sure it's from Y.S. Eco Bee Farms. Honey must be added while the water is hot.

First Step: Bring 1 gallon of filtered water to a medium boil, then remove from heat. Tap water can be used, but let sit uncovered for 24 hours before using because chlorine is added to town/city water. Boil the water for 10 minutes at a rolling boil after 24 hours to sterilize if you let sit out.

Second Step: With the water removed from the heat add 6 tea bags and let steep for 1 full hour. If you wish to have a more stronger brew use 8 tea bags. Make 3 semi-thin slices of lemon, remove seeds then squeeze into tea. After squeezing drop the slices into the tea and let the slices steep for half hour, then remove. You don't need to worry about removing all the lemon juice as it will be steeping. I find a quick squeeze works fine. It is important you remove the slices after half hour to prevent an overpowering lemon taste. Some pulp will be left behind, and that is OK.

Third Step: After 1 whole hour remove the tea bags. Add 1 1/2 cups of sugar and stir. Let cool, then add to pitcher. Place into fridge. Serve over ice when completely cool.

If you've made this right you will have tea tasting as if it were made by a pro! :)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Twinings of London Pure Camomile Herbal Tea Bags, 20 Count
Review:
Thank you, Critic-At-Large. You've saved me a bunch of money by switching to Twinings.

I was also a on the go tea drinker, as much as three times a day everyday. It was not until I seen the top review that I decided to add up the cost of the tea I was buying from Dunkin Donuts. After going through hundreds of my purchases on my bank account (excluding cash purchases) it worked out to $1,532.16 in tea alone. Now if I included cash that amount would be even higher. Crazy.

Here is a twist, Dunkin Donuts actually happens to use Orange Pekoe tea so it's very easy to recreate it. One tea bag for every 12oz of water and let steep for half an hour. Tasted the same if not better. Twinings has forever won me as a customer.

10/10 would buy this amazing tea again.

5.0

The bag says not to use popcorn button, but I did anyway on the 3oz setting and it came out perfect. Cheaper to buy from the store.

Lindt LINDOR White Chocolate Truffles, Kosher, 60 Count Box, 25.4 Ounce
Review:
Lindt is a great chocolate maker, and the white chocolate was amazing. It's smooth, has a soft white chocolate center with a white chocolate shell on the outside. Has exquisite flavour.. you simply cannot go wrong with Lindt.

The serving size is 3 balls (230 cals, 14g carbs (all sugar), but you will desire more.

I was worried about the melting that other shoppers have pointed out. It didn't seem to be a problem with Prime shipping. Perhaps others used the slower shipping and it melted in transit? Either way, chocolate is something you don't want sitting in shipment for a long time. Use Prime's 2 day, or even next day it if you want. If you don't have Prime you could always activate the 30 day trial for the free 2-day.

5.0

HERSHEY'S Cookies 'n' Creme Candy Bar, King Size (Pack of 18)
Review:
Really great candy to stock your pantry with. Even tastes better cold! Has a lot of flavor, really fresh, great candy to treat yourself to. Each bar is 370 calories, so careful if your watching them. You will find yourself wanting to reach for another.

I ordered this on a Friday, but it seems Amazon does not ship perishables over the weekend. It shipped Monday with UPS Air, and arrived the next day all nice and cold in the cooler amazon packed it in. However, I can see the ice packs not lasting longer than 2 days, they were halfway melted by the time it got here (PA to NJ). If you get a delay you can be sure to have melted candy in your hands.

5.0

HERSHEY'S Cookies 'n' Creme Candy Bar, King Size (Pack of 18)

These taste even better when they are cold, try it!

I don't think I will be ordering these from Amazon's warehouse again. Stick to sellers because the employees at the Warehouse might of been looking for a quick snack.

Product:
Spicy Tom Yum Paste / Instant Sour Paste
Review:
I am rewriting my review because I believe some people who do not like MSG marked it unhelpful.

Look I am not trying to tell anyone else how to eat, only that MSG is a staple ingredient in a lot of asian cooking, particularly thai and it is one of the ingredients that create an authentic taste.  I am not denying that some people are sensitive to MSG, although it is much lower than initially thought during the 90's msg scare (much).  Most people are as tolerant to it as they are table salt, so like table salt, use it in moderation (unless you get headaches from it, a sign that you are intolerant and should avoid it).  I'm not an MSG lover or hater, I'm just noting that I am aware of the MSG in this product and for my own personal use, I am okay with it.

So please... let me just say that I like this product.  For a jarred instant soup type product, it really nails the flavor of tom yum.  I think it's great and a good price.  So if MSG is not for you, don't freak out and hate the product, or my review, just move on to something that fits your lifestyle.  If you think you'd be okay with that and want to try the product then go ahead and try it.  If you have any questions let me know how I can make this review more helpful and I'll give it a shot!  Thanks!

Product:
SodaStream Diet Ginger Ale Syrup, 500mL
Review:
After years of dealing with increasing price of soda, finding place to store it and returning  empty bottles decided to give this a try. We bought ours at Costco which came with 1-130L Co2 Carbonator, 2 1-Liter Stainless Steel Bottles and trial flavors pack for $99. First let me say I'm very pleased, the flavors are not bad at all and i can use my own filtered water from either the fridge or Pure faucet attachment and no longer need to pay or bring back bottles for the deposit. They also have much less sodium than store bought soda with the exception of Diet Rite.

 I have tried many diet flavors and the ones i like the best are Orange, Caffeine free cola, dr pete, Fountain Mist, Cream Soda and Root Beer. As for the cost it has changed everything, no longer have to pay deposit, return empties or search for sale price on soda which means lot less trips to the store saving me from impulse buying and gasoline usage. I can now make fresh bottles of soda whenever I need it (unlike store bought soda which can lose carbonation)  and any flavor I feel like at the time. Already used up  1- 130L Co2  carbonator bottle so ordered 1 full bottle + 1 exchange for empty bottle from SodaStream web site this way I'll always have one full bottle when one is done. You should always search the web for coupons for any online store before ordering and SodaStream is no exception, saved $15 which is the price of the license on a new bottle.  So it cost me the same as if ordering to exchange 130L Co2 Carbonators, pretty sweet. If you order 10 bottles of syrup at a time you get one free  and with on line coupons and cashing in points your earn from them with every purchase can save you more than just the shipping cost, the cost of a trip to the store. For me the SodaStream is well worth the cost.

UPDATE: Dr Pete is gross just like cherry cola. Here is a secert for all thoes who like cherry cola but hate Dr Pete like I do. Buy a bottle of DaVinci cherry syrup and add 1 oz. to a 1 liter bottle of Sodastream cola, you got cherry cola. Great part you can get diet cherry syrup to use with diet cola syrup, works the same.

from Divine Organics

We often use dark raw cacao for smoothies, making hot cocoa, etc and was asked to test and use this Divine cacao which is a brand I have never tried. I usually use the HEALTHWORKS brand which runs apx $25 for 3 lb and we are very happy with it. This Divine Organics is 2lb for apx $25.

My daughter found she had to add more powder to her smoothie than her usual dark but it blended fine. The smell is fairly mellow compared to other raw cacaos I have used. I am not sure if this is a bean difference or what. Overall it tasted ok but I had to use so much in my coffee to get a cacao flavor, I can't say I am that impressed. The color is also much lighter than the products I have used in the past. You may be able to tell in the photo below. I can't say I dislike it, but I can't say I like it.. and that per Amazon is a three star rating.

Product:
Shredded Coconut - Unsweetened Organic Vegan Paleo Kosher Non GMO Coconut Meat - Comes With Vegan Recipes - No Sulfites All Natural
Review:
This review is for Shredded Coconut - Unsweetened Organic Vegan Paleo Kosher Non GMO Coconut Meat - Comes With Vegan Recipes - No Sulfites All Natural from Manic Organics

Pros - Preferences - Item info

Ingredients-

Unsweetened Shredded Coconut - Organic

Long medium wide shreds - if you want them smaller, just crush

Crunchy texture - stays crunchy in peanut butter treats. If you want to soften it, soak it in coconut milk or cream

Flavorful

Comes in lined paper ziploc bag for storage

Cons - None really, I guess personal preferences maybe but the coconut is what it says and the flavor is good

We use them to make fat bomb treats

Our basic recipes goes something like

3 tablespoons melted coconut oil
cup of peanut butter
scoop of protein powder or powdered peanuts
cup or more of coconut
add the sweetener of your choice to taste

place haystack sizes on wax paper and freeze

Product:

Product:
2LB Pablo's Pride Gourmet Coffee - Guatemala - Medium-Dark Roast Whole Bean Coffee - 2 Pound (2 lb) Bag
Review:
I am most definitely a coffee snob. I've tried just about every coffee you could name, including coffees which I paid somewhere around a hundred dollars a pound; I can't remember exactly how much, but it was very close to that figure.
In order for me to get what I would call a great cup of coffee, I started roasting my own beans, in fact, I still have several pounds of green beans I purchased mostly at Sweet M.'s.
I hand grind my beans using a conical burr grinder (zaussenhaus), which I find superior to any other way of grinding, (a close second, is mortar, and pestle grinding).
I've tried every way possible, and I do mean that literally...every...way....you could name for coffee brewing, the best two methods for making a great cup of coffee are percolated, and vacuum.  I threw my French Press in the trash where it belongs, that method was the absolute worse way to brew coffee IMO, I didn't even want to give it to anyone, I tried that method for several Months just to be certain there could be no user error...but into the trash it went!
My Keurig, I did give that away as that was not as bad as the French Press, but still not for me.  I've brewed Greek, and Turkish using the Ibirk..etc. Automatic drip brewing is IMO for lazy people who are not that into having a great cup of coffee.  Again, without a doubt, (howbeit not well accepted by the parrots/sheep of the world)...is perked, and vacuum brewing methods.  One more brewing method that is not that bad, is pour over, but that would be my last resort brewing method.

Now that I've somewhat set the stage, let me get to this coffee.  It is going to be hard pressed to find a better coffee than this. I will reserve this being the best until I try all of Pablo's Pride coffee's, (sans decaf).
This is a wonderful coffee, I don't think I could roast a better bean, so it looks as though my green beans will be relegated to becoming green bean extract, which is in, and of itself not a true relegation, but only as far as brewing coffee is concerned.

Product:
igourmet Parmigiano Reggiano 24 Month Top Grade - Pound Cut (15.5 ounce)
Review:
First of all let me state that the seller, (Mondo), was great to deal with. However, since this is a product review, let me review the cheese.
I'm a 68 year old Italian that was raised in an Italian neighborhood. I went to Italian Deli's all my life, I must have eaten literally hundreds, nay, thousands of pounds of Parmigiano Reggiano in my life.
This is some of the worst P.R. I've ever had.....NO...this IS the worst I've ever had!!

There are practically none of the little white crystals I seek in a good P.R., I can actually COUNT the number of little crystals I see. (I actually counted 7 crystals in two pounds of cheese)!!

I like the seller, not the cheese.  This has to be IMO, the lowest grade of P.R., and in fact, if it was not for seeing the stamp on the rind, (its not the stamp I like to see, but it is stamped), I would even question its authenticity.
This is not a good table cheese,(as far as P.R. goes),it is only (at BEST) barely good enough to be grated on macaroni.

Now, I have to try and find some good Parmigiano Reggiano, as the store near me where I now live has closed.

Sorry, but I have to tell it like it is.

If I could, I would give this "Parmigiano Reggiano cheese" a zero star rating!  I feel as though I've simply thrown money away, as I won't eat this crap that is trying to disguise itself as Parmigiano Reggiano!

Let me say this to its defense, as I really like this seller. The price for this cheese is amazing, even factoring in shipping, this price cannot be beat. I used to pay over $25.00 a pound for the good P.R., and that was years ago.
I took a gamble, and lost. If you have not been spoiled by having real P.R. your entire life, then this cheese might be good for you, it is not for me.

The problem is that now I'm leery of buying any P.R. from Amazon. I may have to locate a shop in N.Y. that will ship.

Review:
My college daughter is Gluten Free everything, so when these came available i decided that i needed to get them and give them a try.  I will have to admit that the waffles I ate this morning were very good.  I followed the instructions on the back of the box but I was only able to make 4 -- 7 waffles.  My waffle maker does make large waffles so that really does not have anything to do with the mix.  I was a little worried when I had mixed everything up as instructed and the mix was a little runny.  But the waffles turned out GREAT.  The waffles had a very good taste and looked good on my plate.  I will definitely let my daughter now about the Simple Mills brand.  Knowing her, she is probably already using your products.  I did like the suggestions on the back of the box regarding adding pecans or fresh berries.  Always forget about those until its to late.  I had pecans in the house so i chopped a bunch of those up and added them to the batter.  Great suggestion.  This is a very good product.
UPDATE...Yes my daughter already uses the Simple Mills pancake mix.  She eats everything gluten free due to help her gluten intolerance.
She has them at least once a week.  She told me that several times she will make her breakfast pancakes for dinner at night.  She has never had a problem with this product.  She says it is really good stuff.

Product:
Clamato Tomato Cocktail, 64  Fl. Oz
Review:
I have two  46 ounce bottles of V-8 Spicy Hot Juice in the frig right now so there will be some comparisons made between the Clamato and V-8 juices. I received one bottle of the Clamato under the Vine program. The Clamato is made up of 38% juice while the V-8 is 100%. Both are a cocktail. The Clamato has 60 calories per 8 ounces while the V-8 has 50 calories per 8 ounces. The V-8 has 650 mg sodium while Clamato has 790 mg sodium.
The taste of the juices are definitely among cocktail lines with the Clamato having a more thin liquid and watered down taste while the V-8  juice is thicker and heavier to the taste. If left in the frig for a few days both will need to be shaken before using as there seems to be a clear liquid that will appear on top of the liquid.
The taste for each is acceptable as a cocktail mixer and both have about the same kick when it comes to hotness. The Clamato contains MSG while I do not locate tat on the bottle of the V-8. I personally think either would be fine as a cocktail mixer and would result in about the same taste thus this becomes a personal preference for the buyer, however due to the thickness of the V-8 the Clamato might be more preferable when mixing with beer.  I will lean more to the V-8 juice since it is 100% juice, more favorable and thicker. I often drink it as a drink and not as a mixer.

Got back on the chickory "kick" once again and brought home a can of their chickory flavored coffee. We personally like he taste and my wife thinks it is too strong. It is very good coffee and if one is looking for an instant dramatic change to what they have been drinking they should sip on a few cups of this coffee. You will certainly noticed instantly the change and you might even prefer it over the regular coffee.

Product:

I'm not an Asian food expert but it doesn't appear Betty Crocker is either.  My goodness, I bought a whole case of these seeing as I love Lo Mein.  Well, search further if you are looking for the real thing.  Here it appears like broken spaghetti, and the flavor packet obviously has a lot of bouillon in it, so you get broken spaghetti with salty chicken imitation flavoring.  How healthy, but then if you don't know what good Lo Mein is, and if you like spaghetti, you may be happy with it.  It isn't awful tasting but not that good tasting and definitely not the same texture as Lo Mein.  The box makes the noodles look bigger and they are actually somewhere between angel hair and regular spaghetti size.  It's just not what it says, and it is not good for you.  And, a lot of Asian food is rice noodles or something much more healthy.  Once this is cooked up it does finally make more than what it initially looks like (very little), but really not all that much.  Betty needs to remember that Asian meals are served with big helpings and this was probably a little less than the size of one real Asian dinner helping.  I was disappointed all around on this product.  Here's something odd, the picture of the product that goes with this review is in a totally different box than what I got.  The boxes I got are red and don't disclose it's Betty Crocker except a small spoon on one side.  It's almost an attempt to leave the name off.  Not the norm for this on, company. Product:
Typhoo (240 Tea Bags)
Review:
I love Typhoo!  My delivery arrived about an hour ago (as promised) and I tore into the box with urgency to make myself a cup of my favorite tea!  I love the stronger blend, robust flavor and satisfying after taste only Typhoo gives!  Cup after cup it is consistent, I never get tired of it, and the quality of the blend never varies!  I also love PG Tips; but notice that sometimes the blend isn't always consistent and the strength varies; but I accept this as I love the flavor the vast majority of the time...but Typhoo ALWAYS hits the spot!  From first tea bag or pot full to the last Typhoo is always the same great cuppa without fail.
If I couldn't have both brands and I had to choose just one for the rest of my life it would be Typhoo!  Sorry PG...but Typhoo put the 'T' in Tea:)
Now if only Typhoo would only offer their other products and fan stuff in the U.S. like their cups, collectables, ect.  I personally want a Typhoo tea cup!
Buy this tea and you won't be disappointed!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tetley Tea Bags 240 per pack
Review:
A great blend of Assam/Orange Pekoe tea. After this you can include Brooks Bond which includes Kenyan red tea (which is just incredibly tasty sweet flavor and has a beautiful aroma!) but Tetley is as perfect a tea as you can find.  I'm amazed as well as grateful the price is kept as economical as it is (we working class thank you!) because there are a lot of crappy teas out there that charge a lot more and tout quality that is just not there.  I won't name names but if you are a tea lover you know what I mean.  For the price you would pay for Lipton's in the U.S. you can be enjoying a much, much better tasting, consistently good tea from the first bag to the last damned good tea!
Remember that the Tetley sold in the U.S. IS NOT THE SAME!!! Get the Tetley with the English pricing on it to be sure.  Or from a vendor that is honest and states it is from England and if you buy in bulk/large amount (like here at 240ct) it only costs a little more that American grocery store tea and you are getting one of the best English teas on the market.  (Honestly and excuse my American pallet but Tetley British Blend is a damned good tea too! )
FINALLY...Tetley was Beatles George Harrison and John Lennon's favorite tea.  So, if you don't like Tetley you are a terrible human being. So there!

PG Tips The Strong One Pyramid Tea Bags (80 Bags) NEW by PG Tips
Review:
0.2 Oz extra tea per bag: That's all it is about.  A box of regular PG Tips is 10.4 Oz and this product is 10.6 Oz per box of 80. You are getting a little pinch extra tea per bag is all.  Tetley British Blend doest the same thing except you get a better deal with them because you get 25% more tea per tea bag as opposed to this chincey little 0.2 Oz pinch more tea.  Also I notice the historic flavor that was the original PG Tips is gone now and Tetley is still the same great quality and original flavor...not to mention it was the tea of choice of John Lennon and George Harrison:) Beatle fans unite!
I used to love PG Tips but the blend has changed and is not what it used to be.  Since they got rid of the higher quality Special Blend and replaced it with this more expensive but cheaper blend "Strong One" I've switched to either Tetley British Blend, Typhoo or I've just tried Builders Blend and THAT'S a kick in the butt Cuppa!! Good strong tea flavor and a caffeine kick to get you going!! and not over priced like this swill.  If you haven't tried Builders Tea do so soon! Cheap, good basic very strong tea! Not 'special'...but honest and strong while priced honestly! PG Tips: Not what it used to be; just costs more. Shame on you Unilever!
