prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Nature's Path Organic Instant Hot Oatmeal, Maple Nut, 14 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
a review from Mrs. L.

I gave this oatmeal 5 stars because the flavor, the quality of the food and the ease of preparation was outstanding. Given that we have a family member who requires a very low sodium diet, quick and easy breakfast options can be slim on our typically busy mornings.  And if I have time in the mornings, I would rather spend those minutes staring into a gigantic cup of steaming coffee than stirring a pulsating pot of steel cut or rolled oats. So, with great determination to overhaul our breakfast routine. Tipping towards ease of production and nutrition, I began my search for low sodium, high fiber, no added sugar, no or low sodium foods.

Lordy! What an experience in researching products that fit my criteria. And, it's amazing what manufacturers put in food to enhance flavor.

I finally decided to try Nature's Path Organic Oatmeal Original Flavor. What really sealed the deal was the comment that one reviewer made, that his wife just poured boiling water over it and let it sit for five minutes. I ordered the oatmeal and have used boiling water each time and it turns out perfectly. The oatmeal is good. It has a slightly nutty, earthy flavor. The oats are rolled, so they hold their texture. I add about two tablespoons of golden raisins to the mixture before I pour boiling water on it, so that the raisins give the oatmeal the perfect level of sweetness needed without added sugar. All in all, I just like the wholeness and goodness of a purely unadulterated oat product like these for breakfast.

Now . . .on Amazon's product page for this product there is a picture of the box this oatmeal comes in. On the front of the box,it says "NO SUGAR OR SALT ADDED". But, the Amazon description says that it has a sprinkling of flavor enhancing sea salt. So, I picked up the phone and called the company in Washington state. The company said the Amazon description is incorrect. There is no added salt. They have tried to get Amazon the change the description to no avail.  Also, the company is very nice to deal with and they appreciate consumer questions and feedback.

So, if you are looking for a sodium free oatmeal product, this product has no added salt.

So, overall, this is an excellent product. Healthy, easy to make, good flavor and quality. Responsive company.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Ocean Spray 100% Juice, Cranberry Pomegranate, 60 Ounce Bottle (Pack of 8)
Review:
From Mrs L-

This juice is delicious. It is sweet, but if it is too sweet, it is just as delicious poured over ice with a spritz of icy cold water and a lemon wedge. The blackberry and blueberry taste are apparent in its flavor without having that after bite of bitterness that blackberries and blueberries can have. I have even frozen this juice in ice cube trays and popped the ice cubes in tall glasses and poured cold, unsweetened iced tea over them. Add a sprig of mint and no sugar is needed in your tea.  I also like to pour two cups of this juice in a blender. Add fresh fruit like peaches, pineapples, strawberries, a zing of lemon juice, a handful or two of ice cubes and whir around until it makes a slushy drink.

I actually ordered this on a whim. We had been ordering and will continue to order the cranberry-cherry juice as it was a favorite, but we find that this is a new favorite too!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Doctor Kracker Organic Crispbread, Seeded Spelt, 7 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
A note from Mrs. l-

I think this is really my "go to cracker" when I am craving something delicious, crunchy and visually appealing to eat. These crackers look like something you might find in a great bakery or in a super cookbook like Moosewood genre. (Not that anyone could create something so crisp and delicious).  Some of the ingredients could have had the potential to overwhelm the tastebuds, but the recipe apparently developed into a subtle combination of flavors that led to something quite delicious. I especially like that the cheese flavor is a milder cheddar without a sharp bite and the organic pumpkin seeds are a sweet, nutty note. Pumpkin seeds that are not organic are often subtly bitter. These are happily not!

While one might be happy to munch on just the cracker by itself, these flatbreads are delicious with egg salad, salmon spread, tuna salad, hot vidalia onion spread, curried chicken salad. A messy, but happy snack or lunch involves a light smear of mayo, a sprinkling of fresh basil, a thick slice  of tomato and a sprinkle of grated cheese. Broil until cheese is bubbly. Oh! My! The cracker really holds its weight with wetter foods like sliced veggies. A light spread of creamed cheese topped with a length-wise slice of cucumber and thinly sliced sweet onions is manageable for a delectable lunch without throwing crackers pieces from here to Mars.

The only problem I would note is that there are 150 mg of sodium in one piece.  And, I am not a fan of palm oil because its production can pose harmful effects on the environment. We just choose to eat few products with palm oil in it and this is one of the two products we consume with palm oil.

Anyway, to conclude, a major favorite food item. Not just for snacking. Love a slice with a buttery poached egg. I have even run a package through the food processor to make great crumbs for breading fish or chicken strips to bake in the oven. Also as a cracker component for salmon cakes.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kirkland Signature Organic Strawberry Spread - 42 Oz (2lb), Made with Fresh Strawberries, 65% Fruit, Preserves, Jam
Review:
This is the best strawberry jam ever! Slightly tart, sweet, pure strawberry taste.  Far superior product to popular jams which often seem to have a cloyingly sweet, gummy texture.  I added a heaping teaspoonful to a cup of plain yogurt and it was delicious. My husband loved it on hot buttered toast with a cup  of steaming coffee on yesterday's chilly morning. Excellent purchase for a jam lover.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Oregon Specialty Fruit, Dark Sweet Cherries, Pitted, All-Natural, 15 Ounces, 3-Pack
Review:
 A review from Mrs. L. 

These are absolutely delicious!  The cherries hold their cherry-like texture and are not mushy. Their color is great. I will say that I drain the juice off because it is a bit on the sweeter side. I had originally ordered the cherries to use in a favorite muffin recipe. They were perfect for muffins and cakes. But, we have found we also just like them plain for dessert.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Planters Unsalted Dry Roasted Peanuts, 35 Ounce
Review:
a review from Mrs. L-

I don't normally buy Planters nuts because they are very salty and oily.  In looking for unsalted nuts I came across these on Amazon and ordered them.  They are delicious. Perfectly roasted.  We have enjoyed them plain as a snack, sprinkled on salads, blended with oil in the blender to make peanut butter.  They are sweet and flavorful. One might even not notice that they are unsalted because the flavor is so good.  A nice food product for individuals on low sodium diets or who just don't want to consume highly salted foods.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kraft Three Cheese Ranch Dressing & Dip, 16-Ounce Plastic Bottles (Pack of 6)
Review:
 a review from Mrs. L. 

This salad dressing is absolutely delicious. It has a smooth, savory flavor that does not overwhelm one's salad. Rather it enhances the flavor of the salad. The cheeses are not strongly flavored. The vinegar is not strongly flavored. More of a subtle tang as to not overwhelm the creaminess of the dressing. The thing that I really loved about the flavor is that it did not leave that heavy, chemical aftertaste that some ranch or cheesy dressings can leave in your mouth. There is a delicious, savory aftertaste that does not linger on.

I have made pasta salad with it. Yummo! I have used it as a dip with fresh vegetables.i used it with great success as a dressing for coleslaw.  I used it instead of mayo on a tomato sandwich.  I dunked a few roasted Brussel sprouts in it. Oh. My. Word. That was tasty. But, my favorite use has been on a chopped romaine salad with diced Roma tomatoes, finely chopped sweet onions, organic raisins, sliced dead ripe, but crisp Asian pears and chopped hazelnuts and pecans.  I could eat this salad every day. The dressing makes it a perfect flavor event!

I was concerned that 2 tablespoons of the dressing contained 300 mg of sodium. That was excessive. But when I compared it to the Light version of this dressing there was 460 mg of sodium in the lighter version. So, I ordered the regular variety and try not to use as much.

I will say that I think this is going to be one of my favorite dressings. It just has an appealing flavor. There is the sensation of 'satisfaction' for me after having eaten it that it was an enjoyable taste experience. So far, I haven't tired of it and thoroughly enjoy my daily salads with this dressing.

Oh, and I also,like it that the top on the bottle opens in a flip top through which you squeeze the dressing through a hole in the top. That makes it so much easier to put on a salad when it doesn't come out in a gigantic 'glop'.  The protective cover is very easy to remove off of new bottles.

I have just thoroughly enjoyed this addition to my salad routine!
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Product:
Lazy Day Foods Dark Chocolate Ginger Cookies, 4.4-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4)
Review:
The flavor of this cookie is pretty good for gluten-free fare. Texture is nice, too. Not gritty like some cookies I've had in the past. I wish it was crispy like it says in the description. They were soft and crumbled. I could blame it on California weather but it wasn't that hot today (85 degrees maybe). Any way, the chocolate was completely melted and reformed.
The ginger cookie is not particularly strong in ginger or spice flavor. The cookie to chocolate ratio is chocolate heavy. What makes it so palatable is probably all the super sweet chocolate they use to cover up the slightly bland ginger cookie underneath. There are 8 cookies per box and four boxes per pack, if you buy them from Amazon. Tip for those who want to try these, order them on a chilly day or you'll get a box of crumbly goo like I did.
I gave these three stars because I think they have the potential to be good. And for how limited gluten free cookies and bread options are out there, this is not bad at all. Could have been a lot worse.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
 Ghirardelli Chocolate Intense Dark Bar, Midnight Reverie 86% Cacao Bar, 3.17-Ounce Bars (Pack of 6) 
Review:
These 86% cacao squares are delicious, smooth, and creamy even for such high percentage of cacao. They are intense and are a bit more bitter than sweet. Perfect for those who don't like their sweets too sweet. Perfect for those who want the intense chocolate flavor. Perfect for people like me with absolutely no self-control when it comes to chocolate. The sweet to bitter to chocolate ratio satisfies my cravings. But it's not too sweet to tempt me to eat more than one or two squares at a time. I find the 60% and 72% way too addicting!!! That is why I steer clear of those and only stock the 86% in my desk :)

I also like that they are individually wrapped. Keeps the chocolate fresh. And keeps me from eating more than I should. When I buy chocolate bars, I find myself breaking off bits here and there and ultimately eating WAY too much.

One square is 60 calories. Only 3 Weight Watchers points. I'd much rather eat one square of this than the overpriced fake diet sweets that Weight Watchers sells. This is something delicious that I can splurge on that is also good for me, as I read that it is good to have 1 oz. of dark chocolate (70% cacao or higher) a day. Thank you to whomever did the research to justify that I can have chocolate every day!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nature's Way Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil- Pure, Cold-pressed, Organic, Non-GMO, Gluten-free- 16 Ounce
Review:
You can eat it, cook with it, and put it on your body. I've tried eating it. It's like eating coconut flavored oil. Not too bad...I didn't stick to my regimen so didn't fully experience the health benefits but if you go online and read about it...there are supposed to be many.

I cooked with it and it's a nice oil to cook with. But everything comes out slightly coconutty. Not a problem if you like that flavor, but it doesn't "go" with everything.

I used to use it as a cuticle oil as well which worked wonderfully. I would apply to lips as a natural lip balm. Then when I licked it off, I felt it was natural and good for me.

Recently my friends and I have been applying this to our infants skin to sooth and relieve eczema. We read somewhere that this would work but didn't believe it. But then we were desperate because we tried everything else. And this was AMAZING! cleared up baby eczema, so wholesome, gentle and hydrating. Baby smells and tastes great. Couldn't believe that this was the answer when nothing else worked!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Jolly Time Healthy Pop Kettle Corn - 94% Fat Free Weight Watchers Microwave Popcorn, 3-Count Boxes, 9 oz, (Pack of 12)
Review:
I got this because of the reviews but let me just say that after having my first bag...this stuff is definitely overrated.

I'm going to compare this with the Orville Redenbacher (OR) light/98% fat free kettle popcorn that I usually get. This pops great and has very few unpopped kernels, so in that aspect they're about even. But the taste is way different. The Jolly Time doesn't taste as good and it is way too salty for kettle corn flavor. It's like they took normal salted butter corn and sprinkled some splenda into it. Half way through, I was on salt overload. Texture wise, the Jolly Time is not as fluffly either. So there is less fluffy white and more hard bits.

I'm sure if you have never eaten microwave popcorn before, then this would be quite acceptable. But in comparison to other brands, it lacks. This was definitely a disappointing purchase that I will have to slowly eat...for many many many months. Since there is a plethera of selection out there, I doubt I would buy Jolly Time again.

Also, it took Amazon 10 days from date of purchase to get it to my door. What is up with that?

I think this product deserves 3 stars but I'm going to give it 2 because of the slow shipping and because the average rating should come down a bit. 4.5 stars is too misleading.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Oreo Mega Stuf Chocolate Sandwich Cookies, 13.2 Ounce
Review:
I thought I was in heaven when I ate the first cookie. So much sweet creamy center goodness. After three cookies, I was over the sweet creamy center goodness. I was on Oreo center overload. Plus I kept visualizing my arteries clogging up.

I eventually ate the rest of the box...but I took out most of the centers and threw them away. I know that is wasteful but I just couldn't eat any more cream.

I do personally know some people who really like these. And they say they prefer these un-dunked and the originals dunked. I guess all that extra cream makes it so you don't have to dunk it in a glass of milk.

For me, I'd say that if I was only going to eat one cookie and one cookie only, I would go for the mega stuff. If I wanted more than one cookie, then I prefer the cookie to cream ratio of the originals.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Wholesome Sweeteners Organic Fair Trade Honey, 16-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)
Review:
Organic, fair-trade, delicious honey. According to the description, this honey comes from the jungles of South America. That might explain the flavor and the color of the honey. It is very dark, like the color of a dark ale. Much darker than the picture. The flavor is mild with a hint of tartness and no real identifiable notes of any particular flavor. So if you like clover, orange flower, or other specially flavored honeys, this is might not be for you.

What I really like about this honey is the packaging. Particularly the spout. The opening where the honey squeezes out has a silicon nipple. When you stop squeezing the nipple cuts off the flow of honey. There are no drips. The bottle stays clean. You can actually store the bottle cap down without finding crusty dried build-up from slow leaks. A small little tweak to packaging makes such a big difference. So clean!!!

Love the bottle. Satisfied with the honey. Would recommend to others.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kellogg's Special K Protein Meal Bars, Strawberry, 6 Count Box (Pack of 3)
Review:
I buy these as late afternoon snacks for my husband. He thinks they are delicious (5 stars). I don't eat them because I do not like the taste or texture (3 stars at best). Also 1 bar is 7 WW points or 170 calories for 12 grams of protein and 15 grams of sugar. Not worth it for me or my diet but you be the judge. I do like the price and like auto-delivery on Amazon. So I'll give these average of 4 stars...
Rating:
4.0

Saturated Fats
All fats are composed mainly of triglycerides. These, in turn, are composed of "fatty acids." These fatty acids fall into three categories: saturated, monounsaturated and polyunsaturated. Of these three, saturated fatty acids are the main culprit in raising blood cholesterol.

Foods high in saturated fat come from both animals and plants. Animal-based foods containing lots of saturated fat include butter, beef tallow, lard and poultry fat. Seafood contains a small amount. a pllow of some kind of marshmallow representation

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
KIND Healthy Grains Granola Bars, Peanut Butter Dark Chocolate, Non GMO, Gluten Free, 1.2 Ounce Bar Sample
Review:
While I'm not the biggest fan of granola bars (I prefer my oats cooked in a mushy soft oatmeal), sometimes they're the right snack when you need the extra energy. I don't have a sweet tooth, so I like that the KIND granola bars aren't overly sweet. They're still loaded with sugars (cane sugar as second ingredient, tapioca syrup as third, some brown rice syrup towards the end), with 6g of added sugars for a 150 calories snack; I wish they would `tone` the sugar down. I also like the idea of multiple grains, but in the end the bar is mainly oats with some millet and amaranth... and the quinoa is listed after sea salt (so I assume is less than a pinch).

Granola bars aren't a filling snack for me (I almost get a sugar rush and become more hungry in ~1 hour), these make no exception; but again, if I need the extra energy and sugar for a long hike, I'll take them with me.

The granola bars are somewhat chewy, but they still got some crunch and dryness (but they are not too dry). They make good on the go snacks, since they won't squish or crumble in a backpack or back; they aren't very sticky so you won't need to wipe your fingers after enjoying them.

-> `Oats & Honey with Toasted Coconut` has a nice mild honey flavor and some coconut flakes inside; the coconut flavor was too mild to tell if the coconut was toasted.
-> `Maple Pumpkin Seeds with Sea Salt` has whole roasted (yummy) pumpkin seeds inside and a nice mild maple flavor (and smell). The bar is quite sweet (but not in a sickening way), I didn't noticed any saltiness.
-> `Double Dark Chocolate` contains a few nice tasting milky (not dark) chocolate chips, but it's not bursting with chocolate flavor. It barely tastes like single-chocolate, nothing double flavored, but still is a somewhat enjoyable bar.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
KIND Bars, Dark Chocolate Nuts & Sea Salt, Gluten Free, 1.4 Ounce Bars, 12 Count
Review:
I find it hard to 'commit' to a 12 single flavor of KIND bars, so I like this variety pack option which gives some variety. KIND bars are nice tasting, but not my go-to snack; the ingredients are great, simple, clean, but for me it's not a filling snack for the ~200 calories. I would like best to find the mini bar packs on Amazon at a decent price; I rarely even find them in physical stores.
Like most nut bars the bars are sticky. I don't consider KIND bars good on the go bars; the honey and chocolate coatings melt easily.
The nuts in the bars are good quality and seem quite fresh, but don't pack tons of flavor. The bars I received in December 2017 expire in November 2018. With most nut bars the issue is that depending on expiration date and storing conditions prior to purchase, you can get hit or miss (e.g. stale tasting nut bars), no matter if you purchase from Amazon or the store.
I like that they list the nuts in the order of predominance in the bar, so you can choose your favorite type of nuts.
All flavors in the variety pack tasted good. I enjoy they are not very sweet. The 'spices' (cinnamon, maple) are quite mild, would preferred a stronger flavor.

The box was delivered in decent condition, in a plastic bag; the box was slightly dented (since the bag probably didn't protect it from careless delivery), but the bars were in perfect shape.

Individual bar review:
Dark Chocolate Nuts & Sea Salt - This bar has a rich dark chocolate drizzle and bottom coating; I love it's not a sweet bar, so I can enjoy the dark chocolate and the delicious combination with sea salt. The peanuts are predominant in this bar as flavor, although almonds are listed first.
Dark Chocolate Cinnamon Pecan - This bar has a rich dark chocolate drizzle and bottom coating; I love it's not a sweet bar, so I can enjoy the dark chocolate. The cinnamon flavor is mild, barely noticeable. I liked that the pecan content is high, and I could taste them over the almonds and peanuts.
Maple Glazed Pecan & Sea Salt - This is mostly an almonds bar, with some peanuts and pecans. Again, not very sweet, and the sea salt is nice addition to the flavor. The maple syrup flavor is mild.

Other flavors I tried:
Kind Plus Dark Chocolate Cherry Cashew - I really enjoyed the abundance of cherries and cashews, but I could also taste the raisins. The chocolate bottom melts very easily, this bar needs to be stored in a cool place; the chocolate is not the best tasting. I didn't like how sweet this bar is, the ingredient lists contains dry fruits, sugar, glucose syrup... more sweeteners than needed.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
HEALTH WARRIOR Chia Bars, Acai Berry, Gluten Free, Vegan, 25g bars, 15 Count
Review:
The Health Warrior Chia Bar is a chewy (but compact) and seedy bar; it's not sticky at all, so it's great on the go (although it might soften more on warmer climates). Since it contains chia seeds, it's has an odd texture to eat and will stick to teeth, but I personally enjoyed the bars nonetheless since I'm a chia fan; I mention this since some people might dislike this `seedy` texture.
The flavors are really nice, I find that Health Warrior overall has great tasting bars/snacks. Some varieties have a toned-down, mild flavor, but they're still enjoyable. Most `dark chocolate` based flavors actually taste like milk chocolate, they don't have the bitter richness of dark chocolate. I do find that same flavors tend to vary a lot in taste from bar to bar (even bars in the same box).
Another thing I like a lot is that the brand offers variety packs (Chocolate, Breakfast and Tropical variety) so one can't get bored with one flavor; still, I would love even more a variety pack with all flavors.
The bars are incredibly tiny; it can barely be a snack, I just can't see how people eat this as breakfast and stay full until lunch. The chia seeds will expand in the stomach so it's kind of filling, but even as a snack I need to have the bar with an apple or some carrots or celery sticks,
For a `healthy` snack bar this has an incredible amount of added sugars, from multiple sources (brown rices syrup - twice on the list, agave syrup). It might seem little at 4g of sugars per bar, but it's a tiny bar and it's just added sugar; it would have made more sense to use dates (or other dry fruits) if they wanted to add sweetness. The other ingredients are OK, pretty much natural and without any odd fillers.

Flavors review:
-> `Vanilla Almond`: I'm a fan of both vanilla and almond, and I found this bar great tasting. Most snack bars with `vanilla almond` flavor tend to have an artificial taste; not this one, the vanilla flavor was very enjoyable, almost natural. There were some bits of almonds inside, but very few.
-> 'Dark Chocolate`: While the chocolate flavor was enjoyable, it leaned more towards milk chocolate than dark chocolate in my opinion. There are tiny chocolate chips inside. The cocoa liquor intensifies the flavor, giving it an unique touch.
-> `Chocolate Peanut Butter`: The sample bar I tried of this flavor was an enjoyable treat, with dark chocolate chips inside and a hint of peanut butter; the chips have a surprisingly great quality dark chocolate taste, but I wished a little more peanut flavor. The bars that came in the `Chocolate Lovers` variety pack had a totally different taste, barely any peanut butter flavor, less chocolate chips and a mild vanilla almost coconut flavor.
-> `Dark Chocolate Cherry`: With tiny bits of sour dried cherries and sweet chocolate chips (I simply don't feel any dark chocolate vibes, it's sweet milk chocolate to my taste buts), this variety is a nice treat. But I noticed the `flavorness` varying a lot between bars, from bursting with cherry flavor to simply tasting like the `Dark Chocolate` one. The ratio of chips and cherry pieces also varies a lot from bar to bar.
-> `Caramel Sea Salt`: This bar tastes mostly like caramel, with the specific bitterness. It didn't have enough coconut flavor for my liking, but I loved the mix of sweet and salty (it's very well balanced).
-> Coconut: This bar has a nice coconut flavor, but quite mild and with a hint of bitterness (not necessary in a bad way, but in a coconut extract way). There are some coconut flakes inside, which add up to the seedy texture of chia. It's one of the sweetest flavors, a little too sweet for my liking. But the bar smells wonderfully of coconut.
-> `Mango`: This bar has quite a nice fruity mango flavor, not too artificial. There were quite a few dried mango pieces inside, making the bar even more enjoyable.
-> `Apple Cinnamon`: This bar tastes just like applesauce mixed with cinnamon, a quite natural flavor, but also mild (it might be affected by the fact that the bar delivered by Amazon was passed the best by date).
-> `Banana Nut`: This delicious bar taste exactly like a banana nut muffin, although I couldn't identify any dried banana pieces inside. But it was strangely very greasy compared to the other flavors.
-> `Acai Berry`: There are more cranberries (actual dry bits in the bar) and strawberries (powder) in this bar than acai, but the berry flavor is very toned down, without the specific tartness.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Organic, Gluten Free Spicy Avocado Hummus, 8 oz
Review:
This is a nice tasting hummus, but it's definitely too spicy and peppery for my taste. The texture is creamy, but you can feel the avocado pieces inside. Since it's so spicy, I could only eat it with crackers and bland wraps... for my taste it doesn't work in combination with raw veggies and deli meats.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Navitas Organics Cacao Nibs, 8 oz. Bag — Organic, Non-GMO, Fair Trade, Gluten-Free
Review:
As a dark chocolate lover (I actually dislike milky sweet chocolate), these cacao nibs are a nice treat. The nibs feel like crunching something in between coffee beans and chocolate pieces. Since these are pure cacao beans, they have the winey fermented smell and taste that some might not enjoy; as another reviewer mentioned, these are an acquired taste.
I add these nibs to my oatmeal or yogurt, and the thing I like is that they don't melt; so I can enjoy them whole even with my overnight oats. The nibs are too small for my licking in snacks.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Manitoba Harvest Hemp Hearts Raw Shelled Hemp Seeds, 2oz (Pack of 12); with 10g Protein & Omegas per Serving, Non-GMO, Gluten Free
Review:
Great quality hemp product, as everything I have tried from Manitoba Harvest! I love both the flavor and the texture. I add the raw shelled hemp seeds to salads, smoothies, oats, yogurt, baked products. It adds something special to muffins or bread while baking, I really recommend trying to add hemp to baking.
Nutritionally, they are a great way to add fats to my macros (better than chia in terms of fat vs. carbs). I don't use a full 30g serving, for me 10g are enough. Did not noticed any strange side effects.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co. Vanilla Peanut Powder, Non-GMO Project Verified, Gluten Free, Vegan, 6.5 oz Jar
Review:
I like peanut butter powder as it's so easy to add in baked goods, pancakes, waffles or oatmeal, or to mix with soy sauce for a `Thai` experience. I don't like opening and storing for months jar of peanut butter, I prefer for convenience the powdered form (which is also easier to portion control).
This Mighty Nut product yields a pretty nice `peanut butter` spread with water, good on toast or celery sticks. 2TBSP powder and 1TBSP water yields a more thick consistency, which I personally prefer. The peanut butter flavor is easily overpowered by other ingredients in oatmeal or baking goods. I also add it sometimes into yogurt, mixes well.
But by comparison, I prefer the PB2 flavor; it's more peanuty and stronger. Peanut butter powder is not as tasty as real peanut powder, either way.

I tried both the `Original` and the `Vanilla` flavor, and I did find the `Vanilla` one to have a stronger/better peanut butter taste (while being a little more sweet). The vanilla flavor was there, but not very strong.
Rating:
4.0

Also too many power outages up here (at least 30 years ago) to take a chance storing much in the refrigerator or freezer, we didn't have an automatic generator at that time.
I remember one time my husband bringing home unexpected guests for cocktails and dinner, I always cook enough for an army so dinner wasn't the problem, but having a little nibble to give guest with a cocktail was harder.  But I got out the B&M Bread, I did not toast it, just sliced it thin and into quarters.  I popped a 8oz. block of cream cheese into the food processor along with a half package of dates and a couple tablespoons of Amaretto  and in a few seconds had a nice spread. Product:

Review:
Not my favorite coffee in a can or coffee out of NOLA -- but if you like coffee-with-chicory this is the reference standard.  My shipment from Amazon came two-to-an-order steel cans, shrinkwrapped, at a good price, along with a link to coupons to buy and tips to make at home  that same Cafe du Monde's famous beignets.  If you like chicory in your coffee -- and millions do -- this is a great way to go.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
New England Coffee Blueberry Cobbler, 11 Ounce
Review:
A good flavorful coffee at a very good price -- clear, slightly nutty, a little astringent, and with enough caffeine.  Brews up strong.  In a crowded field, I would only have given this entrant four stars except for the fact it got to us very fresh.  The buyer should be aware that there are many different sizes and varieties of New England Coffee to sort through; this is the Breakfast Blend, 12 ounces, ground.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
New England Coffee Colombian, Decaffieinated, 10 Ounce
Review:

4.0
Product:
Campbell's Soup on the Go, Creamy Broccoli, 10.75 Ounce (Pack of 8)
Review:
This review is of Campbell's "Soup on the Go" CREAMY TOMATO flavor.  It has much to recommend it:  it heats well, has a pronounced tomato flavor, and, while fairly thick, is still easy to drink because it lacks bits of vegetable or pasta that might cling to the bottom of the cup.  My only real complaint with this flavor (besides the high sodium content, endemic to so many Campbell's soups) is that the "dairy" or cream notes are very slight.  This soup is about as thick as cream-of-tomato from the classic red-and-white steel can reconstituted with milk -- but it tastes much more like that same soup reconstituted with water only.  Even so, of the several kinds of Soup on the Go I've tried, this is my favorite.
Rating:
4.0

Eight O'Clock Whole Bean Coffee, The Original, 36 Ounce
Review:
A good, competent, cuppa joe kind of coffee.  Good all day as well as in the morning.  We brew it up a little stronger than the norm, which yields a very full body, good aroma (often lacking in the lower-priced brands) without too much acid or caffeine.  Careful shopping may yield lower prices.
Rating:
4.0

These are the same KRAFT CARAMELS in a bag I remember from my youth, although the grocery-store bag has drifted down in weight from a pound to thirteen ounces.  However, the caramels themselves are the same -- sweet, rather soft, chewy (watch that dental work!), and individually wrapped, with a pronounced milk undertone.  Also suitable for making caramel apples in the fall.  The quoted price here for this size at this time is wholly unrealistic; try the eleven-ounce bag's price instead.

Product:

Review:
ENJOYABLE EATS!!

Wow!! I love the taste, but then again I'm partial to almonds. I had to get used to the small amount of liquid specified in the recipe, and also tried it without eggs but with flax seeds soaked in water (egg substitute) -- and that worked pretty well too.

The gluten free aspect of Simple Mills Gluten Free Pancake and Waffle mix was very appealing to me because I sometimes have major reactions to innocent things like (a small bowl of) shredded wheat or wheat bran, so it was nice to nosh on these pancakes and not have a sudden "nosedive" that takes more than a few minutes to recover from.

As for the expense. well this IS pricey but maybe the price will come down a bit once it's more established? I would hope so!! I really like it !!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Krusteaz Oat Bran Supreme Muffin Mix, 14-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)
Review:
Wow Sun Maid -- you NEVER disappoint!!!

I baked these muffins, even adding pineapple, as suggested on the side of the box -- the muffins (all 12 of them) came out of the oven as scrumptious, semi-moist morsels of perfection, right up to the slightly crispy but still juicy raisins on the tops of each muffin.

They stored well - I eventually put them (covered with foil) in the fridge, and now I am taking the remainder to work with me.

You only need one egg per mix, and some oil or butter, and liquid (in my case I used pineapple juice as liquid) -- it takes very little time to mix (I used a big big serving fork to mix up the batter with) and they pop into and out of the oven in no time.

The price is right and the result is delicious!!!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
FISHER Chef's Naturals Slivered Almonds, No Preservatives, Non-GMO, 2 oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
Good for baking, or eating out of hand.  What I like about Fisher is that the nuts are really fresh, these almonds are almost sweet -- they are moist and bake up very nicely -- sometimes I grind or crush them depending on what I'm making.

I'm happy with them, and the price for these 12 bags is very reasonable.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Skippy Peanut Butter, Natural Creamy, 15-Ounce Jars (Pack of 6)
Review:
Oops scuse me -- got peanut butter stuck on the roof of my mouth. Skippy - I LOOVE you!!!

I've been consuming Skippy ever since I was a little tiny child who just BARELY knew how to slap peanut butter on a slice of bread and then slap jelly and another slice of bread over it and then head for school (Mom NEVER made our lunches). Truth be told, I once even slapped some sardines under the jelly -- I never did that again.

I have seen MANY competitors come and go and even -- gasp!! -- tried some of those products, but always came back to the familiar taste and texture and comfort of Skippy -- whether Chunky or Smooth -- I LOOVE Skippy.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Amazon Brand - Happy Belly Italian Roast Decaf Organic Fairtrade Coffee, Dark Roast, Whole Bean, 12 ounce
Review:
Well, it is Very aromatic -- and when I brew it,  it is very smooth.

The beans themselves were quite aromatic -- I ground them for a drip filter. My other coffees are NOT as aromatic in bean or ground form, but seem to have more taste than Happy Belly.

However, if you want a very smooth coffee with a very mild flavor, this is the one for you.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Green Giant Whole Spear Asparagus, 15 oz, 12 Pack
Review:
And although these do not taste as great as the fresh, they DO taste good -- and perhaps because they have been in liquid, in the can, they are softer and more of the stalk is edible (as contrasted with fresh-cooked, where the stalk usually gets tough once you get to the middle.)

My simple tastes require nothing more than mayo and lemon on these tasty bundles. I pour the liquid into a glass and add some lemon there too-- yum.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Newtons Fig Fruit Chewy Cookies - Snack Packs, 12 Count Box, 24 Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
Either needs more filling or less cookie dough  -- as the dough overpowers the filling, and the dough can really be "heavy" on the stomach.

Although all ls forgiven when these Newtons are crumbled a bit, put in a bowl and covered with a generous dollop of Vanilla ice cream.
Rating:
3.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

<similarpairs>
Product:
Snack Pack Chocolate Pudding Cups, 13 Ounce, Pack of 12
Review:
Great quick snack on the go or small dessert. Lots of chocolate taste and while these pudding cups are sweet, I don't feel like I just had a sugar bomb afterwards. And....you can pretend they are a little bit healthy because they have a bit of calcium and milk.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
SoFit Fruit and Protein Squeeze, Mango Orange, 4.2 Ounce (Pack of 8)
Review:
I like these squeeze puree things as starters for smoothies. Just drinking - slurping? - them straight from the pouch is pretty disgusting actually. The other flavor options are Mango/Orange & Strawberry/Pineapple and both of those taste distinctly like mango and strawberry to me. This one is more of a generic berry mix with a slight tartness underneath.

All three of the flavors have whey protein (milk based) and are soy free, but these are pretty high in sugar for a "healthy" snack. I use one as a base in a smoothie, add fresh berries, cherries, some spinach and ice and blend. No need for anything else. It's too sweet for breakfast for my palate, but makes a nice mid afternoon pick me up.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Quaker Cereal Bars, Apple Crisp,1.30 oz bars 8-Count Bars (Pack of 6)
Review:
This is one of those products that the troops really like in Iraq. They don't melt, don't go stale quickly, each cereal bar is individually wrapped and they fit nicely in a pocket. The flavor is good and less sugar is always a good thing!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
CLIF BAR - Energy Bar - Chocolate Brownie - (2.4 Ounce Protein Bar, 6 Count)
Review:
My husband loves these Chocolate Brownie Clif Bars - he thinks I've given him a fancy brownie. Thank heaven for that, because trying to get that man to eat something that is deliberately healthier than a donut is nearly impossible. These are pretty chewy and have a satisfying texture without tasting or feeling like those old school protein bars from the 1980s that stayed stuck in your teeth all afternoon. They also travel well in a shirt pocket and in the glove box of the truck for a fast energy boost on the go.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
PowerBar Performance The Original Energy Bar, Milk Chocolate Brownie, 2.29-Ounce Bar (Pack of 24)
Review:
These taste great and travel well in a pocket or saddle bag working horses in the mornings. They don't melt or get messy and in the Texas summer heat they don't make me feel heavy or full afterward - I can eat this and continue riding two more horses and clean saddles. My one complaint is they are almost impossible to eat if they get cold - like chipping off pieces of an ice block with your teeth! I do like the fact that these have a high iron content compared to other similar products. The peanut butter and oatmeal raisin are my favorite flavors and I keep them in the barn and the house constantly.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Vega Snack Bar, Chocolate Mixed Nuts & Sea Salt, 1.48oz Bar, 12 Count
Review:
Tastes like a Payday candy bar. Salty, sweet, chocolate & peanut butter and chewy with crunch, but not so sweet that you feel guilty. I much prefer these to a candy bar for a mid day pick me up. A little bit of health food disguised as a treat. I am a full on carnivore, but several of the Vega products are a part of my regular diet now and I pass them out to friends and family who are always amazed that a vegan item is not just edible, but good. I keep these in my car and out at the barn for quick energy after riding/training three horses in a row with more yet to do in my day.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Awake Caffeinated Chocolate Energy Bar, Dark Chocolate, 12 Count 
Review:
So...candy that has added caffeine, who knew? I don't know what I was expecting, but good chocolate was a surprise. The milk chocolate is really rich and very sweet - I actually think it's a bit sweeter than a traditional Hershey bar. I couldn't eat more than a little of this at a single sitting, it's just too rich for me.

 Each bar is divided into four "bites" so you can gauge the amount of caffeine you're ingesting. You will need a Ziploc bag to keep the rest of the bar fresh after you open it. The bites are thick and taste really good, it's definitely a milk chocolate candy bar. I ate one bite piece after lunch and it was enough. I noticed a bump in energy - the combination of sugar and caffeine will do that. I won't be eating any of this chocolate as an after dinner treat, no desire to stay up all night! This is an interesting product that could really come in handy without being a hassle to obtain or make.
Rating:
4.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

Product:
IZZE Sparkling Juice, Blackberry, 8.4 oz Cans, 24 Count
Review:
We have been encouraging our 6-year-old to drink these IZZE products rather than straight fruit juice or the sugary drinks that contain fruit juice.

While 100% fruit drinks may seem wholesome, it is really much better to eat the fruit itself rather than the concentrated juice. Fruit juice is still high in sugar, albeit "natural" sugar, which is still not a healthy choice.

Since it is not just the flavor, but the fizziness she enjoys, we prefer this brand. It is just fruit juice and sparkling water, nothing else. The taste is light, tastes like real fruit, and meets the desire for something cold and refreshing on occasion.

We keep these in supply for our whole family now as well, for those times when we want something a little more flavorful than plain water.
The price of this and other flavors of IZZE is usually quite reasonable when purchased from Prime Pantry.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Larabar Bites, Gluten Free, Double Chocolate Brownie, 5.3 oz Pouch
Review:
I got a selection of four flavors of Larabar Bites a while back. They are surprisingly filling little nuggets of ground dates, almonds, and chocolate. They are actually quite tasty too.
The cherry ones also contain ground cherries, which give them a pleasant tangy taste. Those are my favorite, but there are also coconut and mint varieties.
These are nice to subdue a craving for sweets or chocolate. Just a couple will do the trick.
There are many flavors of Larabars, but I prefer the texture and the handy snacking size of these Bites.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Larabar Bites, Gluten Free, Double Chocolate Brownie, 5.3 oz Pouch
Review:
I do like most Lara bars, with their simple list of ingredients and chewy taste.
Some flavors I've liked more than others, but have never tried a chocolate one, nor any of the flavors in the form of a "bite."
I thought these were pretty good when I tried one, and then I ate several more. The taste really grew on me!
These will make a great snack for when I crave something sweet, and won't send me on a crash and burn expedition either.
I look forward to exploring some of the other flavors as well.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Pepperidge Farm Goldfish Crackers, Cheddar, 30 oz, Carton, 6-Count
Review:
Is there anyone anywhere who has not yet tasted a Goldfish cracker?
These tiny crackers are ubiquitous in school lunches and in mom's purses everywhere.

This particular packaging is a BIG carton for those who go through a lot of Goldfish.
The 30 ounce carton is bigger than a half gallon milk carton, and just as problematic to open.
Of course the carton opening started to tear as I opened it, so I used a knife to carefully finish pulling the spout away from the carton.
I also use a chip clip to better seal the spout, and so far the product has remained fresh and crisp.

This abundant amount of crackers is great to have on hand for distributing to little visitors in bathroom size Dixie cups.
And yes, I keep a baggie of Goldfish in my purse for my granddaughter...and for me.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Lu Cinnamon Sugar Spice European Biscuit Cookies, 9.17 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
LU cinnamon sugar biscuits are back!
These are tender-crunchy cookies that make a glass of milk worth drinking.
Dipped In coffee, they retain some crunch, but turn sandy and melty in your mouth.

The flavor and texture are unique among cookies.
Slightly cinnamony  with a deep brown sugar taste, these cookies are almost too good to be true.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
BUMBLE BEE Sensations Sun-Dried Tomato and Basil Seasoned Tuna with Crackers, High Protein Food, Gluten Free Food, High Protein Snacks, Canned Food, Bulk Snacks, 3.6 Ounce Packages (Pack of 12)
Review:
We like the Bumblebee snack packs that include both crackers and tuna salad type spreads.
They are convenient and filling for a light lunch or snack.

This seasoned tuna mix, however, was disappointing.
It was actually quite bland, with very little jalapeno flavoring, and no hot pepper bite.
This flavor was a complete miss for us.

For both heat and a little sweetness try the Thai Chili variety, everyone in our household prefers this over all the other flavors.
Rating:

Review:
We're Creole and for a Creole, a kitchen without Cayenne simply isn't a kitchen at all.

This is a generously-sized container of Cayenne.  Did I say generously sized?  I meant huge!  It's sealed well and the spice is very fresh.

The Cayenne has good color, a good amount of heat, and excellent flavor.

And I really like the fact that this is organic.

Review:
This is good, basic trail mix.

The bag is jam packed with fruit and nuts.  Seriously, this is extremely generously sized.  It will last you a very long time.

The fruit is very good.  I did wish for a bit of salt on the nuts, but that's my personal taste.  I like a mix of sweet and salty.  They also don't seem to stint on one nut or fruit - really, each handful seems to contain a bit of every represented nut/fruit in the bag.

This tastes pretty good.

You might need to get used to the texture.

It's suggested that, before you open it the first time, you soak the jar in a little warm water.  That will soften the product.  You can then stir it and get a more creamy consistency.  Note that you don't need to this each time you want to eat it.  Just the first time.  After that, a quick stir will suffice.

I don't want to eat it all the time - it's not quite that cravable - but it's good when I want a quick treat!

The resident almost-six-year-old and I both love them - in fact, I've had to put the box on the top shelf of the pantry and dole them out carefully.  Otherwise, between the two of us, we might just polish off the whole box in a weekend!

Product:
Café Bustelo Coffee Espresso, 10 Ounce Bricks (Pack of 4)
Review:
I am a caffiene addict, and usually most coffee at circle k, quik trip, and 7-11 while tasty, is not strong enough to keep me awake.  So i remember my grandma complaining that house blend coffee taste like water and asked me if I had Bustelo.  At the time I did not have any so i decided get some to give it a try.  Man this stuff is strong.  My grandma made expresso the old fashion way with a cloth strainer and wood handle, and my mom uses some stove top device. So if you like strong expresso, this will work.  I personally drink this like drip coffee (i am not an expresso fan).  If i really need to wake up I brew a cup or two of this in my coffee maker with a disposable filter.  There are times when I don't need as much caffiene so I use half bustelo and half some other coffee like Folders (my way off adding shots to regular coffee) .
  If you are a casual coffee drinker or one who mainly drinks light brews/blondes this may be too strong for your taste buds, friends of my who drink basic light house blends don't like it.  On the other hand my friends who drink Medium roast and dark roast coffees like this brand.  and many even like the combo of adding some bustelo with another brand.  So this is a great tasting coffee if you like bold strong coffee or expresso.  Again I brew this like traditional coffee, when I need a lot of caffiene, i brew  this solely, on days when I need a little less coffee i mix it with a regular brand like foldgers.  And its a great price.  Starbucks was getting too expensive especially since I was drinking three to four ventis a day.
Rating:
5.0

Review:
Not much to say other than it is very good, smooth and strong.  Love it!

Review:
I really hate to say it but this tea is NOT for me.  My mother, however LOVES it.  She has been drinking it daily for 8 days now.  While she enjoys the tea and the way it tastes (nice and sweet), she hasn't seen any weight loss benefit from it.  Granted, she doesn't really have much weight to lose but she was hoping for a pound or two.  She is going to continue to drink it because of the benefits it offers (managing blood sugar, cholesterol, and blood pressure).  It steeps well.  She has been using my double walled infusing glass and usually lets it steep a little longer (usually about 3-5 minutes longer than the initial 8 minutes) because she likes it stronger.  It is good that you can re-use 1 tbsp up to 3 times because she drinks it before every meal (but with each use of the tea she has to steep it a little longer, obviously). But my Mother always taught me that anytime is the perfect time for coffee and she is right.  This coffee is delicious.  It smells wonderful coming out of the box and you should smell it brewing.  The aroma is intoxicating...but the flavor is even better!  Delicious and robust.  Very bold but not at all bitter.  Probably one of the best coffees I have ever tasted. Product:

Review:
These pickles really do grow on a person.  (Well not literally.  :)  ).  At first I didn't think they were bad, but wasn't overly impressed.  But after a bit I started to truly enjoy them, thus why I now give them a five star rating.  Due to their use of apple cider vinegar they do have a slightly sweet taste along with the garlic and dill, but not to the point of being nearly as sweet as a bread and butter.  I think if people don't get stuck in thinking they aren't like a kosher half sour pickle but are maybe in a category of their own, they will enjoy them as well.

They are pretty crisp as an aside also, and just slightly spicy.  I'm debating trying either these again, or another variety.

5.0

Review:
These cashews are delicious.  They have a notable dry roasted flavor, and yet the actual flavor from the cashew is never drown out either.  Perfect amount of salt, and are quite fresh.  The bag they come in works well also to keep them fresh after opened.  I'm quite happy, and I'd easily consider buying this or another product by this company again.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Panda Sauce For Mongolian Beef,BBQ Stir Fry, 8-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
How can anyone use this sauce?  Pandas are an endangered species!  The very idea that one would dice up a Panda and then use it as the meat in any meal is disgusting and unethical.  Yes, I know they claim this is sauce for Mongolian beef, but I'm sure that's to hide the fact that a panda is on the front of the label, thus clearly indicating that they expect people to use panda flesh!

As an aside, I have no problem with unusual or exotic meats in general, I'm far from a vegetarian.  But I won't eat a species that is so rare and endangered!

1.0

Newman's Own Con Queso Salsa, 16-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I've been looking far and wide for a salsa or dip that tastes like vomit and has the smell of a soiled diaper.  I am overjoyed to finally find such a product!  In fact, I do wonder since this is a "Newman's Own" product if the late Paul Newman himself upchucked into a vat after eating a copious amount of cheese.  Even if not, the fact that this has the flavor of pre-digested cheese is a plus in my book!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bridgford Italian Salami, 7-Ounce Sticks (Pack of 6)
Review:
To be fair, I didn't purchase this product.  But I found it outside of someone's home as I was wandering the streets.  What I found to be exact was 3/4ths of one of the salami, in some sort of pet food dish as if left for a pet or some wildlife.  Well, since it was left outside, I decided that the owner might not care if I went ahead and ate it.  So I did, and it was wonderful!  I am only giving this product four stars since like "Mntijo" here with his review it was a bit greasy, and I also had stomach distress after eating it.  But this product is still delicious!  I do hope the owner of the home that placed this salami outside orders more, I'd love to get more free food of this caliber.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Old Wisconsin Beef Snack Sticks, 7-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6)
Review:
Although I've had better from local merchants and small businesses, these for being a "major brand" are very good.  Hopefully I don't come off as a food snob of some sort when I say that, but for the price point and in general I do enjoy this product.

The four star rating is more for the following:

1)  They are very greasy, and very slightly sticky also.  The grease is more on the outside of the meat stick then in the meat proper oddly enough.
2)  Although to me it was obvious based on the photo of the product, the package isn't resealable.  Far from a deal breaker, but don't be out of storage bags or containers when one first opens this.
3)  The meat could be packed just a bit denser in the casing.  Not by much, but it could be.

If they made them less greasy and/or a bit more dense I would have come closer to giving this five stars.  Item 2 is more just to mention it, it's not a deal breaker for me at all.
Rating:
4.0

Rose Pork Brains with Milk Gravy 5 Ounce Cans (4 Cans Per Pack)
Review:
This is a wonderful product for those making a survival kit for surviving a zombie apocalypse.  First off, it's canned brains.  Being chased by zombies?  Pop open a can, and leave on the ground.  They will smell the brains and devour these instead of continue chasing you to eat your brains.  One can then run away, or if one has a ranged weapon like a firearm or bow can then run a bit, turn around and kill said zombie.  Of course, one can always eat these if one is desperate.  Or if one IS a zombie but still retains enough intellect to open canned goods.  The cans are small and compact, so keeping a few in a kit as zombie bait and/or emergency food is..pardon the pun, just a no brainer!

5.0

The popcorn is also cold, coming right out of the microwave, I think this is due to it not really having any coating like butter so it gets cold fast......I like warm popcorn. It's also really light and dry.......I like buttery popcorn. All in all this popcorn is good tasting and I am really picky about this stuff and artificial sweeteners, it doesn't taste fake or chemical to me. Have you ever had a popcorn ball? prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Marie Sharp's Orange Pulp Habanero Hot Sauce (5oz)
Review:
Similar to Marie Sharp's Habarnero Pepper Sauce (which adds a bit of sweetness using carrots), this sauce uses oranges instead. Is there a huge difference between the two- no! This orange pulp variety is a bit milder and if you have a delicate palette you might detect the orange versus carrot taste.

As I type this - I'm trying a taste of each side by side - undiluted.

Make no mistake this woman knows how to make a good hot sauce! Fresh tasting, with a sense of "purity" is how I would describe her hot sauces. They are NOT overly complex - a nice bit of sweetness at first blush then just heat, lingering heat but no off tastes.

I don't see how anyone could go wrong with any of her hot sauces even if they lack complexity.

Very nice in a Bloody Mary!

How hot? About equal to Tabasco. Think of 3 or 4 tiny drops in a large Bloody Mary.

Why 3 Stars? I'm seeking perfection! BTW: I'd rate Tabasco's original at 1 star.

Elsewhere on the web this sauce goes for $3.99
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Demitri's Bloody Mary Seasoning Classic Recipe, 16-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)
Review:
Mild but well balanced. This is a concentrate (just add tomato juice and vodka).  It is mostly Worcestershire sauce balanced skillfully with chilies and a variety of other ingredients..

Ingredients/per label: Worcestershire Sauce (Vinegar, Molasses, Sugar, Anchovies, Water, Hydrolyzed Soy and Corn Protein, Onions, Tamarinds, Salt, Garlic, Cloves, Chile Peppers, Natural Flavorings, Shallots), Spices, Chile Pepper Puree, Prepared Horseradish (Grated Horseradish Roots, White Distilled Vinegar, Soybean Oil, Citric Acid, Sugar), Lemon Juice Concentrate, Red Pepper Sauce, Celery Seed, Natural Flavorings and Xanthan Gum.

Want it hotter - add a drop or two of your favorite hot sauce.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Tabasco Original Sauce, Pepper, 12 Ounce
Review:
I've kept a bottle of Tabasco (the original blend) in my kitchen for more decades than I care to admit. I've added a few drops to any number of dishes that I wanted to "kick up" a notch and used it regularly in a Bloody/Virgin Mary.

I'm embarrassed to say I never experimented with any other brand of hot sauce until recently.

After taste testing over 40 different hot sauces (everyone needs a hobby), writing up notes, test tasting them blind again - writing up new notes and then comparing my old notes versus new notes ----- I have to say Tabasco's original blend turns out to be one of the worse hot sauces I have tested blind.

Tabasco's original has only two tastes: hot peppers combined with a very heavy dose of vinegar. The bitter vinegar after-taste, so typical in Tabasco's original, is not an inherent quality of a good hot sauce.

I could provide an extensive list of hot sauces that are far superior to Tabasco's original but here are just a few that are widely available: I encourage you to try any or all of them. I'm quite certain you will be pleasantly surprised.

1) Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce (as potent as Tabasco) but with far less vinegar with a hint of sugar and garlic. Top rated by many. Found in most supermarkets if you look. If you look carefully you'll see it in most pantries on cooking shows
2) Cholula Hot Sauce (milder and less vinegar) - often highly rated by professional reviewers. Found in most supermarkets, look for the wooden top.
3) Tapatio Salsa Picante Hot Sauce (milder and with less vinegar)
4) Huichol Hot Sauce (milder - less vinegar - not widely available)
5) Tabasco's own Chipotle blend (much milder - rich tasting featuring the chipotle smoked pepper -less vinegar).Found in most supermarkets.

I hope I've encouraged everyone to try a few other hot sauces beyond this one

PS: Once you get away from Tabasco's (original) hot sauce and what I find to be its excessive vinegar after-taste you open up a whole new world. There are so many superior hot sauces available that it is almost impossible to comprehend. Things have certainly improved since the late 1800s when Tabasco first came to market. While Tabasco likes to brag that this is their original blend ---- that is not a "plus" in my view but rather a "minus" - a marketing gimmick where they argue that an inherent flaw (a lot of vinegar) is an attribute. BTW: Less anyone think I have an axe to grind with Tabasco - see my review of Tabasco's Chipotle hot sauce which I rated as excellent!

What more can I say - experiment - I sincerely doubt you will stick with Tabasco's original hot sauce after trying a few other brands.

UPDATE ----- A PROFESSIONAL REVIEW of Hot Sauces has come out: While my original review was written over a year prior - just recently America's Test Kitchen, a show on PBS, TESTED a number of HOT SAUCES.

What sauce came in FIRST? ------ Huy Fong Sriracha.

What sauce came in very LAST? ---- Tabasco

I'll admit it is nice to have a professional tasting panel come to the very same conclusions I arrived at a year earlier.

Tastes vary and Tabasco will suit those who like a lot of vinegar in their hot sauce.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Frank's Redhot Original Cayenne Pepper Sauce, Fat Free Hot Wing Sauce, 23 oz
Review:
This is a mild hot sauce. That means you can apply it liberally and it's unlikely you will make any dish too hot. So it is user friendly.

Ingredients (as copied from the label): Aged cayenne peppers, distilled vinegar, water, salt - etc

Why 2 stars? This sauce lacks any character beyond a heavy dose of vinegar. If you happen to like a lot of vinegar in your hot sauce - then you'll love this sauce and my 2 star rating is way off base. I don't like anywhere near this much vinegar. I've blind taste tested over 30 hot sauces and there are many better ones.

What is interesting is that the original Tabasco sauce has a near identical taste to Franks once it is diluted.

You will find mention that this sauce was top rated by Cooks Illustrated. That is absolutely true but what these pundits fail to mention is this was a casual test, done in 2005, comparing only three hot sauces!

Suggestion: Since tastes vary and if you happen to like this sauce - then buy it in one of its larger sizes - at least 23 oz and consider the gallon size. They cost little more than the smaller sizes.

I'd encourage others to experiment with a sauce that is not so heavily laden with vinegar - you just might prefer any of these:

a) Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce - This sauce has considerable heat but it is nicely balanced against a bit of sweetness combined with a hint of garlic. Virtually every supermarket carries it - look in the Asian section! No vinegar.

b) Cholula Original Hot Sauce - features a fine blend of peppers - medium hot and readily available - look in the Mexican section. It has a hint of vinegar.

c) Valentina Salsa Picante Mexican Extra Hot Sauce - a great blend with more vinegar than the above but not too much. Another great blend.

d) Valentina Salsa Picante Mexican Hot Sauce - a decent blend but with a lot of vinegar. Still it is much better than Franks.

e) Tapatio Hot Salsa Picanta - another widely distributed and excellent Mexican Hot sauce. A lot of vinegar but far less than Franks. Once again you will find this in your Mexican isle.

In my opinion, all of the above are far superior to Franks.

If you like Franks and are at the least bit curious, you should try any of these other hot sauces

UPDATE (August, 2013) America's Test Kitchen which is a TV program on PBS recently rated hot sauces. Tabasco came in last, Franks came in the middle and top rated was Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce

PPS: Bon Appetit magazine recently rated Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce as "ingredient of the year"
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Tabasco Chipotle Pepper, 5 Ounce
Review:
This is Tabasco's best tasting hot sauce! The Tabasco brand is traditionally associated with a very hot pepper (chile) sauce. This company has been branching out and now offers a number of new sauces. In my view, this is their very best sauce. In general, I'm not a fan of Tabasco products. Yet this one is excellent.

This sauce is based on the Chipotle - a smoke-dried jalapeno pepper.

The sauce is relatively mild (as is the chile) and it has the unique flavor, typical of this smoked pepper.

I'd call this sauce almost sweet - much like semi-sweet dark chocolate BUT with the additional kick of some gentle heat.

The smoked taste of the Chipotle pepper is fairly unique. Keep in mind, if you like this sauce, you will probably be buying a bottle monthly - given its diluted nature. So if you are use to keeping a bottle of the traditional Tabasco hot sauce in your pantry for a year or more, it certainly won't happen with this variety.

I've been taste tasting 7 other Chipotle hot sauces. This sauce is one of my favorites. The only real competitor is El Yucateco Chipotle Hot Sauce. The Tabasco Chipotle has a bit more vinegar while the El Yucateco has some added sugar and tomato paste. Both are excellent.

As noted, this sauce is far more diluted than the traditional Tabasco hot sauce yet it is far more potent and richer tasting than many other Chipotle based sauces I've tried. At least, in this sauce the Chipotle flavor is concentrated and the added vinegar is not overpowering. Certainly this is the best tasting Tabasco hot sauce ever made and the only real competitor I can find is the El Yucateco Chipotle Hot Sauce which has less vinegar and a bit more tomato taste. All the other Chipotle sauces I have taste tested are so diluted that they lack any real flavor and can be easily dis-qualified.

Try a bottle - if you like the Chipotle pepper and I think you will - you'll love this sauce. You might also try the El Yucateco Chipotle which is also excellent yet a bit different. Beyond these two Chipotle based sauces I have not found any other Chipotle based sauces that come even close!

Heads Up: You can probably find this sauce (in its smaller size) at any supermarket. I'm ordering a half gallon - on-line.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tabasco Chipotle Pepper, 5 Ounce
Review:
This Chipotle Sauce offers some gentle heat along with the rich taste of a smoked Chipotle pepper. It makes a great Bloody/Virgin Mary and will add some interesting flavors to any dish that needs some heat. As another reviewer said -- this is probably the best tasting product within Tabasco's ever expanding lineup.

I've taste tested 7 different Chipotle hot sauces and the Tabasco Chipotle is one of my favorites. The taste is very rich, smokey, semi-sweet and, for once, there is not too much vinegar! Yet make no mistake - there is a good dose of vinegar yet it is not over powering. It is quite simply one of the best Chipotle sauces I have taste tested.

Keep in mind that this sauce is relatively mild when compared to the other Tabasco products.  In this particular sauce, the heat is far more subdued and not what I would have  expected from a Tabasco product. This sauce needs to viewed as a completely different product.  This is the best tasting Tabasco sauce I've ever tasted and beyond that -- near the best tasting Chipotle I have found.

I paid $3.29 for it at my local supermarket. I doubt you'll have any trouble finding it locally and since tastes differ - I'd recommend you first buy a single bottle close to home. Then purchase a half gallon on-line.

What sets this chipotle apart is the richness of its flavor. It is concentrated in the best possible sense. Rich, with some sweetness, smokey, some vinegar and a bit of gentle heat.

I have repeatedly taste tested the following Chipotle:  Tabasco, La Victoria, El Pato, Cholula, Goya, Bufalo and El Yucateco.

The El Yucateco Chipotle is also superb and the only worthy competitor to this sauce. Both are rich - the Tabasco has more vinegar and the El Yucateco has a bit more sugar and a hint of tomato.

Update: My favorite blend turns out to be tomato juice, a fairly heavy dose of Tabasco Chipotle plus a bit of Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce. I also add a dash of Worchester sauce and lemon juice.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Tuong Ot Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce 28oz
Review:
This hot sauce has become a staple in my kitchen and replaced my bottle of Tabasco. Like Tabasco - it is primarily a cayenne pepper delivery device. A few drops add a lot of heat to any dish. This is NOT a watered down hot sauce like Franks, etc.

While Tabasco seems to impart mostly heat along with a vinegar note - this product has far more subtle tastes going on beyond the heat, yet the heat is considerable and dominates. It also lingers, on your taste buds, longer than Tabasco. There is a subtle sweetness with garlic notes to this sauce. While Tabasco can taste harsh if you add enough to a dish ---- this sauce, no matter how much you add, tastes fresh and just a bit sweet.

I wanted to say in my review that this sauce had a hint of tomato yet there are no tomatoes listed on the ingredients. I suspect what I thought was tomato is simply the sun ripened chilies and the added sugar listed on the ingredients. But to be clear - heat - lingering heat - is the primary taste

I like this product and I'd recommend its purchase but I'm not sure it rates 5 stars because the overall flavor does not seem, in any way, exceptional. There really is just one major taste evident and that is heat - and after that only a vague hint of something else which seems to be chiles, sugar and garlic. But chiles, sugar and garlic sure beats the vinegar aftertaste evidenced in Tabasco.

For the $5.99 I paid locally for a 28 Oz bottle --- I'm glad to have it on hand.

As another reviewer recommended - given the potency of this stuff - you probably only want to have a single bottle on hand. Larger quantities will deteriorate over time. I'd recommend you purchase this locally and not in the 2/3/6 packs offered on Amazon. I doubt many households will go through a bottle in a year. As I said: this is potent stuff.

Update (July 2010) - a formal taste test

I put 4 ounces of tomato juice into two glasses and progressively added 1/8 teaspoon of Tabasco or Huy Fong Sriracha into one of the two glasses until they both became too "hot" to taste

Results: With Tabasco - with each added dose the juice became not only hotter but harsher. With the Huy Fong - it became hotter yet retained a very fresh but sweeter note

Update (August 2013): While my review was written some time ago - just recently (August, 2013) America's Test Kitchen, a show on PBS tested a wide number of hot sauces. What sauce came in last? Tabasco! First was the Huy Fong Sriracha.
Rating:
4.0

Product:
SCHARFFEN BERGER Natural Unsweetened Cocoa Powder, 4.4 Pound
Review:
This is very, very yummy.  To make microwave cocoa with it, one cup at a time, put a few teaspoons in the bottom of a cup, with a little cold water, and make a paste. (This mixes it without melting the cocoa, which is why microwave cocoa usually doesn't work.)  Pour regular or almond milk into the cup, once you have made your paste,  and microwave the cup on high for 1 1/2 minutes.  The result is a steaming, sweet, coffeeshop appropriate cocoa.

This is also truly gluten-free. I'm a celiac with a sixteen-year-old diagnosis, and this doesn't make me sick  at all.  The only downside to this is that the bag is huge, and it gets cocoa everywhere. If you don't want cocoa all over your arms or sleeves, you'll have to have another dispenser to put the cocoa in.  Highly recommended.

Review:

golds.output: Horizon Organic Mac Cheese, Macaroni and White Cheddar, 6 Ounce (Pack of 12) is a delightful treat that brings back memories of childhood comfort food.
