Product:
Martinson Single Serve Coffee Capsules, Breakfast Blend, 24 Count
Review:
Bought the Variety Pack to try some new coffees - Barista Prima House Blend, Donut Shop, and Fair Trade Colombian are the house standards.

The Martinson Dark Roast is OK - similar to Donut Shop - and about what you'd expect at a donut shop.  Not as strong Dunkin' as I would expect (or want) from a DARK ROAST.  I like my coffee to provide a rich, robust, deep flavor - just short of French or Italian or Espresso roasts - Starbuck's Morning Joe, for example.  This ain't it.  Not dreadful but nothing to displace the current house favorites.

House Blend is pretty lame (or tame if you're being charitable).  Weaker than Donut Shop - if Donut Shop is a 4 on a 5-point scale, Dark Roast would be a 3 and House Blend a 2.  Just not much by way of rich coffee flavor or aroma.

Final word: these K-cups are being shelved and will bring them out to offer to my in-laws when they invade the house (they all drink coffee with milk and sugar so what difference does the coffee make - not that they have ever actually finished a cup - they just make 'em and then leave them all over the house for me to find after they leave...sometimes LONG after they leave since they "hide" them all over).  Whew.  I feel much better.

But no more Martinsons.
Rating:
1.0

Review:
Best of the Keurig brews - typical faves include Doughnut Shop and Colombian Fair Trade - but the Barista Prima is the tastiest.  Rich, robust, mellow, with great aroma.  But expensive esp. when the other two are available in the shipping box size.  BP is about double the price of those two brews.  But it sure is a great Keurig cuppa.

Tetley's British Blend comes close, but as the reviews suggest, Tips is tops.  Quite likely that it WAS the tea I was drinking.  Brewed according to the rules - warmed pot taken to the boiling water and steeped for 5 minutes - it is rich and flavorful (flavourful?) without being bitter or harsh. Product:
Old Wisconsin Beef Snack Sticks, 7-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6)
Review:
Old Wisconsin Snack Sticks - Turkey.

After reading some of the existing reviews, it appears that they are mixed up between the beef and turkey product. This review is only for the 28 ounce package of turkey snack sticks.

My Doctor recently advised me to cut way back on my red meat intake. I have been searching for turkey products that have decent flavor. These are indeed good tasting, satisfying, turkey snacks with a nice smoked flavor. To me, the taste is very close to the beef. Imagine a 'Slim-Jim' type snack that is less spicy, and bulk packaged in one ounce sticks, also with better texture. That is what these are.

The 28 ounce package that I purchased from Amazon.com, arrived promptly and had a 'use by' date that was 8 months into the future. These are not what people would consider healthy snacks, due to the fat and sodium content. They are darn satisfying though, and at least in my case, healthier than the beef variety. My package does say 'refrigerate after opening'.

Enjoy
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Fiber One Chewy Bar, Oats and Peanut Butter, 1.4 Ounce, 5 Count, Pack of 12
Review:
OK, I ate some of the 'protein' bars and was happy with how full I felt after. These 'fiber' bars are also good, except, I found I was having 4 or 5 bowel movements a day after only one day of eating 3/day. I now limit my intake to one a day and am good.

The taste is excellent to me. What attracted me to this product was that the main ingredient is listed as "Chicory Root Extract". Chicory root appears to have some unverified health benefits. I sometimes enjoy a little tea made from roasted chicory root and it just makes me feel better.

Either way, If you are hungry and need a snack eat one of these, two or more in a day, be sure a potty is nearby.
Rating:
4.0

People's Choice Beef Jerky - Classic - Original - High Protein Meat Snack - 3 Ounce Bag
Review:

I would recommend this to anyone who likes jerky. It is chewy as you would expect natural jerky to be. I use a set of kitchen shears to cut this up into bite sized bits for snacking. Yum!
Rating:

Product:
POPCORNERS Sea Salt Popped Corn Snacks, Gluten Free, Non-GMO, Single-Serve 1oz bags (Pack of 40)
Review:
This review is on the 'Sea Salt' flavor. For a serving size of a 1.1 ounce bag, the facts are: 3.5g fat, 0g trans fat, 0g saturated fat, 190mg sodium, 24g carbohydrate, 6% DV of iron. The ingredients: Yellow Corn, Sunflower Oil, Sea Salt.

The date code on the bags I received was for 10 months onto the future, I have no worry about being able to finish them by that time.

They are popped corn that has somehow been pressed into the shape of a fried corn chip. They are a little crisp mixed with the texture of popped corn, meaning they are not dry and as brittle as a corn chip. Medora did some kind of magic on the pressed chips to make them taste a bit like real corn chips. All in all, I was pleasantly surprised with the snack-ability, good job with that.

I ate two bags of these and then placed an order for another 40 pack, of a different flavor. That is my endorsement.

Enjoy.

Just for grins, I set the unopened pack on a postal scale, 17 1/2 ounces, pretty fair for a 16 ounce bag. The 'Sell By' date is 13 months into the future. No worry there, it will be long gone by the sell by date.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Simply Gum, Cinnamon Chewing Gum, Vegan, Non GMO, 15 Pieces, Pack of 6
Review:
I bought variety packs of both Glee and Simply Gum to stock up and figure out which is my favorite. Yes, perhaps I have too much time on my hands ;) First, heres my overall summary of the two for quality and price:
Simply Gum (5/5 gold stars):
 Simply Gum took me a little while to get used to (my initial rating was 4/5).
 Now that Ive adjusted to the softer, stickier texture, its my favorite gum and I find it hard to go back to regular gum.
 The flavors are all appealing to me  subtle but interesting. Ginger is my go-to flavor.
 The flavor is integrated into the gum (rather than just in a coating) so its not overpowering and also lasts quite a long time.
 It seems more expensive, but with about 20 pieces per box (one piece at a time is sufficient) its actually not bad. A serving of Glee is 2 pieces, so a box of Glee gum contains 8 servings.
 The packaging design is beautiful and functional. It makes me a little happy whenever I use it.

Glee Gum (3/5 gold stars):
 Glee Gum is tasty when you first chew it, but the flavor disappears quickly.
 The texture of Glee is also a bit dense and rigid for my liking  especially after a minute when the sugar is gone.
 Overall, Glee is economical and fine for people who don't want to chew for very long.
 The flavors are all quite good - my favorites are tangerine and mixed berry.

Id much rather chew either of these gums than go back to a major brand like Trident, etc. This is partly because I prefer Glee and Simply Gum and partly because they are more sustainable. Most leading brands of gum list a gum base on their ingredients. This gum base can include polyethylene (plastic), polyvinyl acetate (wood glue), paraffin wax, fats (hydrogenated vegetable oil) and talc. Glee and Simply Gum are both made from natural tree gum (chicle), harvested by tapping Manilkara trees that grow in the rainforests of Central America. I think that both of them are far superior to the big commercial brands of gum and both deserve 5/5 green stars for social and environmental impact. Here is some more info on these two brands:

 Harvesting natural gum from trees can help protect rainforests and support a sustainable practice that has gone on for thousands of years.
 Natural gum also has a lower carbon footprint than petroleum-derived ingredients that are used to make the gum base of commercial gum.
 Natural gums (Glee and Simply gum) are also biodegradable  reducing biological hazards (and ugly pavements).
 In Simply Gum, most of the ingredients (sugar, glycerin, rice flour) are organically grown.
 In Glee Gum, the sugar is not organic but it is Fairtrade certified.
 Both Glee and Simply Gum are packaged in recyclable cardboard boxes  no plastic.
 Both companies and woman-owned and based in the US.
 Glee Gum works with people with disabilities and supports Trees for the Future and scholarships at the Maya University in Mexico.
More info on sustainable chewing gum is available on my site  greenstarsproject. Interested in writing green star reviews? If so, contact me!
Rating:
5.0

Product:
Kashi, Chewy Granola Bars, Honey Almond Flax, Non-GMO Project Verified, 14.4 oz (12 Count)(Pack of 6)
Review:
I eat Kashi cereal sometimes so I was interested in trying their bars to see how they compare. I thought the chewy Chocolate Almond and Sea Salt with Chia bars were a little better than these  tastier and less dry. These Mocha bars are way too dry for my taste, even when I eat them with a drink. In person, they don't look nearly as tasty or as almond-rich as the bar pictured on the box, and then they also taste worse than they look. The flavor doesnt translate as mocha, and theres very little chocolate flavor either.

I think people will be drawn to them for nutritional content, and I think its pretty well balanced when you look at overall content. It has a carbs to protein ratio of 3.5 to 1, which is close to whats considered optimal; low in fat, very high in fiber and moderate in sodium. So the overall balance (3.5 g fat, 4 g fiber, 6 g sugar, and 6 g protein) is pretty good from a purely accounting point of view. I don't love that the protein comes in the form of soy protein isolate however (i.e. the leftovers after oil has been extracted from soybeans with hexane) but thats common to most non-organic bars that use soy protein.

Their newer bars are organic and made with several Fair Trade certified ingredients (including cacao) but unfortunately they fall apart when you unwrap them. These chewy bars hold together better but are not made with Fair Trade certified cacao and thats disappointing. They need a combination of good ingredients and well-made bars. Kashi is also a company of contradictions. For example, they are proud of their new non-GMO products (this is not one of them) and yet in 2012 their parent company, Kellogg, donated $790,000 to the NO on Prop. 37 campaign (labeling of GMO foods). They were also I the news in 2012 for misleading labeling of products as natural (and using GMO ingredients)  the Kashi's general manager responded by stating, The FDA has chosen not to regulate the term 'natural. Overall I feel that they are a mix of good intentions and some bad practices that have seeped in as the company grew (and was acquired by the Kellogg Company). The ingredients are not too bad: for example theres expeller-pressed canola/safflower oil instead of palm oil, which is nice; but I feel that there are too many  it tastes like a highly processed product. Since it contains wheat, nuts, soy and milk, that excludes a lot of people these days!

I feel that overall, for social and environmental impact, Kashi is a little above average, and even Kellogg (the parent company) is setting decent goals these days on things like energy use, waste, ingredient sourcing, etc., even working with the WWF to evaluate impact for their products. These particular bars however, not having organic (except for the cane syrup) or Fair Trade certified ingredients, deserve a middle-of-the-road 3/5 green stars for social and environmental impact and also 3/5 gold stars for overall quality.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Annie's Gluten Free  Rice Pasta & Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese, 12 Boxes, 6oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
Annies gluten-free elbows are made from rice pasta, and the vegan sauce is seasoned pumpkin and sweet potato. The pasta has good texture  rice makes good gluten-free pasta. The sauce is tasty, as long as you don't expect it to taste like cheese  it tastes like the ingredients: pumpkin and sweet potato! If you want a vegan mac and cheese then I suggest Earth Balances cheddar variety: its not gluten free, its high in sodium, but it tastes like the real thing! Annies product is unique, and props to them for developing a healthy vegan mac and cheese (high in vitamin A, decent fiber content, low sugar and fat). So, Id say if you're eating this often then go for Annies; if its an occasional teat then try Earth Balance.

Overall, Id give Annies 3/5 green stars for social and environmental impact. However, some of their products are more sustainable and animal-friendly than others  this mac and cheese is vegan and made from organic ingredients and deserves 4/5 green stars.  Why not 5/5? Well, Annies is now owned by General Mills, who is considered one of the least sustainable of the Big 10 food conglomerates: check out their rating on Oxfams Behind the Brand scorecard. I like Annies but I don't love that they are now part of General Mills. You can see a concerning trend with some of Annies new products, like yogurt tubes, which are taking a step backwards in terms of sustainable packaging. Annies is fairly transparent about ingredients and company operations. They offset some of their carbon footprint through Native Energy and by supporting the Oka Forestry project. They contributed around $0.4 million to charitable causes such as school gardens, versus an annual gross profit of around $70 million  a moderate amount. They use 3550% post-consumer recycled content for paper and glass packaging, but recently improved on their packaging case for mac and cheese by replacing the top half of the case with shrink-wrap plastic! Id rather they stick with cardboard and use 100% post-consumer sources  after all, pasta is one of the products that doesnt require plastic packaging  why needlessly introduce plastic?
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Organic Milk Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups by Justin's, Rainforest Alliance Certified Cocoa, Gluten-free, Responsibly Sourced, 12 Packs of 2-Cups each
Review:
I prefer to eat straight chocolate, but every now and then I think everyone craves a more guilty pleasure (whether something like a Snickers bar or Reeses cups) and I think Justins peanut butter cups fills this gap in a tastier, healthier, and more sustainable way. When you first try them they may seem different to what you're used to (sweeter than dark chocolate, not as sweet as the options mentioned above) but theres a good chance that theyll grow on you and youll eventually be craving more. Im not even that nuts (ho ho) about peanut butter, but Justins cups have converted metheres a good balance between chocolate and peanut butter. Im not going to discuss quality issues related to the supplier; Id suggest buying a pack locally if you want to try them out, and after that be cautious about who you buy them from (check out the other reviews). The ingredients are organic and Rainforest Alliance certified. Justins mention in their press releases and website product info that their chocolate is also fair trade, but theres no fair trade certification stamp on the product itself. One thing that irks me about Justins is that they sell a lot of single-serve nut butters in wasteful packaging.

If you eat two of Justins cups thats 8% of your salt daily value (dv) and 14 grams of sugar. That compares to 5% dv salt and 28 grams of sugar in a regular Snickers bar, and 6% dv salt / 31 grams sugar in a 2-pack of Reeses peanut butter cups. So, Justins have half the sugar, but actually higher in salt than the competition. I don't think Justins cups would lose anything if they reduced the salt content  they definitely taste a tad salty to me. All things considered, Im not going to eat any more Snickers or Reeses if I can help itthe impact on society and the planet is too great (see below).

There can be a huge difference in impact between buying chocolate that is considered fair trade and that which is not. On one hand you can support a sustainable business that in addition to giving workers a fair wage also helps the community in which the cacao is grown; on the other hand (think large multinational chocolate makers) the cheaper chocolate may come at the price of a very poor standard of life for workers, communities that don't benefit, and even child slavery. Child slavery is predominantly an issue in West Africa, where children can be sold by relatives or abducted from neighboring countries, and are forced to work long days under difficult conditions, harvesting cacao pods and missing an education in the process. Mars, Nestle, and (eventually) Hershey have issued statements that their cacao will be child-slavery-free by 2020so until then you know theres a tragic human cost behind their chocolate. Reeses is owned by Hershey while Snickers are made by Mars.

Organic certification is very significant when it comes to chocolate more pesticide is used to grow conventional cacao than almost any other crop, so organic certification is really important. For example, lindane (a neurotoxic organochlorine pesticide that bioaccumulates through the food chain) is commonly used on Cacao and is considered moderately hazardous, compromising the nervous and immune systems as well as posing a cancer risk. And yes, it has been detected in many conventional chocolate bars. It has been banned for agricultural use in the E.U. and U.S. now (which means its still in use for now in cacao-producing countries but being phased out, hopefully not replaced by some equally dubious compound in intensive farms; DDT preceded lindane and is still used on a few cacao farms). Besides the risk to the consumer, conventional (non-organic, non-shade-grown) cacao farming can be very bad news for tropical rainforests and the wildlife within.

Overall, Id give it 4/5 gold stars for quality of the product and 4/5 green stars based on the social-ethical-environmental aspects of producing it. The newer Theo PB cups are a little better on both fronts, in my opinion.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
 SNICKERS Minis Size Chocolate Candy Bars 4.4-Ounce Bag (Pack of 12) 
Review:
I probably don't need to say too much about how they taste  youve probably tried them ;) But, in a nutshell (ho ho), Snickers are still synonymous with satisfying and are one of the best guilty-pleasure options for quickly replenishing energy. For me, they are one of the few candy bars (along with Twix which is also made by Mars) where the U.S. and European versions are both good. Compared to the other best-selling mainstream candy bars, I think Snickers has maintained quality over time, while others like Kit Kat and Reeses products have deviated too far from being actual food (and there are better PB cups out there now).

Snickers loses a gold star because they do contain trans fats (from the partially hydrogenated oil). The label says 0% trans fat because they are allowed by the FDA to label it as such if its less than 0.5%. Other sources will show the trans fat content as 0.1%-0.2%. The trans fat is to me the biggest health risk in a Snickers; you know its bad when President Obama specifically calls for chocolate makers to phase it out within three years.

Besides the 4/5 gold stars for quality, I think Snickers deserves 3/5 green stars for social and environmental impact (perhaps 2.5 stars for the mini version due to the extra packaging). Mars is the worlds second largest chocolate maker but is actually a leader (among these big companies) in sustainability. So, although they not are not up to the standard of some of the smaller organic fair trade chocolate makers, they are better than most of the other companies represented in places like 7-11 stores or gas stations. Read on if you want to hear more about sustainability

Heres how Mars has performed on some of the sustainability goals that they set 2015 (relative to 2007 levels):
Goal: Zero waste send to landfill. Progress is pretty good: as of 2013 they have reduced waste sent to landfill by 66%.
Goal: 25% reduction in energy use by 2015 and carbon-neutral by 2040. Progress is slow: they have reduced fossil fuel use just 6.5% as of 2014.
Goal: 25% reduction in water use. Progress isn't bad: as of 2014 they have reduced water use by 15%.

On other goals are on track, such as introducing recycled content in packaging (20% as of 2013), packaging recyclability (84%), palm oil accountability (84%), and coffee certification (100%). 30% of their cocao is certified, which is better than most of the very big chocolate makers, and some products such as Maltesers are made with 100% Fair Trade cacao. But Mars is still lagging behind the smaller, newer chocolate makers that use 100% Fair Trade cacao (and have a better record on energy use, packaging materials, etc.). Also, Snickers (and most Mars products) contain no organic ingredients, a pretty big drawback since a lot of nasty pesticides are used on cacao plantations.

So, I think Snickers is among best choices among the conventional, ultra-popular candy bars both in terms of quality and social responsibility. But if you want chocolate-peanut snacks that are better for society and the planet, I recommend Theos peanut butter cups (or Justins). Theos in particular are so much tastier than Snickers that they are worth the extra cost to me, and they're healthier too.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Nature's Path Organic Cereal, Heritage O's, 32 Ounce Bag (Pack of 6)
Review:
I bought these rice puffs to make some homemade fruit and nut bars - combined with nuts, seeds, dried fruit and some honey or brown rice syrup the rice puffs worked out really well. After adding the boiling brown rice syrup (or warmed up raw honey) I was concerned that the delicate puffs might disintegrate but they held together and didn't turn soggy. I also tried them with cold milk as a cereal and I thought they were OK - Id prefer if they were a bit crispier and next time Im going to try adding a little date syrup to sweeten them. I want to try their other puffed grains, like millet, especially when making bars.

Gluten: Brown rice itself is gluten free but this product is processed in a facility that contains wheat, so its not certified gluten free. So be careful if you have celiac disease, but if you're just trying to reduce gluten I think its not a big deal  there would probably only be trace amounts of gluten carried over from the equipment.

I think they deserve 4/5 gold stars for quality and 5/5 green stars for social and environmental impact. Natures Path is a good company and better than the competition  they are considered one of the best and greenest companies to work for. Arrowhead Mills (owned by Hain) are also good but their rice puffs are not organic. Then in last place is Quaker (not organic and Quaker are owned by PepsiCo). I really like that the Natures path bag is made from #2 plastic (HDPE), the same type used for many plastic bottles, which makes them much more widely recyclable than the normal #4 bags (LDPE). It also means, no cardboard required. They have reduced their CO2 emissions per pound of product quite a lot since 2008 and aim to be carbon neutral by 2020. They donate at least $2 million each year to food banks and environmental causes and their EnviroKids products support 1% For the Planet. I think one of their biggest contributions have been in reducing packaging waste, so don't forget to recycle your bag once youve finished it!

Arsenic: There was a bit of a scare about arsenic found in rice so I think its useful to discuss that. Bear in mind that some organic arsenic is always found in rice because it occurs naturally in the soil and water, while inorganic arsenic is considered more harmful and may be present in the soil as a result of past pesticide use (e.g. on tobacco) or activities like gold mining. So Im only going to discuss the more harmful inorganic arsenic here. Inorganic arsenic levels are generally higher in rice grown in the U.S. (especially in TX, AR, LA, MO, where tobacco was farmed in the past) than crops from India or Thailand (Californian rice is generally fairly low in arsenic). Consumer Reports have an article (Arsenic in your Food) where they found roughly 3 micrograms of inorganic arsenic per serving of Indian or Thai rice, and around 5 micrograms for U.S. rice, with 9.6 micrograms being the highest levels found in U.S. rice. Bear in mind, that Consumer Reports are basing their safe limit (5 micrograms inorganic arsenic) on the New Jersey limit for inorganic arsenic in drinking water (5 parts per billion, ppb, which means 5 micrograms per liter of water) instead of the overall FDA limit of 10 ppb. None of the rice products in their 2012 report exceeded 10 micrograms arsenic per serving, and most of the studies on arsenic toxicity look at populations that regularly drink water above 50 ppb (50 micrograms per liter). Typical arsenic levels in water are 1-5 ppb, so a serving or rice gives you the same amount of arsenic as drinking a liter of water, or perhaps two. Its estimated that consuming 20 ppb of arsenic per day (2 servings per day of the most contaminated rice found in the U.S.) will increase your risk of developing bladder or lung cancer during your lifetime by 0.7%.  So Im not too concerned with arsenic in rice compared to other risks from processed food. Pregnant mothers could limit consumption to a serving or rice per day to be cautious, and avoid feeding rice-based products to newborn babies too frequently.
Rating:
4.0

Review:

Great for snacking.  Very good for baking.  I like to soak them in hot water, drain, then puree for a delicious cake topping to replace sugar-laden frosting. Product:
Organic Cumin Powder - Cumin Seed Powder -  USDA Certified Organic -  European Union Certified Organic -  Pesticides Free -  Adulteration Free -  Sodium Free - 7 Ounces - 24 Mantra Organic
Review:
This cumin seed powder is extremely fresh.  Being organic, it of course has a very robust aroma and flavor.  It makes wonderful ethnic recipes, especially Mexican, Indian and Middle Eastern.  It's a good deal for 7 ounces.  I use a lot of cumin, so it's better than the little jars.  I like all of the 24 Mantra's products I've bought.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Native Forest Simple Organic Unsweetened Coconut Milk, 13.5 Fluid Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I have not had any issues blending the milk that separates in the can, especially in cold weather.  I've never had it clump in a big ball like the Classic did.  It's only water and coconut.  I just empty the can into the tall blender jar and whip it up with the stick blender.  Perfect.

Back before coconut milk was sold in cans anywhere except Chinatown (I'm that old), there was a recipe going around (with no internet) for making your own.  Soaking dried coconut and processing it in a blender til liquefied made coconut milk.  It was labor intensive and took a while, but it was good.  Some straining was needed unless you didn't mind the tiny coconut bits.  Philippine coconut was the best.  This is what it tasted like.

My cat likes coconut milk as a treat.  Sometimes.  But this coconut milk, the Native Forest Organic Coconut Milk SIMPLE, she slurps up like a dog.  SHE LOVES IT.  When she hears me pull the can tab, her ears perk up.  Next thing I know she's wrapping herself around my ankles, purring.  So we clean out the can, one finger-full at a time.

I asked the vet if it was OK and she said coconut milk is good for cats.  That's a relief.  Actually, her regularity has improved a lot since she started partaking of SIMPLE.  As has mine.

I use it in my coffee every day and make great ice cream from it.

I would never consider changing from this brand.

5.0

Review:
This big bag was a great deal on Amazon.  For a great product.  I lived in the San Francisco area for a few decades and didn't know there WAS any other chocolate.  Ghirardelli rules. :-)

Product:
Kevala Extra Virgin Organic Sesame Oil, 8 Ounce
Review:
At first I loved this because it works great to moisturize delicate skin around the eyes. It also tastes very nice on toast and other food. It has a light sesame taste. But it becomes rancid and goes bad fairly quickly, even when you keep it in the refrigerator. Because this is expensive, it is simply not worth it for me. There are issues with the bottle cap -- it does not stay on very well. It is not easy to pour the amount of oil you want from this bottle -- a lot of oil comes out and runs down the sides of the bottle.

Review:
These sesame seeds are fresh and very yummy! You can add them to salads and all types of food. If you mix them with a little bit of honey, they taste almost like candy. You can put some honey or your favorite spread on top of a sandwich, sprinkle sesame seeds on top--and then you have a crunchy sesame seed sandwich! Review:
When you first open the bottle, the aroma smells so good! I think this is very fresh. It tastes delicious on many foods. I tried it on a tuna melt sandwich and an egg salad sandwich. It makes eggs tastes great! Then I went wild, and I began sprinkling it on everything I ate. That was a mistake, because I think I developed an allergy to it. It began to upset my stomach. My advice is -- use this in moderation. It is very strong.

4.0
Product:

Review:
For over a year I added this to coffee or tea because I read it had a lot of health benefits. It is supposed to be a natural pain reliever. For some people, it helps relieve inflammation. If I try it again, I will probably get a different brand. This brand of turmeric is very gritty. I don't think it is fresh. After taking it for a year, it did not make my health better or worse. It did not relieve my back pain. But it stained my teeth. Turmeric will stain anything it touches. This brand tastes awful. Don't put it in a smoothie. Some people put turmeric on their face, as a facial. There is also a hair remover recipe that uses turmeric.

I did not experience any side effects from taking this. But some people will experience side effects and allergic reactions from turmeric. It interferes with some medications. Because turmeric originates from other countries, the powder is sometimes mixed with dye and inedible or unsafe substances. Turmeric powder should be a gold yellow color. If it is more of an orange red color, then you know that something suspicious is in it.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Kevala Organic Raw Sesame Seeds 1Lb
Review:
Raw sesame seeds have a better nutritional value than toasted sesame seeds, so I wanted to try them. These seeds have a very bitter, unpleasant taste. They would be okay to cook with. But I like to sprinkle sesame seeds on top of food, and these seeds are not good for that. I really enjoyed this same brand's toasted sesame seeds. The difference in taste between raw and toasted sesame seeds is like night and day.

3.0
Product:
SunButter Organic Sunflower Seed Spread Creamy - 16 oz
Review:
This contains only Roasted Organic Sunflower seed. No sugar. No salt. It contains 25% daily value of magnesium and 40% daily value of vitamin E. That is pretty healthy. I love sunflower seeds. But this does not taste like sunflower seeds. It tastes gritty, grainy, oily, burnt, and bitter.  It is bitter because it has no sugar. It tastes burnt because maybe they roasted it too much. A lack of sugar is healthy. But a nut butter that tastes bitter and burnt is not yummy, in my opinion. Maybe I could visualize a field of beautiful sunflowers as I eat this, and then it would taste better?
Rating:
3.0

Product:
Pure Yacon Syrup Gold - All Natural Sweetener & Sugar Substitute - 8 oz - Highest FOS Prebiotics - Raw Root Extract Controls Appetite, Boosts Metabolism, Lowers Blood Sugar, Natural Weight Loss Diet
Review:
This is the best tasting Yacon syrup I have tasted, however, it is a struggle to get it out of the container. It is sweet, almost tastes like mapley-molasses, and has no bitter taste to it at all.

Now, the container is a different matter. Yacon syrup is very thick, and some of it tends to stay in a sludgy, solid mass in the bottom. If the syrup was packaged in a jar, it would be much easier to mix up. After struggling with it for awhile, I finally poured as much of the syrup as possible out of the bottle, and then added some hot water to it, shook it up, poured it into a glass jar, and refrigerated it.

I shall be able to use it this way, although it is a bit watered down. The taste of the syrup is excellent - IF you can get it out of the bottle!

Nutiva Organic Fair Trade Certified Red Palm Oil, 15 Ounce (pack Of 1)
Review:
This was my first experience with red palm oil, and I have to say - I like it! I make popcorn with coconut oil, and then had the red palm oil and butter melted together, which I poured over it. A touch of salt, and I had some really good popcorn!

I tasted it right out of the jar, with a spoon, and it tasted smooth and pleasant. Last night, I made some buttermilk and teff pancakes, and cooked them in it. The oil smoked a lot, but I had it on a very high heat - simply because I was trying to get finished before my husband's burger was done.
They tasted great!

I like how this is obtained, without destroying any natural habitats, and am pleased with the taste of it. I can hardly wait to use it to make some scrambled eggs, as I am sure the color will intensify the natural look of the finished product.

Shipped fast, and my husband and I both love the taste! I do not eat a lot of salt, a practice that I started over 40 years ago, when pregnant with my first child - however - I do like salt, I just don't like my fingers being bloated from eating it.

We tried the Real Salt, last night, and I actually sprinkled some on my food. The taste was refreshingly different from the sea salt we have been using, AND, this morning, my fingers were not bloated. That was amazing.

One try is not really enough to tell if a product is excellent, but the taste is, and the "no-bloated-fingers-effect" is, too!

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Frontier Coriander Seed Powder, 16 Ounce Bags (Pack of 2)
Review:
It smells lemony and tastes as good as my usual organic coriander.  The metal foil pouch only says "Non Irradiated", not organic as claimed on the Amazon product page.  That's the only reason I give it three instead of five stars.  I thought it was too cheap to be organic.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Frontier Natural Products 2693 Fenugreek seed powder, organic 16oz
Review:
I bought Frontier because of the bad review on the competitor brand.  It smells and tastes like fenugreek to me.  I only use 1/8 or 1/4 tsp because fenugreek is a strong seasoning and can overpower a dish in an unpleasant way.  I definitely notice when it is missing, though, so I've got to have it.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Coconut Pacific 100% Pure Organic Extra Virgin Raw Coconut Oil, 4-Ounce Glass Jars (Pack of 4)
Review:
I thought I'd try this coconut oil because it comes in glass instead of plastic and the reviews were good.  I have only tried one other coconut oil, Aloha Nu, before this one.  Aloha Nu may have spoiled me with its freshness and strong smell and flavor of coconut.  I'll definitely be going right back to Aloha Nu even if it does have a plastic bottle.

The Amazon description says the Coconut Pacific is cold pressed, but it doesn't say that anywhere on the four 4 - ounce glass bottles.  It does say it is raw and virgin but it is way too mild with very little freshness or coconut in the smell or taste.  I have some serious doubts about whether this coconut oil is truly raw or may just be made from lower quality coconuts than the Aloha Nu, which I had little doubt about being raw and made with quality coconuts.  Some people go out of their way to find this mildness so Coconut Pacific may be to their liking but not mine.  It is always liquid and would probably make a fine tanning oil.  The four small jars are inconvenient and overpriced overall for a mere 16 ounces, but I'm keeping the cute little jars for when I want to give somebody some seasonings or something.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Manitoba Harvest Organic Hemp Oil, 8 Fluid Ounce
Review:
Since I've been on the hemp oil bandwagon I've tried five brands.

Manitoba Harvest, Just Hemp, and Swanson were very bland, so I give them three stars.

Nutiva was flavorful but has an off taste, so I give it four stars.

Canada Hemp Foods is the best tasting, so I give it five stars.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Manitoba Harvest Hemp Hearts Raw Shelled Hemp Seeds, 2oz (Pack of 12); with 10g Protein & Omegas per Serving, Non-GMO, Gluten Free
Review:
I can't tell the difference between Manitoba Harvest and Swanson.  It's bland, but very easy to eat.

It's definitely a superfood with a ton of magnesium and manganese, which are both very hard to find in food.

It is also very high in both Essential Fatty Acids.  Even though it is just the inner meat with no hull, it still has 1 gram of fiber per tablespoon, too.

19 Nov 2017 update:
The Swanson I just got is a bit gritty, so I downgrade it to 3 stars.  I'll stick with the 5 star Manitoba.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
YS Organic Bee Farms CERTIFIED ORGANIC RAW HONEY 100% CERTIFIED ORGANIC HONEY Raw, Unprocessed, Unpasteurized - Kosher 32oz(pack of 1)
Review:
This is good honey.  I bought this cheaper at my health grocery.  You can buy this honey at many health food stores, too.  I've tried 11 raw, most of which were unfiltered, honeys, and I don't have any real complaints about this one.  It is waxy, which is common, but it is very hard, making it fairly hard to dig it out with a spoon, even though it melts easily and completely in your mouth.  I suppose this is a fairly minor problem, but I wouldn't buy it again.  It is a very mild/bland honey, which some people may prefer.  That said, I only found one raw, unfiltered honey on Amazon that I liked a little better.

The Amish Mountain honey is a little more expensive, but it has a little more flavor and a nice honey like consistency.

I also found a local honey at my health food store that is a dark desert mesquite honey with a normal honey like consistency and lots of flavor for a honey.  It is also cheap, but Happy Bear honey is probably only available in Arizona.  That's the only reason I didn't give this YS organic honey five stars.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Really Raw Honey, Totally Unprocessed, 5-Pound
Review:
This is a fairly good honey.  It is soft with a mostly pasty but also some honey like consistency.  I didn't notice any off flavor or smell.

The capping is quite awful, though.  You aren't doing yourself any favors by chewing and spitting out the wax layer on top to get the last drop of honey out of your jar.  It sticks to your teeth and is quite nasty.  None of the other raw, unfiltered honeys had this problem even though many did have a waxy consistency throughout.  Once you get through the top layer, though, it is a good honey without any other faults.

I would rate it about the same as the Wee Bee, and below the YS organic and Amish Mountain.  The YS organic has a hard, waxy texture, which could be a usability problem for some people.
Rating:
3.0
</similarpairs>

You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

Product:
Santa Fe Bean Company Instant Fat Free Black Refried Beans 7.25-Ounce (Pack of 8) Instant Black Bean Refried Beans; All Natural; High in Fiber; Fat Free; Gluten-Free
Review:
I bought this product for backpacking and camping purpose and did get to try it the past weekend in Yosemite.

Once it was cooked (I added some chicken stock powder, 1 minced Roma tomatoe, and 1 half head of minced red onion), it was creamy and tasty.  It was great to eat with grilled sausages and meats wrapped in tortilla flat bread.

I can use half a cup of this product and half cup of TVP by Bob's Red Mill to make a healthy dinner when I backpack.  It can be a fast party bean dip mixed with pico de gallo and minced avocado.

At home I saute chopped onion and add half a can of diced green chiles into the pot with the beans.  I also use chicken stock instead of water.  The result is FANTASTIC!  No need to add more salt because chicken stock and canned chile pack salt already.  I'd eat it with roasted chicken breast.  The drier white meat tastes super delicious eaten with the embelished black beans.

It takes no time rehydrate, offers healthy calories, and is filling.  Every cupboard should have a bag or two of this product.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Casbah Authentic Grains, Tabouli Wheat Salad Mix, 6 Ounce
Review:
I bought it primarily for backpacking purpose.  This product being in powder form and does not require cooking.

it is easy enough to mix with cold water.  it does get thickend once you start stirring.  i add more powder depending on how thick i want it to be.  i use a spoon to mix and have no issue, no whisk is required.

tastes real good with Trader Joe's crispy pita chips in light sea salt.

update: 12-6-2011

I made a batch using the whole bag.  There were some dry clumps.  I guess I did not stir long enough.  It tasted better after being in the fridge.  I put the whole thing is a tupperware for 2 weeks before using it as a spread on my toasts.

It turns out to be a wonderful spread material, not too thick to make it difficult or too runny to drip.  I put Trader Joe's Just Grilled Chichen meat on top and make a lunch sandwich out of it.  It's a fast, delicious, and healthy lunch.  Don't forget to pack a fresh green salad to add veggie to your diet.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Honey Stinger Organic Waffle, Vanilla, Sports Nutrition, 1.06 Ounce (16 Count)
Review:
In energy snack I've tried every form and brand.  I think I finally found one that I'd stay with, until someone comes up with a better/tastier/easier product.

This is s small palm sized waffle, not hallow but semi soaked (moist).  It will crumble therefore don't take it out of th package (the package can catch the falling crumbs)

To open is easy, just tear the folded area with your teeth or fingers (the tab in the back where the nutrition info is).  It will open the pack right in the middle exposing half of the waffle.  Just hold the half that's still in the package and start eating.  This is the fastest and safest way to consume this product while on the go (I did just that while hiking, holding my poles in one hand and eating this from the other hand).

Haven't tried the chocolate flavor yet but I love all three (strawberry, vanilla, and honey) that I've tried.  Bought Vanilla and Honey from Amazon in bulk.  I know I will finish them based on my scheduled hikes coming up in the remaining 2012.

At 160 calories, it is a good hourly snack.  But the reason I bought it is because it tastes GOOD and no need to work hard to eat it.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Organic Brown Rice Farina Creamy Rice Hot Cereal, 26 Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)
Review:
I love Dr. McDugall's orginal organic instant oatmeal (discovered it as a backpacking food) that I end up having a pack or two each work day morning as breakfast.  Since I don't want to get tired of it, I have been looking for alternative hot breakfast and ended up finding this one.

I had grits for only once in my life time therefore I did not know what to expect.  Granted, this product takes more prep time than instant oatmeal.  After a bit branstorming I found a quicker/no fuss way to fit it into my morning routine.

The night before I'd put 1/4 cup of it in a bowl and a cup of water, add a bit of salt or chicken stock (powder form), stir and then cover the bowl with a plate.  Let it soak over night.

In the morning while getting ready for work, I put the bowl with cover in the microwave to zap it for 3 minutes.  When zapping is done, stir a bit and let it sit.  By the time I am ready to eat it, it'd almost be perfectly soft, gooey, and not too hot.

I prefer eating it with dried pork (pork sung) and diced pickled turnips.  If you like savory breakfast hot cereal, maybe you can be creative to come up with your favorite additives to this wonderful and healthy product!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
YumEarth Organic Pomegranate Hard Candy, 3.3 Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6)
Review:
The peppermint is stronger than the run of the mill after meal mints.  A long term choir singer told me that peppermint is better to sooth the throat than cough drops.  I am happy to have found these little gems.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Shredded Coconut (Unsweetened), 24-ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
I use this and Bob's Red Mill's unsweetened coconut flakes in this recipe.

1/2 can of condensed milk (the gooey kind)
1 1/2 cup of shredded coconut
1/2 cup of coconut flakes

Preheat oven in 350. Baking rack/pan with a baking sheet (i use silicon baking sheet that doesn't require greasing)

in a big mixing bowl, mix the 3 ingredients well.  It is not runny to too dry but more like cookie dough.

spoon or scoop onto a baking sheet (have a bowl of water to wet the spoon or ice cream scooper or it'd be too sticky).  you can make it big or small.  Big it'd be crunchy outside.  Small it'd be crunchy all over.

bake for 30 to 50 minutes depending the type of oven and the size of macaroons.  just don't let the outside become dark brown (it means you burn them by baking too long).
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 McCormick Black Ground Table Pepper, 18-Ounce 
Review:
I had a bottle of 16oz ground black pepper from McCormick I bought at Costco about 20 years ago.  I was not into cooking for the past 20 years and just got started about 9 months ago.  Within 9 months the once almost full bottle of pepper ran out so I bought a new bottle.

Was debating between McCormick and another brand but at the end sticked to the old faithful.

the new pepper, being fresh, is aromatic and finely grounded.  Hopefully I will use this one up much fast than the old one.  Cooking at home rules.  Not only it saves money, it saves calories and everything tastes so much better coming from my own stovetops and oven.

Review:
The first bite of Green & Black's Maya Gold put me off a little. Though I love orange flavored chocolate, I wasn't sure what to make of the spices.  Let it melt in your mouth slowly to appreciate the mixture of flavors and they bloom into something very enjoyable.  This chocolate is meant to be savored in small bits.  My favorite is Green & Black's dark chocolate with cherries, but this one is almost as perfect.

Lindt LINDOR Caramel Milk Chocolate Truffles Kosher, 60 Count Box
Review:
This is the second bag of Lindor Milk Chocolate Truffles that have been extremely disappointing.  Bite in expecting a smooth, creamy center and you'll get an air pocket instead!  The chocolate taste is anemic as well.  There are better truffles out there that can also be purchased at the grocery or drugstore.

Q Drinks, Q Grapefruit, Sparkling Grapefruit Soda, 12  Fl. Oz Slim Can (Pack of 12)
Review:
Great ginger flavor.  Robust and spicy making it great for Moscow Mules or other mixed drinks, or drink on it's own! The product was packaged with care to prevent damage and came with a note from the company founder explaining the purpose of the special packaging.  I would like to try some of the other products.

Brookside Dark Chocolate, Acai/Blueberry, 32 Ounce
Review:
A friend shared a similar product which was dried fruit covered in dark chocolate.  I bought these thinking I was getting the same. What is inside?  Not dried fruit, but some sort of artificial tasting gummy concoction.  From the label, you would expect a somewhat healthy treat. These leave a bad taste in my mouth and have given me indigestion.  I'm not a fan and will not be repurchasing.
Rating:

Product:
Bell Plantation PB2 Powdered Peanut Butter and PB2 with Premium Chocolate, 6.5 Ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
I've been trying to lose weight and have been using a meal replacement shake that comes in sweet cream flavor.  To jazz things up, I've been adding fruit, peanut butter, coffee, etc.  When I heard about PB2, I decided to give it a try.  The 6.5 oz sizes allow you to give the product a try before committing to a large quantity.  PB2 is very light and powdery.  It takes 2 Tbsp. (45 cal) to give a good peanut flavor.  The regular PB2 is better than the chocolate variety.  The chocolate flavor isn't very intense with more pronounced PB flavor.  It mixes well with the shake mix and tastes good.  The price is high considering the small number of servings you'd get per jar.  This was an ingenious way to make the by-product of pressing peanuts for oil into a valuable commodity!

4.0

Hershey Holiday Stocking Stuffer Shapes Chocolate Assortment, 23.1 Ounce
Review:
This assortment was appealing for stocking stuffers.  When they arrives, some pieces sere smashed and others were a bit discolored as if they had suffered a temperature change.  Chalk that up to poor quality control or shipping.  Better off buying at a grocery if you can find this assortment.  I hate to buy a bag of each.  It's just too much to have lying around after the holidays!

3.0
Product:
Good Earth Sweet and Spicy All-Natural Caffeine-Free Herbal Tea Bags, 25-Count (Pack of 3)
Review:
Sweet?  Yes!  Spicy? Yes!  Maybe a bit too much of each.  I'm not a super fan of this tea and now have a lot of it to use up.  I was hopeful that this would be a good option for iced tea, but the flavors are a bit too intense and overly sweet for me.  I've tried to use half decaf green or black tea with these bags and it was still too much.  A ratio of 2 of these to about 5 unflavored is more palatable, but I'm still not a huge fan.

golds.output: This Manuka Doctor Bio Active 10 Plus Honey is a delightful treat!  I love the unique flavor and the fact that it's certified organic and raw. Bragg Organic Unfiltered Apple Cider Vinegar, Raw, 16 Ounce - 1 Pack
Review:
Mother of Apples  (for daily snackin')

Combine 2 cups chilled apple cider (or juice)
with 1/4 cup chilled Raw Apple Cider Vinegar*
and 2 med. crisp red apples, sliced.

* contains the "mother" of vinegar.

Keep refirgerated between servings.
(try with a sprinkle of cinnamon; also consume the juice) ;)

Product:
Bragg Organic Unfiltered Apple Cider Vinegar, Raw, 16 Ounce - 1 Pack
Review:
Warm 2 tbsp virgin olive oil in a large sauce pan, add a large sweet onion (chopped) and 6 med. cloves garlic (sliced), then completely fill with bite-size pieces of freshly rinsed kale. Cover pan and saut on medium heat without stirring 5 min., then add 1/4 cup water and saut until kale is cooked, stirring occasionally.

Sprinkle on desired amount of coarse black pepper and salt, then pour on 1/4 cup Bragg Raw Vinegar; stir briefly then serve hot or place in a covered container and refrigerate when kale has cooled. For a gourmet dish, top with rinsed low sodium canned red kidney beans and (if desired) sprinkle on sharp cheese like parmesan or feta.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Jovial Foods Organic Einkorn Wheat Berries, 16.0-Ounce
Review:
I had not heard of "einkorn" until a week ago, then purchased the wheat berries from Jovial to get familiar with this grain.

First impression: the boiled wheat berries (cooked al dente) would be an excellent substitute for ground meat in chili recipes. The mild flavor, complementary texture and good nutrition make these berries an important addition to the family cupboard. For use in chili, prepare the sauce and berries separately, then simmer together for 15 minutes before serving.

January 2015 update:

How time flies! Six boxes of Einkorn Berries (still in the shipping container) were stored in a closet for over a year; I had drifted back to a favorite staple: organic short grain brown rice. Recently, an impromptu combination created an instant "must have more often": 1 1/2 cups Berries (cooked as directed, then refrigerated overnight), 1 1/2 cups diced sweet onion, 1/2 cup diced fresh parsley, juice of 1/2 lemon, salt & pepper as desired, plus 2/3 cup Newman's Olive Oil & Vinegar Dressing.

I finally discovered the Wheat Berry Salad recipe on the box, but prefer this simpler combination - serve as a main dish with cherry tomatoes, diced cucumbers, and tasty cubes of cheese on the side.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nature's Way Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil- Pure, Cold-pressed, Organic, Non-GMO, Gluten-free- 16 Ounce
Review:
Manuka Mumble  (nutritious snack food)

Combine 16oz container Nature's Way Extra Virgin Coconut Oil and 1/3 cup manuka honey (for more sweetness, try 1 cup oil and 1/3 cup honey). Both ingredients should be cool (not liquid) and coconut oil not cold (will be too hard).

Place a sheet of plastic wrap on a small tray, then drop spoonsful of mixture on top of plastic, cover with another sheet of wrap and press down with a similar tray to about 1/2" thickness.

Refrigerate overnight, then remove top layer of wrap, cut hardened mixture into small squares, and spread on the bottom of a large mixing bowl.

Sprinkle on 1 1/2 tsp cinnamon and 1/2 tsp nutmeg, stir lightly, then sprinkle/stir once more giving 3 tsp cinnamon and 1 tsp nutmeg. Use more or less spices as desired, but enough to coat chilled coconut/honey cubes.

Fold in 3-4 cups walnut halves (or pieces), then refrigerate until served.
Excellent served with dried black mission figs (cut off stem ends).
Melts easily - best served in a small, chilled dessert bowl.

About the "mumble" ...
Creative contraction of "Manuka Coconut Crumble"

About the manuka honey ...
Complementary nutrition to extra virgin coconut oil
(but other honey may be used)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Cherry Bay Orchards Tart Juice Concentrate, Cherry, 32-Ounce
Review:
With three products, used in combination, and all competing for 5-star recognition, the fair thing to do is highlight the one that's unlike the other two (but still include the others). All three: Cherry Bay Tart Cherry Concentrate, Scharffen Berger 99% Cacao Baking Chocolate, Swiss Miss Simply Cocoa Dark Chocolate.

~ Chocolate Cherry Delight:

Rinse, thaw, and combine a 16oz package of frozen dark cherries with 1/4 cup tart cherry concentrate. Spoon into a small desert bowl, top with a dollop of whipped cream then shaved Scharffen Berger and finely chopped walnuts (optional). Enjoy slowly and carefully (a rare cherry pit might be found).

~ Swiss Miss Cocoa Plus:

Prepare Swiss Miss Dark Chocolate Cocoa as directed, then stir in a tablespoon of shaved Scharffen Berger Baking Chocolate for intense-chocolate cocoa. Milk (or cream) might be added but the dark chocolate intensity is then diffused.

~ Moonless Mona (intense cocoa for adults):

A new drink concept:  Moonless Mona  ("Mona" from Saxon mythology = "moon")
Specifically ... the Saxon moon God, Mona  (as in "Oh God!" it's good)

Suggested adulterizer: marshmallow-flavored vodka  (try Smirnoff).
Top with a dollop to be certain there's light in the darkness
... especially after an evening of mutually muffled Monas.

For a 3X 5-Star taste experience, complement a serving of Cherry Delight with a Moonless Mona.

Next day update:

In less than 24 hours after writing this review, I chomped on a "rare" cherry pit. Ouch!
At least, the frozen almond habit was stopped after earning my second crown.
Rating:
5.0

I've been enjoying this K-cup for a while now, and it's a great alternative to my usual Green Mountain K-cups. prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Coffee People Donut Shop Regular Medium Roast Extra Bold, K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig K-Cup Brewers 24-Count (Pack of 2) Review: If you like a medium bordering on bold K-cup, this Donut Shop Coffee by Coffee People will hit the spot. I am so accustomed to drinking only Green Mountain K-cups but discovered this blend quite by accident. I was attracted by the name and was curious :) I am happy to report that I have ordered this coffee (along with my Green Mountain Breakfast Blend, Heifer Blend, and Vermont Blend, etc) a half dozen times and find it a wonderful, hearty morning cup of coffee. Coffee People coffee is fresh, bold and I really like the company philosophy--it's fun. Think Dunkin' Donuts meets McDonald's and I think you will discover that this coffee will not disappoint. I love my K-cups and I'm particular ... these make my A-list. Enjoy! Rating: 5.0 Product: Folgers Classic Roast Ground Coffee, Medium Roast, 30.5 Ounce Review: We've been drinking this coffee for about 6 months or so and the three of us in our household can totally notice a difference in the way this coffee affects our stomachs. Since coffee is the first part of my morning ritual is my beloved cup of coffee. I've been accustomed to K-cups for so long but were finding them a little too wasteful and costly for my taste. Instead, I brew a pot of this (most of the times two pots for us) and we can drink this without all of the acidity and stomach issues that a regular cup of coffee can sometimes cause. The only difference i notice is in the strength ... I feel like I have to use a little bit more of this coffee to make the pot as strong as I want it. Still though, this coffee is a stomach saver and I recommend it for anyone who has a tough time with stomach acidity for that morning cup of coffee. Tastes great too. 26 April 2017 - still drinking this coffee but have alternated it with Breakfast Blend by Folgers which is a milder blend. This Simply Smooth should be renamed the gut saver ... still works great and for me, a noticeable difference. I have to add a few more grounds to get a stronger blend but this does not alter it's stomach saving qualities. This stuff works. Rating: 5.0 Product: Tattle Tea Earl Grey Black Tea, 5 Ounce Review: I am a fan of the Tattle Tea brand. This Earl Grey tea is smooth and not bitter at all. I love my tea and I have discovered that this brand is really very good. The packaging keeps the tea fresh - but I find the closure on this 2 lb bag to be a little more difficult. I would like to see a zip lock or something better than the tape. Delicious tea, a 3-5 minute steep (depending on how you like it) and you get a wonderful, aromatic cup of Earl Grey without the bitterness. I have found many Earl Grey teas leave a bitter taste. Not this one. Smooth and delicious. We are really enjoying it. Rating: 5.0 Product: Glutino Gluten Free Breakfast Bars, Apple, 5-Count Boxes (Pack of 6) Review: I am trying to move to more of a Gluten Free type of diet and just can't give up my sweets. These Glutino bars offered a good option for me. While I don't quite taste the apple in these bars, they are definitely hearty for what they are. They are filling where a Nutri-Grain Cereal Bars, Apple Cinnamon, 8-Count Bars (Pack of 4) bars are tastier in the way of Apples but are not filling at all. It isn't a meal in and of itself but can definitely complement a yogurt or something else. The apple does not taste like apple - but the crust is good. I will try the blueberry next. Rating: 4.0 Product: SPLENDA No Calorie Sweetener Packets, 400 Count Review: It doesn't matter to us whether we get a different, generic brand from one of our membership clubs or get the brand name of Splenda. Sucralose is Sucralose and that's what Splenda is (with a bulking agent added). This box of 400 was a great deal, so I nabbed it. As far as the sweetener is concerned, we found that we like this one over aspartame, saccharin, stevia or whatever else is out there. I only use Splenda to sweeten my hot tea on occasion and my partner uses a packet for her coffee. It provides a great level of sweetness without the aftertaste. No aftertaste is the real key for us. Aspartame always gave me a headache, saccharin has a funky aftertaste (I remember drinking Tab Diet Soda 12oz Cans (Pack of 6) which was one of the first diet colas when I was growing up and it had that Sweet and Low aftertaste.) As far as Stevia Sweetener in the Raw 1000 Ct Box goes, I just can't seem to get a hang of the strange initial taste and aftertaste. I don't need something sweetened enough to use Stevia. Given my druthers, I go for honey or raw sugar Wholesome Sweeteners Fair Trade Raw Cane Sugar, Individual Packets (Pack of 1000). But I use extra sweeteners so rarely that keeping one on hand that my partner and guests seem to prefer is the key. Splenda (or sucralose) fits that bill. At about 2.5 cents a packet, not a bad deal at all for the brand name. A I mentioned though, I am not partial to any brand of Sucralose ... but Amazon had Splenda at a good price, so I pulled the trigger. Rating: 5.0 Product: Ghirardelli Chocolate Intense Dark Bar, Twilight Delight 72% Cacao, 3.5-Ounce Bars (Pack of 6) Review: I drink my coffee black, I love a sharp cheese and a robust, full red wine - the drier the better. This chocolate fits in perfectly with my type of taste. I love the Intense Dark 72% bar ... an absolute favorite and after eating between 60%-90%+, I have found my home with this 72% bar. To me, the perfect combination of sweet and bitter. When I pair this with a nice glass of Cabernet Sauvignon, the complexity of this chocolate comes out and I can taste hints of coconut and coffee beans. I love it. Really a nice after dinner treat for me and a way to conquer the sweet tooth. Rating: 5.0 Product: Buzz and Bloom Honey Creamy Spread, Original, 12 Ounce Review: I am a huge fan or raw, spun honey. I love it like I love Maple Syrup. One of God's great, natural gifts. That said, sometimes messing with nature doesn't yield the expected consequences. I love Cinnamon a lot - like cinnamon toast. Could eat it every day. :) I also love spun, creamy honey. I thought that this honey would contain a subtle touch of cinnamon .... just enough to add character to the concoction. I was wrong about that! The cinnamon seems so strong and artificial that it really turned me off - but the packaging says NATURAL cinnamon. Maybe they need a lot less of it. The taste of cinammon is the kind of cinnamon you get from a Fireball ... not the kind of cinnamon you get from cinnamon toast. I was hoping for the latter. My Mom (who is 86 and with diminished taste buds) appreciates the honey and does not mind the taste of the cinnamon. But she could not reconcile the price with the product. That's not an age thing ... I wouldn't pay the slightly less than $10 for this product. I also cannot imagine what the Blueberry version tastes like? Personally, I will stick with Y.S. Eco Bee Farms Raw Honey - 22 oz which I have bought since 2012. $12 for 22 oz seems much more fair. The taste is pure and awesome. I wish I could say the same about the Buzz and Bloom brand. I am sure their natural variety would be my favorite ... but again, too pricey. Review:
One of the best , if not the best, cups of coffee I have ever brewed. When opening the bag the aroma was very fresh and  "coffee-ie". To me, it is medium bodied but full flavored with absolutely no bitterness. It is very smooth and well-rounded in taste and I noticed no subtle or unique flavors, only an excellent coffee flavor.

I like that it is a medium-dark roast because a medium roast usually lacks boldness whereas a dark roast can be too overbearing with that too toasted, often bitter, taste. This comes off as being the best solution between the two.

This coffee is so good I can leave it at room temperature for hours in a tight lid jar or thermos, and after SLOWLY reheating it, it will taste just about as good as when first brewed.

The beans are a combination of 50% Honduran Peaberry/50% Guatemalan San Antonio.

And, the price is outstanding for these high quality coffee beans!

This will be my regular java from now on.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: NongShim Shin Black Noodle Soup, Spicy, 4.58 (Pack of 18) Review: I'm a ramyun addict and I have always loved ramyun since I was little. It is the first thing I crave when I'm hungry and it's the only thing I can keep down when I'm hung-over. Ramyun has been and will always be my comfort food although I consider them very unhealthy. When I first spotted the Black Shin Ramyun on Amazon, I thought it was too expensive and didn't want to buy an entire box especially while I've been trying so hard to stay away from ramyun products to reduce my sodium and other toxic intakes. After many fruitless searches at nearby Asian markets to try a few packets, I ended up getting a case from Amazon after several months of hesitation; what can I say...I have to try all ramyun that I notice. Upon trying, I must say that I'm not disappointed at all and this is my new favorite ramen for the moment. The broth is thicker (from the beef bone extract powder) and has a bit of miso flavor very similar to the restaurant quality Japanese (non-instant) miso ramyun. It is definitely not as spicy as the regular Shin ramyun, but it has much more complex flavor and tastes more home-made with bigger chunks of mushrooms, hot peppers, etc. It is unbelievable that the product is MSG free with its play on all my taste buds, and I was very impressed that the product didn't make me feel as tired as most ramyun usually do after consumption. I'm very happy that I still have many packets left, and I'll savor them for all they're worth, which is actually much cheaper than comparable restaurant ramyun and home-made noodle soups. update 4/4/2013: I've subscribed for an auto-delivery subscription and unfortunately have been enjoying the ramen a bit too often. The nutrition fact shows that a package serves 2, but that is unrealistic as most will finish an entire package by themselves. The sodium intake for a package is 1840mg (76% daily value) and total fat of 18g (28% dv) if you finish the soup! The sodium content is actually improved from the original (Gourmet Spicy Picante) Shin ramen's 2100mg. I try to make it a bit less evil by adding some cabbage, green onions and other vegetables for additional roughage and flavors. Adding fresh hot peppers or Jalapeos to the ramen makes it even more amazing. Sometimes I'll even drop an egg for additional protein, but try not to consume the york. I avoid drinking the liquid to cut down on sodium but boy is it hard to stop once you start... Having a constant supply of this ramen is dangerous but I don't have the heart to stop the subscription because I can't find it locally. Help~~! Rating: 5.0 Product: NongShim Shin Cup Noodle Soup, Gourmet Spicy, 2.64 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: I don't know why there's such difference but this smaller paper cup instant ramyun tastes so much better than the big bowl (plastic microwavable) version or even the packaged Shin ramyun. The veg flakes have bigger "stuff" and the broth tastes deeper, almost as if they're different products. I used to have this on auto-delivery when it used to cost around $10 but now at around $25 it's overpriced. I'll be on the lookout for the price to go back down. Rating: 5.0 Product: Myojo Ippeichan Yakisoba Japanese Style Instant Noodles, 4.77-Ounce Tubs (Pack of 12) Review: Being a ramen lover, I had to try this product due to its consistently high reviews. I tend to prefer noodle soup products so I may be biased, but I don't particularly love the sweet Worcestershire sauce instant yakisoba flavor, although it's okay once in a while for a change of pace. For those of you addicted to this particular instant Yakisoba product, it may be worth trying the Sapporo Ichiban Chow Mein, 3.6-Ounce Packages (Pack of 24), which tastes practically the same in my opinion. The Sapporo lacks the dried vegetables and the mustard mayo, but the core flavor is very similar. You can add your own vegetables as instructed and purchase the Japanese mustard mayo if desired, and you'll spend less than a dollar as to over $3 per each package of Myojo Ippeichan Yakisoba. The preparation time is a little over 3 minutes for both products with boiled water, although Sapporo lacks the fancy packaging. May be my expectation was set too high, but I will not be reordering this product now that my curiosity had been satisfied, mostly due to its high cost. Rating: 4.0 Product: Samyang Godd Jjajangmen Chajang Noodle Ramen 5-pack Review: I was so impressed with the latest jjambbong from Samyang, I had to try their Jjajangmen version out of curiosity. I am eating it now and I must say that I'm very disappointed. Although it is still a tasty version of an instant Jjajangmen (all instants are very different from the real thing), it's not noticeably different from the old long-standing chapagetti in its flavor. The noodles are bigger but this "Premium" packaged noodle commanding such inflated price unfortunately can't make up for the price hike with minor improvements. I won't repurchase because I can't justify the premium price. Rating: 4.0 Product: Paldo Jjajangmen Chajang Noodle Vegan No MSG 16-pack Review: NOPE this does not taste like the real Jjajangmen, and it's too sweet as if blackstrap molasses had been added to the sauce. I'm disappointed and bought it purely out of curiosity, but won't repurchase especially at the premium price. This may be more fitting for kids' sweeter palette, but not for adults who crave the Chungjang taste of genuine Jjajangmen. Rating: 3.0 Product: illy Coffee, Moka Ground, Medium Roast, 100% Arabica Bean Signature Italian Blend, Premium Gourmet Roasted Coffee, Pressurized Fresh 8.8 Ounce Tin, Stovetop Moka Pot Preparations Review: I only decided to try this coffee because I've recently tried Lavazza Crema E Gusto that I loved and someone mentioned illy being even better although at twice the price. Well... I must completely disagree, and although this is tasty coffee, now that I've satisfied my curiosity it'll be the last costly purchase I make while Lavazza is available at half the price at a greater flavor when used with my stovetop espresso maker. Rating: 4.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Rooibos Tea, Madagascar Vanilla, 20 Count (Pack of 6) Review: My husband and I stopped drinking decaffeinated coffee after dinner and switched to drinking teas instead. This decaffeinated Rooibos tea offers health benefits and subtle vanilla flavor, perfect with desserts or for relaxing after meals. Of 20+ teas we've tried, this is one of our favorite. The bulk price at around 2.30 for 20 teas is a fantastic value, especially considering this particular flavor is hard to find at local stores. The subtle earthiness of the roast is complex and satisfying, with notes of dark chocolate and a hint of spice.  It's a perfect choice for those who enjoy a rich, full-bodied cup without being overly bitter.  I've been brewing it with a French press and it's been a revelation.  It's a bit pricey, but the quality is undeniable and the taste is worth every penny.  I'll definitely be buying this again and

Product:
Equal Exchange Organic Very Dark Chocolate Bars, 2.8 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I just was at my local healthy market, and looking for some dark chocolate, I had never tried this brand, I usually get the Green & Black brand, and then I noticed this Equal Exchange bar, the 71 %, and it was the last one in the display so I thought it must be good if it's almost sold out - and it was!

Not just the intense deep flavor, the high percentage of chocolate and all the good health that goes with it - but the texture! velvety, melt in your mouth, reminding me almost of a quality version of the 'ice cube' chocolates I liked as a kid. It is fair traded and organic, and a win all around - just be moderate, it's addictive!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Quinn Snacks Microwave Popcorn - Made with Organic Non-GMO Corn - Great Snack Food for Movie Night - Parmesan & Rosemary, 7 Ounce (3 Count)
Review:
Absolutely love this popcorn. No nasty chemicals in the bag lining. Only thing you have to really watch the time, it burns easily so start out with two minutes. More than enough sunflower oil and seasoning in the packets for one bag, or even use part of it if you want to cut down on oil, just so buttery delicious and good. I got the butter and sea salt, and also the maple syrup, both great, but butter and sea salt my favorite.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Grassfed Organic Ghee 7.8 Oz - Pure Indian Foods Brand (6-Pack)
Review:
I do watch my fat intake but also realize that good fats are necessary to health, and even some saturated fats in small amounts (in fact I believe recent studies back this up), I've always hated margarine and butter substitutes so if I'm going to use it I want the real thing. The organic and grass fed means it is high in vitamin K, which is hard to come by, and has a host of health benefits. Everyone always compliments me on my skin and I think the healthy fats I consume (avocado, nuts olive oil, coconut oil and this butter), play a role (in addition to healthy lifestyle and skin care regimen).

And because it is SO flavorful, you may need only a dab to get that butter 'fix'. I like a dab on my oatmeal on my flax toast or even on a vanilla or tapioca pudding (I make a lower sugar version). That buttery flavor really harmonizes with the vanilla!

You might be able to find it for somewhat less in a retail store, but I order many grocery /gourmet items here from Amazon so I like the convenience.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Artisana Organics - Cashew Butter, Certified organic, RAW and non-GMO, no added sugar or oil, rich and creamy
Review:
Luxuriously delicious, subtle slightly sweet flavor, it is good fats, but still be careful with quantities if you need to watch our weight! It can be addictive!

Scrumptious low glycemic raw vegan treat recipe made with this:

1/3 cup (or so) of cashew butter
a few tablespoons of Sunfoods Raw Cacao powder (or other cacao powder)
tablespoon of coconut nectar (or to taste)
tsp of vanilla
dash of salt

(optional - ground almonds or walnuts for crunchy texture, or coconut)

Use the amounts in the recipe that taste good to you - I don't like things super sweet, and the cashew butter has an innate sweetness)

Smoosh ingredients all together in a bowl with clean hands or forks (hands work best, messy as it is), make them into little balls and put on a cookie sheet with waxed paper in the freezer for an hour or two (then store in the refrigerator).

You never tasted anything so decadent and delicious, and it is all organic and healthy ! (in modest quantities!)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
YS Organic Bee Farms CERTIFIED ORGANIC RAW HONEY 100% CERTIFIED ORGANIC HONEY Raw, Unprocessed, Unpasteurized - Kosher 32oz(pack of 1)
Review:
This stuff is GOOD, and as another reviewer said you have to be careful because it is that tasty you can overdo!

It is REAL. (Sadly these days counterfeit honey is a rampant problem - the raw stuff is hard to counterfeit, but rest assured this is an ethical supplier.

The health benefits of raw honey are many as it's a live food, full of enzymes, and acts as prebiotic (containing substances that contribute to a healthier gut and flora in the entire body).

It is hard to avoid completely all the processed, 'dead' foods in the modern world, that do little more than add calories and contribute to disease, so adding things like this to our diet, can help a lot.

I like it in tea, I put it in the cup first and then pour in the hot water and stir it.

I especially love it in a broccoli salad I make - using chopped/grated broccoli stalks & carrots,  organic raisins or dried cherries, and Vegenaise with a tablespoon of this honey -- it is DELICIOUS and a sweet tooth satisfier!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bare Fruit Organic Granny Smith Apple Chips, Gluten-Free + Baked, 11-Ounce Bags (Pack of 2)
Review:
First of all - conventional apples are one of the 'dirty dozen' of produce to avoid, so finding an organic version of dried apples to snack on is wonderful. I first got these at Costco like others here, but I am going to order here now.

They are nice alone - but try them with a bit of organic raw cheese, some pistachios or healthy crackers - delicious! The combination of the tangy with the salty /creamy is mouth watering and satisfying.

Much preferable if you are having a sweet tooth to do this as opposed to candy or pastry. You do have to watch the quantities because the sugar grams will add up, even though it is natural fruit sugar.

I really encourage parents to get these for their kids as a snack, and try them with cheese or something salty.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
3 Small Venus Flytraps - Fly Trap - (Dionaea Muscipula) Carnivorous Plant 3 Inch Pot
Review:
I will echo other reviewers about how responsive and responsible the seller is. The plant arrived quickly with good instructions, and the seller even followed up to see how it was doing. It's a fascinating plant with its opening and closing 'mouth' and the fact that it's carnivorous! I got it hoping it would help with my fruit fly issues. I haven't seen anything catch anything so far, but maybe needs to grow bigger to do that. I

 have it in a sunny window and keep the bowl it sits in 1/3 filled with distilled water, as instructed. Have to watch out for water evaporation in that sunny window, but so far the plant seems to be doing well.

5.0
