prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Uncle Lee's Tea- Organic White Tea, Premium Organic White Tea in Tea Bags 100ct Review: This is the first time I have tried white tea. Lots more antioxidants than green or black teas. It has a nice tea taste and I prefer it cold brewed with a dash of lemon and a little juice from smashed strawberries and blueberries. Very good mixed with herbal red zinger too. Rating: 5.0 Product: Traditional Medicinals Organic Chamomile Herbal Leaf Tea, 16 Tea Bags (Pack of 6) Review: This tea really doesn't have much taste, in my opinion. I added some lemon juice and a little stevia. Didn't help much. Why did I get it you ask? I read on Nutrition Facts.org that lemon balm was useful for flyers who get exposed to a lot of atmospheric radiation, and others who have exposure from other sources. Clinical trials have shown it protects people somewhat from DNA damage. Information also says it is useful for generalized anxiety, and is a sleep aid. The negative I read was that people who have thyroid problems and take medication, should not be drinking too much of this. I take meds for low thyroid function, so I won't be buying this again. Rating: 3.0 Product: Uncle Lee's Organic Green Tea -- 100 Tea Bags net wt 5.64 oz (160g) Review: I use this with white tea and red zinger hibiscus to create a great tasting drink. Cold brewing saves time and works really well. Great flavor! Rating: 5.0 Product: Nutiva USDA Certified Organic, non-GMO, Gluten-free, Unrefined Coconut Flour, 16-ounce (Pack of 6) Review: When it's necessary to limit carbohydrates, to avoid insulin levels from climbing too high, this is the flour to use. Rather than completely cutting out bread, I make a multi grain bread substituting 1/4 of the flours with coconut flour. I use some whole wheat, rye, buckwheat, flax and oats. All organic, found here on Amazon. I am not gluten sensitive, so I add a couple tablespoons to get a better rise. There are many web sites for using this flour to make breads, muffins pizza dough, and other things without gluten and other grains. We eat the bread sparingly of course. At first I was disturbed by the use of so many eggs in the preparation of "bread" using only coconut flour. However, I have recently read the best selling book "The Great Cholesterol Myth" by Jonny Bowden. Great Cholesterol Myth(Available on Amazon, of course). If it is true that we have been misled regarding cholesterol and eggs, (by the drug companies) then using them with this flour is not going to cause a problem. One fourth cup contains 22 carbs and 16 grams of fiber. I have seen it said that this makes the flour a net carb serving of 6 grams. Besides being carb friendly, the Coconut Oil Miracle by Bruce Fife The Coconut Oil Miracle will open your eyes to how wonderful coconut is, in every form. I was astounded by the apparent way we have been manipulated (politics!) to believe that coconut was a bad thing. Finally doctors and nutritionists are speaking out.. Their advise? Go real easy on the grains, (avoid sugar!) and add coconut to your diet. This product is a winner! I'll be ordering again. Rating: 5.0 Product: NESTLE COFFEE-MATE Coffee Creamer, Hazelnut, liquid creamer singles, Pack of 180 Review: A little coconut oil is sure better than HF corn syrup as in powdered creamers. This is super creamy and really makes coffee taste good. Be sure to get this ORIGINAL kind because the other coffee mate choices have the syrup. Rating: 5.0 Product: Uncle Lee's Tea Organic White Tea, Tea Bags, 100-Count Boxes (Pack of 4) Review: I was getting the Uncle Lee's organic green tea until I read an article on my favorite nutritional web site "nutrition facts.org". Dr. Gregor compared the benefits and antioxidant power between the green and white tea. White tea is less processed than the green, and the most processed is the black tea. White has even more benefits when lemon juice is added. The best news is that cold brewed tea is as beneficial as hot brewed. I make a three quart pitcher with 8 white tea bags and two bags of Celestial brand cinnamon apple spice tea. I add a half cup of lemon juice and 1/4 cup of Truvia. This is cold brewed overnight. Fabulous! Rating: 5.0 Product: Viva Naturals Organic Dried Goji Berries, 1lb - Premium Himalayan Berries Perfect for Baking, Teas, Trail Mixes and More Review: I purchased these for their terrific health benefits, especially for my eyes. They taste somewhat like cranberries, but a little more tart and just a little more chewy. I put them on my yogurt and toss a few in my salad. I have incorporated them into my homemade granola too. 1/4 cup contains about an ounce of dried berries, and is considered a daily serving of about 100 calories. I understand these are very easy to grow in containers and I am looking into purchasing a few plants. I have a dehydrator which will be vey useful, I'm sure. I'm very pleased with these overall, but they are expensive and if I can learn to grow my own, I will be even happier. P.S. I have found that one of those ceramic brown sugar saver things keeps these moist and prevents them from getting hard. Product: Jade Leaf Matcha Green Tea Powder - USDA Organic, Authentic Japanese Origin - Classic Culinary Grade (Smoothies, Lattes, Baking, Recipes) - Antioxidants, Energy [30g Starter Size] Rating: 2.0 Review:

golds.output: These Planters Deluxe Whole Cashews are my absolute favorite! They're so delicious and satisfying. The lightly salted flavor is just right - not too salty, not too bland. They're the perfect snack for any time of day. I love to eat them straight from the canister, or I'll add them to trail mix or salads for a little crunch and flavor.  I've tried many brands of cashews over the years, and these are by far the best. They're so flavorful and satisfying, and they're a great source of healthy fats. I highly recommend them!

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Planters Deluxe Whole Cashews, 18.25 oz Can Review: I'm nuts about nuts and Planters has been my favorite conventional (not organic) nut brand for over 40 years. They're yummy, as always. And I've tried many brands of cashews over the years (conventional and organic) and of all the conventional cashews Ive had these are the absolute best. Some brands taste stale or "off" and I can never figure out why - I just spit them out and never buy them again. But Planters is always consistent in quality and flavor and they're never too salty. They're great alone or you can use them in recipes, or make your own trail mix. I recommend these cashews when eating them alone, because they're perfect. Or use them in a recipe that calls for basic whole cashews. But if you're going to make trail mix I recommend the lightly salted kind. Here's my trail mix recipe: 1 cup Planters Deluxe Whole Cashews (lightly salted) - Planters Deluxe Whole Cashews Canister, Lightly Salted, 18.25 Ounce 1 cup Planters Cocktail Peanuts (lightly salted) - Planters Cocktail Peanuts, Lightly Salted, 16-Ounce Canisters (Pack of 6) 1 cup Diamond Walnuts - Diamond Walnuts, Shelled, 16 Oz 1 cup sesame sticks - Sincerely Nuts Sesame Sticks - One (1) Lb. Bag - Fiber Rich - Appetizing Golden Color - Delicious & Insanely Fresh - OK Kosher Certified! 2 cups raisins - Sun Maid Natural California Raisins, 20-Ounce If you want something sweeter in your trail mix, Newman's Own Organics Organic California Raisins, 15-Ounce Cans (Pack of 3) seem to be a bit sweeter than Sun Maid. And you can also sweeten up your trail mix with honey or caramel coated Planters nuts: Planters Honey Roasted Peanuts, 12-Ounce Packages (Pack of 3) Planters Deluxe Whole Cashews Honey Roasted, 8.25 oz. (Count of 3) Rating: 5.0 Product: Frontier Basil Leaf, Sweet-domestic, C/s Certified Organic, 16 Ounce Bag Review: I LOVE Frontier Organic herbs and spices. I've been buying their products for over 20 years and have never been disappointed. I've been cooking meals for over 45 years, and almost always used dried herbs, and this is the best dried sweet basil I've tasted. I cant make my tomato sauce without it. It tastes great, plus it's non-GMO & organic! Great taste and aroma, as fresh as dried can be. This is the same product as Simply Organic basil (same company) you get in a .54 ounce glass jar. I recommend buying one jar (see link below), then buy this 16 ounce bag to refill the jar. You get nearly 30 refills in one bag! That's well over $110 worth of refills! The one pound bag is a great bargain and is enough for you and a friend. You can't go wrong. Great product, buy in bulk to save money. I buy most of my herbs and spices from Frontier and Simply organic in the same way - I buy one jar of Simply Organic and refill with their Frontier Organic bulk products. Comes in a well sealed Mylar bag that can last for a couple of years if kept well sealed. And if you have any questions, the people at Frontier and Simply Organic are very friendly and always helpful. What is SWEET Basil? Sweet basil (Ocimum basilicum), also called basic basil, Mediterranean or European-type basil, and is the most common basil grown, sold and used in the United States. Its most often used in Italian cooking and in soups but can also be used in Asian dishes such as Thai (as a replacement for Thai basil). Simply Organic Basil Certified Organic, 0.54-Ounce Container Rating: 5.0 Product: Heinz Twin Pack Organic Tomato Ketchup, 88 Ounce Review: This is my fallback organic ketchup brand. I've tried many others, but I only like Heinz and Annie's so far. I prefer Annie's Organic Ketchup but I can't always find it in local stores or online at a decent price. So, when I can't get Annie's I get Heinz. There is a difference in taste from Annie's to Heinz and from Heinz Organic to Heinz regular. Heinz Organic has a bit of a bite to it (compared to regular Heinz), but not so much that you don't get use to eat by the end of your first meal. Just like anything else, once you get use to it you have trouble going back to what you use to eat (regular Heinz). So, if you can get Annie's Organic Ketchup I recommend it, but if you can't, try this and I don't think you'll be unhappy at all. PS) Annie's has a completely different taste, not as sweet as Heinz, with more of a robust, rich, deeper flavor. It takes getting use to too, but I hate regular ketchup after eating Annie's. Rating: 4.0 Product: Annie's Organic Saltine Classic, Baked Crackers, 6.5 oz (Pack of 6) Review: MY REVIEW: Here's my review of Annie's Organic Saltine Classics (what Amazon is calling "Bunny Classic Crackers Saltines"): I love them. I prefer them over Nabisco Premium (my old favorite) for many reasons. First is the flavor; Annie's Saltines taste like traditional oyster crackers. I didn't realize it until after I tasted them, but I prefer the flavor of oyster crackers over traditional saltines. But I think they taste more like Westminster brand oyster crackers (a richer flavor) than Premium or Sunshine brand oyster crackers. They're also not too salty, light but crisp & crunchy, and of course the fact that they're organic is a huge plus. They taste great with cheese slices or spread. They also hold up well when spreading peanut butter & jelly, butter, or cream cheese on them. Added on 11-9-14: The price has gone from $19 to $29 since my purchase. This product is not worth $5 a box so I am now ordering Late July brand, which is currently $38 for 12 (about $3.15 per box). If Amazon keeps raising prices to ridiculous amounts they're going to loose my business as well as thousands, if not millions, of other consumers. See below for cautions regarding reviews/ratings, return policy, confusing item names, and more. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ RETURN POLICY: One huge caution before you buy - Grocery Items Can NOT Be Returned, for any reason, as per Amazon's return policy. I'm normally a huge fan of Amazon and their more than fair return policy, but when it comes to grocery items their return policy falls short, since some grocery items may be damaged by mishandling or improper storage, may have gone bad, etc. I personally would have no problem ordering Annie's Saltines again, even with this return policy, because I have faith in most items shipped from Amazon. However, I did receive other grocery items in the past that I felt were not up to par and could not return them. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ SHIPPING & CONDITION OF PRODUCT: Although this is not reflected in my star rating, I should mention how well they were packaged and that they were not damaged in shipping. The six boxes were wrapped together and shipped in a box with air pack cushioning. Only one or two crackers were broken in each box, at most, and I suspect that happened in the factory. I ordered them in July 2014 and the product expiration printed on the box was March 2015. So consumers who are worried about getting broken or expired product, I have had no problem with these issues. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ MISLEADING STAR RATINGS: I've tried many different Annie's crackers & cookies. Some I give 5 stars, some 1 star. It should be noted that the star ratings on this page are MISLEADING. As of August 2014 Amazon is lumping several Annie's Cracker flavor reviews together. This means the star rating you see is for ALL the flavors combined. Each flavor is and should be considered a separate product with their own rating, but they are not. The only way for sure to know how other consumers rate each flavor is for you to pay close attention to the details of the review. If the reviewer's purchase is verified Amazon will post which flavor they're reviewing, but you must look closely at the review to see this. It's easily overlooked. For those reviewers whose purchase is not verified by Amazon, there may be no way to know which flavor they're reviewing. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ CONFUSING ITEM NAMES: The titles (names) Amazon shows for these products sold on this page are also misleading. Even though Annie's has stopped making some of their crackers in the shape of a bunny, and have changed the names & packaging of these products to reflect this, as of July 2014 Amazon has not changed the names of the products sold on this page. This may cause consumers to be confused about which products they're buying, or what they'll get. The list below may be helpful. Annie's makes many different kinds of crackers & cookies. Most of them use to be bunny shaped, some are organic while others are not, many have similar names. To help you understand the different cracker & cookie flavors and shapes, here is the breakdown of what is being offered on this page, as of August 3, 2014. There are four different crackers: Annie's Homegrown Organic Saltine Classics (hexagon shaped) Amazon title: Annie's Homegrown Organic Bunny Classic Crackers Saltines Annie's Homegrown Organic Cheddar Classics (hexagon shaped) Amazon title: Annie's Homegrown Organic Bunny Classic Crackers Buttery Rich Annie's Homegrown Organic Buttery Rich Classics (hexagon shaped) Amazon title: Annie's Homegrown Organic Bunny Classic Crackers Cheddar Annie's Homegrown Organic Cheddar Bunnies (bunny shaped) Amazon title: Annie's Homegrown Organic Cheddar Bunnies ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ MAKE SURE YOU'RE GETTING THE RIGHT PRODUCT: Because you might be looking for a cracker or cookie that's not listed above, and you may be wondering if the cracker or cookie you want is still made or discontinued, I thought it might be helpful to list what Annie's currently makes, with a notation as to which ones are currently being sold on this page (as of August 3, 2014). I'd link to all of them, so you can find them quicker, but Amazon only allows 10 links per review: Cheddar Bunnies (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Organic Cheddar Bunnies (bunny shaped) - currently sold through this page White Cheddar Bunnies (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Bernie's Farm Cheddar Crackers (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (different colored farm related shapes, naturally colored) Whole Wheat Cheddar Bunnies (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Extra Cheesy Cheddar Bunnies (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Sour Cream & Onion Bunnies (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Honey Bunny Grahams (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Cinnamon Bunny Grahams (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Chocolate Chip Bunny Grahams (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Chocolate Bunny Grahams (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Friends Bunny Grahams (mix of Honey Graham, Chocolate Chip Graham, and Chocolate Graham flavors), (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Snickerdoodle Cinnamon Sugar Bunny Cookies (gluten-free, peanut-free), (not organic), (bunny shaped) Ginger Snap Bunny Cookies (gluten-free), (not organic), (bunny shaped) Cocoa & Vanilla Bunny Cookies (gluten-free), (not organic), (bunny shaped) Organic Saltine Classics (hexagon shaped) - currently sold through this page Organic Buttery Rich Classics (hexagon shaped) - currently sold through this page Organic Cheddar Classics (hexagon shaped) - currently sold through this page Cheddar Squares (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (square shaped, similar to Cheez-Its shape) Organic Honey Grahams (shaped similar to Honey Maid brand graham crackers) Organic Cinnamon Grahams (shaped similar to Honey Maid brand graham crackers) Annie's also makes snack mixes, pretzels, gummy style bunnies, and some foods other than snacks. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ I'm not an Annie's representative. I do not have any ties to the company. The reason I give so much information about Annie's cookies and crackers is just that I like many of their products and I've found myself becoming confused with all the cookie & cracker names. I also like Annie's Naturals Organic Ketchup! Rating: 5.0 Product: Late July Organic Round Saltine Crackers, 6-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12) Review: These are my favorite saltines these days because they're organic, don't have high fructose corn syrup, and taste good. PROS: > Organic > No high fructose corn syrup > Taste great; tastes more like oyster crackers than typical Premium saltines > Firm; holds up to using in dips or with toppings > Fresh and never over cooked; haven't yet had a problem with off tastes or burnt crackers (like with other brands I've purchased) CONS: > A bit more expensive than what I'd like to pay, definitely more expensive than traditional saltines. But since they're healthier I pay the price (as long as they don't go more than $4 a box) Rating: 5.0 Product: Woodstock Organic Smooth Peanut Butter, Salt Added, 35 oz Review: I love the flavor and ingredients of Woodstock Organic Smooth Peanut Butter, but I will NOT buy it in a plastic jar. I don't have to buy it to know PLASTIC IS TOXIC. I don't know why they changed it (use to come in glass) but I'm moving to another brand if they don't go back to glass jars. Again, plastic is toxic, and they should know this. Storing an organic product long term in a plastic jar is ridiculous! How something tastes is not the only mark of the item's quality - how it's made and how it's stored, if it is stored in toxic plastic, makes a difference and that's why I give this product 3 stars instead of the 5 stars I give to Woodstock in glass jars. They're doing this for cost savings, because it costs less to ship, but that savings is surely not passed on to consumers. And even if it were, I would not want to eat peanut butter stored in toxic plastic. They're lucky I'm giving it 3 stars. Rating: 3.0 Product: Santa Cruz Organic, 100% Lemon Juice, 16 Ounces Review: I like the taste - tastes very close to fresh squeezed lemon juice and has a stronger flavor than the juice found in squeeze bottles. It can be used to make great tasting lemonade (don't forget to add sugar), but I prefer to mix it with grape juice (or other juices and juice blends) for a concoction that helps to relieve kidney stones. If you use it for this reason you should take 2-4 ounces a day. And yes, it helps relieve very painful kidney stones. I also love that it's organic. I've used Santa Cruz brand and Sicilia squeeze bottle. Santa Cruz brand is best for making the freshest tasting lemonade or punch, but Sicilia is best if you want to always have some on hand (and don't have room in the fridge), or if you need just a little squeeze on fish now and then, and for traveling (Sicilia does not need refrigeration until it's opened): Sicilia Organic Lemon Juice, 4 oz Rating: 5.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Quaker Instant Oatmeal Cinnamon & Spice, 10-Count Boxes (Pack of 4)
Review:
Okay, I don't ever buy instant oatmeal like this, we buy bulk organic quick oats and add brown sugar. I have always found instant oatmeal in the little packs to not have good flavor despite all the additives and I always want to add more sugar to make it taste better. This was not the case with this oatmeal!  I actually loved this oatmeal with out wanting to add sugar or flavoring to it.  I liked the cinnamon flavor and did not feel it was too much and did not feel it was too little.  Who knows how many grams of sugar I add to my plain oatmeal when I make it, I may be better of eating this instead, and the ingredient list was pretty darn clean too, nothing I would avoid.  I would definitely buy again and would RECOMMEND.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
CAILLER L'Art du Brut, Dark Chocolate 54% Cocoa with whole Almonds & Cranberries, 6.87 ounce bars (Pack of 2)
Review:
Review of the dark almond cranberry.

My two bars arrived in good condition, no melting or other issues.  The chocolate bar is very unique, expensive looking, and pleasing to the eye.

First off I want to say that I am a dark person, that is why I wanted to try these bars so badly.  No where on any of the packaging does is it indicated the percentage of cocoa in this chocolate, it is only mentioned on the product page that it is 54%.  Also, I waited to write this review until my sample of the dark blueberry arrived so I had something to compare this to.

The price is about $17 for two bars with shipping costs included.  Each bar is nearly 7 ounces.  When compared to Green & Black's which is a bar I have bought in the past all too many times, the price is actually really similar when taking into account the cost of shipping being rolled into the price given that these Cailler bars are twice the weight of a Green & Black bar.

Cailler's dark chocolate is very rich and smooth and not at all bitter or chalky or hard or crunchy.  The texture and flavor, however, may be a result of the relatively low cocoa percentage compared to many other dark chocolates I am used to eating which are all above 65% and most 70% or above.  Research states that the health benefits of dark chocolate do not kick in until a certain threshold of cocoa content has been passed which Cailler's dark chocolate is no where near, so don't think you are doing your body good eating one ounce of this a day.

I like almonds and the cranberries gave this a nice kick, the flavor really popped, like dark chocolate over an orange jelly.  I did feel, however, that because of the almonds and cranberry content that there was less chocolate in each bite than I'd have liked.

I don't have a sweet tooth, I have a whole sweet mouth.  I can sit down and eat and entire Green & Black's bar in one sitting and barely bat an eyelash.  This bar seemed so rich to me that after four pieces (one row) I was able to put it down and walk away, even for the rest of the day.  This is nice for me because it means that this chocolate would last for me and that I won't over do it on this either.

I also like that while Nestle may be the parent company now this chocolate is still actually made in Switzerland as it had been before Nestle.

Would I buy this again?  Yes, but I might wait until I can find it in stores so that I am not paying a higher price because of shipping.

So, why not five stars?  Cost, not enough chocolate in each bite due to fruit and nut content, lower cocoa content than I'd like.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Salted White Truffle Grass-Fed Ghee Butter by 4th & Heart, 9 Ounce,Pasture Raised, Non-GMO, Lactose Free, Certified Paleo, 9 oz
Review:
First I want to say that the only other ghee I have tried is Purity Farms.  Next, I only have used ghee for baking purposes, for making things the most flaky possible when making puff pastry and when working with phyllo dough as clarified butter, I think, really makes a difference.  For our regular butter that we keep in our butter dish we ALWAYS buy grass fed, we used to get Pastureland which is the best but that hasn't been available in over a year so we did a taste test between Kalona and Organic Valley and we now buy Kalona Supernatural.  Anyway, when I saw this sample pack by 4th & Heart I though what would I do with it all and what would I do with the different flavors.  Then I started thinking how the vanilla would be neat in pastries, and how the garlic could make easy garlic bread, the item description talked about just using it as a spread.  So, I tried it, and now I can't stop eating the stuff.

I want to start with the fact that this is grass fed.  I attached a photo of the original 4th & Heart ghee next to my Purity Farms ghee and you can see the huge color difference, and no, there is no color added to the 4th & Heart, the deeper yellow comes from the cows having been grass fed.  Grass fed dairy is higher in many, many nutrients but most notable in my mind are conjugated linoleic acid and vitamin K2.  K2 is a big deal because it is hard to get natural unless you eat a lot of seaweed and it makes a huge difference in calcium being deposited where it should go, in bones, not in arteries.  CLA is good for maintaining muscle mass and metabolism and also helps keep cancer away.  Now, on to taste.

Our first tasting was on 100% whole wheat bagels just as spread, everyone in the family tried all five flavors.  Since then we have been eating daily.

OH MY GOD did just the plain unsalted original have amazing sting butter flavor, this stuff will spoil you.  Kids liked it too, husband loved how buttery it tasted.  Would definitely buy this again.

We eat pink Himalayan sea salt at home as our usual salt, so I thought it was great that this was what 4th & Heart uses.  The flavor of this ghee was also fantastic.  That being said, the amount of salt in this the is more than twice that of Kalona Supernatural grass-fed butter we usually eat.  But still, it tastes really good :)  Kids and hubby really liked this flavor as well.

The vanilla is delicious and the kids now ask for it at breakfast.  There is nothing but clarified butter and vanilla in this yet it seems to have a sweet taste to it, and it brings out the sweetness in in anything it is mixed with.  The kids now request this butter on their bagels, toast, and english muffins which we usually serve with a little maple sugar sprinkled on top and the mix of the vanilla with the maple sugar is wonderful, and because of the added sweetness of the vanilla ghee I can actually cut way back in the maple sugar I sprinkle and the kids don't notice or care.  I have not yet tried baking with this, we have been enjoying all the flavors so much as just plain spreads that I may never bake with it as we most likely will just eat it all as is.

The garlic smells so heavenly and intense, but the flavor was just not there, it was so odd to smell so much garlic and then taste next to none, I was disappointed thinking my grand plans of super fast and easy and delicious garlic bread using this stuff and ciabatta bread were dashed.  It took me a few times of using it to figure out that there was no salt added to the garlic and this might make a difference.  So, I tried adding a little of my own salt and voila, there was the garlic flavor I was looking for, just not as strong as it smells though.  I like this so much that I have been using the garlic with added salt on my bagels as a savory bagel instead of going with something sweet.  I have not yet tried garlic bread, but will be buying ciabatta in a few days when we next go grocery shopping.  My kids did not care for this one, no big surprise there for me, and my husband agreed with me that the smell was fantastic but that the garlic flavor was just not there.  he has not yet tried it with salt, but I am sure he'd agree with me that salt brought out the garlic flavor.

I have never tried white truffle anything before though I have seen the oil around a lot lately.  This flavor ghee really did nothing for any of us, no one particularly cared for it but it certainly wasn't bad tasting though.  I told my mom about it and I swear she was salivating through the phone, so I may give her the rest of the jar and perhaps she will appreciate it more than my family.

Lastly, price.  This stuff is expensive.  The Purity Farms I bought at a natural food store and so did not have to pay for shipping, so I decided to see what it sells for on Amazon where shipping is included in the price to more fairly compare pricing and this 4th & Heart grass-fed ghee is about the same price per jar.  Purity Farms is organic but not grass fed, 4th & Heart is grass fed but not organic.  So, this may be why the pricing is so similar.  I can't help but wonder how much more affordable 4th & Heart would be if I were to find it in a store.  At an average of $14 per jar it is quite spendy to use every day as a spread, it is about 2.5 sticks per jar and Kalona Supernatural is about $8 or $9 for 4 sticks, though it is not clarified  just grass-fed and organic.  I would definitely buy this 4th & Heart regularly if I could find it at a store for less than what it sells for on Amazon, and I will still buy it once in a while on Amazon for a treat as both myself and the kids are really loving it, it is really so flavorful as compared to the other ghee I have tried and so much more flavorful than out usual stick butter.  But I think I would choose jars individually so that we get what we like the best and not have to pay for so so flavors.  I can see where this multi-flavor pack would make a totally awesome gift.  And I like how clarified butter has a much longer life span than regular butter, so this stuff doesn't have to be consumed so fast and will last a long while.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tasty Brand Organic Fruit Snacks, Mixed Fruit Flavors, 4 Ounces 5-Count Packages (Pack of 6)
Review:
These are now our go to for fruit snacks.  Annie's changed their recipe and now contain 11 grams of sutra per serving instead of 10 and they are now sticky which makes for yucky fingers after eating them.  These fruits snacks are the lowest in sugar I can fins that are organic and contain no artificial colors or flairs or preservatives.  As a bonus, not that we need it but one on my daughter's friends is allergic, all Tasty products are produced in nut free facilities.  Very clean, very tasty, as the name says, and the kids love them of course, heck, me too for that matter.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co. Chocmeister Hazelnut Spread, Milk Chocolatey, 13 Ounce Jar
Review:
I debated the star rating on this, 5 stars would be for taste alone, but despite the reduced sugar and extra protein the nutritionals on this still are not good, so a 4 star was the best I can do.

I love hazelnuts, I love hazelnut butter.  It is actually really hard to find plain hazelnut butter.  When traveling I have found brands like Kettle, Futters, and another brand, the only of these still available is Futters, and no one in the Minneapolis/St Paul area carries it.  So, I had been making my own hazelnut butter using my Vitamix and it was delicious.  I never needed a chocolate hazelnut butter.  My kids and I have all tried Nutella at my mother's house and it is tasty, of course it is, sugar is the first ingredient, and it really tastes just like eating chocolate.  Not my thing, and I am surprised it is my mother's.  I was excited when Justin's came out with a chocolate hazelnut butter, the nutritionals are WAY better than any other chocolate hazelnut product out there, but it is isn't truly chocolate hazelnut because it is almond too, and it is dry and difficult to squeeze out of the little pouches or too dry to scoop out of the cup with the pretzels it comes with, and it just wasn't as tasty as I was hoping.

Now, enter Chocmeister.  They are trying to compete with Nutella as is everyone.  In that vein this has sugar as the first ingredient and has oil added in the form of palm oil.  This being their dark chocolate version does not have any milk added.  Chocmeister says this has 50% more protein than Nutella and 25% less sugar, and this it does indeed.  However, if you really care about the nutritionals you'd choose their milk chocolate version instead because it has 4 grams of protein instead of 3 (Nutella has 2gr protein).  I like that with Chocmeister they use cane sugar instead of beet sugar, cane sugar is not GMO whereas all beet sugar (unless it is organic) is GMO.  I also think it is awesome that they use sunflower lecithin instead of soy as many people are trying to avoid soy for health reasons.  Also, Chocmeister uses natural vanilla instead of the artificial vanillin which has been linked to allergies and ADD like behavior in kids.  Interestingly Chocmeister has also opted to try to boost the fiber content of their product by adding chicory root, and who doesn't need more fiber, right?  I get the feeling that this company is really trying to do things right, or at least better.

The jar does not say to refrigerate after opening, so I did not, but it was cool (42 degrees) when I pulled it out of the mailbox and yes, I tried it right there in the car, didn't even wait to get home, and was not very spreadable at 42 degrees, but at room temperature is was more than spreadable.  I am looking forward to heating it up in the microwave and trying it as topping on sea salt carmel ice cream :)

So, on to flavor.  Chocolate is all I taste when I eat this, I don't taste any hazelnut butter.  I am sure there are plenty out there with whom this is fine.  My kids really liked this stuff too, of course, remember, sugar is the first ingredient.  I have to say I have always been a fan of dark chocolate over milk, my kids will tell you they prefer milk, but they didn't complain about this being dark.  If you want something to compare the flavor of this to, it is a lot like the "cocoa fudge" they use at Dairy Queen.  I have not tasted Chocmeister's milk chocolate version but I watched a Youtube blind taste test and folks could pick out the Nutella and said that Chocmeister's milk chocolate had more hazelnut flavor and less chocolate flavor in comparison.  So if you are trying to decide between the milk and dark Chocmeister keep that in mind.

While I really like the taste of this, I have to say it seemed really rich, and I can't imagine eating two whole tablespoons of this as one serving, I think that is too much.  I think a single tablespoon is way more doable AND it cuts the sugar to 7.5 grams which is within the 9 gram limit we try to keep per serving on foods we buy (not including whole fruits and such).  One tablespoon is plenty for a whole slice of toast or both halves of an English muffin or half a bagel.

No one is eating this or any other chocolate hazelnut spread for the protein, they eat it for the chocolate, the hazelnut butter is just the spreadable medium the chocolate is suspended in.  So this, like any other chocolate hazelnut spread, is a treat, a dessert.  That being said the reduced sugar (and slightly elevated protein) in this is really a nice thing and makes the guilt factor a lot less.  If you are used to Nutella and love it you may not go for the taste of Chocmeister products, but if you are and you want to move to eating a little better make the switch and you'll get used to the taste of this and be happy.  If you are like me and have never bought Nutella because of how bad for you it is but want a little treat and not to feel that badly about about being bad, then Chocmeister is the way to go.  I can see, since I con't keep sweets in the house, that when those cravings hit I will go to this jar with a spoon and will be satisfied and will not feel as bad about it as other things I could eat, like sneaking my kids' halloween candy....
Rating:
4.0
Product:
CAILLER Praliné Chocolate Selection, Large Box Assortment, 7.8 Ounce, (25 Pieces)
Review:
I read a lot of the other reviews that said their chocolates arrived melted.  I counted myself quite lucky that mine arrived without melting despite having been shipped from Las Vegas to Minnesota, perhaps my luck has to do with it being the end of October.  While mine did not arrive melted there were still half a dozen pieces that were damaged in some way, sad when this chocolate tries so hard to make a nice and high end presentation with packaging and all.

This assortment is really quite diverse and I liked that, there were some types in the box I had not ever had before.  There were two of each kind which allowed me to eat one of each and let the rest of the family share the remaining pieces so I was able to make up my mind about these chocolates having tried it all.  The quality of the chocolate was really fabulous, this may have been my first time eating chocolate actually manufactured in Switzerland, it was so creamy, smooth, flavorful, and rich.  My husband and I are much more the dark sort but my daughters are both milk types, they just about died eating their allotment from this box they were in so much chocolate heaven.  I would definitely say that if you are the type to prefer dark then maybe this assortment is not for you.  If you love nuts then this is an amazing assortment.  My favorite nuts are hazelnuts and almonds and I definitely got my fill in this box that's for sure.  Very well done chocolate, very lovely presentation, would make for a real statement gift or a special treat/reward for yourself.

This is quite pricey, it comes out to about $70 per pound basically.  Anytime I see a product that has free shipping I know I have to remember that the price is inflated to cover the cost of shipping, I cannot help but wonder how much less expensive one might find this box in a store for, and perhaps with less to worry about in terms of damage or melting from shipping.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
FISHER Chef's Naturals Walnut Halves & Pieces, No Preservatives, Non-GMO, 16 oz
Review:
These are great.  I got them because I like using them in a salad topper recipe (walnuts, chia seeds, almond slices, dried cranberries, dried apple when I have it, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, pecans when I have them).  I also like them in oatmeal and in plain yogurt both with raisins.  I also like adding them to banana bread.  But my favorite recipe for these is cherry chicken pasta.  However, when these arrived, they were opened and sampled and then my daughter sat at the computer just munching on them, so I guess these may not even make into a recipe they are that good.  I like the resealable package, that is a nice change from the nuts in the baking aisle at the grocery store.  I am kind of bothered that they are advertising non-GMO since there are no FDA approved GMO crops other than corn (non-sweet corn), soybeans, sugar beets, canola (rapeseed), and cotton.  So, all walnuts are non-GMO anyway, and since the ingredients are simply walnuts there again would be no need to push these as non-GMO.  I guess I like that Fisher's $ is going to the Non-GMO Project and that they support the labeling of GMO's.  Anyway, good tasty chopped walnuts, not sure about pricing, seems a little high, but then again shipping is included in that, so...
Rating:
5.0

Product:
 Roland Foods Balsamic Glaze, 12.9 Ounce (Pack of 2) 
Review:
This is a completely edited review.  I even changed my rating from 3 stars to 2.  There are some stellar reviews here so I'm going to say this must be a matter of taste.  I've had a lot of balsamic glazes in my long life and this one is the least appealing to me.  My first issue is the vinegar.  When I taste it alone I don't get a balsamic vinegar taste in my mouth.  I just get a harsh plain old vinegar taste that makes my mouth pucker.  I looked at the ingredients and immediately understood why. This is not pure balsamic reduced vinegar.  It's mixed with wine vinegar and that's what I'm tasting.

I tried doctoring this glaze up with honey and it's better but still not what I want.  This just isn't for me.

2.0

Planters Cashew Halves & Pieces, Salted, 1 Pound and 10 Ounce
Review:
We love cashews but they can be expensive.  These large jars of halves and pieces fit the bill for snacking.  Every jar I've ever purchased has been fresh and delicious.  I've got them on Subscribe and Save so we don't run out.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kraft  Asian Toasted Sesame Dressing & Marinade, 16-Ounce Plastic Bottles (Pack of 6)
Review:
I absolutely love this salad dressing.  One thing I really like to do is make a green salad topped with cooked chicken.  I dress the salad with the Kraft Asian Toasted Sesame Dressing and then toss the chicken with Kraft Honey Mustard Dressing which I also buy on Amazon through Subscribe and Save.  What a fantastic taste combination.

By the way, I've tried other sesame dressings and don't care for them at all.  I only like this one so if you've never tried it...give it a shot.  It's got bold taste with a sweet edge that just melts in your mouth.

Product:
Old El Paso Fat Free Refried Beans 16 oz Can (pack of 12)
Review:
These are very tasty refried beans with add flavor and fiber in lots of ways.  Beside the traditional recipes adding the beans to burritos, dips, and other Mexican style dishes, I also sometimes add a can to homemade bean and veggie soups as a thickener and taste booster.  Fat free is always a big plus.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Quaker Natural Granola Oats, Honey, Raisins and Almonds - Two 34.5oz Bags
Review:
My husband is addicted to this cereal.  It's a daily ritual...1/2 a bowl of this granola with 1/2 a bowl of mini shredded wheat, and a banana. A friend gave him a bag of it a few months ago and that was it.  Love at first bite...lol  I wish they'd bring the price down though.  I bought the first bag here but when I found out it was going to be a regular purchase checked Walmart.  It's cheaper there.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Barilla Collezione Pasta, Cheese & Spinach Tortellini, 12 Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
I purchased Barilla Three Cheese Tortellini about a month ago at the super market after being discharged from the hospital. I was told to stay on a low fiber/no meat diet for a while.  They suggested pasta and rice as a base.  When I saw this I thought...it's Barilla...how bad can it be.  It was pretty darn good with a little drizzle of quality olive oil and parm cheese sprinkled on top.  Now I can eat seafood and right away thought about this with sauteed shrimp and fresh garlic tossed in.  As usual, I checked for the product on Amazon and see they've got a 4 pack available through Subscribe and Save....my favorite way to shop.

I'm looking forward to trying the shrimp dish. While the tortellini is cooking I'll quickly saute fresh shrimp and chopped fresh garlic in a little olive oil and a small pat of butter for rich flavor. Toss that into the cooked pasta and top with a little grated cheese.....yummy!!!!!  Can't wait to add veggies to this dish.  One bag serves 4 or, if you're a robust eater, provides 2 REALLY generous servings.  By the way...leftovers keep well in the frig for days and reheat well if not over cooked so singles or someone cooking for two shouldn't shy away from cooking a whole bag at once.
Rating:
5.0

First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:

Product:
Capella Flavor Drops Cool Mint Concentrate 13ml
Review:
This is a really interesting mint flavor. Kind of like between butter mints and spearmint. Be careful if using in ice tea as 3 drops was too much for my 20 oz bottle. I'm going to try some other Capella Mint flavors too. Definitely will be around in my cupboard!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
SweetLeaf Sweet Drops Liquid Stevia Sweetener, Vanilla Creme, 2 Ounce
Review:
I got these vanilla cream drops to sweeten my homemade yogurt. They did not disappoint. I did have to use more than I thought I would, but it will help me to use less sugar in my homemade yogurt. I did impart a bit of flavor and that added nicely to the vanilla extract I had already added. It's nice in a dropper bottle so you can more accurately control how much you use.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Splenda Minis Dissolvable Tablets, 100-Count (Pack of 4)
Review:
I like Splenda Minis much better than granulated Splenda, and having them in a dispenser is nice. Hopefully one day they will come in a cardboard container that I will be able to refill my dispenser from. In the meantime I just pop the top off and dump them all into my 400 count dispenser. For some reason you can only get 100 counts in the US
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Harney and Sons Decaf Hot Cinnamon , Decaf Flavored Black 20 Sachets per Tin 1.4oz
Review:
I have had a tin of this tea for several years. I just wasn't using a lot of decaf, but I got it as a gift. When I finished the tin last week I realized it was coated with cinnamon from the lovely tea bags. I threw in a cup of sugar and shook it. A week later I had the flavor of the tea back, in my sugar!!!! Wow! Just makes the tea even more special!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
nutpods Unsweetened Dairy-free Creamer, 4-pack (Original, Discontinued Listing)
Review:
Oh how I hoped for more when I saw this creamer. Alas it doesn't stand up to percolated coffee. I shook it well and added the 2 tablespoons to my coffee. I added more, stirred, more, stirred, more, stirred. I added a third of the 11 oz container and gave up. I still had to add regular half & half to get to a reasonable level of creaminess.

I guess if you like your coffee weak and just a splash of cream it would work. However, it just doesn't stand up to espresso or percolator grinds.

Taste was good (no noticeable aftertaste) but for the calorie load I'll stick with half & half. I can deal with the 40 calories of half & half much better than the higher calorie load it takes to lighten my coffee with Nutpods. I'll just use it on the weekends and maybe in some dinner rolls or baking recipes to use it up.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Stur - Classic Variety Pack, Natural Water Enhancer (5 Bottles, Makes 100 Flavored Waters) - Sugar Free, Zero Calories, Kosher, Keto Friendly Liquid Drink Mix Sweetened with Stevia
Review:
I am very happy so far. I got these to add to a powdered collagen supplement that I use in order to make it more palatable. I have tried two of the five flavors so far and they are good. I was not sent the exact description of the items as I did not get the Blue and Blackberry one, but a Black Tea with Lemon was subbed instead, so I am deducting a star for that. Otherwise they are very good, with none of the bitter stevia aftertaste that so turns me off about stevia. Will probably but again.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Pomonas Pectin Universal 3 Pack
Review:
Works great, much better than other pectins I have used. I tried it in yogurt, but the yogurt came out grainy, and I did not go over 180 degrees, so I know it was the pectin. Instead of using it in the milk, I just made really tight low sugar fruit and froze the packets. It worked much better in my yogurt that way.
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Review:

golds.output: I've been using NOW Foods Organic Better Stevia Extract Powder for a while now and I'm really happy with it.  It's a great alternative to sugar and it doesn't have that bitter aftertaste that some stevia products have.  I use it in my coffee, smoothies, and even baking.  It's a little pricey, but I think it's worth it.  I'll definitely be buying this again.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:

Product:
Jovial Foods Organic Einkorn Flour, 32.0-Ounce
Review:
I just re-ordered this unique flour, and still trying out different recipes.  Have seen some recipes for No-Knead bread using this flour.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
NuNaturals - NuStevia - Pure White Stevia Extract – 1 Ounce
Review:
I've always purchased the Now 1lb stevia, but a food blogger highly recommended this brand, saying it does not have bitter aftertaste - as long as you don't over-add it.  This small bottle will go a long way because it is very strong. I "powdered" some over a pint of fruit salad (pineapple chunks, mandarin orange segements and freeze dried raspberries), and it perfectly corrects and balances the tartness and the sweetness, enhancing the flavor of the canned pineapples, especially,.

It is a softer stevia, and at the same time very concentrated, which is why I used the term "powdered".

My only objection is the plastic bottle, and as soon as I can I will put this in a glass bottle that fits the lid. I took away the fifth star for that. For flavoring though I give it five stars.  I will purchase this again.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Food For Life Ezekiel 4:9 Organic Sprouted Grain Pasta, Penne, 16-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
I purchased this at a local health food store because I do like the Ezekiel bread occasionally. It's OKAY if cooked to softness in something like a strong tomato sauce or a spicy hungarian goulash. When I first opened the bag it did not pass the sniff test - musty smelling. Imagine eating a wet Triscuit cracker that has no salt or sugar or seasonings - that's what it's like if you undercook it. I'd rather purchase a bag of sprouted grain flour and make my own spaghetti noodles - I'm sure it would taste better.  I would not purchase this again and even though I really like noodles I prefer the zucchini noodles. I also like the Jovial brand classic white einkorn pasta but the phytic acid is still an issue with all grains and seeds products that have not been pre-germinated. The ancients knew this. There is a longstanding myth that the human body needs protein to break down into amino acids, whereas the body is perfectly able to create its own protein from amino acids in fresh fruits and vegetables. Nuts, seeds, grains should not need to be more than 10% of diet, and meats amd dairy even less --- I did not start to experience a restored youthfulness until I made ripe fruits and leafy greens 80% of my diet...doctor's orders.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
King Soba Noodles Organic Sweet Potato and Buckwheat Noodles, 8.8 Ounce
Review:
Great packaging, great product, and I've looked for and tried other sobas... most of them contain wheat as first ingredient.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Garden of Life Raw Organic Protein Unflavored Powder Packets, 10ct Tray - Certified Vegan, Gluten Free, Organic, Non-GMO, Plant Based Sugar Free Shake with Probiotics & Enzymes, 4g BCAAs, 22g Protein
Review:
My body did not jump up and down for joy with this product, and I'm not referring to the taste, smell, or texture.  I follow Dr. Peter D'Adamo's guidelines and data re blood types, have found it to be largely true for myself.  For example, I have to sprout my grains before I eat them without consequences, esp. beans and wheat.  My personal idea of really great raw protein is Steak Tartare, and probably costs the same as this canister cost me.  However, I can see how the "A" blood groups would mostly love this product.  My envy  :-)
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Native Forest Organic Premium Coconut Cream, Unsweetened, 5.4 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I purchased this at $1.54 per can which I thought was a fair price. The same size can of organic tomato paste is a little less, but this size is needed for a single person who does not have a lot of refrigerator space to spare. It packs a lot of cream for its size.

I decided to purchase only the Native Forest brand after trying other cans. I also purchase the "Simple" (no guar gum) product. Native Forest uses BPA-free cans. I know BPA-free is not a guarantee of food safety and I've asked the Eden Foods Company to start selling coconut milk in their high integrity food-grade BPA-free cans.

I use one chilled or frozen can of this and frozen fruit in my nutribullet-900 to make creamy soft frozen desserts.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
REDMOND Real Sea Salt - Natural Unrefined Organic Gluten Free Fine, 26 ounce pouch (1 Pack)
Review:
Great on mashed potatoes.  Of course I had to "PR" to my people the little black specks in the otherwise white salt because they are used to the conventional bleached table salt.  I will be ordering this salt again and again.
Rating:
5.0

I've used it mostly for baking and it works well, but I wouldn't say it's a standout product.  It's a decent value for the price, though, and it's a good option if you're looking for a more affordable alternative to other agave nectar brands.  I'd

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Hoosier Hill Farm Cheddar Cheese Powder, 1.5 lb.
Review:
I have always been a big fan of the Kraft grated cheddar cheese. The kind that comes with their macaroni and cheese dinners, and used to be available in containers. They vanished from stores years ago, and they used to sell it in small 3 oz shakers by the case here on Amazon, but that too has since disappeared.  Unfortunately grated cheddar is very expensive as compared to the standard Romano or Parmesan.  The Kraft was worth the extra cost for it was so delicious.  But the others I have tried have either been way to expensive, or weak and flavorless.  This Hoosier cheddar blend is not as strong nor as flavorful as the Kraft by any means in my opinion.  But it is still very good, and excellently priced.  Unlike many on here, I don't use it much on popcorn.  I love it on pasta especially, and when making my home made pizzas.  It is also very tasty in soups as well.  It is indeed unfortunate that the Kraft grated cheddar is not available anymore, but this is a very worthy alternative, especially for the price.  Not quite as good as Kraft, but still decent and recommended... : )

PS:  At the time of this writing, the 1 1/2 pound size is a much better bargain over the one pound container.  It's just around $3.00 more and you get another half pound of product.  Also, I was originally sent a one pound container by mistake, but the seller allowed me to keep it and promptly sent me the correct larger size. : )
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Beef Broth Powder, 8 oz.
Review:
This is excellent bullion at a bargain price.  Since its a powder you can much more easily make an accurate measurement of how much you want to add to your stock. And as a powder, it contains slightly less sodium than the familiar cubed bullion. A little of this powder goes a long ways for it is so rich.  So this 8 oz. package ends up being a bargain for it will last most of us through several winters. I highly recommend it.  It has helped me make the best vegetable beef soup in the United States.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Viva Naturals Organic Ghee 8 oz - from 100% Grass-Fed Cows, Non-GMO, and Certified Paleo Diet Friendly
Review:
This stuff doesn't taste exactly like butter, or margarine, but it is close enough that it has a very pleasant, buttery like taste all its own...Though it states that it should be refrigerated after opening, enough reviewers here have taken note that it is not really a requirement....Thus this stuff stays rather soft and spreadable by remaining at room temperature..(But not as soft as butter or margarine that has sat at room temperature for a while). One thing about this stuff that is a nice advantage is its higher boiling point.  Spreading it out in a frying pan sees much less smoke and more substance that butter...A good asset for sure if you really like cooking with this.  Personally with its cost I did not find any real advantage to cooking with it as to taste in the finished product.. If you are really into this being a purer perhaps healthier alternative to butter, that would be a different matter.  But for myself I like it best as a spread for hot rolls, toast, cornbread, etc, all of which it tastes great on.  All in all some really good stuff...A little too costly for me to  use regularly, but a little of it goes a long ways which is a good thing...Recommended for those that are into this sort of thing and really do enjoy the rich taste...
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Chef Boyardee Overstuffed Italian Sausage Ravioli, 15 oz, 12 Pack
Review:
This is undoubtedly the best canned ravioli I have ever tasted. And I am not usually a big fan of canned ravioli except for a quick lunch sort of thing. I just recently came across this variety in the market here and gave it a try.  Not only is the ravioli truly overstuffed, but the sausage they use is very tasty without being hot and spicy.  I have actually baked these with Parmesan cheese and some added garlic and onion for 15 min and had people rave about them being home made.  If you can't find this in your market, its a good deal here on Amazon by the case, and with free shipping.  Excellent home made flavor, and highly recommended... : )
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Cheddar Cheese Powder, 1 lb. by Barry Farm
Review:
I am admittedly a big fan of Barry Farm products.  They make just about any food, veggie, dairy product, or spice in either a freeze dried or powdered form.  As an outdoor enthusiast that enjoys carrying along a little taste of home into the savage wilderness, this is a company that I am well familiar with.  Not everything they make is delicious, or worth it. My experience with them however is that most of their products are just about the finest, and many times the only ones around.  This cheddar cheese powder is definitely one of their best.  Many reviewers here mention making macaroni and cheese, and popcorn with it.  Although I have used it for those purposes like everyone else, I have also used this powder as an addition to many soups that call for cheese, or grated cheese. (It makes a very flavorful substitute for grated cheese in many recipes.) Hamburger and sausage soups are a good example.  Many times I have concocted delicious one pot meals using this powder while out in the wilds on a hike, or camping. They are remembered as some of the best meals I have ever had. It is also very good when sprinkled on home made pizza, and I have an excellent recipe that includes this powder, butter, flour, and salt, that makes a delicious cheese spread for crackers and super bowl parties. Barry Farms cheddar powder is strong and flavorful, and a little goes a long ways.  A one pound bag will get you through many a recipe and outdoor adventure.  However since the shipping on this is a little high, (and the powder so reasonable) I suggest buying two pounds or more at once and storing it in a good air tight container.  You will save a lot on the shipping, and this powder will last for months if stored correctly.  I highly recommend this cheddar powder for those that enjoy the simple pleasures of popcorn and mac and cheese, as well as the more adventurous among us in the kitchen, and over an open fire...
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tomato Flakes, 2 oz.
Review:
I have used a pretty good size line of Barry Farms dehydrated veggies for more than a decade now.  Although I occasionally have used them when cooking in my kitchen, the vast majority of time I use them for campfire cooking when I am hiking.  I love carrying dried products such as this on my hikes for they are light, easy to carry, and you can just use what you want and reseal the bag.  (Unlike canned veggies and such that don't take kindly to being bagged and toted along as leftovers).  Best of all, these tomato flakes are very flavorful.  Make that downright delicious.  I add about a third of one bag to any stew or soup I am making on an open fire, and the rich taste of fresh tomato is your reward in every spoonful. A little of these flakes goes a long ways as to flavor, so keep that in mind if your a beginner with them.  They have a much fresher taste than you would imagine, and have been a part of some of the best meals I have ever put together in the wilderness.  My only recommendation when ordering these flakes is to get at least 3 bags at once to make the shipping worth it.  You can order 3 of them for the same shipping cost as one.  Really rich tasting and well worth your money in my opinion...
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kirkland Signature California granulated garlic, 18 oz
Review:
Garlic powder is like salt and pepper in this house...Never without it and never left out of a recipe...Although I have settled for cheaper brands, quality in the past, this has now become a staple in my home...You can really smell the freshness and strength of this upon opening, and definitely in the taste of whatever I am cooking...This is also superior to the McCormick California garlic which I have had and used before...Fresher and stronger, and even lasts longer...Garlic like any other spice can go bad, lose its pungency over time.  This size jar is just right for how often I use it and its keeping well fresh till the end...And it comes at a very fair price, as well as arrives fast and intact...Really good stuff and recommended...Now, its time to make my home made spaghetti sauce...With garlic...: )
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Grady's Cold Brew Coffee is a solid choice for those who want a smooth, less acidic coffee experience.  The coffee itself is flavorful and has a nice, rich taste.  The storage can is a nice touch, and the included bean bags make it easy to brew a fresh batch.  I've found it to be a good alternative to traditional drip coffee, especially in the mornings. Product:
Community Coffee Ground Coffee, Signature Dark Roast, (Pack of 3)
Review:
Community coffee dark roast was a disappointment. Flat and with very little flavor. I am a big coffee drinker, and usually enjoy a strong dark roast doctored with brown sugar and cream. Big rich flavor is what i am looking for. I was concerned when I first opened the bag and realized I couldn't smell it. Brewed a cup anyway, and it still didn't have that rich coffee smell.

 It didn't taste bad, and people who like a milder cup would probably enjoy it. Definitely not for you if you enjoy the darker roasts.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Cap Mundo Single-Cup Coffee for Nespresso Brewers, Yrgacheffe, 10 Count (Pack of 6)
Review:
These are, and seem cheaper than the real thing.

These don't fit perfectly in my machine.

The taste is watery, dull, lifeless.

Spend the extra few dollars for the genuine article.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Java Factory Single Cup Coffee for Keurig K Cup Brewers, Dark and Handsome Dark Roast, 24 Count
Review:
STRONG aroma of chocolate and coconut.  Coffee is definitely the background note with these.  I'm not a fan, but my teens love them.  The cups fit in the standard Keurig type coffee maker.  We  hadn't tried this brand before, so wasn't sure what to expect.  Will have to keep searching for a regular cup and not the flavored variety.  It does smell amazing after brewing a cup.  If you like the sweet flavored coffee store drive through drinks, you will likely love these.  Add milk and your favorite sweetener and you could make this hot or iced.  A definite bargain over that drive through joint!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Balance Bar, Chocolate Caramel Peanut Nougat, 1.41 ounce bars 6 count, Chocolate Caramel Peanut Nougat Nutrition Bar
Review:
Balance bars are handy to have on hand when you don't have time for breakfast, or need a substantial snack.  At 190 calories, 6g fiber, and 7g protein they are considerably more nutritious than a candy bar.  Yes, they have quite a bit of sugar.  If you don't look at these as an all the time meal replacement, they are a perfectly fine snack.  The name is 'Balance" after all.

The bars come in two pieces.  Chocolate coated with a chewy center that isn't too hard.  Not gritty or waxy tasting, as some of these bars can be.  They will likely melt easily, so not something you want to leave in a hot car or carry in your pocket.  Sturdy enough to toss in a backpack though.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Barley Malt Powder, 1 lb.
Review:
Barley malt powder goes great in our homemade "Ovaltine" powder.  Its a pricey ingredient compared to the others, but if you like an old fashioned malt, this is what you want.  This is a smooth and very fine powder.  One pound is equal to about a quart.  After I opened the bag, I poured the rest into a quart jar for storage.  This bag doesn't re seal, so you will need to store it elsewhere.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
GoGo squeeZ Organic Applesauce on the Go, Apple Banana, 3.2 Ounce (48 Pouches), Gluten Free, Vegan Friendly, Healthy Snacks, Unsweetened Applesauce, Reusable, BPA Free Pouches
Review:
My kids love these.  They are great for an on the go snack.  Easy to toss in a bag or backpack.  My gripe is that they are pricey.  We likely won't order online again unless there is a super sale.  But...my kids are all older and perfectly able to munch on an apple or banana and then dispose of the core/peel.  If I had littles I would likely keep these in stock and just suck it up.
This package arrived as twelve boxes of four pouches each.  A lot of packaging waste, but that does make it easy to keep the pouches contained and protected.
Fun snack but expensive
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Arrowroot Starch/Flour, 16-ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
Bought this to use in various body care recipes and cooking.  Makes a great sensitive skin deodorant when mixed with coconut oil or glycerin.  Thickens pies and sauces quickly and easily.
Rating:
5.0

I now only use this and one other salt because I can actually see the minerals in the salts. This salt tastes so much better and I can use less of it than the processed stuff. The minute I get a scratchy throat or any other symptom I brew up a cup of this tea and I start feeling better that day. It may take a few hours but before I know it, I soon realize that I am back to my old self again! Product:
Manitoba Harvest Hemp Hearts Raw Shelled Hemp Seeds, 2oz (Pack of 12); with 10g Protein & Omegas per Serving, Non-GMO, Gluten Free
Review:
I have read a lot about the health benefits of Hemp Hearts so I was very happy to find these at a lower cost than the ones in my local grocery store. I cannot attest to all of the health benefits that I have read about, but I can say that putting them in my morning smoothie has kept me full longer and given me more energy. They have helped me to keep my weight down when I do a little cheating on my diet. Before using them I would gain back weight and sometimes add on more than I started with. I just went on a camping trip and took my smoothies along. After eating all sorts of things I shouldn't have, I came home to find I had lost 3 lbs!! It has also helped me lower my blood pressure, it was getting to a point where I would have to go on medication, but not anymore! I like to grind them into a mix with flax and chia seed to add to my flour mix to make some delicious, healthy cookies.

Product:

Review:

Rating:
5.0
Product:
Fever-Tree Premium Indian Tonic Water, 6.8 Ounce Glass Bottles (Pack of 24)
Review:
Love Fever Tree. Locally, we can only get the Indian and Elderflower tonics, so when I read about the Mediterranean version, I searched online for it. I knew I would have to pay a premium because of shipping, but was willing to give it a go just for taste test purposes. We use tonic for gin and tonics, no other drinks really, other than little experiments here and there. Needless to say, this is a very good tonic, but not much different from the Indian. So long story short, if it were available locally I would totally purchase it in addition to the other Fever Tree tonics, but since it isn't and it wasn't any better, I won't. Still, if you are into cocktails and want to give it a go, you won't be disappointed, but it isn't critical.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Shredded Coconut (Unsweetened), 24-ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
Clean, simple coconut. I use it for baking and for making coconut butter. It has a subtle flavor, but this is a great price.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Pop-Tarts Frosted Brown Sugar Cinnamon Toaster Pastries, 12-Count (Pack of 3)
Review:
Our once a year treat for beach vacations, a classic junky breakfast.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
French Market Coffee & Chicory Decaffeinated, 12 Ounce Cans (Pack of 3)
Review:
My husband is from Louisiana, and we visit often. I have long had a love of Louisiana cuisine and culture, and every time we go down I dive into in whole heartedly. I love chicory coffee---it has a stronger flavor but not bitter, and a bit less caffeine which is sometimes nice when I want a hot cuppa joe but not the buzz.

Where we live in the Northeast, we can get a more commercially well-known brand of chicory coffee, and while this brand is fine and well-marketed, it is not the only one made, by far. There are a lot of choices in Louisiana, and I have tried a bunch. But French Market is by far my fave, and the white can of Restaurant blend is overall the best.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Harissa Condiment In Tube - Spicy 120 Gr
Review:
Used this harissa paste for a traditional Moroccan carrot dip, and it gave it just the right amount of peppery flavor. I love the harissa paste vesus the powder for this use, it seems to have more depth of flavor. For meat rubs, try the dry harissa spice.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Watkins All Natural Extract, Root Beer, 2 Ounce (Pack of 6) (Packaging May Vary)
Review:
Good almond flavor for baking and for smoothies. Great price. I wish there wasn't a word quota for reviews because there is not really much more to write. Ok, made it!
Rating:
5.0

Not a bad product and I'm sure this will work great in my curry dishes but I wish this had more coconut flavor.

Review:
The flavor of this coconut is excellent and perfect for baking with. Because this was a Warehouse Deal, these were nearing their expiration date, so, I vacuum sealed and froze what I didn't need to use immediately.

As usual, Bob's Red Mill products are top notch.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Galil Whole Hearts of Palm, All Natural/Non-GMO 14-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:
These are delicious right out of the can...firm outer leaves with a creamy center stalk (how I prefer them anyhow).

I appreciate that these have pull-top lids for when I'm in a hurry and need a quick hearts-of-palm munchie fix!

Interesting use: If you drain and blend a can of these into a paste, you can add hearts of palm to cheese fillings for lasagna or ravioli to cut down on fat/calories.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Lotus Foods Gourmet Organic Madagascar Pink Rice, 11-Pound Bag
Review:
This rice is gorgeous and it turns a beautiful, deep blackberry purple after being cooked. My only gripe is that the water per cup of rice is off (for cooking from scratch in a stainless steel pan). The water should be more like 1 1/2 cups of water per cup of rice [NOT 1 3/4 cup water] and I recommend bringing the water to a boil first and THEN adding the rice. I also add a dash of peanut oil along with my kosher sea salt.

I'm psyched to try this rice as a 'decorative' aspect to my sushi rolls.

The taste is nutty and this black rice has a nice chewy mouth feel.

Overall? An excellent product! A+++
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Pacific Foods Organic Turkey Bone Broth, 32oz, 12-pack
Review:
Not sure about the funky flavor. This had an odd 'gamey' taste that just didn't sit right with me so I added some chicken broth concentrate to dilute the flavor away from being the top-note.

Three stars for quality ingredients.

Just my personal taste but I won't purchase again.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Colavita Mediterranean Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 68 Fluid Ounce
Review:
I was so pleasantly surprised by the flavor of this olive oil. Very good quality and a beautiful color, flavor and aroma.

My only gripe is I wish this was bottled in glass but I poured this into my own glass jars once I opened it up.

This made some excellent honey mustard dressing and homemade mayonnaise. This brand of olive oil is definitely a keeper.
Rating:
