prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Viva Naturals - The BEST Organic Ground Flax Seed, 15 oz - Proprietary Cold-milled Technology
Review:
I bake a lot of breads, and always try to sneak some extra health in each loaf.
I know that health benefit of flax seeds, but worry about small seeds when baking for those that might be prone to diverticulitus.

I love this product, all the goodness with none of the risk. I've put it in baked goods and even stirred it in yogurt and honey. Next will be in smoothies that are made in a VitaMix.
Nice, fresh smell.
I received a sample size to try, views and opinions are my own.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
2LB Premium Raw Organic Cacao Nibs, Rich Dark Chocolate Taste - Healthy Chocolate Chip Substitute, 60-Day
Review:
DISCLOSURE: I received a small 2oz sample of these cacao nibs to test, with the option to review. Views and opinions are my own.

And you only need 2 ounces to see how easy it is to add this superfood in, well, almost everything!
As is, they are crunchy with a mild, pure, unsweetened dark chocolate taste. A bit bitter and astringent, wonderful in a trail mix.
Use as a nut substitute, in baking, in smoothies and shakes. I like to sprinkle over potatoes that are oven roasted with poblano peppers, garlic, and flaked sea salt.

Cacao nibs are an antioxidant powerhouse, with studies showing that regular consumption can lower blood pressure and possibly reduce the risk of heart issues.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nutiva Organic, Cold-Pressed, Unrefined, Virgin Coconut Oil from Fresh, non-GMO, Sustainably Farmed Coconuts, 15-ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
This coconut oil has a very strong coconut taste, making it an excellent option for cakes, cookies, curries, and the like. On the down side, it seems to melt at a lower temp than some other brands, and a combination of that and seals that do not hold tight make for an occasional messy package in summer months. Still, it has a nice fresh taste and it's a reasonable price.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
ORCHARD VALLEY HARVEST Cranberry Almond Cashew Trail Mix, Non-GMO, No Artificial Ingredients, 1 oz (Pack of 8)
Review:
In listing my top ten of favorite snacks, these little packets of Trail Mix are definitely on the higher end.
Not only is it the perfect portion control size, but the flavor and freshness is near unbeatable.
Very lightly salted, the nuts are crunchy and crisp.
Raisins are coated in a glossy dark chocolate. The sweetness of the raisins tempers the bittersweet of the chocolate. Decadently chewy.
I was thinking that some of these would be sent to a dear friend in college as part of her care package.
Nope.
Not one pack made it into the box.
Guess I'll have to send some directly from Amazon to her.
They are that good!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Organic Coconut Oil, Extra Virgin, Cold Pressed, Unrefined, Non-GMO - 16 ounce (1 lb.) Use for Cooking, Hair and Skin - Hexane-Free Extraction and Fair-Trade Certified
Review:
On opening this jar of coconut oil, you'll notice that it's a bit more mild than some other brands, but still has a fresh coconut scent.
That makes it great in a wide range of dishes.
I saute using it, and it adds a slightly more interesting flavor...but here's my favorite way to use it:
Chop any fresh vegetables you have on hand.
One good combination is diced potatoes, cauliflower florets, red and green peppers, garlic and/or onion, and a can of peas.
Saute the fresh veg in a generous tablespoon of coconut oil. Sprinkle on as much curry powder as you like, along with sea salt. Before serving add a dollop of plain yogurt.

Also, it's a healthy treat for your dog. Put a half teaspoon on your hand or spread on a plate and let your pup lick away.

And of course, it makes a wonderful after bath skin treatment.

Delicious as well as a huge multi-tasker, and organic to boot.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Spectrum Culinary Organic Unrefined Virgin Coconut Oil, 54 fl. oz. (Pack of 2)
Review:
Before it was so easy to buy certain organic products in the grocery store, the Spectrum company had all kinds of wonderful fresh oils that I would buy at the health food store. Since that time, certain oils are available in my local grocery. I guess what I'm trying to say, is that they have been around a long time, and always with a focus on high quality and good health.
Coconut oil has all but replaced my cooking oils, and most of the butter I use. To say nothing of being used on my hair and skin.

In the years I've been using it, it's become clear that not all coconut oil is the same.
Unlike a few others, this one has no 'off' scent, it smells fresh and the coconut scent is mild enough to used in a wider variety of cooking applications, as opposed to the highly scented ones that are best in dishes where you want a prominent coconut flavor.
Non GMO, which I really like.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Viva Naturals Organic Quinoa, 4 LB - 100% Royal Bolivian Whole Grain
Review:
At first quinoa was treated like a flash-in-the-pan 'trendy' fad, but thankfully, it looks like it is here to stay.
And with good reason.
If you're reading this, you're already familiar with the health benefits of this ancient grain. What you might not be as familiar with, is it's versatility.

Yes, it makes a wonderful pilaf, with or without the addition of rice. Have you tried it in a cold salad? I recently bought one of those super expensive lunch salads from Starbucks,  it was a southwestern one with black beans, roasted corn, tomatoes, and quinoa. Fabulous!

Quinoa is also terrific in soups. I love it in any tomato based soup, and it lends itself well to almost any broth based soup or stew.
This particular brand not only cooks up well, it is a much better value than the boxes at the local grocery store.

I received a sample to cook up and review, I really like it.
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Product:
Namaste Foods, Gluten Free Brownie Mix, 30-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
These are very dark chocolate and not very sweet. There is also a bit of a grainy taste. If you like really dark chocolate, these may be worth a try. Maybe if you've been on a gluten-free diet a long time you may be used to foods that don't taste like their grocery store counter parts, but I am new to a gluten-free diet and I thought these were barely edible. The rest of my family thought they were really disgusting and tossed them out.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Almond Chocolate Organic Nutrition Bar, 1.8 oz (12 Pack) Vegan, Gluten-Free, Non-GMO, Nii Bar
Review:
This tasted neither like coconut nor cacao to us. We really loved the Cherry Coconut flavor, but this one just wasn't nearly as good. I had a bunch of friends try both flavors and everyone agreed that the Cherry Coconut bar was amazing but this one was a disappointment. I think its partly the name because we are expecting a bar with a coconut/cocoa taste, but the nut butter flavor (which isn't bad) stands out much stronger. I think if they re-named this as a nut-butter bar, it would help a lot with expectations.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Almond Chocolate Organic Nutrition Bar, 1.8 oz (12 Pack) Vegan, Gluten-Free, Non-GMO, Nii Bar
Review:
We love that these are less sweet tasting than most nutrition bars. It has a great nut-butter taste, with a delicious hint of cherry. We had mixed reactions on the coconut--some of us could barely taste it and others thought it was really strong, but all of us liked it. If you aren't a coconut fan, you might skip these, but otherwise, I would highly recommend them instead of any of the sweeter bars on the market. The price is a little high so I'm hoping that will come down as these become more popular.

I received this at a discount in exchange for an honest review.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Svelte Organic Protein Shake, French Vanilla, 11 Ounce (Pack of 8)
Review:
This is the only organic soy drink I can find on the market so I was very happy that it also tastes good. I do wish it did not contain a sugar alcohol, but its still the best protein drink I've found. Most protein drinks use very low grade proteins which aren't very healthful so its great to find one which is organic and dairy-free.

You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

Product:
Good Earth White Tea with Vanilla, 18-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
Yuck - this tea is really not to my liking.  This tea has a very unpleasant taste, something I cannot quite describe.  I have to force myself to drink it until I use up my supply.  It sort of makes me shudder as I swallow it.  I have tried brewing it for shorter times and I still don't like it.  I have also tried the Decaf White Tea, with the same opinion.

It was surprising to me that I dislike this white tea.  I love other Good Earth tea products, with the decaf green tea and organic decaf green tea with mango being my favorites that I drink daily.

I know the other reviewers have rated this white tea highly, but I would suggest trying a box from your local grocery before ordering in bulk.
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Traditional Medicinals Organic Throat Coat Seasonal Tea, 16 Tea Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
This tea sampler is a must for cold and flu season.  I like to have this variety of teas on hand, and pick one most appropriate for how I am feeling "under the weather".  The box contains 4 sachets of 4 kinds: Throat Coat, Echinacea Plus, Breathe Easy and Gypsy Cold Care.  My favorite is the Breathe Easy which really helps to clear up clogged sinuses.  Be aware that the echinacea- or other flower-based kinds might affect people who have allergies to certain flowers, this may also depend on how long they are brewed.  Note that it is recommended to brew these teas for 10 to 15 min.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Good Earth Herbal Tea, Sweet & Spicy, Caffeine Free, 18 Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6) (Packaging May Vary)
Review:
I have been drinking Good Earth Decaf Green Tea for many years and it is my favorite tea. This tea is not purely green tea leaves - it also contains lemongrass and other flavors. It is flavorful but mild. Ingredients: Decaffeinated Green Tea, Lemongrass, Natural Flavors (Contains Soy Lecithin), Rose Petals and Peppermint.

Be aware that the Good Earth Decaf Green Tea does not have the more delicate flavor as real Japanese green tea (and not a roasted flavor like Genmai), but it is great as an everyday tea. If you are expecting green tea like in Japanese restaurants, this is not it - if you want that, get high quality loose tea leaves and brew it with the correct temperature water in a teapot. (Although maybe the Good Earth green tea would taste more similar to Japanese green tea if brewed like Japanese green tea should be - read on...)

I often leave my tea bag steeping for a long time (I know, not recommended for green tea, but it likely does extract more of the beneficial antioxidants), up to 30 min, and this tea does not get bitter. It also does not get bitter if the tea sits around before drinking. One Good Earth tea bag works fine for my large 16 oz mug. I have found that other brands of tea can be weak and not flavorful if using only one bag for 16 oz water.

I also like that this tea is decaf since even the smaller amount of caffeine in green tea affects me. Decaf green teas are somewhat hard to find. This company uses a CO2 process for decaffeination, preferable to a solvent extraction process.

Note that this product is available in 18-count and 25-count boxes.

I have tried many other brands of green tea (decaf and regular) over the years and keep coming back to Good Earth brand. Highly recommended.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Kashi, Breakfast Cereal, Organic Autumn Wheat, Non-GMO Project Verified, 16.3 oz(Pack of 4)
Review:
This is one of my favorite cereals that I always try to have on hand.  It is very lightly sweetened throughout (not frosted), has a great taste and good fiber content of 6g per serving.  I tend to avoid any sweetened cereals but I like the light amount of sweetness in this cereal.  I prefer this version over the Kashi Cinnamon Harvest, which was still excellent but a little too "cinnamony" for me.

This Kashi cereal is organic and is a great option compared to the standard brands for shredded wheat and frosted mini wheat cereals.  It tastes better than plain shredded wheat.  It is a healthier option with 7 g sugars compared to 12 g sugars in frosted mini wheats and those contain ingredients I am trying to avoid like high fructose corn syrup and gelatin.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peacock Brown Rice Vermicelli, 7-Ounce Packages (Pack of 12)
Review:
I am always looking for healthier, whole grain versions of foods I enjoy.  Unfortunately, these Peacock brand noodles are yet another food masquerading as healthy.  The product title in big letters on the front says "Brown Rice Vermicelli", making the consumer think "this is made with brown rice, so it should be a healthy choice".  But the first indication that it is not is when looking at the fiber content on the nutrition facts - only 0.6g per 2oz serving.  Then onto the ingredients list to see why so low... contains brown rice, sago starch and water.  The sago starch comes from palms and must not have much (if any) fiber.

The Annie Chun's Maifun Brown Rice Noodles (sold on Amazon and in my local healthy grocer) has become one of my staples and is my frame of reference when comparing to the Peacock brand.  The Annie Chun's product is made with 100% whole grain, with ingredients brown rice flour and water.  Per 2oz serving, it has 4g fiber and pretty much the same calories and other nutrients as the Peacock brand.

If you do try this Peacock brand noodles and have not used rice noodles before, you will need to seek guidance elsewhere on preparation.  As others have pointed out, the Peacock package gives almost no directions on how to prepare the product, aside from a brief mention in the recipes (in the header text it does say that they are "easy-to-cook" but does not say how).  It also contains a very strange recipe for rice noodles: Aglio Olio style - this is an Italian recipe for noodles with olive oil/garlic/sprinkled with grated cheese that I think would not be very tasty.  The second recipe appears to be for a soup with veggie strips.  Neither recipe gives amounts or much direction.  In comparison, the Annie Chun's package gives clear, specific directions on rice noodle preparation and two recipes.

I use rice noodles = maifun = rice sticks = sometimes called vermicelli for making the Vietnamese salad "bun tofu", to serve with stir-fried veggies or in lettuce rolls.  They can also be used in spring rolls/egg rolls.  When cooking with thin rice noodles, be careful not to oversoak/overcook/overmix or they tend to disintegrate.  Asian rice noodle vermicelli (maifun) are not the same as Italian vermicelli and are not readily interchangeable.  If making an Italian recipe, the best results would be expected from Italian pasta and not maifun.

A few final notes...  Both Peacock and Annie Chun's brown rice noodles are gluten free.  The Peacock is made in Singapore and the Annie Chun's in Thailand.  The Peacock noodles do taste fine (kind of bland), but so do the Annie Chun's.  At this time, they are both approximately the same price.  Peacock come in an plastic bag with some noodle crushage upon shipping; Annie Chun's are perfect upon removal from their cellophane bag in a box.  Overall, I highly recommend the Annie Chun's Maifun as a healthier option over the Peacock brand.  On a related note, the Annie Chun's soba and brown rice pad thai noodles are also excellent.

Rating for this product: 2.5 stars rounded down to 2 stars.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Gaia Herbs Sleep and Relax Herbal Tea Bags, 16 Count
Review:
I am a regular tea/herbal tea drinker and have tried lots of brands and types of tea, including may of the Sleepytime-type before bed teas.  Those tend to be comforting and relaxing but have not made me sleepy.  I was surprised that this Gaia Sleep & Relax tea actually worked to make me sleepy and relaxed within about 15 to 30min.  Thus, I would not drink other than right before bed because it did make me sleepy.  It has a good flavor; I tend to let the teabag steep for a long time and this did not result in bitter or unpleasant flavor.  I assume that letting it steep may result in more of the sleep-inducing herbs to come into the hot water.  The box says to let steep 10min and to drink 1 hour before bed.  This is the second Gaia product I have tried and I have been impressed with the quality.  Although not prominent on the front of the package, this product is certified organic.  Good value for the 20 tea bags.  Definitely recommend.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Annie Chun's Soba Noodles, 12-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
I agree with the 5-star reviews for this product.  These noodles are excellent tasting, have a good texture and cook up very quickly (4 to 5 min in boiling water).  I have not really bought many soba noodles in the past, so I'm not sure how these US-made noodles compare to authentic Asian soba.

It is easy to saute some veggies and make a quick sauce (or use a purchased sauce), for a weeknight meal.  I often cook the whole box then divide in half, making 1/2 as a hot stir-fry dinner and then save the other 1/2 (plain noodles) to use the next day.  I put the left-over noodles in the microwave for a brief time (just to bring them to room temp) then assemble the salad.  Amazingly, the noodles taste fresh and good the next day, possibly better tasting than freshly cooked.  I'm sure they would make a great noodle soup, although I have not tried yet.

Ingredients are unbleached enriched wheat flour, buckwheat flour, water, egg whites, salt.  They seem pretty healthy and have a decent amount of fiber, although they are probably not as healthy as a 100% whole wheat pasta, for example.  For the 12 oz box, 6 servings/box, amounts per serving: 200 cal (10 from fat), 3g fiber, 390mg sodium, 8g protein, 10% iron.  Also, great price from Amazon.
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Product:

Review:
Ghee is a product I've walked past in the grocery store hundreds of times. I've heard of it but have never given it any thought until now. What I didn't understand is that though it's butter, it is clarified butter and therefore has a higher smoke point than just regular butter. This has the same great taste as butter, even richer I think, but is good for high temperature cooking. I used it tonight on my  oven-baked fresh cut fries and it worked wonderfully and made the best tasting fries I've ever had. I think this will be a product in my kitchen from now on. I'll use it for a popcorn topping, sauting vegetables, basting and cooking meats...the list is endless. Add this to my cupboard of good fats. I'm now a fan.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Frontier Organic Seasoning, Harissa, 1.9 Ounce
Review:
I try to keep food prep from taking over all the available time - I cook in batches of basic, low-fat meat and non-gluten sides like rice, then want to vary them each day until they're gone. So I'm lovin' these pre-mixed offerings of spices from various places in the world. As I am fond of Mediterranean cuisine, this mixture from Tunisia with its peppery bite hits my palate just right. I only had to correct the salt. You can just sprinkle it or make a paste with water or olive oil for a rub.

It tastes very fresh and of course had a good seal when it arrived. It has already been assigned a place in the refrigerator in order to keep it fresh as long as possible. Well, not sure its life expectancy is ALL that long cuz it tastes really good!

The label says it contains organic paprika, organic caraway, organic crushed red chili pepper, organic cayenne, organic coriander, organic cumin, organic garlic, organic peppermint and sea salt. I don't think sea salt can be organic. I'd rather they didn't put that in as our oceans are so polluted and sometimes I've seemed to react badly to it, like an allergy.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Progresso Soup, Traditional, Homestyle Chicken Soup, 19 oz Cans (Pack of 6)
Review:
This review is for the Chicken and Wild Rice that the can describes as "savory". Which it is. There never is a lot of chicken in any canned soup and I suppose the consumer doesn't expect it. But there IS some and obviously rice including wild rice and vegetables. There are three things I particularly like which are that it is gluten free, the vegetables do not overwhelm the rest of the ingredients and the stock is in fact particularly savory.

I've never quite gotten over an ad campaign Progresso mounted in which they mocked and targeted their competitor, Campbell soups. It seemed to be the work of the worst kind of bully. I spoke to both companies about it. It put me off Progresso products for some time but I happened to come into the possession of this soup and did find it very good.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Senseo Dark Roast Coffee Pods, 4.41 Ounce, 18-Count Pods (Pack of 4)
Review:
Here's the thing: the one-cup Senseo coffeemakers for which this pod is designed have proved unreliable. I wouldn't buy any more of them. But these pods are fabulous.

I got these nearly two years ago for my Senseo pod coffeemaker that lasted for all of 30 uses. Junk, crap. But these pods have proved the opposite. They have outstanding flavor, even when they ought to be stale. Usually I have brewed coffee but when I run out and it doesn't make sense to make another pot, I put fresh water in a cup, add one of these and heat it in the microwave. Presto! A cup of java to which I add my 1% milk and enjoy. I am simply amazed that I can get such a good cuppa from a non-refrigerated, long-opened package, coffee pod!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Senseo Dark Roast Coffee Pods, 4.41 Ounce, 18-Count Pods (Pack of 4)
Review:
I have been most impressed with both my super-fast Senseo single-serve and its coffee pods. But no, the coffee does not taste as good as that I freshly grind. I realize that is an option if I want to produce my own pods but that would defeat the undeniable convenience of the single-serve machine. The coffee produced by this pod arrangement is happily strong - with this Dark Roast; I haven't yet tried any others - and the crema is wonderful, over and over. I do pre-wet the pods before brewing. I guess I could also wet down the machine parts. And I do heat non-fat or 1% milk in the microwave, then brew directly into that cup. This procedure mixes moo and joe quite adequately.

There is some aspect to the taste of the brew that does not please me - not sure I can put it into words well. I think it is partly due to the inevitable not-entirely-freshness of the pods. In addition there is some kind of harshness that seems intended to masquerade as richness. Duh? Maybe someone more knowledgeable about coffee prep can identify it better. I do not see anywhere on the package that these coffee pods are 100% Arabica. Could that be it? But for the convenience and cost, I cannot complain TOO much. I am really happy with the purchases.

Want to say a word of thanks to other reviewers who have made helpful suggestions and observations. Here's one I've found through experimentation: There is still strength left in the pod after one brewing. I've started re-using them. The method depends upon my coffee needs at the moment. Sometimes I install the 2-cup holder in the machine and re-use one with a new one. Then I end up with two used ones, and darned if they don't have another use in them. Maybe you won't like this but it is an option to try if you wish. (By comparison, I've found there is absolutely no value in the used grounds after I've brewed a pot of drip.) By the way, the used pods still produce a fine crema; whether this is due to the pods or the well-designed machine I do not know.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Fire Cider, Apple Cider Vinegar Tonic with Honey, Original Flavor, Natural Detox, Pure & Raw, Certified Organic Ingredients, Ideal for Cleansing Diet, No Heat Processed, 16 Shots, 8 oz.
Review:
In order to obtain a trademark for Fire Cider, these people had to pretend that it was not already in common usage. All you have to do to discover that it has been used and shared for years, particularly by herbalist leader Rosemary Gladstar - and specifically called Fire Cider - is to Google it. Please do. Even if by some weird coincidence, they HAD happened to come up with both a strikingly similar formula and exact name, they could only obtain a trademark (which they have!) via false search results. Even if it weren't illegal, this is such a betrayal of trust, such a dishonorable act, that these Shire City "business" people deserve zero respect. The obvious lack of morals in claiming to have originated this, calls into question their credibility in every other aspect. Do they think they can corner the market by legally preventing anyone else from making for sale, a recipe that was developed by someone else before they were born? They seem to claim they won't do that, but as I said, they have already destroyed their credibility.

Here's their less-than-honorable attempted enforcement of this shabbily-obtained trademark. After claiming on an Internet site that their trademark was needed to protect the product from the large food corporations, they stated that they had no intention of keeping others from using fire cider as they had been prior to the trademark. On their Wordpress blog, they state, "We are not interested in suing anyone, especially herbalists working outside of the commercial marketplace." Right. Forcing others to discontinue selling long-held products via a well-known auction site is not the same as bringing a lawsuit. Go find them. Their blog is entitled "firecider" and as I said, it is at Wordpress. (Also search Fire Cider for their Facebook page.) You'll find their blog explanation cleverly worded but if you know the turf, very slippery. What happened, according to herbalist friends, is that they then proceeded to cause Etsy, the artsy Internet auction site, to stop other retailers from offering fire cider there. Do you need any more proof?

Before I knew of the problem these people have created, I bought some of the product locally and it was so-so - a friend a few blocks away makes some that is far better. Thing is, if people will claim ownership of a commonly-held recipe and name for profit, in what way will they alter their products for more profit?
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Fini Balsamic Glaze, 8.45 Ounce Bottles
Review:
Luckily found this at the supermarket but not a great deal cheaper. I enjoy balsamic vinegar and also the art of cooking, so a product that is condensed balsamic vinegar was something I just had to try. Naturally, I had to research it first. Turns out a lot of brands add a lot of extra ingredients; that I didn't want. This has just "Balsamic vinegar of Modena ('aceto balsamico di Modena I.G.P.') 90%, (concentrated cooked grape must, wine vinegar, caramel color), glucose syrup, modified corn starch. Yes, it is sweeter than just plain balsamic. It makes such an elegant dollop, say on roasted pork with which it pairs well.

In addition to having a wonderful taste, I like the way the container is designed. It will stand up on either end, taking up less room in the fridge and promising utility when I have to get that last remaining amount to the business end. Speaking of the business end, I am delighted to find an unusually well-designed dispenser which allows me to put a dollop or smear exactly where I want it and when done, there is no mess. I mean the outside of the dispenser is totally clean after dispensing.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
True Orange Shaker, Ginger, 2.82 Ounce
Review:
Another great flavor burst from True Citrus Co, made in the USA and containing only crystallized orange [citric acid, orange oil, orange juice], ginger, maltodextrin, natural flavor. Contains soy. No preservatives. Gluten free. I keep it in the refrigerator and use it to instantly transport my simple meals to International Flavor City.

The orange flavor is very definite. The ginger is less so but its tart tang adds to the orange. I am accustomed to buying gingerroot and paring and mincing just before consumption; it is unlikely a dried version can replicatehat flavor. At any rate, I am more than happy with these products, their convenience and purity.
Rating:
5.0

And I can report that indeed I do not like it...I LOVE it!  It has a light cinnamon flavor and an almost buttery finish. Review:

It's not cream, don't expect the same texture especially as this product doesn't contain the typical thickeners usually found in products like this.  But the taste is excellent (nutty and slightly sweet with a creamy vanilla finish), and I experienced no issues at all with curdling when I added to the tea.  The amounts are pretty true to cream for me;  if I add cream to my team, it's usually about a teaspoon, and the same amount of nutpods worked well for me.

If you would like to avoid dairy and like the taste of nut milk, I think you'll be pleased with this product.  I would (and will) be buying this again.

Product:

Review:
We love Tropic Bee Orange Blossom honey.
My husband likes to use it in the crock pot on pork roasts, and uses half of the bigger jars.
I thought this size would be just right for his cooking ventures.
It also seems a little easier to handle, since honey can be a little heavy.

VERY happy with my purchase. The company packs their honey VERY well, and everything
arrived in great condition with no leaks or messes.
We'll be long-time customers of this brand.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Crystal Light Pure Drink Mix, Strawberry Kiwi, On The Go Packets, 7 Count (Pack of 6 Boxes)
Review:
I was very pleasantly surprised to see a Crystal Light product that wasn't loaded with aspartame!

I hope they get on the stevia bandwagon (or even go back to saccharine since it has long since been proven
to be perfectly safe) and start making more flavors.

I love the drink mix packets anyway, and I'm always happy when there's a really tasty flavor.
This one had my attention as soon as I opened it - it smells like cotton candy when in the powder form!
(It made me wish I had some!)  I had to cut the packet open - the little corners don't always tear
too well.

It dissolved fairly easily, and makes your water a shade of pink.
It tastes really good, even though I had room temp water, not cold water.
It is a little bit strong in the 16.9 oz bottle (since I took a drink out of it before
adding the powder), but nothing outrageous or overwhelming.

All in all, I'd buy it again.

Crystal Light - I hope you'll start making more flavors in the Pure Fitness line.
I'd buy your products all the time if you didn't have them stuffed with aspartame.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Lipton Iced Tea Mix, Raspberry 10 qt, (Pack of 6)
Review:
Well, to say this was disappointing is putting it mildly.

I love raspberry iced tea, and always try to get it at places like Denny's, Taco Bell, whereever it
might be offered. While I knew this had sugar in it (most premixes do), I still wanted to try it, as I am trying
to break a Pepsi habit I acquired in the last few years.

I originally wanted to buy raspberry kool aid and just add it to a pitcher of regular iced tea.
However, good luck finding the raspberry kool aid! What did they do with it?!

Anyway - this makes a RED drink, and it tastes like raspberry kool aid that they waved a tea sprig
over. It isn't horrible tasting, but do not buy this thinking that you will be making a glass of tea
with raspberry flavoring. You'll be making raspberry kool aid with a tiny bit of tea flavoring.

I won't be buying it again, that is a big fer-shure.

Lipton - you can do SO much better - why don't you try it?
You already know how to do tea - now you need to work on flavorings and sweeteners.
Here's a news flash - most of us do NOT want aspartame in our drinks any more.
PLEASE change over to stevia, which does not cause the side effects or raise blood glucose levels.
Listen to the customers...

Meanwhile, pass on this one!  : P
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Laffy Taffy Rope, Strawberry, 0.81 Ounce (Pack of 24)
Review:
These are so good!
The product we received as very fresh and tasty.  Every rope was a big mangled, like they'd been shoved in the package by ogres, but they were not popped open and were safe to eat.

Laffy Taffy, for those who have not had it before, is a very soft, chewable taffy, not at all sticky.
We love all the Laffy Taffy flavors except grape, but strawberry is a big favorite.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Sunsweet Prune Pitted Ones, 7-Ounce Packages (Pack of 10)
Review:
I absolutely love these!
Each canister is filled with individually wrapped prunes.

I am the only one in our house who eats these.  I've tried buying the bags,
and buying another type of canister, but they always get dried out before I
can finish them all.  This is just right - allows me to eat them when I want to,
and I always get a fresh product.

While they could do better on the cost in my opinion, I have not had a bad one
from this canister from Sunsweet yet. Is it the best value for your money?
Depends on how you look at it - it costs more per prune, but in my case, I have a lot
less waste. So, it is a flip of the coin.

The fruit, however, is fresh, soft and tasty. Don't let an "old person" image of prunes
keep you from trying this yummy fruit!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Fiber One 90 Calorie Soft-Baked Bar, Lemon Bar, 12 Fiber Bars, 10.6 oz (Value Pack)
Review:
I was skepticle about these bars being very good.  I mean, I know Barry from the commercials loves the Fiber One bars, but what about those of us to had to actually buy them, and weren't paid to eat them?

Well, turns out that these are VERY good. They are also VERY small.  Apparently, Fiber One made the portion size with keeping under 100 calories in mind.  I was seriously surprised at the tiny size. But, you have to keep your focus on the fiber so you don't kick yourself for such a tiny bar. They do have a lot of sugars in them, mainly from the lemon flavored frosting squiggles. Not sure if they had to add so much sweetness to cover the taste of the inulin (chickory root), the fiber they use or what, but at this point, I don't mind.  Thanks to dental troubles, I can't chew as well as I used to, so getting fiber is a challenge. (Sorry, I just can't down a glass of Benefiber, even though I know it isn't supposed to be gritty! I know it's in there!)  These bars seem to be doing the job I hired them to do, and taste goodwhile doing it.

Well done Fiber One.  This is one I'll be a repeat buyer for.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
DaVinci Gourmet Syrup, Zero Calorie Caramel, 12.7 Ounce
Review:
We have a recently-diagnosed diabetic in our house, so have been purging the house of all things sugary
and trying out replacements that do not have aspartame in them.

We have several flavors of the sugar-free syrups.
This one tastes like pancake syrup.
Not unpleasant, but I wouldn't call it caramel either!
Very thin and watery, and definitely leaves the pancake syrup flavor behind in your mouth.
Ok maybe for super sweet coffee drinks.

I don't think I'd buy it again.
Rating:
4.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Pinto Beans, 27-ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
I grew-up around Southerners, and one of their favorite meals was pinto beans, slow-cooked all day with ham hock and chunks of ham, until it made a thick, rich, brown gravy...and tasted absolutely scrumptious. I left home, and did not really bother to make beans for years and years, then one day I experienced an incredible urge for a pot of Pinto Beans. I bought some at the grocery store, but they were tiny, not the right color, and their taste was dull, without any of the rich gravy that I had come to expect from every batch of Pinto Beans that I had ever had in my life.

So, I turned to good old Amazon, certain that Ammy would have more Pinto Beans than even the most ardent lover of beans could ever imagine. I was right, it took me an hour to go through all of the various Pinto Beans on offer, and I had to make a few tough decisions.. In the end, I opted for Bob's Red Mill Pinto Beans. While they are not organic ( my preference), they are non-GMO, and are thick, plump, lightly-speckled beans, just the type that I grew up with.

I ordered a big , old- fashioned Southern ham from a smokehouse in the Deep South, boned it out, cut up the bones, chopped about a quart of the ham into cubes, and was ready to go. First, I washed the beans and soaked them overnight in cold water, in a pan covered with a cloth, at room temperature. The next day, I drained the old water and added enough fresh water to cover about 2 inches above the beans, I added about four pieces of ham bone, four cups of cubed ham, two chopped bell peppers, 1 chopped onion, 2 bay keaves, a tea strainer full of about one tablespoon of whole black peppercorns, and two cans of original flavor Rotel Sauce. I brought this mixture to a boil, turned the beans way down low to simmer, and left them, barely bubbling, on the stove for about 5 hours. I stirred them infrequently, just to make sure that they weren't 'sticking on the. bottom of the pan.

I made a batch of long- grain brown rice in my rice maker, and we each had a soup bowl filled with rice, and topped by these luscious , flavorful, and delicious beans with a thick rich gravy. They were so good that even my Yankee husband went back for seconds. These pinto beans are the best that I have ever eaten. They were a whole new taste experience for me, each bean was plump, juicy, and full of its own rich flavor, not to mention the flavor of the ham which had permeated the entire pot of beans with its own hickory-smoked flavor.

These are without a doubt the best Pinto Beans that I have ever tasted. They were clean, pale cream in color with the classic pinto dark markings. They had a very sweet taste, which was clean and pure, and they  soaked-up the ham and other seasonings as well. These beans are really expensive, my Southern ancestors must be turning in their graves over the price that  I paid ! However, I do not eat them every day, and they are the only beans that I have ever found that taste as good as the  beans that I grew-up with. You can serve them over brown rice, or you can make a nice batch of cornbread made with stone-ground corn meal and buttermilk., and use that to sop-up the yummy gravy.. Again - these beans are so expensive, but they are the only beans that I have ever found that taste like the beans from my childhood.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Organic Extra Thick Rolled Oats, 32 Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
I live on Smoothies. One of the many, many ingredients is oats. I like thick,hunky, seriously "Oatey" oats.these fill the bill. Like all "Bob's Red Mill organic" items, the quality is just superb.

The have a fresh, rich, oat fragrance, and are the trickiest cut that I have been able to find. I have 26!noz. smoothie cups. These are serious Smoothies that I am making, and I live on them. I add 1/4 cup oats to each cup (approx), along with about 1/8 teaspoon of cinnamon to bring out, and accentuate the flavor.. I put them in the cup, and mix them into the Smoothie,not wanting to run them through the blender, and  totally defeating the purpose of my lovely fby chopping them up all tiny again.

They are about as pure and additive-free as can be found. The flavor and quality is just like candy to me ( I lack a sweet-tooth.), and really read and consider the nutritional level of this oat, I should be blasting off to the  moon some day,  under my own steam some day soon.

I highly recommend these. I double bag themin Zip-Loxks, and freeze them. They stay nice and fresh, and their vitamins and nutrients are unaffected by the heat of a warm kitchen. If you can, try these. The nutrition that is added to your system, plus the luscious taste, makes these oats worth the effort.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill, Organic Medium Grind Cornmeal, 24 oz
Review:
I grew up eating cornbread, not the kind made with finely ground meal, white flour, sugar, and other non-Southern affectations. No, my family made the real thing : Stone Ground Coarse Yellow Corn Meal ( Personally fetched from the mill.), buttermilk, eggs, baking soda, salt, and bacon drippings. A large cast iron skillet was heated in the oven, with a spoonful of bacons drippings, until smoking hot, then the batter was poured into the pan. The pan was so hot, that the bottom and sides of the batter immediately fried and climbed the sides of the pan. This pan by the way, was a sacred object in our kitchen, it was never to be washed with soap and water, never scrubbed, and only Mother was allowed to use it. When the cornbread was baked, she would grab the hot pads and flip the heavy, cast iron pan over onto a plate. The cornbread came sliding smoothly put of the pan, exhibiting a golden, crispy, and yummy crust. Mother then wiped the hot pan out with a paper towel, and left it on the stove to cool down, that was it. Generations of Southern women seasoned these precious pans and passed them down to a lucky daughter.

The corn bread was yummy, tart and rich from the buttermilk, crispy on the outside, smelling of bacon, and crumbly and speckle-colored on the inside. This freshly ground corn meal was not solid yellow, it had various colors of specks in it, including black specks. Since it had just been ground, this was not mold or dirt, that was just what stone-ground corn meal looked like. I grew-up, left home, and forgot about cornbread for many years. But then the urge for it returned, I purchased my own cast-iron skillet and began a search for corn meal. I could not find any coarsely ground, stone ground corn meal that even remotely resembled what I grew up with until I tried this meal from Bob's. What a relief, the grind is just right, the meal is coarse and full of  differently colored specks, just exactly like what I grew up with. The corn bread that I produced was perfect, just as Mother would have made it. This meal is really expensive, my female Southern ancestors must be turning in their graves over what I paid for this. But......it is authentic, and just exactly what was needed to produce a real old-fashioned Southern cornbread.

* Always store this in the freezer, it will go rancid very quickly otherwise.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Baja Bob's Maui Madness Mai Tai Mix, Sugar Free, 32-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 6)
Review:
I ordered a case of this product, not expecting much in the way of taste, but at least it would be a low- calorie way to enjoy a Margarita. Amazingly enough  - this is an excellent mixer,  it tastes as if it has been made with fresh limes, and the artificial sweetener does not give the mix an odd taste. I just followed the instructions on the bottle, 3 parts mix to one part of Tequila. I added nothing additional, and served the drink with crushed ice. It has a light and refreshing taste, a recommended way to enjoy a nice Margarita, without an overload of calories.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Carr's Whole Wheat Crackers, 7-Ounce Units (Pack of 12)
Review:
These are the most lovely biscuits that I have had to good fortune to discover -  rich and whole-wheat flavored, and that extra " Highlands Butter taste. These have a womderfully fine crumb, the aroma wafting from these must be eaten, or enjoyed, with a fine Cappuccino..

They have a lovely golden  color, and one can easily eat three or four of these, without recognizing that fact. These must be carefully packed, and well-padded, if their wonderful flavor and  good taste is to be enjoyed whole. Just set a few out on a plate, and watch them disappear.

I have eaten so many of these over the years, we used to get  them only during the holiday season.  My entire family is addicted, and If you like  nothing betterr than a lovely,  crumb texture, and a rich golden crumb, these are for you.

They are worth the occasional splurge-out for a truly super Scottish Cookie.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Walkers Shortbread Animal Shapes, 6.2-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
These chocolate shortbread cookies are extremely cute. The idea of baking Scottish Shortbread into the shape of a Scittie dog was a good one. They are just so cute, you really do not want to eat them. I gave several boxes to friends with little dogs that resemble the cookie dog. They all laughed and enjoyed the cookies.

Walker's Shortbread is an old, well-established, and top-quality of Scottish shortbread. Normally it projects an intense buttery aroma, and is light, flaky, and crumbly. Walker's is the very standard for what good shortbread should be. Therefor,e,  I was a tad bit surprised to find that these cookies were not quite up to the normal Walker's quality.

The boxes of cookies were fresh and undamaged, not a broken cookie in sight, so that could not be the problem. It appears that the alterations required to produce a chocolate shortbread batter make a less flaky and delicate cookie. The chocolate taste was just a bit strong, lovely for chocoholics , but less exciting for the pure shortbread contingent.

The most noticeable feature of Walker's shortbread has always been the amazingly rich and buttery fragrance, along with a light and delicate crumb. The addition of chocolate tends  to obscure the buttery fragrance,  Also,, the texture of the chocolate variety of this Walker's Shortbread is a bit tougher, and the crumb is less fine thanthat of the standard Walker's shortbread.

If you are a big fan of chocolate, and prefer more of that taste, then these cookies will be quite suitable for you. If, as some are, your entire shortbread experience is heavily based-upon the rich and buttery flavor, and the fine crumb, you will be better served with the original, and non-chocolatey version.

These are nice cookies, the  little dog figure is quite sweet,  and they are of high quality. For chocolate lovers everywhere, these are a fine choice.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Roland Sushi Ginger, 16 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I eat a lot of sushi, and acquired a strong liking for pickled ginger. I ordered this ginger, and am pleasantly surprised by the price and the taste.  It is thinly sliced, although there are a few thicker pieces mixed in. It is quite spicy, not too sweet, and tastes very good. it is sweetened with sugar, not aspartame. There is no artificial red food coloring in this product. Recommended for other pickled ginger fans.
Rating:
5.0

Fresh and soft with a slight denseness that comes with higher quality marshmallows, and perfect flavor.  I don't notice any aftertaste either.  I love them so much!  I didn't want to spend extra for the chocolate kind, so sometimes I'll layer it with a caramel Atkins square, and BOY that is heavenly! Product:

Review:
I really like this curry. I just ordered my second jar. It was a hit at Christmas dinner, and were New England white people with palates of New England white people. I still prefer super spicy food and noticed some reviewers mentioned its not spicy enough. I say you just have to add more of this curry. In India spices are an ingredient not a condiment. Like, go crazy with this. Dump in a cup. Youll taste the spiciness then. What I will observe is that the flavors besides just spicy are big... but thats a good thing. My aunt had never tried curry and she loved this. My brothers girlfriend kept coming back for more and even the five year old loved it, adventurer that he is. My family is mostly vegan now so were really exploring new flavors and Im certain Ill be buying this again - as well as looking at other spices from this seller. I made veggie and red lentil curry using coconut oil and potatoes and diced tomatoes. Its a really fine grind - if youve cooked with curries you know this is best - and I like working with it better than paste. Its a great price too. One more thing, the packaging is easy!!! No bags to re-seal, no refrigerator needed.

I rinse beforehand & that's recommended with this (not pre-rinsed). That's a slight pain honestly. I'll probably get pre-rinsed in the future. But the price is right! And it's yummy!

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

Product:
Cheddar Cheese Powder (1.5lb) by Anthony's, Batch Tested and Verified Gluten-Free, No Artificial Colors
Review:
This is much better than I'd actually expected it to be!

It tastes like a creamy mild Cheddar - which is, well, what it is.  ;)
It's especially good for sauces or other places where one wants a very smooth texture - I personally tend to like my Cheddar super-sharp, but the fact is that it's difficult to melt it smoothly into a sauce or sooth coating.  This powder fixes that - it makes a nice sauce in and of itself ((and it's good mixed into all sorts of other things, too!)), but it also makes a very good "matrix" into which very sharp, harder cheddar can be melted.

There are very few ingredients in it, which is why I decided to try it ;)
Some folks have said it tastes like the here-unnamed "famous boxed brand-name mac and cheese".  I didn't grow up eating that, so I went ahead and tried some a few years back, shortly before I turned 58 - and I trashed it after the first bite. This is NOT that!!!  This is actually cheese, with some buttermilk and whey protein (which is a component of milk).  The yellow color is from Anatto, which is derived from the nut of a shrubby South American tree that's been used for food and other uses for thousands of years. Some people raise a fuss about Anatto because some folks do seem to have an allergy to it ((just as some people have an allergy to peanuts, and/or other various foods)), but Anatto is so widely used, including in butter, so if you're allergic, you probably found out early on.

In the absence of such an allergy, I recommend this as a tasty addition to one's pantry.  I haven't yet tried making any sort of cheese crackers or rolls with it, but I'm betting it would be good in baked goods as well, for those folks who like ((or need)) to make their own.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Organic Buckwheat Flour, 22-ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
I enthusiastically like everything I've gotten from Bob's Red Mill - the quality is always high, and I like that it's a o-op sort of arrangement.

The Buckwheat flour (like all of their flours) is fine and evenly-sized, delicious, and a pleasure to use, especially for those for those of us with wheat allergies.

I have - and keep! - my pantry stocked with a variety of Bob's Red Mill non-wheat flours.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Suzie's Whole Grain Thin Cakes, Puffed Brown Rice Crackers, 4.9-Ounce Bags (136g) (Pack of 12)
Review:
- Basically, "Suzie's Whole Grain Thin Cakes, Puffed Brown Rice Crackers" are UNSALTED thin brown-rice cakes.  But the operative word there is THIN.  Maybe 1/4"/apx 6mm or a bit less.  They also are less crumbly than "regular" rice cakes.  And the brown rice gives them a bit more taste and 'substance'.  I also think the size is perfect.
 - What I get is the ultra-plain, no salt, nothing-but-rice ones.  They're a bit bland, I guess, for eating on their own ((to me, they taste a bit like plain pop-corn)), but I generally use them as a substitute for bread ((I don't have a gluten problem - I have an allergy problem)), so I've used them for everything from little "pseudo-Ruben" type things, to mini-pizzas, to tuna "sandwiches", to having them with peanut butter.  Or just melting some cheddar on them.  And so on.
 - And again, they seem to me to be a little more "dense" and less crumbly than regular rice cakes.  So, they hold the toppings, and don't clash with anything.
 - As long as they keep selling them, I definitely will keep getting them, because they are, for me, the best "bread substitute" I've found.
Rating:
5.0

Review:
This is my favorite soy sauce - it's 100% soy, NO WHEAT, hooray!, and it's delicious.  I use soy sauce frequently, so yeah, I bought the humongous bottle, LOL!  Not sure what else I can say about soy sauce...

Review:
I bought this at a grocery store because I have a wheat allergy and can't eat wheat pasta, and now am ordering from Amazon so I can be assured of a steady supply.  This is by far THE BEST non-wheat pasta I've ever had!  The texture is not at all grainy, but rather, is smooth very pleasant, *very* much like "regular" pasta; the flavor is excellent ((I do not at all like the wheat-free pastas that are made with corn :p )); and it's *easy to cook*, tolerates even a bit of over-cooking, and retains its structure - some non-wheat pastas get crumbly, but not this one.

Product:
Mighty Leaf Tea, White Orchard, 15-Count Whole Leaf Pouches 1.32 Oz. (Pack of 3)
Review:
Lovely tea.  The peach does not overpower.  The fragrance is truly orchid-like.  Not bitter either.  One of my favorites from Mighty Leaf.

Don't over-brew this one:  Usually white teas require five or six minutes to steep, but this one will loose its peach and melon flavor if steeped that long.  No more than three minutes works well for me.  Also, do not use boiling water; let boiling water sit for several minutes before pouring over white teas (or do not bring it to a boil). White teas like 180 to 185 degrees Fahrenheit.

Highly recommend if you like a floral fragrance in your tea.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Dole Pineapple Chunks in Heavy Syrup, 8.25 Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:
Come warmer weather and we turn from soups and stews to grilled and lighter dishes, I make sure I always have a can of these Dole Pineapple Chunks on the pantry shelf.  When I don't have an appropriate fresh fruit, and I need a sweet-sour-spicy salsa for fish or chicken, I grab this can.

The pineapple is as close to fresh as it can be.  I buy the chunks so I can chop it into smaller pieces myself.  I believe the bigger chunks hold their flavor in the can better.  And we like a bigger chop than what comes crushed, and a smaller chop than comes with the tidbits.  Plus, these chunks work for kebobs, too.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Knorr Pasta Sides, Beef 4.3 oz
Review:
After serving Knorr's Smokehouse Bacon Parmesan Pasta Sides to my family at dinner last week, they insisted that they would not ever try another Pasta Sides flavor. So, I cooked this up during the day, just to give it a try.  I tasted a few spoonfuls to confirm that my pre-conceived opinion was correct, then I dumped the rest.  I didn't even want to give it to the chickens in the yard, because I felt the wimpy noodles and excessive salt were not healthy for them.

This package makes two cups prepared pasta.  One cup is considered a serving size.  I was appalled to see that one cup of this stuff contains 31% of a person's recommended daily salt intake.  And I could only stand at the counter and shake my head when I read that two cups of this weighed in at 580 calories--and this is just a side dish?!?

If you try this product, remember to not exceed the 12 minute boiling time in an effort to get the sauce to thicken; your noodles will be mush.  Thickening occurs during the two minute resting period after you take it off the flame.

I don't know why anyone would bother with this product, as it isn't even a true "convenience" food that you can pop into the microwave at work.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
ZICO Watermelon Raspberry Coconut Water Drink, 16.9 fl oz, 12 Pack
Review:
Having been lucky enough to have once lived in an area where I was able to crack open as many fresh green coconuts as I desired, I must say that the flavor in these bottles is decent:  Not perfect, but not bad.  I had to get it really, really ice cold to achieve the correct flavor.  Coconut water right out of the shell is extremely refreshing, and I don't think it can ever be correctly duplicated.  (Same like the juice from a freshly-squeezed lime or lemon loses its true taste as it ages.)  But his offering from Zico comes close.  And the aftertaste is authentic, too.

I don't think that all people understand that fresh coconut water does not taste like coconut meat.  Coconut water has only a hint of the flavor of  coconut meat, and it has a slight tang and almost a slight "soapy" taste.  It is nothing like coconut milk or coconut cream.  And its nothing like the coconut flavor in a pina colada.

I'll say it's decent enough flavor to bring back memories of shaking green coconuts to listen to the slosh of the water inside.  Then taking a machete and trimming off the top of the tough outer green of the coconut.  The final swipe would expose a hole to the inside.  Bring it to the lips and some water would always trickle down my chin. Review:

This is great! It's kind of citrusy and has a very, very faint hint of salt that reminds me of how good Gatorade tastes when you are dehydrated. It tastes ...clean, not syrupy, and very refreshing. Also, it's a pretty color. I'm not sure why grocers don't carry it, but it costs less on here and is well worth waiting. I get plenty of fluids daily because I am drinking this. It's also good with a little more water than the directions call for.

5.0
Product:
Terrasoul Superfoods Raw Coconut Chips (Organic), 12 Ounces
Review:
I use these to soak in lime juice with a little chili and salt, then toast for a low-carb snack.
It is hard to find pieces that are large.
So far, this has had the most consistently large flakes per bag, and they have excellent flavor and taste, even untreated.

Anyone who wants to try this:
1/4 cup lime juice
1/8 tablespoon chili powder
1/8 tablespoon cayenne
1/8 tablespoon salt
(I mix all that first)
Then add 2 cups or so of the coconut.
Stir gently so all coconut is covered, sometimes let sit to absorb.
Spread thinly on a cookie sheet
Convect at 2:20 degrees Fahrenheit  for 1 hour and 20 minutes,
stir a bit, then another 10 minutes, then remove from oven to let cool.

If you are cutting carbs and calories, and if you are not allergic to artificial sweeteners, it's a wonderful product. It's harder to find than the other flavors.

I keep checking the ingredients that there isn't something more in it! lol! The chocolate has an almost fruity taste with tid bits of extra chocolateiness with a coffee-like undertone. Yet it is still smooth without any bitterness or over creaminess. I am a Paleo eater, (mostly due to medical issues) ao it's extra grew that it is something that I can eat without harm. Product:
 Schr Gluten Free Penne, 12 oz. Box, 5-Pack 
Review:
Invested a bit per lb than I usually do at a local store for a special occasion meal. I was not disappointed! People who know we are gluten free and are very much into quality foods, asked if it was the real thing? They said it was solo good! All I added was EarthBalance butter, salt and pepper, with a touch of garlic powder and paprika. I was certainly a hit among us normally gluten free eaters. I would love to make this a staple item, but it's just too much $ at more that $3 per box. Hopefully, they can add it to Subscribe & Save to help some:) Btw, if you're like us and try to stay away form GMO's while being gf, if the product is form Europe you're generally safe;0)

Product:
Bob's Red Mill Gluten Free Brownie Mix, 21-ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
I really enjoy several of the BRM products. So when I noticed this brownie mix, I had to try them. As I followed instructions, I noticed the batter was super dense. No problem, I just spread it till it reaches the edges of the pan. We tried these warm and they were ok. We both agreed they were no like brownie (chewy and chocolatey)they tasted "off" but familiar. We agreed, they were more like a crumbly fudge cake. After we tried them cooled down, I figured it out what was off...it was too much baking soda/powder flavor. Not really sure but I know I got that after taste when I was learning to bake as a teen. If we ever try these again, we will load them up with other things like blue berries, chocolate chips, nuts, coconut, or whatever I have around.

Would I recommend? It depends. I don't need a gluten free diet. So, for those who are like me in that way, then No. For those who need gluten free, then Yes.

My favorite brownie to date, is Trader Joe's brownie mix...oh, with Biscoff spread, OMG! Heavenly.

Sam Mills Pasta for Kids, Ducks, Gluten Free, 12-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
Bought this on a quick 'why not' whim. Tonight I made my chicken noodle soup ( made it about 5+ times this past month) and tasted it to make sure it all good before adding the noodles. With no noodles, it was great (even thought of not adding the noodles - but they should make it better, right?). Then I added the noodles, cooked them 8m (like the pkg indicates), and poured it right in a bowl to enjoy. At first I thought it was me, cause something tasted yucky. You might be asking, "hey is she used to gluten free products?", Well yes, been gf for about 6m & have eaten many noodles. Well it ruined my soup! I thought letting it sit would make it better. Nope! The funky taste got stronger. All that soup gone to waste. Then I realized this product is not made with GMO free corn. My mistake for not reading. I noticed before that the GMO corn products tend to have a weird taste. Not sure why, but that has been my experience.

Review:

My husband I couldn't decide if they were better with or without syrup!? I saw that these were one of Amazon's greatest sellers on Subscribe & Save. We did want to put out too much $ to just try something. (Especially, since we never really tried any gluten free foods yet (at least not by default). So, we tried the trial pack at our local market first. OMG! My hubby asked me twice this week if I ordered these yet & did not want to wait for almost another month for S&S, LOL! IF your just interested in trying these, I would say they are a sure bet. I plan on making these anytime we have guests to visit:)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Viva Naturals Organic Coconut Sugar: Non-GMO, Low-Glycemic Sweetener, 6 lbs Bag
Review:
I have tried several coconut sugars (Nutiva, Madhava, Wholesome, Coconut Secret, Woodstock, Organic Traditionals, Sunfood, Vitacost, Navitas Naturals and now Viva Labs) and this one tastes very different...in a bad way. The reviews say other people like it, but mine tastes more like molasses than other brands. It surprises me how very different coconut sugars can be, some are grainier, sweeter, clump together and have almost a bitter taste (like this one). Maybe it came from a different place or just a bad batch, but I can't even finish it. If you're interested in the ones I liked and the ones that I feel fall short of the others: The first 5 names are in my opinion good and the last 5 bad.

For me... a little goes a long way as I don't care for anything overly sweet.  I use the same amount of this product that I used with the organic sugar I've now replaced.  For Lucy who is wondering whether this is 100% organic coconut sugar, the ingredient list states: organic granulated coconut nectar (it is made from the flower buds of the coconut tree).  It is very yummy!  I have even introduced others to it who like it so much they are now "converts".

Review:
as coconut sugars go... it's "ok".  I much prefer Nutiva or Madhava to this one.  The difference in texture is almost startling.  This one is very fine and clumps horribly.  The other 2 are more granular and don't clump at all.  Also, the flavors of the others are different.  The only phrasing that comes to mind is that they "taste fresher and less processed".  I know that probably doesn't help much, but some of you might get what I'm trying to say.  I have been using the other 2 brands for 5 or 6 yrs, this one I just started using about 6 months ago because grocery outlet had it on sale for seven dollars.

I pretty much just go through the fridge, freezer, and pantry and add leftovers.  The soup comes out different each time... great with linguica!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Taste Nirvana Real Coconut Water, Coco Aloe with Refreshing Aloe Vera, 16.2 Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:
I really love this one... and I have tried several over the last few weeks.  The tastes have really varied with each and every one I tried and after reading all of  the reviews for the different brands, I've been struck with some realizations.  First of all... the different brands utilize coconuts from different parts of the globe.  That in and of itself would cause flavor differences.  But, the other thing that came to mind is how the same tree can produce different flavor and texture results in things like oranges and apples depending on the weather pattern for that season, etc.  Perhaps the same applies to coconuts?  In any case, of all the brands I've tried, this is by far my favorite.  I decided to try drinking coconut water to help with lowering my blood pressure and it has definitely done that.  So I am happy that I finally found one that I can happily consume and enjoy every day!

First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Lightly Sea Salted Whole Pumpkin Seeds, 4 LBS by Gerbs – Top 12 Food Allergy Free & Non GMO - Vegan & Kosher Certified - Dry Roasted In-Shell Pepitas from United States Review: I'm used to pumpkin seeds roasted in the oven at home at Halloween, and these don't measure up all that well in comparison. They're barely toasted at all, so they don't have much flavor. On the other hand, they're a healthy snack, and not that bad. They certainly don't lead me to overeat. I'll probably finish them eventually, though if I had more choices (I'm prediabetic with celiac disease), I doubt I'd try. Rating: 3.0 Product: Eat Natural Almond & Apricot Bar with Yogurt Coating,1.76 Ounce Bar, 12-Count Box Review: I've been carrying Larabars with me as a gluten-free snack, and bought "Eat Natural" almond & apricot bars to give them a try after seeing the glowing reviews. They are indeed delicious - though I find the coconut and yogurt flavors come through much more strongly than the apricot. They're somewhat more filling than Larabars - 235 calories vs. 180 calories, in both cases half fat. There's big difference in saturated fat - 9 grams for "Eat Natural", 1 for Larabars, and "Eat Natural" bars have almost 20 times the sodium (95 mg, as compared to 5 mg), and half the fiber (2 grams as compared to the Larabar's four). "Eat Natural" ingredients don't get any more unnatural-sounding than soya lecithin, glucose syrup, and dextrose - but the list is certainly a whole lot longer than my Larabar's "dates, almonds, unsweetened apples, walnuts, raisins, cinnamon" (yes, that's all). These "Eat Natural" bars do taste good and are a little better at killing hunger pangs than Larabars. I might buy them again sometime if I find I need a snack that's a little better at killing hunger but think I'll stick to Larabars in the meantime. Rating: 4.0 Product: Eat Natural Bars: Almond & Raisin with Brazil Nuts & Peanuts, 1.76-Ounce, 12-Count Boxes Review: Not something I'll buy again - rather bland puffed rice and nuts (mostly Brazil nuts and almonds), sweetened with glucose syrup and with some raisins mixed in - the only fruit I could taste, though the ingredient list includes apricots and peach. The result is bland as well as overly sweet. Though "Eat Natural" yogurt-coated almond & apricot bars are even sweeter, they're far tastier and would be my choice if I were to buy "Eat Natural" bars again. I prefer Larabars to either - though I know they're not everyone's cup of tea. (And the dates and other fruit used to sweeten Larabars seem more natural ingredients to me than the glucose syrup used to sweeten "Eat Natural" bars.) Rating: 3.0 Product: Raw Almonds from California - 10 (1 Lb) Resealable Packages Review: These are great almonds - bigger and not as dried out as the ones I've been paying a lot more for at the grocery store. Not a bad almond in the lot, and very well packaged too. We'll buy these again! Rating: 5.0 Product: Bakto Flavors Pure Madagascar Vanilla Extract - 8 OZ Review: This is really good vanilla extract, in a bottle size that's much better suited to the amount of baking I do than the much smaller bottles available in my local grocery store. Not a bad buy, either. Rating: 5.0 Product: Madi K's Almonds, Whole Natural Nonpareil, 31 Count (Pack of 31) Review: Love these - have been getting them on subscription for months now. So handy to tuck away for a snack on the go - I'm gluten free and diabetic, and finding good portable snack foods is a problem! They always taste fresh. Not just my imagination - I brought them with me as part of my contribution of food for a 13-hour session working the polls at a special election recently, and they were a big hit with everyone else too. The box they come in works as a dispenser - has a drop-down panel at the front. Very convenient too. Rating: 5.0 Product: Ideal Brown No Calorie Sweetener, 10.6 oz. Review: I'd had no luck finding a gluten-free brown sugar substitute until I found this on Amazon - and checked the manufacturer's website, which assured me it is gluten-free. AND mostly xylitol - the sugar substitute I prefer anyway. So I order one bag to try it, and quickly went back to order more. It's great stuff - more like light brown sugar than dark brown, so I need to add a tad of molasses in some of my baking. And of course like plain xylitol, it's much drier than sugar, but adding a little applesauce to whatever I'm baking helps with that. But mostly I use it on my breakfast cereal - sprinkling cinnamon in the bottom of the bowl, adding Bob's Red Mill Gluten Free Whole Grain, Rolled Oats, 32-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4) and a handful of raisins, microwaving it, and topping it with Ideal Brown no-cal sweetener. Yum. Well, I get great use of my Keurig brewer as the water heats to the right temperature to make a great cup of coffee.  Without the k-cup in the compartment, I can make a great cup of Columbian Taster's Choice coffee using one or two of these sticks depending on how big a mug I decide to use!

Review:
Five TASTY Stars! "Skinnygirl" White Cherry Water Enhancer adds a very nice taste to water, and it is one of those zestier enhancers, not the underpowered brands that barely register on the taste buds. I put 2 or 3 squirts into a normal 16 ounce bottle of water and it yields a taste that is more strawberry than cherry. Always dilute Skinnygirl. It's for everyone to use, despite the catchy brand name.

It has 5 calories per serving and zero fat, carbs, sugar, sodium, protein, or calories. Ingredients are: water, citric acid, natural flavors, cane sugar, stevia extract (sweetener), vegetable and fruit juice (color). Contains less that 2% potassium benzoate and potassium sorbate (preservatives). Highly Recommended. Five PLEASING Stars. (2-1.62 fluid ounce/48mL plastic squeeze bottles, 24 servings in each. Product:
Bob's Red Mill, Texturized Vegetable Protein, 10 oz
Review:
I love TVP.  I use it at work all the time.  Here are some tips on using it:

Rehydrate your TVP in a double or triple strength liquid, like bouillon or soup base with twice or triple the recommended amount added to the water.

Cover the TVP with the bouillon or soup mixture until it kind of sloshes around.  It will absorb more liquid over time.

After the liquid has absorbed (usually 10 minutes or so) taste test it to see if the seasoning is to your liking.  You can add more seasoning, or add more TVP depending on how strong it is.

Once it's at the right flavor, use your culinary skills to give it some kick.  Add an egg and some breadcrumbs, and make TVP burgers or "meat"balls.  Add some cumin, onion, garlic, and chili, thicken with a little starch, and you get TVP taco filling.  The possibilities are endless!

BIG SECRET tip: Use a little sugar in your hydrating liquid if you are going to brown the TVP in any way, as in taco filling or patties.  The sugar will help it brown (Google: Maillard Reaction) And if your dishes are tasting salty without tasting "savory" try adding a little nutritional yeast, or yeast extract.

My only complaint: this TVP is pale, like breadcrumbs. I like my TVP to have a nice dark color usually, but it all tastes the same, so not a big deal.

The rice has a bubble gum flavor that is OK, but a little overpowering when mixed with the other ingredients, so I ate mine mostly separated to try the different flavors.  Each topping is a fruit flavor of some kind, and some are more sour than others.

The inner wrapper comes with little "plates" you can cut out and use to put your sushi on, it's adorable!
