prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Viva Naturals Organic Quinoa, 4 LB - 100% Royal Bolivian Whole Grain Review: The things I like Best about this quinoa is that it's USDA certified organic and that it is prewashed. Quinoa naturally has a slightly bitter coating which has to be rinsed off. This can be a little bit difficult since it's such a tiny seed. That means it has to be rinsed in a fine mesh strainer and often sticks to the strainer This product saves that step. It's already washed. Quinoa is nice for a change of pace from rice or other grains but can be prepared in much the same manner. It's actually a seed and not a grain and has a more complete protein profile than rice. I usually prepare it in my Stainless Steel Rice Cooker Model ME81 (Formerly ME8) - by Miracle Exclusives and often mix it with barley or brown rice and cook them together. I use about two parts of water to one part quinoa. I often use it for Tabouli Salad to replace the bulgar. I've also used it in pilaf and in chilled salads with vegetables. It works very well in a rice pudding type of dish too. (In place of the rice.) Quinoa has an impressive nutrient profile as well. It has 50% more protein than brown rice and more fibre. A cup of brown rice has 14 per cent of the recommended daily fibre. As good as that is, quinoa does rice even better, with 21 per cent. It also is one of the few plant sources that contains a complete protein meaning that it has all of the protein forming amino acids. Sample received for review. Rating: 5.0 Product: Emergency Preparedness & Survival Gluten-Free Food Supply - All Natural, Kosher, Non-GMO - 10 Year Shelf Life - 15 Servings Review: These aren't the kind of jelly beans where you stuff a handful into your mouth. These are meant to be savored and enjoyed one at a time. Each has a vibrant, distinctive flavor, the kind you want savor, one at a time. And this sampler is the perfect way to try a variety of David's Signature Beyond Gourmet Jelly Beans. It provides a nice variety including bacon, black cherry, blueberry, coconut, cranberry, ginger, grape, green apple, Himalayan sea salt, lemon, orange punch, peach, pomegranite, root beer, strawberry and vanilla bean. All of them were very good, but my personal favorites were strawberry, lemon, coconut and bacon. I have to admit that the bacon was a strange flavor for a jelly bean. Maybe that's why I liked it. It had sort of a burnt flavor, like bacon when it's crispy. These jelly beans use natural flavors that are quite intense. One of these small beans fills your whole mouth with flavor. If you are really adventuresome you could try a pack of David's Signature Beyond Gourmet Jelly Beans Man Mix. The bacon, ginger and Himilayan Sea salt flavors from this sampler are included, but there is also a chipotle, Thai chili, wasabi and a habanero jelly bean that is three-alarm hot! If you like unusual flavors you have to give them a try too. From what I understand David Klein created the first gourmet jelly beans some 35 years ago, so he's quite accomplished when it comes to unique flavors that are fun to taste. Wouldn't this be the perfect thing for the Easter Bunny to leave for the adult jelly bean fans on your list? The manufacturer supplied me with this sampler for review. Rating: 5.0 Product: Tiesta Tea Blueberry Wild Child Blueberry Hibiscus Fruit Tea, 30 Servings, 1.8 Ounce Pouch - Caffeine Free, Loose Leaf Herbal Tea Eternity Blend, Non-GMO Review: This herbal tea has an interesting blend of flavors with the predominant ones being watermelon and peppermint. The flavors remind me of summer. It doesnt contain any regular tea leaves, making it actually a tisane. Ive switched to caffeine-free drinks lately, so this is perfect. The flavors make it a natural for an ice tea but its also very good as a hot brewed tea. To make it iced, I just brew it hot with a smaller amount of boiling water, and then add ice once its brewed. Ive been using a lot of loose teas lately because I like having more control over the strength of the Tea and because its actually quite a good deal moneywise using the loose rather than teabags. I love these canisters with the airtight seals that Tiesta uses. Theyre attractive and they keep the tea fresh. Rating: 5.0 Product: goodnessKNOWS Cranberry, Almond & Dark Chocolate Gluten Free Snacks Square Bars 12-Count Box Review: The ingredients in these.small 4 section bars are basic and simple, with blueberries, sugar, crisp rice roasted almonds and dark chocolate among others. Each bar weighs 1.20 ounces, which isn't a lot, but the flavors, especially the dark chocolate, make them satisfying. They are just 150 calories each so they're a good snack for those of us trying to keep our weight down. They're low enough that they don't cause that big sugar drop a half hour or so after eating them like some regular candy bars do. They have 2 grams of fiber and 3 grams of protein per bar. I like that they're GMO-free. They aren't a health food, but they fit in with my plan for a reasonable number of calories in a snack while still tasting very good. Rating: 5.0 Product: Yogi Tea - Echinacea Immune Support - Supports Immune Function - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total Review: My husband often has a scratchy throat, probably from acid reflux. Several weeks ago my sister gave him a couple tea bags of this product and he said it was soothing to his throat so I ordered this pack of 6 boxes from Amazon. It's not always an easy tea to find in grocery stores and this is so much more convenient. He's been drinking it every night so it looks like I'll be ordering more in the future. Rating: 5.0 Product: truRoots Organic Quinoa 100% Whole Grain Premium Quality, 4 lbs Review:
 This quinoa is nice for a change of pace from rice or other grains but can be prepared in much the same manner. It's actually a seed and not a grain and has a more complete protein profile than rice. I usually prepare it in my Stainless Steel Rice Cooker Model ME81 (Formerly ME8) - by Miracle Exclusives and often mix it with barley or brown rice and cook them together. I use about two parts of water to one part quinoa. I often use it for Tabouli Salad to replace the bulgar. I've also used it in pilaf's and in chilled salads with vegetables. It works very well in a rice pudding type of dish too. (In place of the rice.) It should be rinsed in a fine mesh strainer because it tastes slightly bitter if it's not rinsed first. I use a strainer like this: Stainless Steel Fine Mesh Strainer Colander Sieve with Handle for Kitchen Food Rice Vegetable,set of 3. The prices change on Amazon but I can usually find a cheaper at Costco. I made a short video for anyone who isn't familiar with quinoa. I don't usually play with my food, but just wanted you to see the texture. :) Rating: 5.0 Product: KIND Sweet and Spicy Bars, Korean Chili, Gluten Free, 10g Plant Protein, 1.6oz, 12 Count Review: I just purchased my first box of Strong & Kind Roasted Jalapeno bars and I think these could become a serious addiction. They aren't too sweet which I appreciate when trying to lose weight and not overeat, because they don't give my that blood sugar spike that a lot of energy bars give which end up making me want to keep eating. These are satisfying and I love the jalapeno. It's heat is bold but not overwhelming. For me, it's just the right amount of heat. One bar is 230 calories but with all the almonds, pumpkin and hemp seeds it's very satisfying makes me feel full for a couple of hours after I eat one. The ingredients are: almonds, pumpkin and hemp seeds, honey, non-GMO glucose, and pea crisps, jalapeno chili, onion powder, garlic powder, smoked sea salt and sunflower lecithin. The nuts and seeds are whole, not mashed into some gooey mass and baked. I like being able to taste the indivual ingredients. The slight smoky taste is perfect with the other natural flavors. These are more savory than sweet. I will definitely keep buying these. Update 4/8/15 - I just had one of these bars from a different box, a box of 4. The heat was gone. I could barely taste it. I hope it was just that bar and not the rest of the box as well. The heat was what I liked about this bar. I hope they didn't change the recipe. prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Archway Cookies, Original Coconut Macaroons, 10 Ounce Box
Review:
Summary: Not very lemony and very, very crumbly.  Give these a pass and find some higher quality cookies.

I love good lemon cookies, these really are not very good at all.  The lemon flavor is there but subdued and not terribly "fresh" tasting.  The cookie is soft to the point of crumbing in your hand and even taking one out of the package is likely to break pieces off and scatter your table with crumbs.

There are far too many unneeded ingredients and they use (or may use) palm oil and other cheap oils and high-fructose corn syrup.  For those to whom it matters, they use some level of genetically modified foods.  I do nor care and this is not really a genuine issue but many people do care and I present the facts so people may make their own decisions.

I'd suggest not giving these to small kids as it is going to be an unqualified mess as the cookies break apart if you glance at them and a small child will simply turn this into a cleaning mess with sticky crumbs and bits of "frosting" all over the landscape.

In fact, I'd simply suggest giving them a complete miss regardless.  These are third rate cookies at best, in my opinion, and not worth the cost or calories.  Archway has always been a "brand of last resort" in my experience and nothing here changes my mind in the least.

Addendum:  As others mention, these leave an unpleasant aftertaste that lingers.  I have half the package left and am simply tossing them into the food waste bin.  Just not good.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Bibigo Korean Gochujang Sauce, 11.46 Ounce, 2 Count
Review:
This is the first time I've used Gochujang hot sauce after hearing about it for years and seeing it on many cooking shows.  Not sure I'll continue to use it though as it is one third sugar.

No idea if they are all like that but that's way too much sugar.  It occurs three times on the ingredient list in various places and there's 10 grams of sugar in a 30 gram serving. Sugar is the next ingredient after peppers.  Ridiculous.

The flavor is good.  This stuff is no foolin' spicy.  I like it.  Good "burn" without overdoing it.  Reminds just a bit of Tabasco Sauce although the flavor is decidedly different.  There is (obviously) a sweet aftertaste as well from all that brown sugar and cane sugar.  Too much really for my taste.

Maybe in summer if you can use it like a barbecue sauce to get that caramelized flavor on the grill it may work better, but for for my use it's just sugary hot sauce and I can get great hot sauces without all the extra sugar for a lot less money.

Not meaning to harp on this as I'm not particularly a health nut but if excess sugar in your diet matters, use this with caution.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Jack Link's Meat Snacks Beef Jerky, Peppered, 5.85 Ounce
Review:
Rather like Pastrami Jerky...and that's a good thing.  Hot without overdoing it, very peppery but not masking the rich beef flavor you get from Jerky.

Very chewy, a traditional jerky that can pull fillings if you're not careful but worth the risk.  ;)

Only odd ingredient is "Hydrolyzed corn protein".  No idea what that is doing in my beef jerky but be aware if such things matter to you.

Overall, a great snack and a very traditional one.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
NongShim Neoguri Noodle, Spicy Seafood, 4.2 Ounce Packages (Pack of 20)
Review:
I was hankering for something a bit different from standard Ramen.  I gave these a try and they are a serious hit.

They take about ten minutes end to end using a microwave (I add some dried shrimp for a bit more flavor and Umami.  The noodles plump up well and have a good texture with a decent "bite" to them, they are not soggy paste. They don't dall apart and remind me of a decent pasta.

The broth is definitely spicy/hot.  Not "burn your mouth " hot but not fooling around either.  There's a great seafood flavor and an intruiging mix of ocean life (sand lance anyone?)

As usual, there's a ton of sodium so this may not be for everyone and it's not low calorie either, a full pack is a bit over 500 calories.  They play the usual game about portions and presume there's two portions in the bag.  I doubt most folk will divvy it up but there is enough that you could do so without feeling like you are making portions for a child's tea party.

On a cold, damp, rainy day, this is a nice way to warm up and I intend to keep some around and try their other flavors and maybe add some dried bonito flakes as well.  This stuff is a good platform for experiments.

Tasty, hearty and highly recommended to fill that void in your tummy or your craving for noodles.
(Note, the product has origins in Korea I think but the version sold here is made in the USA.)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Buzz and Bloom Honey Creamy Spread, Original, 12 Ounce
Review:
A very creamy honey.  Easily spreadable with a knife or scoopable with a spoon but not pourable.

Mild honey flavor with just enough cinnamon to enhance it without overwhelming it.  I used it in my morning cup of very strong black tea and it works surprisingly well which I did not expect cinnamon to do.

Melted onto toast or a hot bagel and you have an even better delight.  It would seem Ukrainian bees do a fine job of work.  ;)

Highly recommended for a breakfast or snack "change-up" or to put some zip in your morning sip.  I suspect this will be superb in a cup of coffee with some Cognac or in a Mocha with some Coffee liqueur as well. I shall report back on this once I try one or the other. (I don't drink alcohol much so be patient.)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bumble Bee Sensation Seasoned Tuna with Crackers, Chipotle, 3.6 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
Shredded tuna about one grade above cat food, doused with an annoyingly spicy chipotle sauce that is all burn and no taste.

Can is annoyingly hard to open and the miniature plastic scraper almost useless in getting the tuna out without making a mess everywhere.  Have a napkin on the table or desk as you're going to get tuna crumbs all over unless you have the dexterity of a surgeon.

The included crackers are decent but not spectacular and work as a vehicle to hold the tuna and can be gently used to "spoon" upt he tuna once the can is somewhat empty.  Works better than the tiny plastic "spoon" provided/.

The chipotle flavor drowns out the tuna completely and lacks the subtle heat and warmth of the good stuff like the assorted "rooster sauces".

This will do as a back-up snack or such but only if you have water or milk or something to tame the annoying afterburn.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Pure Leaf Tea House Collection, Organic Iced Tea, Wild Blackberry & Sage, 14 Ounce Bottles, Pack of 8
Review:
It's summer.  Where I live has had record breaking heat and the joy of smoke from major brush fires.  Add in the place not being fully air conditioned (Didn't used to need it in these parts) and you have the "prefect storm" that is best quenched by a nice iced tea (at least until I get bids on adding real A/C).

Now, while I enjoy iced tea, I am coming to dislike the heavily sweetened versions moistly available.  This particular line, while being sweetened, does use cane sugar rather than corn sweetener and uses it judiciously.

A bottle of this is 90 calories while a similar bottle of "Gold Peak" is 180 calories. Another brand I like, Tea's Tea, is zero calories with no artificial sweeteners but is a bit more of an acquired taste if you are used to the fizzy corn syrup and water that passes for sodas and such in the USA.  (I do suggest trying it...the Jasmine green tea does not *need* sugar and your palate will awaken.)

There are multiple flavors in this particular assortment but I am only going to comment on the Sicilian Lemon and Honeysuckle as that is what I have had so far.  I may add an update when I get to the Blackberry and Sage one as that really sounds odd.

Short form:  Good stuff, a refreshing drink that is not overly sweet.

The lemon is tart without being bitter or making you pucker and the honeysuckle brings up distant chords of memory from when my grandfather taught me when I was a child to pick and enjoy honeysuckle nectar right off the vine.  Refreshment and nostalgia in one bottle, a nice combo.

if you want to advance your taste and selection past Lipton and Snapple, you won't go wrong giving these a try.  You might not like every flavor but experiment, you may find something you didn't know you loved.

Flavor Update:  Just finished a bottle of the "Blackberry and Sage".  Interesting.  They use brewed blackberry leaves and brewed sage leaves along with the usual black tea.

Makes for a different but not unacceptable variant.  The blackberry leaves add a deep, mildly tart note and the sage presents an almost savory aftertaste that is not unpleasant but does linger.

I'd not want this every day but it is an intriguing variant on an old stand-by.  Worth giving it a try if you are curious at all about such things.
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Product:

Review:
Fake phony flavors do not impress me at all especially ones so I don't know why I bought this except for the rave reviews.  There is a definite split in our population between those who become exuberant over their phony mango shampoos, etc. and those who know a toad when they see one.

This flavor combo is so intense it has even absorbed itself into my plastic insulated cup and I can't get it out. You know that highpitched overly sweet chemically induced maddness that resembles so many cosmetics these days. Out, out dammed spot for I have poisoned the queen...eek.  And all that sugar...omg no it is not better than aspertame. It makes children wild and mice sick and loves cancer.

 Make these doggone sodas yourself; get some seltzer better yet Perrier or mineral water, and add some real mango juice and yogurt or juice your own strawberries.  Naturalists avoid this simile made with benzyole hydrate and concentrate on the living.

  And try using Xylitol....may have to dissolve it in warm water first but tastes much better than all the others and 1/2 the cal of sugar and natural to the body.

I also just bought some Maggi Authentic Indian Tamarina on amazon which is so ssoooo delicious and I will use that all by itself to spruce this up.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Stash Tea Super Irish Breakfast Black Tea 20 Count Tea Bags in Foil (Pack of 6) Individual Black Tea Bags for Use in Teapots Mugs or Cups, Brew Hot Tea or Iced Tea Review: I don't understand anyone claiming this fine tea lacks strong, rich flavor. It's the best bagged black tea I've discovered, though we've enjoyed PG Tips and Yorkshire teas. This "Irish Breakfast" tea is strong, without being overly tannic or sour. It's not like loose Lapsang Souchong, being a far more mellow smokey experience. If you crave an authentic, comforting tea that reminds you of being far from the maddening crowd, perhaps in a safer environ of Midsomer than Badger's Drift, than this is the tea for you. We like it with milk & sweetener, though it's wonderful with honey or sugar. Rating: 5.0 Product: PG Tips Black Tea, Pyramid Tea Bags, 80Count Boxes (Pack of 4) Review: Other reviews are right, this is potent tea, bright and tart. So, if you can't be out on the moors, cold wind blowing, autumn chill refreshing the soul, then you can pretend. This leap of imagination may be even more necessary during the summer's bleak weeks, with heat lambasting the West, furnacing deadly forest fires. We highly recommend this reliable U.K. classic, PG Tips Black Tea, sweetened with Splenda. Years ago, we spend cold months in the U.K., savoring this tea when clouds darkened the horizon and wet leaves scuttled against the windows. For a simple, traditional accompaniment with your PG Tips tea, you may want to try Crawford's Garibaldi Biscuits (also available for a sightly better price with Pennywise (Crawfords) Garibaldi Biscuits), or the rich, spicy Carr's Ginger Lemon Creme cookies. And for vicarious escape to England's North Country, you can't go wrong watching Brenda Blethyn in the Northumbrian mystery series Vera and Vera: Set 2. Enjoy! Rating: 5.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Green Tea, Authentic, 40 Count (Pack of 6) Review: We make a big pot of this refreshing and gently invigorating green tea every morning. It's delicious, a blend of white & green tea leaves that brings out the best in each. I've imbibed a great deal of tea from various parts of the world, and this is an excellent, richly flavorful tea. For fun, we often add a couple of bags of Celestial Seasonings Herb Tea, Peppermint to the pot; it's a riff on a Moroccan tradition that mixes mint leaves with tea. Enjoy! Rating: 5.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Tension Tamer Tea, 20 ct Review: Celestial Seasonings Chamomile tea is the most intensely flavored I've tried. Sourced from Egyptian Chamomile, the aroma and flavor are concentrated, naturally sweet, and densely flowery. We have found this to aid in relaxation and even peaceful sleep. I've found it helpful combating colds and flu, and calming allergies. Invariably, Celestial Seasonings provides consistently excellent quality, holding to extremely high standards. Enjoy! Rating: 5.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Tension Tamer Tea, 20 ct Review: This does not taste artificial. It's delicious! Better tasting than most actual pulpy peaches these days. You'd have to have the tastebuds of a Macho Montana Iguana to not enjoy savoring this tea. I know whereof I speak, having entertained an Irascible Iguana who only deigned to eat raw elk-burger. Then he'd run around and try to bite the cat's tail. He grew large and monstrous on elk-burger, but would never eat a peach, or any other foodstuff he was supposed to like, aside from meat. So, go for it. Be an Uniguana and drink your serene peach tea sweetened with Splenda No Calorie Sweetener, Granular, Individual Packets, 700-Count Box. This true peach adds to the fantastic spectrum of Celestial Season's flavors. PS: The cat was given to a rural artist, grew large and happy, and did not miss the lizard. Rating: 5.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Tension Tamer Tea, 20 ct Review: This exceptional tea reminds me of running in the Rocky Mountains past fields of peppermint, fragrant in the afternoon sun. We drink this tea by the bushel-load, from morning to night. The flavor is exceptional and consistent, delicious during the summer, or warming you through Winter. Enjoy! PS: Best accompanied by U.K. mysteries, like Midsomer Murders: The Early Cases Collection, and buttery biscuits, lots of 'em. Rating: 5.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Tension Tamer Tea, 20 ct Review: The flavors of each one of these five flavors is remarkably intense. Each sample pouch consists of four-bags of Raspberry Zinger, Country Peach Passion, Black Cherry Berry, Cranberry Apple Zinger, and Tangerine Orange Zinger. There are no artificial additives, this is achieved naturally by the master blenders at the ever-reliable Celestial Seasonings, a company that has not compromised on consistent high-quality. The teas are not only wonderful hot, each flavor makes for refreshing pitchers of fruity iced tea. Enjoy! Product:
 Lindt LINDOR 60% Extra Dark Chocolate Truffles, 5.1 Ounce (Pack of 6) 
Review:
I love dark chocolate, and the darker the better (until we get all the way into unsweetened!).

These are gorgeous candies. The shell has a great snap to it, and the interior literally melts in the mouth. Both have superb flavor.

These are pretty much my favorite chocolates EVER...except that for Christmas my husband found a bag of similar ones but with COFFEE added! Those were even more brilliant.

Still, these are a totally gorgeous treat!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Frontier Soups Homemade In Minutes San Francisco Thai Golden Peanut Soup, 4.50-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4) 
Review:
I've now tried a number of Frontier's soup kits, and this is one of the best.

It is amazingly tasty, and does not taste pre-fab at all. The flavor balance is excellent, and the (added) peanut butter adds amazing richness and depth.

I made it with the meat from a turkey drumstick leftover from Thanksgiving, and it was perfect. The hardest part was cutting the meat off the drumstick! The only other add-ins are chicken broth (6 cups), and a cup of peanut butter; I used mostly unsalted natural style, since i don't think high-fructose corn syrup would be a welcome addition to the flavors.

I recommend this highly. It is only very slightly spicy; heat-lovers might want to supplement that a bit, though as-is, I can't see anyone objecting to it. If you are allergic to peanuts, I think sunflower butter would work equally well. I really liked the turkey in it, but the chicken the recipe calls for would be lovely, too.

It is also very filling. It makes 4 servings, and those make a very satisfying meal, possibly with a salad. It's even better after resting overnight in the fridge- the vegetables get more succulent, the soup thickens up, and the flavors blend.

I will definitely be buying this one again!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Maldon Sea Salt Flakes, 8.5 ounce Box
Review:
I love how handy this was to order. The salt is very good quality, and it's useful to be able to mail-order it.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Koon Chun Black Vinegar, 20.3-Ounce Bottle (Pack of 2)
Review:
This is an ingredient I'd despaired of finding in my suburb, many, many miles away from any comprehensive Asian market. And yet, so many recipes I want to try require it! OK, one can sub in balsamic, but that's definitely going to change the flavor.

I was very happy to find it available through Amazon, and I hope my 2 bottles last a while.

Although the packaging was excellent, the shipping cost was itself about as much as 1 bottle of the vinegar. So, if you can find it locally, that would be better than ordering it.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Frontier Soups Hearty Meals Minnesota Heartland Eleven Bean Soup, 18-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)
Review:
This is a hearty and delicious soup, and it was both pretty easy and made LOTS. I really love the flavor balance, and all the beans were done at the finish time,

We did go with all the add-ins: ham hock (ours had lots of meat), kielbasa, and chicken breast. All the meats were from our meat CSA, by the way!

The meat combination makes this a sort of American cassoulet (which traditionally has pork, sausage, and poultry confit).

A nice crusty bread makes the perfect accompaniment.

It does take some serious elapsed time, though most of it is hands-off. It's probably 6+ hours from start to finish, though that can be divided into a couple of days. The physical prep is easy and straightforward- mostly chopping veg and the sausage and chicken.

And, like all the frontier kits I've tried thus far, it does not taste like a mix. It tastes homemade.

Can you do similarly yourself? sure! but I love the mix of seasonings and beans, and the meat suggestions, and just not having to THINK!

Very recommended!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Hoosier Hill Farm Dry Malt (Diastatic) baking Powder 1.5 lb.
Review:
My husband and i do home brewing, so we are not unacquainted with malts.

The problem with malts is- they are very hydrophilic- meaning, as soon as you open them, they glom onto any moisture in the air and turn into a sticky and sullen mass.

The packaging for this one is a huge help. It's far easier to seal it against humidity. It's not 100% effective- but it's a huge help.

I think if you are brewing, you'd do better to buy malt powders or syrups from your local homebrew shop. But when one needs an occasional tablespoon or quarter cup for baking- this is really handy.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Hoosier Hill Farm Fermented Black Beans, 1.5 Pound
Review:
I do not live handy to a good Asian market, so I tend to either buy stuff online, or in the supermarkets.

As with spices, the supermarkets tend to charge a LOT more for smaller quantities.

Failing a good Asian market opening up close, this kind of thing is great. It's a huge amount of fermented black beans for Chinese dishes, that costs per recipe a tiny fraction of what they do in the supermarket. The tightly-sealing jar in which they are shipped is also great.

Very cost-effective, and of a good quality for Chinese black bean dishes.
Rating:
5.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
FISHER Snack Honey Roasted Peanuts, Golden Roast, 14 oz
Review:
These are really good dry roasted peanuts. I usually get players but wanted to try the Fisher brand and was pleased with their flavor and crunch. Planters dry roasted peanuts have a very mild flavor than works as a snack or you can use in desserts since they do not taste very savory. These Fisher dry roasted peanuts are way more savory in a good way that is great as a snack or on salads like This satay salad and such. I would not use these in desserts, you can really taste the paprika and spices, which I really like but you should be aware of.

There was a TON of spice sediment in the hat that I had to sift out to avoid dumping powder in my hand when grabbing a handful for a snack. I will be buying these in the future when this jar is finished, they are very satisfying and great on curry and thai dishes! Get Planters if you are making rocky road fudge or other sweet.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Emerald Nuts Dry Roasted Almonds, 11-Ounce Canisters (Pack of 4)
Review:
I find the flavor of these almonds to be wonderfully savory, the coating is barely covering the nut but really keeps them nice and crunchy.  I think the coating has the same flavor profile as old fashioned dry roasted peanuts, the slightly seasoned ones I remember my grandma always having a jar of.

I guess these are really a love them or leave them type of product; you'll notice the very high or very low star ratings, not one 3 star review when I tasted these.  I think the split is because the almonds do not have the word "seasoned" in the title so people looking for plain almonds feel duped.  I also see that some people are mad about them containing MSG; it is listed clearly in the ingredient list so you can avoid it if you have problems consuming it.  Some people get sick or bad headaches so this is an important thing to be aware of if you are sensitive.

I can see how someone would be put off by any flavor if they were looking for plain; my advice is to always hunt down the ingredient list to any food you are planning to buy without tasting first, especially if ordering in bulk.  I went to the grocery store and got one jar of these to see if I liked them, when these are gone I will be getting these in bulk here on amazon since I paid almost $6 for one jar.  Good flavor, good value.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
YumEarth Organic Lollipops, Assorted Flavors, 5 Pound Bag
Review:
I had morning sickness so bad it lasted all day and for 5.5 months, ugh!  I called it baby flu since there was little relief.  Ginger ale and YummyEarth organic candies were the only two things that settled my stomach enough to eat a small meal.  The assorted bag was nice to switch it up depending on my taste that day.  After I delivered my baby girl, I still enjoyed these when I have a dry mouth or would like a little sweetness.  It was so nice to find a tasty organic hard candy, so much tastier than Preggo Pops!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
YumEarth Organic Lollipops, Assorted Flavors, 5 Pound Bag
Review:
If you need a treat for your toddler that is small and tasty and natural, then these are for you! The flavors taste like fruit, not just chemicals and dyes like other small pops like Dumdums do.  There are a lot in the bag and last a long time in our pantry.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
MacFarms Dry Roasted Macadamia Nuts With Sea Salt Fresh From Hawaii 24 Ounce
Review:
These are the BEST macadamias I have ever had the pleasure of enjoying. They are consistently crunchy, fresh tasting and perfectly salted! I love these straight out of the bag. A small handful is the perfect snack packed with healthy fats and salty crunch, the perfect replacement for chip cravings. The price is right and I will be a lifelong customer!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Newman's Own Organics Pretzels, Salted Sticks, 8-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
A pretzel is a pretzel right?  Wrong.  I was amazed at how these really taste better than any I have had before.  I think these are the best tasting pretzel rods you can get in a supermarket or here on amazon.

The malt really makes a difference in the flavor.

The diameter is perfect for dipping in mustard or eating plain, not too thin and not too thick.

They have an even and sufficient coating of salt.

They arrived undamaged and very fresh with high crunch factor, not at all stale.

Mine were not burned like others have experienced with their orders.

I have 12 bags and am happy to keep a supply in the pantry to put out for guests when they drop by; it makes it very easy to serve good food at a good price by buying in bulk on amazon.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Ritz Crackers, Real Peanut Butter, 1.38 Oz, pack of 8
Review:
Probably not the best snack for you out there, but better than candy or other sugar-filled kid's treat.  My toddlers get a pack of these if we are on a car trip, they make little mess and enjoy them quite a bit.  They don't get a lot of packaged snacks or food on a daily basis, to it is a treat to them to get this kind of snack food.  The crackers are always crisp and the peanut butter is sweet enough to make it taste like a special snack.  I like that they are not colored orange like a lot of PB crackers are, no one needs extra food coloring :P

5.0

I usually make tuna salad by mixing mayonnaise, hot sauce, and a few spices into the tuna.  This time I mixed in only the Taco Bell sauce.  Incidentally, the sauce has half the calories per tablespoon of the mayonnaise.  The tuna salad turned out well. It was very similar to the mayonnaise-based version.

I was pleasantly surprised by my initial experiments with the sauce.  I have tried both the Chipotle and Jalapeno versions. They both work equally well.  That is, I find it hard to tell the differences in taste.

I wanted something that would cream my coffee without needing refrigeration, and this is perfect. I may never buy the liquid again, actually. This can be used with or without milk, and tastes wonderful. It does not completely dissolve in the hot coffee sometimes, but the tiny bits that float detract nothing from the flavor or texture of the beverage, which is all I care about.

You can also mix it with whole milk ahead of time, using a stick blender or other appliance, and store it in the refrigerator. I'd suggest you mix only a small amount at a time, or for special occasions when you will have company.

Review:
well, I loved the stuff.  I really did.  I made pot after pot, day in day out and I was convinced this was the best coffee around.  But the quality has veeeeeeeeeeery verrrrrrrrrrrrrrrry slowly been changing.  Its good coffee, don't get me wrong.  But it's no longer superior coffee.  It has that awful back taste that lesser blends or not so fresh beans have...an ugly bite.  No amount of french roasting will cover the fact that a bad bean is a bad bean.

I can't say it's all bad.  It's just not superior.  I hung in there for a while, even mixing it with an expresso bean to ramp it up.  But all I see is that it makes the other coffee taste weak and bitter.  So the search is on again.

________________previous revue________________
it's got everything:
rich roasted bean aroma before it's ground.
freshness
perfect oil balance (the beans SHINE like little patent leather shoes)
perfect acid balance
a touch of chocolate like flavor
winey

fantastic coffee. Now I'm spoiled rotten.  Had to make do with a lesser (although I used to think the lesser was good coffee but now  pftt!) when I ran out, became miserable and surly without my morning perfect cup.  and this IS the perfect cup of coffee.

if you're a coffee person, get yourself a coffee maker that grinds too, because no point in pregrinding and wrecking the perfection.  if you're gonna do it, do it right.

This didn't do it though. It's an adequate coffee, meaning not terrible and it is fresh, but it's got a back sort of oily/clanky flavor reminding me of supermarket brands, which isn't terrible but not good either.

I always freeze my coffee, taking out what I need for about a week and storing those beans in a container in the frig, so the coffee is always fresh and we use a Cuisinart grind and brew, which makes great coffee.

I would use it again if I had to, but I wouldn't recommend it as Cameron's best nor would I go out of my way to buy it.

Product:
Lavazza Filtro Classico Ground Coffee Blend, Medium Roast, 8-Ounce Bricks (Pack of 5)
Review:
I've been buying the Lavazza Tierra - it's an espresso grind, this is a coarser "drip" type grind. It's got a lighter fruitier more acidic flavor when used in the drip coffee maker (one scoop per cup of coffee on the carafe ie. 8 cups on the side, 8 scoops in the filter) I'm liking it much better as a cold brew coffee, it's very smooth in the cold brew (but then most everything is). I won't be ordering it again, I'm going to try the dark roast, instead. But I got this very very inexpensively, so I'm not that disappointed, I just can't rate it higher for the price, when people want a review of the taste. :)
Rating:
3.0
Product:
 Lavazza Tierra! 100% Sustainable Ground Coffee, 8-Ounce Cans (Pack of 3) 
Review:
1st cup down, second cup being enjoyed. My can says it expires 5/2011 - I have no idea how far out they set their best used by dates, so I've no idea how long this has been around. However, my first and second cup of coffee were flavorful and NOT bitter or sour. I paid next to nothing for this coffee and would again, but I wouldn't pay the nearly 8 dollars per can it is now when I paid a little more than that for 3 cans. It wasn't a knock your socks off, I can never drink another cup unless it's this cup of joe - but it's smooth, mellow, and enjoyable, especially when I paid next to nothing for it. If I'm going to pay nearly 8 bucks for a 1/2 pound, I'll go up to the local coffee roaster and get it fresh. (oh, normally I don't get my coffee in ground form, I usually grind it myself, but this was soooo inexpensive, I figured I'd give it a try.)

Side note - this is an espresso grind. I had no trouble with it floating or clogging, but I sprinkled it with some cold water to wet the grinds a bit before I started the brewing, that helps keep them from floating up. I also propped open the little spring loaded cover to the coffee basket with a skewer so it was as open as it could get. Result was a clear coffee and no mess. Ratio - one level coffee scoop per cup as measured on the carafe.

edit update 3/29/2011 - I've now had about 9 cans of this coffee - it's my go to coffee, it's still smooth mellow and enjoyable and I've given it an extra star for consistency, it's been good through all those cans, when ever it's on a decent sale (usually on the Friday Sale) I buy it again, just got another 3 cans. I also use it for the rub I put on ribeyes and a rub I made up to put on a pork butt for pulled pork...good stuff!  :)

4.0

This price is better than I get them at Wally World for the 6oz can and they are cheaper there than anywhere else. So, buy these, buy them now and hide the other bags from yourself (or send them to me) ...they are SO good, I'm eating them now! :

Oregon Chai Caffeine Free Chai Tea Latte Concentrate 32-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6), Liquid Chai Tea Concentrate, Decaffeinated Spiced Black Tea For Home Use, Café, Food Service
Review:
I've been making my own Chai with Lipton Chai Spice tea (so yummy)and a little honey and a splash or two of half and half. I don't keep milk in the house. Well, I thought I'd try the sugar free concentrate as a quicker way to fix the tea, bought some milk and BLECH...it was so sweet I had to dump it. And it was not spicy. I love the Lipton's it's rich and spicy and tastes like drinking Christmas...I want some right now! So, I cannot recommend this at all. If you want a very very mild flavored tea that's extremely sweet - this is your stuff - and I have some you can have! Come on by, it's yours! :D

UPDATE 12/23/12 - now make my Chai from the Celestial Seasonings Chai - which blows the Lipton out of the water, in fact, I had forgotten I made it from Lipton till I reread my review. Try the Chai from CS - but it is generally less expensive at Wally world. Yesterday I bought several boxes for 2.48 a box. (vs 2.82 right here on Amazon)

1.0

Review:
These remind me of something made out of tapioca...especially the "rice" it's like little balls, not grains of rice. I have rinsed them, boiled them and rinsed them again and had no problem with them, but the texture doesn't bother me, the kind of semi rubbery texture of pearl tapioca. Honestly, I really like them and hope I can find them for less. I used the "rice" the other day in a dish of sausage, onions and peppers with some asparagus all sauteed together, I rinsed the rice and then put them in the microwave and nuked them for 5 minutes, drained and rinsed them again and then dumped them in the sausage veggie mix, they soaked up the pan juices and were delicious. I've enjoyed the noodles in Asian style dishes and with spaghetti. I think I'll use the little "rice" balls in soup. I recommend these. I am only giving them 5 stars because they are obviously not pasta, but for what they are, they are great. :)

 Royal Oak Gourmet Jumbo Virginia Salted Peanuts, 40-Ounce Holiday Christmas Tins (Pack of 2) 
Review:
I have a serious nut addiction, granted peanuts aren't really nuts, but if they're crunchy and salty that's pretty much good enough for me. These are both crunchy and salty, they are big and you can see where the oil has bubbled on the surface of some of them. Some of them crunch with a soft crunch like a macadamia and then kind of melt and some of them CRACK and almost shatter in your mouth, some are just plain old peanutty and crunchy...the textures and taste and crunch crunch crunchy goodness make these a delight. Now are they way better than Planters or any other peanut, I honestly couldn't tell you, I don't buy peanuts. I'm generally low carb and eat other more low carb nuts, like pecans, macadamias, almonds, etc...but I bought these on a whim and now they are nearly gone. Five pounds of peanuts in a VERY short period of time, consumed in mass quantities, by the addict. Peanut crack. Buy some, buy them all, keep me from being able to order more...now, to buy some macadamias!

UPDATE: I was going to order more but today on 9/12/13 these peanuts officially cost around 8 dollars more than when I bought them last, less than a year ago. HOLY SMOKES!! What is going on with Peanuts, or is it just Royal Oak, too bad, I was going to order more. :( I can't justify a rise in price of over 25% in less than a year.
Rating:
5.0

Product:
 Arrowhead Mills Organic Hot Cereal, Steel Cut Oats, 24-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 4)
Review:
We've been experimenting with various oatmeals and this one, hands down, is the best we've found.  It's nutty, chewy and tastes good.  I don't even add salt.

One caveat is to let it cook for longer than the package calls for, and add a bit more water.  After 20 minutes, it's still pretty soupy, but 30 minutes gives the perfect texture. For two servings, I use 1/2 cup oats to 1 1/2 cups of water, bring to a boil, cover, reduce the heat and cook for 30 minutes.  I usually add one T of brown sugar and a handful of dried blueberries, dried cranberries or raisins to the water before cooking.  The moisture plumps the dried fruit beautifully and the sugar adds just a hint of sweetness. Slosh on some low fat milk and it's good to go.  This is the perfect breakfast food!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Marlo's Bakeshop Gluten-Free Soft-Baked Biscotti, Banana Bread, 5 Ounce
Review:
While there's definitely some banana bread flavor in these biscotti, they aren't wonderful.  They don't have the density of true biscotti, and they're very crumbly.  The one I just ate tasted like a slice of dry, almost stale banana bread made from a mix.

If you are on a gluten free diet, they might be satisfying bits of sweet, but speaking as a dedicated cookie eater, I'm not a fan of these.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Organic Grain Quinoa, 26 Ounce Packages (Pack of 4)
Review:
Quinoa is the most user-friendly grain I've ever found.  It cooks in the same amount of time and same liquid to solid ratio as white rice, but it has a flavor and a little crunch that's not as bland as rice.  Cook it in water or broth; add some sauteed onion and garlic or some ratatouille and it's a wonderful quick lunch.  Serve it as a bed for salmon or chicken and it's an equally delicious and fast dinner.

Bob's Red Mill Quinoa is my first experience with this ancient grain, and I'll be a fan for life.  Although I've read that quinoa should be washed before cooking to eliminate a bitter flavor, I've not had to do that with this brand.  It does have a bitey quality, but I happen to like it.  Even my meat and potatoes husband likes quinoa!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Juicy Fruit Starburst Strawberry Sugarfree Gum, 15 piece,10 Count
Review:
I love Starbursts.  Juicy Fruit Starburst Gum has exactly the same sweet/tart flavor as the candy, but it lasts longer.  While not an habitual gum chewed, I do like a little afternoon pick me up, and this gum is just the ticket.  It's delicious.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Jeremiah's Pick Coffee Kona Blend, Whole Bean Coffee, 5-Pound Bag
Review:
We really liked Jeremiah's Pick Fogbusters coffee in the five pound whole bean package, so I ordered this one for a bit of variety.  We're SO pleased!

Yes, it's a blend (what did you expect for the price?), but the mellow smoothness of the Kona really comes through and makes for an outstanding pot of coffee.  Without the almost-bitter notes of the Fogbuster, this Kona blend is complex, rich and delicious.

For a 12 cup drip coffeemaker, I use two and a quarter coffee scoops of the beans and grind for 15 seconds.  It's perfect, and way better than Maxwell House or Folgers.  Highly recommended!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co. Chocmeister Hazelnut Spread, Milk Chocolatey, 13 Ounce Jar
Review:
I could sit down with this jar and a spoon and eat the whole thing.  It's delicious.  I love the combination of hazelnuts and dark chocolate, and the back off on sugar is exactly to my taste.  The dark grittiness of the cocoa comes through, the hazelnut gives it richness, and it's not overpoweringly sweet.

By no means is this stuff good for you!  A serving size is two tablespoons at 200 calories with half of those from fat.  Maybe it does have bumped up protein, but I still got sugar jitters from the spoonful I couldn't keep myself from devouring right out of the box it arrived in,  This won't be a breakfast spread for me, but I'm going in search of some coconut macaroons to serve as its vehicle for a totally decadent Sunday afternoon snack.

I'm rating it in terms of its flavor, not for its implied healthiness.  That is simply misleading.  This is a fat laden sweet treat, and I love it!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Indus Organic Authentic Indian Curry Powder Spice (Medium Hot), 8 Oz, Salt Free, Freshly Packed
Review:
Through years of trial and error, I've learned I don't like curries with cinnamon, allspice, and nutmeg.  They give dishes a dessert-y dimension I find unpleasant.  I've been searching for the perfect blend and this is it!  It's hot, curry-ish and delicious.  I've experimented with using it in salad dressing, chicken salad, and deviled eggs and it's the perfect blend for my taste.  There's no aftertaste and no funky cookie flavor.

My only quibble is the "mild" description.  This curry is quite spicy, and I love it.  Though it's branded as Authentic Indian Curry Powder, this would make a great base for Chinese, Japanese and Jamaican curries as well.

Since my primary interest is flavor, I'm not that much concerned with organic spices, but I do appreciate that it's salt free, which makes it versatile.  I'm very pleased. It's everything I was looking for.

5.0

Product:
Stouffer's, Meatloaf, 16 oz (Frozen)
Review:
We like this size of the Stouffer's Meatloaf. It's "okay" and we "like it" is the best we can say about the meatloaf. The mashed potatoes suck. I chuck those and make my own (Honest Earth instant is WAY better than this quickie mashie in this meal). I add a salad or sauteed veggies, and divide the two loaves: a meal for two pretty fast.

I hate molding/dealing with raw meat, so when I get a meatloaf craving, I go to Boston Market or I keep this in the fridge. This 16 oz size is fine for two if you add sides. (Trust me, the mashed potatoes are not worth the calories, and you're better off making your own or baking a couple taters or just having some veggies and crusty bread on the side.)
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Explore Cuisine Fettuccini, Organic Edamame & Mung Bean, 8 Oz (Pack Of 6)
Review:
First off, if you like a bit of an earthy taste to your noodles, this will work fine for you. If you are expecting it to be like wheat or rice or corn pasta--not so much.

I liked the simplicity of ingredients (mung beans + water) and the very high fiber (11 grams per serving), plus lower carb and higher protein than regular grain pastas. I figured I'd take a risk. Know what? I like these.

Because some reviewers had used the term earthy--rightfully so--I boiled up a batch (raw vegans can just soak them for a day). I sauteed artichoke hearts and fresh mushrooms in EVOO and garlic, then just tossed in these noodles and added parmesan. Very nice. I enjoyed them a whole lot. I cooked them till they were al denter and I like the chewiness of the texture.  I will be trying these with pesto and red pepper sauce, too.

A very pleasant surprise. I like em. I won't say they are like real pasta. They are simply a different sort of noodle for folks who enjoy that, and I do.

If you aren't sure if it's for you, just order ONE from some vendor. Don't buy this huge quantity.

Oh, you can eat these raw as a snack with a dip. My sister and I tried them raw before I cooked up some. We both agreed they were kinda interesting uncooked--crunchy. They might work fine for folks who can digest these okay raw.
Rating:

I like this one a bit more than the portabella one, but I have to say the ease of this frozen breakfast item is terrific. A couple mins in the microwave and DONE. I hope they make more flavors. However, they really need to rethink the price. For how tiny these quiche "patties" are, five bucks plus for 2 of them is insane. prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Torani Vanilla Syrup 12.7 ounce Review: Torani makes a nice flavorful syrup, but the cherry is a bit tart. I prefer DaVinci Classic Cherry Syrup (DaVinci Gourmet Classic Syrup, Cherry, 25.4-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)). Both are made with cane sugar (and NO corn syrup of any kind.) I find DaVinci's more flavorful, even though they use artificial and natural flavors. Torani only uses "natural" flavorings. Try two ounces (1/4 cup) syrup in a 12-ounce glass. Add ice and fill with cold seltzer (not club soda.) Mix well and you have a great tasting soda (at about half the calories of a 12-ounce can of commercial soda pop.) Rating: 3.0 Product: Swiss Miss Hot Cocoa Mix, Sensible Sweets, Light, 8 count,0.29 ounce, (Pack of 6) Review: Swiss Miss diet hot cocoa mix is very tasty. The only problem is it is sweetened with sucralose (Splenda). For many people, sucralose causes gastrointestinal difficulties (bloating, flatulence, cramps.) If you are not affected by sucralose, you should try Swiss Miss - there is nothing diet about the flavor. Rating: 3.0 Product: HERSHEY'S Baking Cocoa, SPECIAL DARK Hot Cocoa, 8 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: This is cocoa. It is not chocolate, it is a component of chocolate. You need to learn to work with cocoa to achieve maximum enjoyment. Cocoa is bitter and a bit gritty. How you proceed depends on your desired results. Hot Chocolate is a good place to start. If you like the packets, then you want sweet and creamy. About 2 1/3 to 1 ratio of sugar to cocoa is about right. Try 2 tablespoons plus one teaspoon of sugar mixed with one level tablespoon of cocoa. One cup of hot (NOT boiling) milk and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract, plus a dash of salt. Mix well in a mug and enjoy. Hershey's is a good cocoa and a good value in this offering. Cocoa can also be used in baking (brownies, chocolate/devil's food/mocha cake, for example,) and chocolate or fudge confections and candies. Rating: 4.0 Product: Barilla Pronto Pasta, Half-Cut Linguine, 12 Ounce (Pack of 16) Review: Barilla Pronto is a new, interesting take on pasta. Use cold water, just enough to cover the pasta. Turn on the stove and allow the water to be absorbed. Just like steamed rice. No draining. Add sauce in the same pan and done. Voila! Quick-prep pasta al-dente. A great concept and quite the time saver. The package directions assume you are preparing one whole box. If you want a different amount of pasta, you need to visit the Barilla web site for alternate instructions. A chart on the box would be more convenient and useful. From box to sauce-ready in just 10 minutes. Quick, convenient and tasty. Rating: 4.0 Product: HERSHEY'S Kisses Chocolate Candy, Baby Shower Pink"It's A Girl", 7 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: If you are traditional, (boys=blue, girls=pink) Hershey's has a treat for you. Milk chocolate Kisses, wrapped in pink or blue foil. The same Kisses that have been satisfying your chocolate cravings for decades, now in lovely wrappers to highlight your buffet table or gift bags. They are small enough to indulge every once in a while, yet big enough to enjoy their chocolate goodness. Rich, sweet and affordable; the three pound bag is ideal for parties (or if you're feeling REALLY depressed.) The light pink and blue colors are also great for Easter and other festive occasions, not just your baby parties. (However, the "flags" say "It's a boy/It's a girl", so they may not be appropriate for other parties, but when you need chocolate, do you really care?) Rating: 4.0 Product: Kellogg's Nutri-Grain, Soft Baked Breakfast Bars, Assorted Pack, 1.3oz (48 count) Review: Nutri-Grain cereal bars are tasty snacks that are not totally devoid of nutritional value. They consist of grains and fruit pures. The package contains three flavors: Apple-cinnamon, Blueberry and Strawberry. The bars are flavorful, but the texture is off-putting.. It's like a cookie baked with insufficient shortening; crumbles and falls apart; no body. Nice try Nutri-Grain, you got the filling right, now let's see what you can do with the shell... Rating: 3.0 Product: Dubble Bubble 380 Count Tub - Fruitastic Flavors, 3LBS 12.3 OZ (1.71 KG) Review: What ever happened to the bubble gum of old? If you expect to find it here, you will be disappointed. Bubble gum used to be a penny a piece. The penny piece was also a decent sized piece. Now, the price has jumped and the size did shrink. This is not the same Dubble Bubble gum any more. The flavor is nice, for a few seconds. Then, nothing. The pieces are also too small to blow bubbles. You need to chew two to three pieces to get a decent bubble. Maybe I should look for Bazooka Joe? (Or is he too, just a distant memory?) prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Stevita Liquid Squeeze Bottle Sweetener, Chocolate, 1.35 Ounce Review: I love peach flavor, but have had trouble finding a stevia that gives that extra punch to a peach cobbler. This has a really authentic peach taste along with sweetness and is an excellent ingredient for peach tea, peach smoothies, cobblers or pies, or even simple peaches-and-cream. Yummy! :-) Rating: 5.0 Product: Frontier Organic Vanilla Flavoring, 4 Ounce Review: I hated this. There was nothing about it that tasted even remotely like vanilla. Rating: 1.0 Product: Dante Confections 98% Cocoa Stevia Chocolate Bars, 4 Count, Sugar-Free Review: Let's face it. Chocolate, all by itself is bitter. And Stevia is super sweet and also bitter. So the combination of these two ingredients creates an intense DARK CHOCOLATE that is very bitter-sweet. Not a product for beginners, but very good for those who are accustomed to and appreciate the bitter notes of true chocolate and the super bittersweet flavor of stevia. Chocolate has the potential to be a healthy superfood when it is consumed correctly - meaning that sugar and milk are not a part of the mix. When chocolate candy is created, sugar and milk are added to tone down the bitterness of the chocolate. But when people struggle with health issues, sugar is sometimes not an option, and often milk is also not an option. Furthermore, milk negates the health benefits of chocolate. According to the University of Michigan Health System, "Milk binds to antioxidants in chocolate making them unavailable; therefore, milk chocolate is not a good antioxidant source. To get the benefits of antioxidants, avoid drinking milk with dark chocolate." (I would cite my source but Amazon doesn't allow links in their reviews. Just google the terms, dairy and chocolate antioxidants, and the very first article should be the one I am referring to.) In other words, to get the health benefits of chocolate, you must consume it without sugar and without dairy. I really like the simplicity of the Dante's ingredient list: Chocolate Liqueur, Stevia, Pure Vanilla. 98% Cocoa. And as a diabetic, I am in love with the fact that there is no sugar in the mix. With this kind of list, the bitter taste is impossible to avoid. So - if you hate bitter, then don't try this. But if you like a simple, healthy, exotic and sophisticated dessert, then this might just be right up your alley. You must also understand that this in not a low calorie food. Even without sugar, there are still 260 calories per 45 gram bar AND 12 grams of carbohydrate. Most of the calories in the Dante bar come from chocolate's high quality fat. Compare to a Hershey's Special Dark Chocolate bar which is 190 calories per 41 gram bar and 25 grams of carbohydrate (the carbs are mostly from sugar). This isn't about low calorie, low fat or low carb. It is about the health benefits of pure chocolate and NO dairy or sugar - which is great news for diabetics who are open to new taste sensations. This stevia sweetened chocolate is SO intense that you might not be able to eat more than one tiny square at a time. This is where you will save on calories, fat and carbs - this chocolate is so satisfying that you will eat less and your cravings will be satisfied to the extent that binging will become a thing of the past. Or if straight chocolate is too much for you, then you can grate it and sprinkle it on top of a whipped coconut cream mousse for a touch of chocolatey flavor without the dairy and sugar. There are lots of things you can do with this, but be aware that this will NEVER taste anything remotely like a Hershey's candy bar. Do not buy this thinking you will be able to make that switch because the two do not really compare. It is better to realize that the bitterness inherent in both the chocolate and the stevia is to be appreciated and not avoided. If you can come to terms with that, you might end up being one of those people who LOVE Dante's Stevia Chocolate. If not, you will hate it. So - I am giving the 4 stars - deducting one star because I was unable to confirm that the chocolate used is organic and non-GMO. But for a simple, nutrient rich, sugar free chocolate rush - I think the Dante is wonderful! However I am a long time Stevia user and am used to the taste of stevia. And, my husband and I are both used to eating 100% UNSWEETENED chocolate and we weren't surprised at the bitterness. As long as you understand what it is and what it is not, I think you might like it, too! Nutrition Facts: Serving Size - 1 bar Servings per container - 1 Calories 260 Calories from fat - 210 (remember that chocolate fat (cocoa butter) is a super healthy fat) Total Fat - 24 grams Saturated Fat - 14 grams Trans Fat - 0 grams Cholesterol - 0 grams sodium - 0 grams Total Carbohydrate - 12 grams Dietary Fiber - 7 grams Sugars - 0 grams Protein - 7 grams Rating: 4.0 Product: Dante Confections 98% Organic Cocoa Stevia Chocolate Bars, 8 Count, Sugar-Free Review: Let's face it. Chocolate, all by itself is bitter. And Stevia is super sweet and also bitter. So the combination of these two ingredients creates an intense DARK CHOCOLATE that is very bitter-sweet. Not a product for beginners, but very good for those who are accustomed to and appreciate the bitter notes of true chocolate and the super bittersweet flavor of stevia. Chocolate has the potential to be a healthy superfood when it is consumed correctly - meaning that sugar and milk are not a part of the mix. When chocolate candy is created, sugar and milk are added to tone down the bitterness of the chocolate. But when people struggle with health issues, sugar is sometimes not an option, and often milk is also not an option. Furthermore, milk negates the health benefits of chocolate. According to the University of Michigan Health System, "Milk binds to antioxidants in chocolate making them unavailable; therefore, milk chocolate is not a good antioxidant source. To get the benefits of antioxidants, avoid drinking milk with dark chocolate." (I would cite my source but Amazon doesn't allow links in their reviews. Just google the terms, dairy and chocolate antioxidants, and the very first article should be the one I am referring to.) In other words, to get the health benefits of chocolate, you must consume it without sugar and without dairy. I really like the simplicity of the Dante's ingredient list: Chocolate Liqueur, Stevia, Pure Vanilla. 98% Cocoa. And as a diabetic, I am in love with the fact that there is no sugar in the mix. With this kind of list, the bitter taste is impossible to avoid. So - if you hate bitter, then don't try this. But if you like a simple, healthy, exotic and sophisticated dessert, then this might just be right up your alley. You must also understand that this in not a low calorie food. Even without sugar, there are still 260 calories per 45 gram bar AND 12 grams of carbohydrate. Most of the calories in the Dante bar come from chocolate's high quality fat. Compare to a Hershey's Special Dark Chocolate bar which is 190 calories per 41 gram bar and 25 grams of carbohydrate (the carbs are mostly from sugar). This isn't about low calorie, low fat or low carb. It is about the health benefits of pure chocolate and NO dairy or sugar - which is great news for diabetics who are open to new taste sensations. I think people often lose weight when using such foods because it is intense and you cannot eat much at all. A very little bit is satisfying and goes a long way. This stevia sweetened chocolate is SO intense that you might not be able to eat more than one tiny square at a time. This is where you will save on calories, fat and carbs - this chocolate is so satisfying that you will eat less and your cravings will be satisfied to the extent that binging will become a thing of the past. Or if straight chocolate is too much for you, then you can grate it and sprinkle it on top of a whipped coconut cream mousse for a touch of chocolatey flavor without the dairy and sugar. There are lots of things you can do with this, but be aware that this will NEVER taste anything remotely like a Hershey's candy bar. Do not buy this thinking you will be able to make that switch because the two do not really compare. It is better to realize that the bitterness inherent in both the chocolate and the stevia is to be appreciated and not avoided. If you can come to terms with that, you might end up being one of those people who LOVE Dante's Stevia Chocolate. If not, you will hate it. So - I am giving the 5 stars because it is sugar and dairy free and the chocolate used is organic and non-GMO. For a simple, nutrient rich, sugar free chocolate rush - I think the Dante is wonderful! However I am a long time Stevia user and am used to the taste of stevia. And, my husband and I are both used to eating 100% UNSWEETENED chocolate and we weren't surprised at the bitterness. As long as you understand what it is and what it is not, I think you might like it, too! Nutrition Facts: Serving Size - 1 bar Servings per container - 1 Calories 260 Calories from fat - 210 (remember that chocolate fat (cocoa butter) is a super healthy fat) Total Fat - 24 grams Saturated Fat - 14 grams Trans Fat - 0 grams Cholesterol - 0 grams sodium - 0 grams Total Carbohydrate - 12 grams Dietary Fiber - 7 grams Sugars - 0 grams Protein - 7 grams Rating: 5.0 Product: Mediterranean Gourmet Argan Oil, 8.45 Ounce Review: I have travelled extensively in Morocco, but during my stay, I only used Argan oil on my skin. It might have been in some of the delicious food, but since I never cooked while I was there, I am not sure if I ate it during my stay or not. I probably did and never knew it, but since I don't know, I cannot compare what I tasted there to this product. I think this tastes akin to a very strong olive oil. I prefer a lighter tasting oil, but I cannot say that this strong taste indicates a rancid flavor or if it is simply how Argan oil is supposed to taste. I suspect that it's supposed to taste like this - I know what a rancid oil is like and this doesn't taste rancid to me. Just really, REALLY strong. When you put it in a dish, be sure to know that the flavor will overpower everything else. I do have some real experience with exceptionally good quality extra virgin olive oil, and in my experience, the best olive oils do not have this intense, unpleasant flavor. This product gets 4 stars from me because of the vitamin E content. I bought this because I am allergic to wheat and since wheat is a major source of vitamin E in the American diet, my levels were getting low. Then I found out that Argan oil is even richer in vitamin E than wheat and my problem was solved. Since I don't like the taste in cooking, I just take a teaspoon every day along with my disgusting cod liver oil and other supplements. It does the trick. Just to make sure I have a really fresh Argan oil, I am planning to buy a different brand next time so I will have a basis for comparison. If I find that Argan oil is always this strong in flavor, I'll come back and give this item 5 stars instead of 4. If I find that I like other brands better, I come back and reduce my rating to 3 stars. If I realize that this Argan oil is rancid, I'll come back and change my 4 stars to 1 star. I might even take it to a local Moroccan restaurant and ask the owners to taste test it and give me a knowledgable opinion. Rating: 4.0 Product: Native Forest Organic Premium Coconut Cream, Unsweetened, 5.4 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: UPDATE - June 4, 2017: Since writing the above review, I have discovered that Thai Kitchen has some questionable additives and I have switched to Natural Value Coconut Milk. I just pour off the water to get 100% Cream. And this brand does seem to have a generous amount of cream in the can, with absolutely NO additives. Get it here: Natural Value Organic Coconut Milk, 13.5 Ounce Cans (Pack of 12) ORIGINAL REVIEW: I really love coconut milk and coconut cream, but this is not a very good brand. It was supposed to be CREAM for goodness sake, but when I opened this can there was hardly any cream in the can. The contents were grayish and watery. There wasn't enough cream in this to make it worth anything. I would rather buy Thai Kitchen coconut milk, which is pure white, FULL OF CREAM, and a rich milky water that is great for smoothies or soups. I am not sure how they define CREAM, but I feel like I got mostly water from this can. Rating: 1.0 Product: Miracle Noodle Shirataki Zero Carb, Gluten Free Fettuccini, 7 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: A quick look at the reviews of this product shows that people are divided as to whether this is a guilt free pasta dream come true or whether this is a nasty, smelly, slimy nightmare. And I fall solidly into the "Dream Come True" camp. As a person with miltiple food allergies and type 2 diabetes, my diet had become a bland, monotinous string of meat and vegetables. I don't like "fake" food and so I had opted out of substitutes like fake cheese, low carb bread, and artificial sweeteners. Then I ran across these noodles (my doctor carries a line of low carb foods in his office), and decided that I would try them once, even if I probably wouldn't ever want to eat them again. I am really glad I tried them. I like the texture, and the taste is so bland that they quickly soak up any flavor that is cooked into them. The initial odor coming out of the package is kind of "fishy", but that goes away quickly as the noodles are prepared and they absorb the flavors and aromas of the foods they are cooked with. The texture is slippery, stretchy, and chewy - kind of like I remember real pasta being. Some reviewers said that they didn't like the "slimy" texture, but I didn't find it to be any slimier than real pasta. In any case, it didn't bother me at all I started with spaghetti and meatballs, then I had buttered noodles, and then I had noodles with taco meat and a yummy mexican sauce with olives and avacado. Then there was my allergen free version of Pad Thai. The list goes on and on and I have never failed to love whatever I have used them in. AND my blood sugar stays within the normal range! I tried several shape varieties, and I like the fettuccini noodles the best for pasta because they have substance. I like the shiratake rice as a rice substitute. I used the "fake rice" for a stuffed zucchini dish that was to die for - my whole family dove in and raved for more! Shiratake noodles are now a part of my diet and long term lifestyle, and I have enrolled in the Subscribe and Save program because I use them so often. Shiratake noodles are something a person either loves or hates, and there doesn't seem to be much in between, so I recommend that anyone who isn't sure and wants to try it once should buy from the Miracle Noodle website because they accept returns if you don't like the product. If you like them, you can then purchase from Amazon, but first time users should buy directly from the manufacturer. Product:
NOKA Superfood Blend, Organic Fruit & Veggie Smoothie Squeeze Pack, Sweet Potato Goji, 4.22 Ounces, (Pack of 6 pouches)
Review:
I am happy with this product.  It is a box of six pouches, with a liquid, smoothie-type product.

I was worried that this product might have soy.  But after reading the ingredients, I saw no soy.  Here are the ingredients:  organic mango, organic banana, organic apple, water, organic flax seed, organic coconut, organic brown rice protein, organic mango flavor, organic camu camu berry, organic lemon juice concentrate, organic coconut flavor.  It is vegan, gluten-free, bpa-free, organic & verified non gmo.

The taste is superb.  I tasted the mango and coconut.  Also, there are small coconut flakes, which make it that much better, and give it texture.  I love coconut flakes.

I love products such as these.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Raw Rev 100, Chocolate & Coconut 100 Calorie Organic Live Food Bar, 0.8-Ounce Bars (Pack of 26)
Review:
To me, chocolate and coconut is pure heaven.  This particular bar is so awesome, it's hard to believe it is healthy as well as it tastes good.  I particularly love the way the taste of the cashews come through and blend in so beautifully with the chocolate and coconut.  This bar is so heavenly good.

As good as this bar tastes, it is also healthy, vegan, organic, raw, soy-free.  It's hard to believe something that tastes so good can also be so good for you.

This bar is indescribably awesome.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Eden Organic Quinoa, Whole Grain, 16-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6)
Review:
I finally bought this Quinoa, and it is really good.  It is versatile; depending on how you season it depends on how it turns out.  For example, it can be seasoned with lemon, pepper, garlic, basil, etc.  It can also be seasoned with brown sugar.

I am not going to write a long review; the grain itself is versatile enough to make it just about any way you want.  And it's easy to prepare.  And it's healthful (I'll get into that in the next paragraph).

From what I'd heard about the grain, it is "old", "strong", "healthy, "wise" (even has built up a coating that is a resistance to insects).  This grain intrigues me; I plan to look up its history.

Quinoa (which I recently found out) is what dieticians call a "complete protein".  Other than meat products, there aren't a lot of "complete proteins" that I know of, other than soy.  I do not eat soy.  So I thought I'd give this product a try.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Lipton Black Iced Tea Bags, Cold Brew Decaffeinated Family Size,22 Count,4.8 Oz (Pack of 3)
Review:
This tea is perfect for me, especially since I don't boil my tea, anyway.  I just let it seep out of the bags into the water.  I put the bags in the gallon jugs, and let it set there in the refridgerator.  And I love the taste of this tea.

I do usually drink decaffeinated tea, as the caffeinated versions keep me up really late.  I wish I had of known about this back in the day when I had to pull all-night duty.  Back then, I did not know that caffienated tea did this to me.  I tried coffee to keep me perky all night, but it did nothing for me.

I love tea.  This particular type of tea tastes really good to me.  And I love cornbread and iced tea.  That is a combination that goes good together for some reason.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Blue Diamond Natural Oven Roasted Almonds Vanilla Bean, 8-Ounce Jars (Pack of 6)
Review:
These nuts are heavenly in more ways than one.  For one, all nuts are healthy.  Almonds are especially heathful.  For two, the taste is out of this world.  It is an almond taste with a smooth vanilla background.  If you like both almonds and vanilla, then you will be in heaven.

Lucky for me, I am a nut lover.  I am lucky to love something so healthy.  And the vanilla background of these nuts make them a very healthy and tasty snack; they are so good, it is hard to believe that they are healthy.

Almonds are good for the heart, as well as other organs.  Even though raw nuts, I'm sure, are healthier than cooked nuts, I do sometimes include nuts in different recipes.  However, I would never include these vanilla almonds in any recipe, because I would be afraid that the vanilla might come off.  I only eat these raw.

This is a very healthy snack.  Highly recommended.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Late July Organic Dark Chocolate Sandwich Cookies,  8.2-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
I was attracted to this box of cookies because of the "brand". "Late July" sounds like a wonderful brand name, and late July does bring back wonderful memories for me: it sounds like a fish fry with homemade french-fried potatoes and cole slaw and hush puppies, an ice bucket, iced tea, a cool breeze blowing from the fan, a porch, and lots of love. That's what I thought of when I saw this brand. Also, it is natural and therefore, vegans can have this product.

Vanilla bean with green tea:  The cookies didn't taste good. The flavor idea was pretty good. There was a hint of good flavor. Vanilla bean with green tea sounds wonderful. Possibly, the bad taste was due to all the soy and soy products used.  I managed to eat this whole box (of vanilla bean with green tea) without throwing any out.

Dark chocolate:  Horrible.  I couldn't even finish the whole box; I had to throw out most of it.  (And I'm the queen of conservativeness.)  The "dark" chocolate was so dark and so horrible, that it was too much for even a chocolate lover.  The chocolate had a horrible taste.  Not to mention the horrible taste it left in your mouth.  (Possibly too much soy, and whatever was in that chocolate.)  I literally had to go and buy some lemons and ate two, and also some potato chips, just to get that taste out of my mouth.

Never again.

1.0

4- They are non-GMO.

Product:

Review:
I'm a committed low-carber since that's the only food style that lets me lose weight and feel good. Chia seeds are the magic potion: sprinkle several tablespoons on a daily salad, a tablespoon in some eggs before scrambling, more on steamed cabbage -- they're small like poppy seeds and add a nice crunch on the way to your stomach where they'll expand and keep you feeling full longer. They also help move food through your system so that constipation is never a problem. Try them!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Navitas Organics Chia Seed Powder, 8 oz. Bag
Review:
These may last forever at 1T every day in my morning shake since I'm having trouble finding recipes for other ways to use these seeds, but they will keep (in a sealed plastic container).
UPDATE: Figured out the best use of these seeds for ME--I love salad with 1/4 cup of sunflower seeds and am now adding 2 tablespoons chia seeds, too. This way I get lots of crunch, different textures and a REALLY filling meal. I've been eating very low-carb (20 grams or less/day) for about 9 months now and have lost 30 lbs. But, at that low level of carbs, even using them all on vegetables and drinking jugs and jugs of water can still leave a constipation problem. These seeds fixed that immediately even as they facilitated eating less and feeling more satisfied. Miracle food is REAL. (I've been working through many of the other positive reviews and found some new "recipes" that I'll try, too.) HOORAY FOR CHIA SEEDS!
Rating:
5.0

and just start scarfing. I have a large old Tupperware bowl with a good lid, so I popped enough to fill it and I'll work through it at will.
